IAST: tvaṁ hy agne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā
Griffith: THOU, first inventor of this prayer, O Agni, Worker of Marvels, hast become our Herald.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्यग्ने प्रथमो मनोतास्या धियो अभवो दस्म होता
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | agne | prathamaḥ | manotā | asyāḥ | dhiyaḥ | abhavaḥ | dasma | hotā || tvam | sīm | vr̥ṣan | akr̥taṇoḥ | dustarītu | sahaḥ | viśvasmai | sahase | sahadhyai ||6.1.1||

IAST: tvaṁ sīṁ vṛṣann akṛṇor duṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai
Griffith: Thou, Bull, hast made us strength which none may conquer, strength that shall overcome all other prowess
Devanāgarī: त्वं सीं वृषन्नकृणोर्दुष्टरीतु सहो विश्वस्मै सहसे सहध्यै
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | agne | prathamaḥ | manotā | asyāḥ | dhiyaḥ | abhavaḥ | dasma | hotā || tvam | sīm | vr̥ṣan | akr̥taṇoḥ | dustarītu | sahaḥ | viśvasmai | sahase | sahadhyai ||6.1.1||

IAST: adhā hotā ny asīdo yajīyān iḻas pada iṣayann īḍyaḥ san
Griffith: As Priest thou sattest at the seat of worship, furthering us, best Offerer, meet for honour.
Devanāgarī: अधा होता न्यसीदो यजीयानिळस्पद इषयन्नीड्यः सन्
pada pāṭha: adha | hotā | ni | asīdaḥ | yajīyān | iḷaḥ | pade | iṣayan | īḍyaḥ | san || tam | tvā | naraḥ | prathamam | deva-yantaḥ | mahaḥ | rāye | citayantaḥ | anu | gman ||6.1.2||

IAST: taṁ tvā naraḥ prathamaṁ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu gman
Griffith: So first to thee have pious men resorted, turning thy mind to thoughts of ample riches.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा नरः प्रथमं देवयन्तो महो राये चितयन्तो अनु ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: adha | hotā | ni | asīdaḥ | yajīyān | iḷaḥ | pade | iṣayan | īḍyaḥ | san || tam | tvā | naraḥ | prathamam | deva-yantaḥ | mahaḥ | rāye | citayantaḥ | anu | gman ||6.1.2||

IAST: vṛteva yantam bahubhir vasavyais tve rayiṁ jāgṛvāṁso anu gman
Griffith: In thee, still watching, they have followed riches, who goest with much wealth as with an army,
Devanāgarī: वृतेव यन्तं बहुभिर्वसव्यैस्त्वे रयिं जागृवांसो अनु ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: vr̥tā-iva | yantam | bahu-bhiḥ | vasavyaiḥ | tve iti | rayim | jāgr̥-vāṁsaḥ | anu | gman || ruśantam | agnim | darśatam | br̥hantam | vapā-vantam | viśvahā | dīdi-vāṁsam ||6.1.3||

IAST: ruśantam agniṁ darśatam bṛhantaṁ vapāvantaṁ viśvahā dīdivāṁsam
Griffith: The radiant Agni, lofty, fair to look on, worshipped with marrow, evermore resplendent.
Devanāgarī: रुशन्तमग्निं दर्शतं बृहन्तं वपावन्तं विश्वहा दीदिवांसम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥tā-iva | yantam | bahu-bhiḥ | vasavyaiḥ | tve iti | rayim | jāgr̥-vāṁsaḥ | anu | gman || ruśantam | agnim | darśatam | br̥hantam | vapā-vantam | viśvahā | dīdi-vāṁsam ||6.1.3||

IAST: padaṁ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpann amṛktam
Griffith: They who approached the God's abode with homage, eager for glory, won them perfect glory:
Devanāgarī: पदं देवस्य नमसा व्यन्तः श्रवस्यवः श्रव आपन्नमृक्तम्
pada pāṭha: padam | devasya | namasā | vyantaḥ | śravasyavaḥ | śravaḥ | āpan | amr̥ktam || nāmāni | cit | dadhire | yajñiyāni | bhadrāyām | te | raṇayanta | sam-dr̥ṣṭau ||6.1.4||

IAST: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṁ te raṇayanta saṁdṛṣṭau
Griffith: Yea, they gained even sacrificial titles, and found delight in thine auspicious aspect.
Devanāgarī: नामानि चिद्दधिरे यज्ञियानि भद्रायां ते रणयन्त संदृष्टौ
pada pāṭha: padam | devasya | namasā | vyantaḥ | śravasyavaḥ | śravaḥ | āpan | amr̥ktam || nāmāni | cit | dadhire | yajñiyāni | bhadrāyām | te | raṇayanta | sam-dr̥ṣṭau ||6.1.4||

IAST: tvāṁ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṁ tvāṁ rāya ubhayāso janānām
Griffith: On earth the people magnify thee greatly, thee their celestial and terrestrial riches.
Devanāgarī: त्वां वर्धन्ति क्षितयः पृथिव्यां त्वां राय उभयासो जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | vardhanti | kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thivyām | tvām | rāyaḥ | ubhayāsaḥ | janānām || tvam | trātā | taraṇe | cetyaḥ | bhūḥ | pitā | mātā | sadam | it | mānuṣāṇām ||6.1.5||

IAST: tvaṁ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadam in mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: Thou, Helper, must be known as our Preserver, Father and Mother of mankind for ever.
Devanāgarī: त्वं त्राता तरणे चेत्यो भूः पिता माता सदमिन्मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | vardhanti | kṣitayaḥ | pr̥thivyām | tvām | rāyaḥ | ubhayāsaḥ | janānām || tvam | trātā | taraṇe | cetyaḥ | bhūḥ | pitā | mātā | sadam | it | mānuṣāṇām ||6.1.5||

IAST: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣv agnir hotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān
Griffith: Dear priest among mankind, adorable Agni hath seated him, joy-giver, skilled in worship.
Devanāgarī: सपर्येण्यः स प्रियो विक्ष्वग्निर्होता मन्द्रो नि षसादा यजीयान्
pada pāṭha: saparyeṇyaḥ | saḥ | priyaḥ | vikṣu | agniḥ | hotā | mandraḥ | ni | sisāda | yajīyān || tam | tvā | vayam | dame | ā | dīdi-vāṁsam | upa | jñu-bādhaḥ | namasā | sadema ||6.1.6||

IAST: taṁ tvā vayaṁ dama ā dīdivāṁsam upa jñubādho namasā sadema
Griffith: Let us approach thee shining in thy dwelling, kneeling upon our knees, with adoration.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा वयं दम आ दीदिवांसमुप ज्ञुबाधो नमसा सदेम
pada pāṭha: saparyeṇyaḥ | saḥ | priyaḥ | vikṣu | agniḥ | hotā | mandraḥ | ni | sisāda | yajīyān || tam | tvā | vayam | dame | ā | dīdi-vāṁsam | upa | jñu-bādhaḥ | namasā | sadema ||6.1.6||

IAST: taṁ tvā vayaṁ sudhyo navyam agne sumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ
Griffith: Longing for bliss, pure-minded, God-devoted, Agni, we seek thee, such, meet to be lauded.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा वयं सुध्यो नव्यमग्ने सुम्नायव ईमहे देवयन्तः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tvā | vayam | su-dhyaḥ | navyam | agne | sumna-yavaḥ | īmahe | deva-yantaḥ || tvam | viśaḥ | anayaḥ | dīdyānaḥ | divaḥ | agne | br̥hatā | rocanena ||6.1.7||

IAST: tvaṁ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo agne bṛhatā rocanena
Griffith: Thou, Agni, leddest forth our men to battle, refulgent with the heaven's exalted splendour.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विशो अनयो दीद्यानो दिवो अग्ने बृहता रोचनेन
pada pāṭha: tvam | tvā | vayam | su-dhyaḥ | navyam | agne | sumna-yavaḥ | īmahe | deva-yantaḥ || tvam | viśaḥ | anayaḥ | dīdyānaḥ | divaḥ | agne | br̥hatā | rocanena ||6.1.7||

IAST: viśāṁ kaviṁ viśpatiṁ śaśvatīnāṁ nitośanaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: Sage of mankind, all peoples' Lord and Master, the Bull of men, the sender down of blessings,
Devanāgarī: विशां कविं विश्पतिं शश्वतीनां नितोशनं वृषभं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | śaśvatīnām | ni-tośanam | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām || preti-iṣaṇim | iṣayantam | pāvakam | rājantam | agnim | yajatam | rayīṇām ||6.1.8||

IAST: pretīṣaṇim iṣayantam pāvakaṁ rājantam agniṁ yajataṁ rayīṇām
Griffith: Still pressing on, promoting, purifying, Agni the Holy One, the Lord of riches.
Devanāgarī: प्रेतीषणिमिषयन्तं पावकं राजन्तमग्निं यजतं रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: viśām | kavim | viśpatim | śaśvatīnām | ni-tośanam | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām || preti-iṣaṇim | iṣayantam | pāvakam | rājantam | agnim | yajatam | rayīṇām ||6.1.8||

IAST: so agna īje śaśame ca marto yas ta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim
Griffith: Agni, the mortal who hath toiled and worshipped, brought thee oblations with his kindled fuel,
Devanāgarī: सो अग्न ईजे शशमे च मर्तो यस्त आनट् समिधा हव्यदातिम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agne | īje | śaśame | ca | martaḥ | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | sam-idhā | havya-dātim || yaḥ | ā-hutim | pari | veda | namaḥ-bhiḥ | viśvā | it | saḥ | vāmā | dadhate | tvā-ūtaḥ ||6.1.9||

IAST: ya āhutim pari vedā namobhir viśvet sa vāmā dadhate tvotaḥ
Griffith: And well knows sacrifice with adoration, gains every joy with thee to guard and help him.
Devanāgarī: य आहुतिं परि वेदा नमोभिर्विश्वेत्स वामा दधते त्वोतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | agne | īje | śaśame | ca | martaḥ | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | sam-idhā | havya-dātim || yaḥ | ā-hutim | pari | veda | namaḥ-bhiḥ | viśvā | it | saḥ | vāmā | dadhate | tvā-ūtaḥ ||6.1.9||

IAST: asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhir agne samidhota havyaiḥ
Griffith: Mightily let us worship thee the Mighty, with reverence, Agni! fuel and oblations,
Devanāgarī: अस्मा उ ते महि महे विधेम नमोभिरग्ने समिधोत हव्यैः
pada pāṭha: asmai | ūm̐ iti | te | mahi | mahe | vidhema | namaḥ-bhiḥ | agne | sam-idhā | uta | havyaiḥ || vedī | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | ā | te | bhadrāyām | su-matau | yatema ||6.1.10||

IAST: vedī sūno sahaso gīrbhir ukthair ā te bhadrāyāṁ sumatau yatema
Griffith: With songs, O Son of Strength, with hymns, with altar: so may we strive for thine auspicious favour.
Devanāgarī: वेदी सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैरा ते भद्रायां सुमतौ यतेम
pada pāṭha: asmai | ūm̐ iti | te | mahi | mahe | vidhema | namaḥ-bhiḥ | agne | sam-idhā | uta | havyaiḥ || vedī | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | ā | te | bhadrāyām | su-matau | yatema ||6.1.10||

IAST: ā yas tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiś ca śravasyas tarutraḥ
Griffith: Thou who hast covered heaven and earth with splendour and with thy glories, glorious and triumphant.
Devanāgarī: आ यस्ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा श्रवोभिश्च श्रवस्यस्तरुत्रः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | tatantha | rodasī iti | vi | bhāsā | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | ca | śravasyaḥ | tarutraḥ || br̥hat-bhiḥ | vājaiḥ | sthavirebhiḥ | asme iti | revat-bhiḥ | agne | vi-taram | vi | bhāhi ||6.1.11||

IAST: bṛhadbhir vājaiḥ sthavirebhir asme revadbhir agne vitaraṁ vi bhāhi
Griffith: Continue thou to shine on us, O Agni, with strength abundant, rich, and long enduring.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्भिर्वाजैः स्थविरेभिरस्मे रेवद्भिरग्ने वितरं वि भाहि
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | tatantha | rodasī iti | vi | bhāsā | śravaḥ-bhiḥ | ca | śravasyaḥ | tarutraḥ || br̥hat-bhiḥ | vājaiḥ | sthavirebhiḥ | asme iti | revat-bhiḥ | agne | vi-taram | vi | bhāhi ||6.1.11||

IAST: nṛvad vaso sadam id dhehy asme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us ever, as man needs, O Vasu, abundant wealth of kine for son and offspring.
Devanāgarī: नृवद्वसो सदमिद्धेह्यस्मे भूरि तोकाय तनयाय पश्वः
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | vaso iti | sadam | it | dhehi | asme iti | bhūri | tokāya | tanayāya | paśvaḥ || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | āre-aghāḥ | asme iti | bhadrā | sauśravasāni | santu ||6.1.12||

IAST: pūrvīr iṣo bṛhatīr āre-aghā asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu
Griffith: Food noble, plenteous, far from sin and evil, he with us, and fair fame to make us happy.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीरिषो बृहतीरारेअघा अस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | vaso iti | sadam | it | dhehi | asme iti | bhūri | tokāya | tanayāya | paśvaḥ || pūrvīḥ | iṣaḥ | br̥hatīḥ | āre-aghāḥ | asme iti | bhadrā | sauśravasāni | santu ||6.1.12||

IAST: purūṇy agne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasutā te aśyām
Griffith: May I obtain much wealth in many places by love of thee and through thy grace, King Agni;
Devanāgarī: पुरूण्यग्ने पुरुधा त्वाया वसूनि राजन्वसुता ते अश्याम्
pada pāṭha: purūṇi | agne | purudhā | tvā-yā | vasūni | rājan | vasutā | te | aśyām || purūṇi | hi | tve iti | puru-vāra | santi | agne | vasu | vidhate | rājani | tve iti ||6.1.13||

IAST: purūṇi hi tve puruvāra santy agne vasu vidhate rājani tve
Griffith: For in thee Bounteous One, in thee the Sovran, Agni, are many boons for him who serves thee.
Devanāgarī: पुरूणि हि त्वे पुरुवार सन्त्यग्ने वसु विधते राजनि त्वे
pada pāṭha: purūṇi | agne | purudhā | tvā-yā | vasūni | rājan | vasutā | te | aśyām || purūṇi | hi | tve iti | puru-vāra | santi | agne | vasu | vidhate | rājani | tve iti ||6.1.13||

IAST: tvaṁ hi kṣaitavad yaśo 'gne mitro na patyase
Griffith: THOU, Agni, even as Mitra, hast a princely glory of thine own.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि क्षैतवद्यशोऽग्ने मित्रो न पत्यसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | kṣaita-vat | yaśaḥ | agne | mitraḥ | na | patyase || tvam | vi-carṣaṇe | śravaḥ | vaso iti | puṣṭim | na | puṣyasi ||6.2.1||

IAST: tvaṁ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṁ na puṣyasi
Griffith: Thou, active Vasu, makest fame increase like full prosperity.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विचर्षणे श्रवो वसो पुष्टिं न पुष्यसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | kṣaita-vat | yaśaḥ | agne | mitraḥ | na | patyase || tvam | vi-carṣaṇe | śravaḥ | vaso iti | puṣṭim | na | puṣyasi ||6.2.1||

IAST: tvāṁ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhir gīrbhir īḻate
Griffith: For, verily, men pray to thee with sacrifices and with songs.
Devanāgarī: त्वां हि ष्मा चर्षणयो यज्ञेभिर्गीर्भिरीळते
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | sma | carṣaṇayaḥ | yajñebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īḷate || tvām | vājī | yāti | avr̥kaḥ | rajaḥ-tūḥ | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ ||6.2.2||

IAST: tvāṁ vājī yāty avṛko rajastūr viśvacarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: To thee the Friendly Courser, seen of all, comes speeding through the air.
Devanāgarī: त्वां वाजी यात्यवृको रजस्तूर्विश्वचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | sma | carṣaṇayaḥ | yajñebhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | īḷate || tvām | vājī | yāti | avr̥kaḥ | rajaḥ-tūḥ | viśva-carṣaṇiḥ ||6.2.2||

IAST: sajoṣas tvā divo naro yajñasya ketum indhate
Griffith: Of one accord men kindle thee Heaven's signal of the sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: सजोषस्त्वा दिवो नरो यज्ञस्य केतुमिन्धते
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣaḥ | tvā | divaḥ | naraḥ | yajñasya | ketum | indhate || yat | ha | syaḥ | mānuṣaḥ | janaḥ | sumna-yuḥ | juhve | adhvare ||6.2.3||

IAST: yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyur juhve adhvare
Griffith: When, craving bliss, this race of man invites thee to the solemn rite.
Devanāgarī: यद्ध स्य मानुषो जनः सुम्नायुर्जुह्वे अध्वरे
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣaḥ | tvā | divaḥ | naraḥ | yajñasya | ketum | indhate || yat | ha | syaḥ | mānuṣaḥ | janaḥ | sumna-yuḥ | juhve | adhvare ||6.2.3||

IAST: ṛdhad yas te sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate
Griffith: Let the man thrive who travails sore, in prayer, far thee the Bountiful.
Devanāgarī: ऋधद्यस्ते सुदानवे धिया मर्तः शशमते
pada pāṭha: r̥dhat | yaḥ | te | su-dānave | dhiyā | martaḥ | śaśamate || ūtī | saḥ | br̥hataḥ | divaḥ | dviṣaḥ | aṁhaḥ | na | tarati ||6.2.4||

IAST: ūtī ṣa bṛhato divo dviṣo aṁho na tarati
Griffith: He with the help of lofty Dyaus comes safe through straits of enmity.
Devanāgarī: ऊती ष बृहतो दिवो द्विषो अंहो न तरति
pada pāṭha: r̥dhat | yaḥ | te | su-dānave | dhiyā | martaḥ | śaśamate || ūtī | saḥ | br̥hataḥ | divaḥ | dviṣaḥ | aṁhaḥ | na | tarati ||6.2.4||

IAST: samidhā yas ta āhutiṁ niśitim martyo naśat
Griffith: The mortal who with fuel lights thy flame and offers unto thee,
Devanāgarī: समिधा यस्त आहुतिं निशितिं मर्त्यो नशत्
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | yaḥ | te | ā-hutim | ni-śitim | martyaḥ | naśat || vayā-vantam | saḥ | puṣyati | kṣayam | agne | śata-āyuṣam ||6.2.5||

IAST: vayāvantaṁ sa puṣyati kṣayam agne śatāyuṣam
Griffith: Supports a house with many a branch, Agni, to live a hundred years.
Devanāgarī: वयावन्तं स पुष्यति क्षयमग्ने शतायुषम्
pada pāṭha: sam-idhā | yaḥ | te | ā-hutim | ni-śitim | martyaḥ | naśat || vayā-vantam | saḥ | puṣyati | kṣayam | agne | śata-āyuṣam ||6.2.5||

IAST: tveṣas te dhūma ṛṇvati divi ṣañ chukra ātataḥ
Griffith: Thy bright smoke lifts itself aloft, and far-extended shines in heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वेषस्ते धूम ऋण्वति दिवि षञ्छुक्र आततः
pada pāṭha: tveṣaḥ | te | dhūmaḥ | r̥ṇvati | divi | san | śukraḥ | ā-tataḥ || sūraḥ | na | hi | dyutā | tvam | kr̥pā | pāvaka | rocase ||6.2.6||

IAST: sūro na hi dyutā tvaṁ kṛpā pāvaka rocase
Griffith: For, Purifier! like the Sun thou beamest with thy radiant glow.
Devanāgarī: सूरो न हि द्युता त्वं कृपा पावक रोचसे
pada pāṭha: tveṣaḥ | te | dhūmaḥ | r̥ṇvati | divi | san | śukraḥ | ā-tataḥ || sūraḥ | na | hi | dyutā | tvam | kr̥pā | pāvaka | rocase ||6.2.6||

IAST: adhā hi vikṣv īḍyo 'si priyo no atithiḥ
Griffith: For in men's houses thou must be glorified as a well-loved guest,
Devanāgarī: अधा हि विक्ष्वीड्योऽसि प्रियो नो अतिथिः
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | vikṣu | īḍyaḥ | asi | priyaḥ | naḥ | atithiḥ || raṇvaḥ | puri-iva | jūryaḥ | sūnuḥ | na | trayayāyyaḥ ||6.2.7||

IAST: raṇvaḥ purīva jūryaḥ sūnur na trayayāyyaḥ
Griffith: Gay like an elder in a fort, claiming protection like a son.
Devanāgarī: रण्वः पुरीव जूर्यः सूनुर्न त्रययाय्यः
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | vikṣu | īḍyaḥ | asi | priyaḥ | naḥ | atithiḥ || raṇvaḥ | puri-iva | jūryaḥ | sūnuḥ | na | trayayāyyaḥ ||6.2.7||

IAST: kratvā hi droṇe ajyase 'gne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Agni, like an able steed, art urged by wisdom in the wood.
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वा हि द्रोणे अज्यसेऽग्ने वाजी न कृत्व्यः
pada pāṭha: kratvā | hi | droṇe | ajyase | agne | vājī | na | kr̥tvyaḥ || parijmā-iva | svadhā | gayaḥ | atyaḥ | na | hvāryaḥ | śiśuḥ ||6.2.8||

IAST: parijmeva svadhā gayo 'tyo na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ
Griffith: Thou art like wind; food, home art thou, like a young horse that runs astray.
Devanāgarī: परिज्मेव स्वधा गयोऽत्यो न ह्वार्यः शिशुः
pada pāṭha: kratvā | hi | droṇe | ajyase | agne | vājī | na | kr̥tvyaḥ || parijmā-iva | svadhā | gayaḥ | atyaḥ | na | hvāryaḥ | śiśuḥ ||6.2.8||

IAST: tvaṁ tyā cid acyutāgne paśur na yavase
Griffith: E'en things imperishable, thou, O Agni, like a gazing ox,
Devanāgarī: त्वं त्या चिदच्युताग्ने पशुर्न यवसे
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyā | cit | acyutā | agne | paśuḥ | na | yavase || dhāma | ha | yat | te | ajara | vanā | vr̥ścanti | śikvasaḥ ||6.2.9||

IAST: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ
Griffith: Eatest, when hosts, Eternal One! of thee the Mighty rend the woods.
Devanāgarī: धामा ह यत्ते अजर वना वृश्चन्ति शिक्वसः
pada pāṭha: tvam | tyā | cit | acyutā | agne | paśuḥ | na | yavase || dhāma | ha | yat | te | ajara | vanā | vr̥ścanti | śikvasaḥ ||6.2.9||

IAST: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām agne hotā dame viśām
Griffith: Agni, thou enterest as Priest the home of men who sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: वेषि ह्यध्वरीयतामग्ने होता दमे विशाम्
pada pāṭha: veṣi | hi | adhvari-yatām | agne | hotā | dame | viśām || sam-r̥dhaḥ | viśpate | kr̥ṇu | juṣasva | havyam | aṅgiraḥ ||6.2.10||

IAST: samṛdho viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyam aṅgiraḥ
Griffith: Lord of the people, prosper them. Accept the ofrering, Angiras!
Devanāgarī: समृधो विश्पते कृणु जुषस्व हव्यमङ्गिरः
pada pāṭha: veṣi | hi | adhvari-yatām | agne | hotā | dame | viśām || sam-r̥dhaḥ | viśpate | kr̥ṇu | juṣasva | havyam | aṅgiraḥ ||6.2.10||

IAST: acchā no mitramaho deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatiṁ rodasyoḥ
Griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might, call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | deva | devān | agne | vocaḥ | su-matim | rodasyoḥ || vīhi | svastim | su-kṣitim | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | dviṣaḥ | aṁhāṁsi | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.2.11||

IAST: vīhi svastiṁ sukṣitiṁ divo nṝn dviṣo aṁhāṁsi duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema
Griffith: Bring weal from heaven, that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may w
Devanāgarī: वीहि स्वस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄन्द्विषो अंहांसि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | deva | devān | agne | vocaḥ | su-matim | rodasyoḥ || vīhi | svastim | su-kṣitim | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | dviṣaḥ | aṁhāṁsi | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.2.11||

IAST: agne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotir naśate devayuṣ ṭe
Griffith: TRUE, guardian of the Law, thy faithful servant wins ample light and dwells in peace, O Agni,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने स क्षेषदृतपा ऋतेजा उरु ज्योतिर्नशते देवयुष्टे
pada pāṭha: agne | saḥ | kṣeṣat | r̥ta-pāḥ | r̥te-jāḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | naśate | deva-yuḥ | te || yam | tvam | mitreṇa | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | deva | pāsi | tyajasā | martam | aṁhaḥ ||6.3.1||

IAST: yaṁ tvam mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martam aṁhaḥ
Griffith: Whom thou, as Varuna in accord with Mitra, guardest, O God, by banishing his trouble.
Devanāgarī: यं त्वं मित्रेण वरुणः सजोषा देव पासि त्यजसा मर्तमंहः .
pada pāṭha: agne | saḥ | kṣeṣat | r̥ta-pāḥ | r̥te-jāḥ | uru | jyotiḥ | naśate | deva-yuḥ | te || yam | tvam | mitreṇa | varuṇaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | deva | pāsi | tyajasā | martam | aṁhaḥ ||6.3.1||

IAST: īje yajñebhiḥ śaśame śamībhir ṛdhadvārāyāgnaye dadāśa
Griffith: He hath paid sacrifices, toiled in worship, and offered gifts to wealth-increasing Agni.
Devanāgarī: ईजे यज्ञेभिः शशमे शमीभिरृधद्वारायाग्नये ददाश
pada pāṭha: īje | yajñebhiḥ | śaśame | śamībhiḥ | r̥dhat-vārāya | agnaye | dadāśa || eva | cana | tam | yaśasām | ajuṣṭiḥ | na | aṁhaḥ | martam | naśate | na | pra-dr̥ptiḥ ||6.3.2||

IAST: evā cana taṁ yaśasām ajuṣṭir nāṁho martaṁ naśate na pradṛptiḥ
Griffith: Him the displeasure of the famous moves not, outrage and scorn affect not such a mortal.
Devanāgarī: एवा चन तं यशसामजुष्टिर्नांहो मर्तं नशते न प्रदृप्तिः .
pada pāṭha: īje | yajñebhiḥ | śaśame | śamībhiḥ | r̥dhat-vārāya | agnaye | dadāśa || eva | cana | tam | yaśasām | ajuṣṭiḥ | na | aṁhaḥ | martam | naśate | na | pra-dr̥ptiḥ ||6.3.2||

IAST: sūro na yasya dṛśatir arepā bhīmā yad eti śucatas ta ā dhīḥ
Griffith: Bright God, whose look is free from stain like Surya's, thou, swift, what time thou earnestly desirest,
Devanāgarī: सूरो न यस्य दृशतिररेपा भीमा यदेति शुचतस्त आ धीः
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | na | yasya | dr̥śatiḥ | arepāḥ | bhīmā | yat | eti | śucataḥ | te | ā | dhīḥ || heṣasvataḥ | śurudhaḥ | na | ayam | aktoḥ | kutra | cit | raṇvaḥ | vasatiḥ | vane-jāḥ ||6.3.3||

IAST: heṣasvataḥ śurudho nāyam aktoḥ kutrā cid raṇvo vasatir vanejāḥ
Griffith: Hast gear to give us. Come with joy at evening, where, Child of Wood, thou mayest also tarry.
Devanāgarī: हेषस्वतः शुरुधो नायमक्तोः कुत्रा चिद्रण्वो वसतिर्वनेजाः .
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | na | yasya | dr̥śatiḥ | arepāḥ | bhīmā | yat | eti | śucataḥ | te | ā | dhīḥ || heṣasvataḥ | śurudhaḥ | na | ayam | aktoḥ | kutra | cit | raṇvaḥ | vasatiḥ | vane-jāḥ ||6.3.3||

IAST: tigmaṁ cid ema mahi varpo asya bhasad aśvo na yamasāna āsā
Griffith: Fierce is his gait and vast his wondrous body: he champeth like a horse with bit and bridle,
Devanāgarī: तिग्मं चिदेम महि वर्पो अस्य भसदश्वो न यमसान आसा
pada pāṭha: tigmam | cit | ema | mahi | varpaḥ | asya | bhasat | aśvaḥ | na | yamasāna | āsā || vi-jehamānaḥ | paraśuḥ | na | jihvām | draviḥ | na | dravayati | dāru | dhakṣat ||6.3.4||

IAST: vijehamānaḥ paraśur na jihvāṁ dravir na drāvayati dāru dhakṣat
Griffith: And, darting forth his tongue, as 'twere a hatchet, burning the woods, smelteth them like a smelter.
Devanāgarī: विजेहमानः परशुर्न जिह्वां द्रविर्न द्रावयति दारु धक्षत् .
pada pāṭha: tigmam | cit | ema | mahi | varpaḥ | asya | bhasat | aśvaḥ | na | yamasāna | āsā || vi-jehamānaḥ | paraśuḥ | na | jihvām | draviḥ | na | dravayati | dāru | dhakṣat ||6.3.4||

IAST: sa id asteva prati dhād asiṣyañ chiśīta tejo 'yaso na dhārām
Griffith: Archer-like, fain toshoot, he sets his arrow, and whets his splendour like the edge of iron:
Devanāgarī: स इदस्तेव प्रति धादसिष्यञ्छिशीत तेजोऽयसो न धाराम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | astā-iva | prati | dhāt | asiṣyan | śiśīta | tejaḥ | ayasaḥ | na | dhārām || citra-dhrajatiḥ | aratiḥ | yaḥ | aktoḥ | veḥ | na | dru-sadvā | raghupatma-jaṁhāḥ ||6.3.5||

IAST: citradhrajatir aratir yo aktor ver na druṣadvā raghupatmajaṁhāḥ
Griffith: The messenger of night with brilliant pathway, like a tree-roosting bird of rapid pinion.
Devanāgarī: चित्रध्रजतिररतिर्यो अक्तोर्वेर्न द्रुषद्वा रघुपत्मजंहाः .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | astā-iva | prati | dhāt | asiṣyan | śiśīta | tejaḥ | ayasaḥ | na | dhārām || citra-dhrajatiḥ | aratiḥ | yaḥ | aktoḥ | veḥ | na | dru-sadvā | raghupatma-jaṁhāḥ ||6.3.5||

IAST: sa īṁ rebho na prati vasta usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitramahāḥ
Griffith: In beams of morn he clothes him like the singer, and bright as Mitra with his splendour crackles.
Devanāgarī: स ईं रेभो न प्रति वस्त उस्राः शोचिषा रारपीति मित्रमहाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | rebhaḥ | na | prati | vaste | usrāḥ | śociṣā | rarapīti | mitra-mahāḥ || naktam | yaḥ | īm | aruṣaḥ | yaḥ | divā | nr̥̄n | amartyaḥ | aruṣaḥ | yaḥ | divā | nr̥̄n ||6.3.6||

IAST: naktaṁ ya īm aruṣo yo divā nṝn amartyo aruṣo yo divā nṝn
Griffith: Red in the night, by day the men's possession: red, he belongs to men by day, Immortal.
Devanāgarī: नक्तं य ईमरुषो यो दिवा नॄनमर्त्यो अरुषो यो दिवा नॄन् .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | rebhaḥ | na | prati | vaste | usrāḥ | śociṣā | rarapīti | mitra-mahāḥ || naktam | yaḥ | īm | aruṣaḥ | yaḥ | divā | nr̥̄n | amartyaḥ | aruṣaḥ | yaḥ | divā | nr̥̄n ||6.3.6||

IAST: divo na yasya vidhato navīnod vṛṣā rukṣa oṣadhīṣu nūnot
Griffith: Like Heaven's when scattering beams his voice was uttered: among the plants the radiant Hero shouted,
Devanāgarī: दिवो न यस्य विधतो नवीनोद्वृषा रुक्ष ओषधीषु नूनोत्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | yasya | vidhataḥ | navīnot | vr̥ṣā | rukṣaḥ | oṣadhīṣu | nūnot || ghr̥ṇā | na | yaḥ | dhrajasā | patmanā | yan | ā | rodasī iti | vasunā | dam | supatnī iti su-patnī ||6.3.7||

IAST: ghṛṇā na yo dhrajasā patmanā yann ā rodasī vasunā daṁ supatnī
Griffith: Who with his glow in rapid course came hither to fill both worlds, well-wedded Dames, with treasure.
Devanāgarī: घृणा न यो ध्रजसा पत्मना यन्ना रोदसी वसुना दं सुपत्नी .
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | yasya | vidhataḥ | navīnot | vr̥ṣā | rukṣaḥ | oṣadhīṣu | nūnot || ghr̥ṇā | na | yaḥ | dhrajasā | patmanā | yan | ā | rodasī iti | vasunā | dam | supatnī iti su-patnī ||6.3.7||

IAST: dhāyobhir vā yo yujyebhir arkair vidyun na davidyot svebhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ
Griffith: Who, with supporting streams and rays that suit him, hath flashed like lightning with his native vigour.
Devanāgarī: धायोभिर्वा यो युज्येभिरर्कैर्विद्युन्न दविद्योत्स्वेभिः शुष्मैः
pada pāṭha: dhāyaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | yaḥ | yujyebhiḥ | arkaiḥ | vi-dyut | na | davidyot | svebhiḥ | śuṣmaiḥ || śardhaḥ | vā | yaḥ | marutām | tatakṣa | r̥bhuḥ | na | tveṣaḥ | rabhasānaḥ | adyaut ||6.3.8||

IAST: śardho vā yo marutāṁ tatakṣa ṛbhur na tveṣo rabhasāno adyaut
Griffith: Like the deft Maker of the band of Maruts, the bright impetuous One hath shone refulgent.
Devanāgarī: शर्धो वा यो मरुतां ततक्ष ऋभुर्न त्वेषो रभसानो अद्यौत् .
pada pāṭha: dhāyaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | yaḥ | yujyebhiḥ | arkaiḥ | vi-dyut | na | davidyot | svebhiḥ | śuṣmaiḥ || śardhaḥ | vā | yaḥ | marutām | tatakṣa | r̥bhuḥ | na | tveṣaḥ | rabhasānaḥ | adyaut ||6.3.8||

IAST: yathā hotar manuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi
Griffith: As at man's service of the Gods, Invoker, thou, Son of Strength, dost sacrifice and worship,
Devanāgarī: यथा होतर्मनुषो देवताता यज्ञेभिः सूनो सहसो यजासि
pada pāṭha: yathā | hotaḥ | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātā | yajñebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yajāsi || eva | naḥ | adya | samanā | samānān | uśan | agne | uśataḥ | yakṣi | devān ||6.4.1||

IAST: evā no adya samanā samānān uśann agna uśato yakṣi devān
Griffith: So bring for us to-day all Gods together, bring willingly the willing Gods, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: एवा नो अद्य समना समानानुशन्नग्न उशतो यक्षि देवान् .
pada pāṭha: yathā | hotaḥ | manuṣaḥ | deva-tātā | yajñebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yajāsi || eva | naḥ | adya | samanā | samānān | uśan | agne | uśataḥ | yakṣi | devān ||6.4.1||

IAST: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇir na vastor agnir vandāru vedyaś cano dhāt
Griffith: May Agni, radiant Herald of the morning, meet to be known, accept our praise with favour.
Devanāgarī: स नो विभावा चक्षणिर्न वस्तोरग्निर्वन्दारु वेद्यश्चनो धात्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vibhā-vā | cakṣaṇiḥ | na | vastoḥ | agniḥ | vandāru | vedyaḥ | canaḥ | dhāt || viśva-āyuḥ | yaḥ | amr̥taḥ | martyeṣu | uṣaḥ-bhut | bhūt | atithiḥ | jāta-vedāḥ ||6.4.2||

IAST: viśvāyur yo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūd atithir jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Dear to all life, mid mortal men Immortal, our guest, awake at dawn, is Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: विश्वायुर्यो अमृतो मर्त्येषूषर्भुद्भूदतिथिर्जातवेदाः .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vibhā-vā | cakṣaṇiḥ | na | vastoḥ | agniḥ | vandāru | vedyaḥ | canaḥ | dhāt || viśva-āyuḥ | yaḥ | amr̥taḥ | martyeṣu | uṣaḥ-bhut | bhūt | atithiḥ | jāta-vedāḥ ||6.4.2||

IAST: dyāvo na yasya panayanty abhvam bhāsāṁsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ
Griffith: Whose might the very heavens regard with wonder: bright as the Sun he clothes himself with lustre.
Devanāgarī: द्यावो न यस्य पनयन्त्यभ्वं भासांसि वस्ते सूर्यो न शुक्रः
pada pāṭha: dyāvaḥ | na | yasya | panayanti | abhvam | bhāsāṁsi | vaste | sūryaḥ | na | śukraḥ || vi | yaḥ | inoti | ajaraḥ | pāvakaḥ | aśnasya | cit | śiśnathat | pūrvyāṇi ||6.4.3||

IAST: vi ya inoty ajaraḥ pāvako 'śnasya cic chiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
Griffith: He who sends forth,, Eternal Purifier, hath shattered e'en the ancient works of Asna.
Devanāgarī: वि य इनोत्यजरः पावकोऽश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पूर्व्याणि .
pada pāṭha: dyāvaḥ | na | yasya | panayanti | abhvam | bhāsāṁsi | vaste | sūryaḥ | na | śukraḥ || vi | yaḥ | inoti | ajaraḥ | pāvakaḥ | aśnasya | cit | śiśnathat | pūrvyāṇi ||6.4.3||

IAST: vadmā hi sūno asy admasadvā cakre agnir januṣājmānnam
Griffith: Thou art a Singer, Son! our feast-companion: Agni at birth prepared his food and pathway.
Devanāgarī: वद्मा हि सूनो अस्यद्मसद्वा चक्रे अग्निर्जनुषाज्मान्नम्
pada pāṭha: vadmā | hi | sūno iti | asi | adma-sadvā | cakre | agniḥ | januṣā | ajma | annam || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | ūrja-sane | ūrjam | dhāḥ | rājā-iva | jeḥ | avr̥ke | kṣeṣi | antariti ||6.4.4||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na ūrjasana ūrjaṁ dhā rājeva jer avṛke kṣeṣy antaḥ
Griffith: Therefore vouchsafe us strength, O Strength-bestower. Win like a King: foes trouble not thy dwelling.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न ऊर्जसन ऊर्जं धा राजेव जेरवृके क्षेष्यन्तः .
pada pāṭha: vadmā | hi | sūno iti | asi | adma-sadvā | cakre | agniḥ | januṣā | ajma | annam || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | ūrja-sane | ūrjam | dhāḥ | rājā-iva | jeḥ | avr̥ke | kṣeṣi | antariti ||6.4.4||

IAST: nitikti yo vāraṇam annam atti vāyur na rāṣṭry aty ety aktūn
Griffith: Even he who cats his firm hard food with swiftness,and overtakes the nights as Vayu kingdoms.
Devanāgarī: नितिक्ति यो वारणमन्नमत्ति वायुर्न राष्ट्र्यत्येत्यक्तून्
pada pāṭha: ni-tikti | yaḥ | vāraṇam | annam | atti | vāyuḥ | na | rāṣṭrī | ati | eti | aktūn || turyāmaḥ | yaḥ | te | ā-diśām | arātīḥ | atyaḥ | na | hrutaḥ | patataḥ | pari-hrut ||6.4.5||

IAST: turyāma yas ta ādiśām arātīr atyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut
Griffith: May we o'ercome those who resist thine orders, like a steed casting down the flying foemen.
Devanāgarī: तुर्याम यस्त आदिशामरातीरत्यो न ह्रुतः पततः परिह्रुत् .
pada pāṭha: ni-tikti | yaḥ | vāraṇam | annam | atti | vāyuḥ | na | rāṣṭrī | ati | eti | aktūn || turyāmaḥ | yaḥ | te | ā-diśām | arātīḥ | atyaḥ | na | hrutaḥ | patataḥ | pari-hrut ||6.4.5||

IAST: ā sūryo na bhānumadbhir arkair agne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā
Griffith: Like Surya with his fulgent rays, O Agni, thou overspreadest both the worlds with splendour.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यो न भानुमद्भिरर्कैरग्ने ततन्थ रोदसी वि भासा
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | na | bhānumat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ | agne | tatantha | rodasī iti | vi | bhāsā || citraḥ | nayat | pari | tamāṁsi | aktaḥ | śociṣā | patman | auśijaḥ | na | dīyan ||6.4.6||

IAST: citro nayat pari tamāṁsy aktaḥ śociṣā patmann auśijo na dīyan
Griffith: Decked with bright colour he dispels the darkness, like Ausija, with clear flame swifily flying.
Devanāgarī: चित्रो नयत्परि तमांस्यक्तः शोचिषा पत्मन्नौशिजो न दीयन् .
pada pāṭha: ā | sūryaḥ | na | bhānumat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ | agne | tatantha | rodasī iti | vi | bhāsā || citraḥ | nayat | pari | tamāṁsi | aktaḥ | śociṣā | patman | auśijaḥ | na | dīyan ||6.4.6||

IAST: tvāṁ hi mandratamam arkaśokair vavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣy agne
Griffith: We have elected thee as most delightful for thy beams' glow: hear our great laud, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: त्वां हि मन्द्रतममर्कशोकैर्ववृमहे महि नः श्रोष्यग्ने
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | mandra-tamam | arka-śokaiḥ | vavr̥mahe | mahi | naḥ | śroṣi | agne || indram | na | tvā | śavasā | devatā | vāyum | pr̥ṇanti | rādhasā | nr̥-tamāḥ ||6.4.7||

IAST: indraṁ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyum pṛṇanti rādhasā nṛtamāḥ
Griffith: The best men praise thee as the peer of Indra in strength, mid Gods, like Viyu in thy bounty.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं न त्वा शवसा देवता वायुं पृणन्ति राधसा नृतमाः .
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | mandra-tamam | arka-śokaiḥ | vavr̥mahe | mahi | naḥ | śroṣi | agne || indram | na | tvā | śavasā | devatā | vāyum | pr̥ṇanti | rādhasā | nr̥-tamāḥ ||6.4.7||

IAST: nū no agne 'vṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣy aṁhaḥ
Griffith: Now, Agni, on the tranquil paths of riches come to us for our weal: save us from sorrow.
Devanāgarī: नू नो अग्नेऽवृकेभिः स्वस्ति वेषि रायः पथिभिः पर्ष्यंहः
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | agne | avr̥kebhiḥ | svasti | veṣi | rāyaḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | parṣi | aṁhaḥ || tā | sūri-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | rāsi | sumnam | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.4.8||

IAST: tā sūribhyo gṛṇate rāsi sumnam madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Grant chiefs and bard this boon. May we live happy, with hero children, through a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: ता सूरिभ्यो गृणते रासि सुम्नं मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः .
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | agne | avr̥kebhiḥ | svasti | veṣi | rāyaḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | parṣi | aṁhaḥ || tā | sūri-bhyaḥ | gr̥ṇate | rāsi | sumnam | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.4.8||

IAST: huve vaḥ sūnuṁ sahaso yuvānam adroghavācam matibhir yaviṣṭham
Griffith: I INVOCATE your Son of Strength, the Youthful, with hymns, the Youngest God, whose speech is guileless;
Devanāgarī: हुवे वः सूनुं सहसो युवानमद्रोघवाचं मतिभिर्यविष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | sūnum | sahasaḥ | yuvānam | adrogha-vācam | mati-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭham || yaḥ | invati | draviṇāni | pra-cetāḥ | viśva-vārāṇi | puru-vāraḥ | adhruk ||6.5.1||

IAST: ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāro adhruk
Griffith: Sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure, bringer of many boons, devoid of malice.
Devanāgarī: य इन्वति द्रविणानि प्रचेता विश्ववाराणि पुरुवारो अध्रुक्
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | sūnum | sahasaḥ | yuvānam | adrogha-vācam | mati-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭham || yaḥ | invati | draviṇāni | pra-cetāḥ | viśva-vārāṇi | puru-vāraḥ | adhruk ||6.5.1||

IAST: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotar doṣā vastor erire yajñiyāsaḥ
Griffith: At eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts, O Priest of many aspects,
Devanāgarī: त्वे वसूनि पुर्वणीक होतर्दोषा वस्तोरेरिरे यज्ञियासः
pada pāṭha: tve iti | vasūni | puru-aṇīka | hotaḥ | doṣā | vastoḥ | ā | īrire | yajñiyāsaḥ || kṣāma-iva | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yasmin | sam | saubhagāni | dadhire | pāvake ||6.5.2||

IAST: kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṁ saubhagāni dadhire pāvake
Griffith: On whom, the Purifier, all things living as on firm. ground their happiness have stablished.
Devanāgarī: क्षामेव विश्वा भुवनानि यस्मिन्सं सौभगानि दधिरे पावके
pada pāṭha: tve iti | vasūni | puru-aṇīka | hotaḥ | doṣā | vastoḥ | ā | īrire | yajñiyāsaḥ || kṣāma-iva | viśvā | bhuvanāni | yasmin | sam | saubhagāni | dadhire | pāvake ||6.5.2||

IAST: tvaṁ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīr abhavo vāryāṇām
Griffith: Thou from of old hast dwelt among these people, by mental power the charioteer of blessings.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विक्षु प्रदिवः सीद आसु क्रत्वा रथीरभवो वार्याणाम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | vikṣu | pra-divaḥ | sīdaḥ | āsu | kratvā | rathīḥ | abhavaḥ | vāryāṇām || ataḥ | inoṣi | vidhate | cikitvaḥ | vi | ānuṣak | jāta-vedaḥ | vasūni ||6.5.3||

IAST: ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vy ānuṣag jātavedo vasūni
Griffith: Hence sendest thou, O sapient Jatavedas, to him who serves thee treasures in succession.
Devanāgarī: अत इनोषि विधते चिकित्वो व्यानुषग्जातवेदो वसूनि
pada pāṭha: tvam | vikṣu | pra-divaḥ | sīdaḥ | āsu | kratvā | rathīḥ | abhavaḥ | vāryāṇām || ataḥ | inoṣi | vidhate | cikitvaḥ | vi | ānuṣak | jāta-vedaḥ | vasūni ||6.5.3||

IAST: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsad agne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt
Griffith: Agni, whoever secretly attacks us, the neighbour, thou with Mitra's might! who harms us,
Devanāgarī: यो नः सनुत्यो अभिदासदग्ने यो अन्तरो मित्रमहो वनुष्यात्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | sanutyaḥ | abhi-dāsat | agne | yaḥ | antaraḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | vanuṣyāt || tam | ajarebhiḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | tava | svaiḥ | tapa | tapiṣṭha | tapasā | tapasvān ||6.5.4||

IAST: tam ajarebhir vṛṣabhis tava svais tapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān
Griffith: Burn him with thine own Steers for ever youthful, burning with burning heat, thou fiercest burner.
Devanāgarī: तमजरेभिर्वृषभिस्तव स्वैस्तपा तपिष्ठ तपसा तपस्वान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | sanutyaḥ | abhi-dāsat | agne | yaḥ | antaraḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | vanuṣyāt || tam | ajarebhiḥ | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | tava | svaiḥ | tapa | tapiṣṭha | tapasā | tapasvān ||6.5.4||

IAST: yas te yajñena samidhā ya ukthair arkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat
Griffith: He who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel, with hymn, O Son of Strength, and chanted praises,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते यज्ञेन समिधा य उक्थैरर्केभिः सूनो सहसो ददाशत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | yajñena | sam-idhā | yaḥ | ukthaiḥ | arkebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | dadāśat || saḥ | martyeṣu | amr̥ta | pra-cetāḥ | rāyā | dyumnena | śravasā | vi | bhāti ||6.5.5||

IAST: sa martyeṣv amṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti
Griffith: Shines out, Immortal! in the midst of mortals, a sage, with wealth, with splendour and with glory.
Devanāgarī: स मर्त्येष्वमृत प्रचेता राया द्युम्नेन श्रवसा वि भाति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | yajñena | sam-idhā | yaḥ | ukthaiḥ | arkebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | dadāśat || saḥ | martyeṣu | amr̥ta | pra-cetāḥ | rāyā | dyumnena | śravasā | vi | bhāti ||6.5.5||

IAST: sa tat kṛdhīṣitas tūyam agne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān
Griffith: Do this, O Agni, when we urge thee, quickly, triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen.
Devanāgarī: स तत्कृधीषितस्तूयमग्ने स्पृधो बाधस्व सहसा सहस्वान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tat | kr̥dhi | iṣitaḥ | tūyam | agne | spr̥dhaḥ | bādhasva | sahasā | sahasvān || yat | śasyase | dyu-bhiḥ | aktaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | tat | juṣasva | jarituḥ | ghoṣi | manma ||6.5.6||

IAST: yac chasyase dyubhir akto vacobhis taj juṣasva jaritur ghoṣi manma
Griffith: When thou art praised with words and decked with brightness, accept this chanted hymn, the singer's wors
Devanāgarī: यच्छस्यसे द्युभिरक्तो वचोभिस्तज्जुषस्व जरितुर्घोषि मन्म
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tat | kr̥dhi | iṣitaḥ | tūyam | agne | spr̥dhaḥ | bādhasva | sahasā | sahasvān || yat | śasyase | dyu-bhiḥ | aktaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | tat | juṣasva | jarituḥ | ghoṣi | manma ||6.5.6||

IAST: aśyāma taṁ kāmam agne tavotī aśyāma rayiṁ rayivaḥ suvīram
Griffith: Help us, that we may gain this wish, O Agni, gain riches, Wealthy One! with store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: अश्याम तं काममग्ने तवोती अश्याम रयिं रयिवः सुवीरम्
pada pāṭha: aśyāma | tam | kāmam | agne | tava | ūtī | aśyāma | rayim | rayi-vaḥ | su-vīram || aśyāma | vājam | abhi | vājayantaḥ | aśyāma | dyumnam | ajara | ajaram | te ||6.5.7||

IAST: aśyāma vājam abhi vājayanto 'śyāma dyumnam ajarājaraṁ te
Griffith: Desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened, and win, Eternal! thine eternal glory.
Devanāgarī: अश्याम वाजमभि वाजयन्तोऽश्याम द्युम्नमजराजरं ते
pada pāṭha: aśyāma | tam | kāmam | agne | tava | ūtī | aśyāma | rayim | rayi-vaḥ | su-vīram || aśyāma | vājam | abhi | vājayantaḥ | aśyāma | dyumnam | ajara | ajaram | te ||6.5.7||

IAST: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnum acchā yajñena gātum ava icchamānaḥ
Griffith: HE who seeks furtherance and grace to help him goes to the Son of Strength with newest worship,
Devanāgarī: प्र नव्यसा सहसः सूनुमच्छा यज्ञेन गातुमव इच्छमानः
pada pāṭha: pra | navyasā | sahasaḥ | sūnum | accha | yajñena | gātum | avaḥ | icchamānaḥ || vr̥ścat-vanam | kr̥ṣṇa-yāmam | ruśantam | vītī | hotāram | divyam | jigāti ||6.6.1||

IAST: vṛścadvanaṁ kṛṣṇayāmaṁ ruśantaṁ vītī hotāraṁ divyaṁ jigāti
Griffith: Calling the heavenly Priest to share the banquet, who rends the wood, bright, with his blackened pathway
Devanāgarī: वृश्चद्वनं कृष्णयामं रुशन्तं वीती होतारं दिव्यं जिगाति
pada pāṭha: pra | navyasā | sahasaḥ | sūnum | accha | yajñena | gātum | avaḥ | icchamānaḥ || vr̥ścat-vanam | kr̥ṣṇa-yāmam | ruśantam | vītī | hotāram | divyam | jigāti ||6.6.1||

IAST: sa śvitānas tanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhir nānadadbhir yaviṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: White-hued and thundering he dwells in splendour, Most Youthful, with the loudvoiced and eternal-
Devanāgarī: स श्वितानस्तन्यतू रोचनस्था अजरेभिर्नानदद्भिर्यविष्ठः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | śvitānaḥ | tānyatuḥ | rocana-sthāḥ | ajarebhiḥ | nānadat-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭhaḥ || yaḥ | pāvakaḥ | puru-tamaḥ | purūṇi | pr̥thūni | agniḥ | anu-yāti | bharvan ||6.6.2||

IAST: yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūny agnir anuyāti bharvan
Griffith: Agni, most variform, the Purifier, who follows crunching many ample forests.
Devanāgarī: यः पावकः पुरुतमः पुरूणि पृथून्यग्निरनुयाति भर्वन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | śvitānaḥ | tānyatuḥ | rocana-sthāḥ | ajarebhiḥ | nānadat-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭhaḥ || yaḥ | pāvakaḥ | puru-tamaḥ | purūṇi | pr̥thūni | agniḥ | anu-yāti | bharvan ||6.6.2||

IAST: vi te viṣvag vātajūtāso agne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaś caranti
Griffith: Incited by the wind thy flames, O Agni, move onward, Pure One! pure, in all directions.
Devanāgarī: वि ते विष्वग्वातजूतासो अग्ने भामासः शुचे शुचयश्चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: vi | te | viṣvak | vāta-jūtāsaḥ | agne | bhāmāsaḥ | śuce | śucayaḥ | caranti || tuvi-mrakṣāsaḥ | divyāḥ | nava-gvāḥ | vanā | vananti | dhr̥ṣatā | rujantaḥ ||6.6.3||

IAST: tuvimrakṣāso divyā navagvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ
Griffith: Thy most destructive heavenly Navagvas break the woods down and devastate them boldly.
Devanāgarī: तुविम्रक्षासो दिव्या नवग्वा वना वनन्ति धृषता रुजन्तः
pada pāṭha: vi | te | viṣvak | vāta-jūtāsaḥ | agne | bhāmāsaḥ | śuce | śucayaḥ | caranti || tuvi-mrakṣāsaḥ | divyāḥ | nava-gvāḥ | vanā | vananti | dhr̥ṣatā | rujantaḥ ||6.6.3||

IAST: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṁ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ
Griffith: Thy pure white horses from their bonds are loosened: O Radiant One, they shear the ground beneath them,
Devanāgarī: ये ते शुक्रासः शुचयः शुचिष्मः क्षां वपन्ति विषितासो अश्वाः
pada pāṭha: ye | te | śukrāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | śuciṣmaḥ | kṣām | vapanti | vi-sitāsaḥ | aśvāḥ || adha | bhramaḥ | te | urviyā | vi | bhāti | yātayamānaḥ | adhi | sānu | pr̥śneḥ ||6.6.4||

IAST: adha bhramas ta urviyā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ
Griffith: And far and wide shines out thy flame, and flickers rapidly moving over earth's high ridges.
Devanāgarī: अध भ्रमस्त उर्विया वि भाति यातयमानो अधि सानु पृश्नेः
pada pāṭha: ye | te | śukrāsaḥ | śucayaḥ | śuciṣmaḥ | kṣām | vapanti | vi-sitāsaḥ | aśvāḥ || adha | bhramaḥ | te | urviyā | vi | bhāti | yātayamānaḥ | adhi | sānu | pr̥śneḥ ||6.6.4||

IAST: adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo goṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā
Griffith: Forth darts the Bull's tongue like the sharp stone weapon discharged by him who fights to win the cattle.
Devanāgarī: अध जिह्वा पापतीति प्र वृष्णो गोषुयुधो नाशनिः सृजाना
pada pāṭha: adha | jihvā | pāpatīti | pra | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | goṣu-yudhaḥ | na | aśaniḥ | sr̥jānā || śūrasya-iva | pra-sitiḥ | kṣātiḥ | agneḥ | duḥ-vartuḥ | bhīmaḥ | dayate | vanāni ||6.6.5||

IAST: śūrasyeva prasitiḥ kṣātir agner durvartur bhīmo dayate vanāni
Griffith: Agni's fierce flame is like a hero's onset: dread and resistless he destroys the forests.
Devanāgarī: शूरस्येव प्रसितिः क्षातिरग्नेर्दुर्वर्तुर्भीमो दयते वनानि
pada pāṭha: adha | jihvā | pāpatīti | pra | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | goṣu-yudhaḥ | na | aśaniḥ | sr̥jānā || śūrasya-iva | pra-sitiḥ | kṣātiḥ | agneḥ | duḥ-vartuḥ | bhīmaḥ | dayate | vanāni ||6.6.5||

IAST: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṁsi mahas todasya dhṛṣatā tatantha
Griffith: Thou with the sunlight of the great Impeller hast boldly over-spread the earth's expanses.
Devanāgarī: आ भानुना पार्थिवानि ज्रयांसि महस्तोदस्य धृषता ततन्थ
pada pāṭha: ā | bhānunā | pārthivāni | jrayāṁsi | mahaḥ | todasya | dhr̥ṣatā | tatantha || saḥ | bādhasva | apa | bhayā | sahaḥ-bhiḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | vanuṣyan | vanuṣaḥ | ni | jūrva ||6.6.6||

IAST: sa bādhasvāpa bhayā sahobhiḥ spṛdho vanuṣyan vanuṣo ni jūrva
Griffith: So drive away with conquering might all perils. fighting out foemen burn up those who harm us.
Devanāgarī: स बाधस्वाप भया सहोभिः स्पृधो वनुष्यन्वनुषो नि जूर्व
pada pāṭha: ā | bhānunā | pārthivāni | jrayāṁsi | mahaḥ | todasya | dhr̥ṣatā | tatantha || saḥ | bādhasva | apa | bhayā | sahaḥ-bhiḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | vanuṣyan | vanuṣaḥ | ni | jūrva ||6.6.6||

IAST: sa citra citraṁ citayantam asme citrakṣatra citratamaṁ vayodhām
Griffith: Wondrous! of wondrous power! give to the singer wealth wondrous, marked, most wonderful, life-giving.
Devanāgarī: स चित्र चित्रं चितयन्तमस्मे चित्रक्षत्र चित्रतमं वयोधाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | citra | citram | citayantam | asme iti | citra-kṣatra | citra-tamam | vayaḥ-dhām || candram | rayim | puru-vīram | br̥hantam | candra | candrābhiḥ | gr̥ṇate | yuvasva ||6.6.7||

IAST: candraṁ rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṁ candra candrābhir gṛṇate yuvasva
Griffith: Wealth bright, O Bright One, vast, with many heroes, give with thy bright flames to the man who lauds t
Devanāgarī: चन्द्रं रयिं पुरुवीरं बृहन्तं चन्द्र चन्द्राभिर्गृणते युवस्व
pada pāṭha: saḥ | citra | citram | citayantam | asme iti | citra-kṣatra | citra-tamam | vayaḥ-dhām || candram | rayim | puru-vīram | br̥hantam | candra | candrābhiḥ | gr̥ṇate | yuvasva ||6.6.7||

IAST: mūrdhānaṁ divo aratim pṛthivyā vaiśvānaram ṛta ā jātam agnim
Griffith: Him, messenger of earth and head of heaven, Agni Vaisvanara, born in holy Order,
Devanāgarī: मूर्धानं दिवो अरतिं पृथिव्या वैश्वानरमृत आ जातमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: mūrdhānam | divaḥ | aratim | pr̥thivyāḥ | vaiśvānaram | r̥te | ā | jātam | agnim || kavim | sam-rājam | atithim | janānām | āsan | ā | pātram | janayanta | devāḥ ||6.7.1||

IAST: kaviṁ samrājam atithiṁ janānām āsann ā pātraṁ janayanta devāḥ
Griffith: The Sage, the King, the guest of men, a vessel fit for their mouths, the Gods have generated.
Devanāgarī: कविं सम्राजमतिथिं जनानामासन्ना पात्रं जनयन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: mūrdhānam | divaḥ | aratim | pr̥thivyāḥ | vaiśvānaram | r̥te | ā | jātam | agnim || kavim | sam-rājam | atithim | janānām | āsan | ā | pātram | janayanta | devāḥ ||6.7.1||

IAST: nābhiṁ yajñānāṁ sadanaṁ rayīṇām mahām āhāvam abhi saṁ navanta
Griffith: Him have they praised, mid-point of sacrifices, great cistern of libations, seat of riches.
Devanāgarī: नाभिं यज्ञानां सदनं रयीणां महामाहावमभि सं नवन्त
pada pāṭha: nābhim | yajñānām | sadanam | rayīṇām | mahām | ā-hāvam | abhi | sam | navanta || vaiśvānaram | rathyam | adhvarāṇām | yajñasya | ketum | janayanta | devāḥ ||6.7.2||

IAST: vaiśvānaraṁ rathyam adhvarāṇāṁ yajñasya ketuṁ janayanta devāḥ
Griffith: Vaisvanara, conveyer of oblations, ensign of worship, have the Gods engendered.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरं रथ्यमध्वराणां यज्ञस्य केतुं जनयन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: nābhim | yajñānām | sadanam | rayīṇām | mahām | ā-hāvam | abhi | sam | navanta || vaiśvānaram | rathyam | adhvarāṇām | yajñasya | ketum | janayanta | devāḥ ||6.7.2||

IAST: tvad vipro jāyate vājy agne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ
Griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs the mighty singer, from thee come heroes who subdue the foeman.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्विप्रो जायते वाज्यग्ने त्वद्वीरासो अभिमातिषाहः
pada pāṭha: tvat | vipraḥ | jāyate | vājī | agne | tvat | vīrāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ || vaiśvānara | tvam | asmāsu | dhehi | vasūni | rājan | spr̥hayāyyāṇi ||6.7.3||

IAST: vaiśvānara tvam asmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi
Griffith: O King, Vaisvanara, bestow thou on us excellent treasures worthy to belonged fo r.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर त्वमस्मासु धेहि वसूनि राजन्स्पृहयाय्याणि
pada pāṭha: tvat | vipraḥ | jāyate | vājī | agne | tvat | vīrāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ || vaiśvānara | tvam | asmāsu | dhehi | vasūni | rājan | spr̥hayāyyāṇi ||6.7.3||

IAST: tvāṁ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṁ śiśuṁ na devā abhi saṁ navante
Griffith: To thee, Immortal! when to life thou springest, all the Gods sing for joy as to their infant.
Devanāgarī: त्वां विश्वे अमृत जायमानं शिशुं न देवा अभि सं नवन्ते
pada pāṭha: tvām | viśve | amr̥ta | jāyamānam | śiśum | na | devāḥ | abhi | sam | navante || tava | kratu-bhiḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āyan | vaiśvānara | yat | pitroḥ | adīdeḥ ||6.7.4||

IAST: tava kratubhir amṛtatvam āyan vaiśvānara yat pitror adīdeḥ
Griffith: They by thy mental powers were made immortal, Vaisvanara, when thou shonest from thy Parents.
Devanāgarī: तव क्रतुभिरमृतत्वमायन्वैश्वानर यत्पित्रोरदीदेः
pada pāṭha: tvām | viśve | amr̥ta | jāyamānam | śiśum | na | devāḥ | abhi | sam | navante || tava | kratu-bhiḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āyan | vaiśvānara | yat | pitroḥ | adīdeḥ ||6.7.4||

IAST: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahāny agne nakir ā dadharṣa
Griffith: Agni Vaisvanara, no one hath ever resisted these thy mighty ordinances,
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानर तव तानि व्रतानि महान्यग्ने नकिरा दधर्ष
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānara | tava | tāni | vratāni | mahāni | agne | nakiḥ | ā | dadharṣa || yat | jāyamānaḥ | pitroḥ | upa-sthe | avindaḥ | ketum | vayuneṣu | ahnām ||6.7.5||

IAST: yaj jāyamānaḥ pitror upasthe 'vindaḥ ketuṁ vayuneṣv ahnām
Griffith: When thou, arising from thy Parents' bosom, foundest the light for days' appointed courses.
Devanāgarī: यज्जायमानः पित्रोरुपस्थेऽविन्दः केतुं वयुनेष्वह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānara | tava | tāni | vratāni | mahāni | agne | nakiḥ | ā | dadharṣa || yat | jāyamānaḥ | pitroḥ | upa-sthe | avindaḥ | ketum | vayuneṣu | ahnām ||6.7.5||

IAST: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā
Griffith: The summits of the heaven are traversed through and through by the Immortal's light, Vaisvanara's brillia
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरस्य विमितानि चक्षसा सानूनि दिवो अमृतस्य केतुना
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarasya | vi-mitāni | cakṣasā | sānūni | divaḥ | amr̥tasya | ketunā || tasya | it | ūm̐ iti | viśvā | bhuvanā | adhi | mūrdhani | vayāḥ-iva | ruruhuḥ | sapta | vi-sruhaḥ ||6.7.6||

IAST: tasyed u viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥ sapta visruhaḥ
Griffith: All creatures in existence rest upon his head. The Seven swift-flowing Streams have grown like branches
Devanāgarī: तस्येदु विश्वा भुवनाधि मूर्धनि वया इव रुरुहुः सप्त विस्रुहः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarasya | vi-mitāni | cakṣasā | sānūni | divaḥ | amr̥tasya | ketunā || tasya | it | ūm̐ iti | viśvā | bhuvanā | adhi | mūrdhani | vayāḥ-iva | ruruhuḥ | sapta | vi-sruhaḥ ||6.7.6||

IAST: vi yo rajāṁsy amimīta sukratur vaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ
Griffith: Vaisvanara, who measured out the realms of air, Sage very wise who made the lucid spheres of heaven,
Devanāgarī: वि यो रजांस्यमिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो वि दिवो रोचना कविः
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | rajāṁsi | amimīta | su-kratuḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | vi | divaḥ | rocanā | kaviḥ || pari | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanāni | paprathe | adabdhaḥ | gopāḥ | amr̥tasya | rakṣitā ||6.7.7||

IAST: pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe 'dabdho gopā amṛtasya rakṣitā
Griffith: The Undeceivable who spread out all the worlds, keeper is he and guard of immortality.
Devanāgarī: परि यो विश्वा भुवनानि पप्रथेऽदब्धो गोपा अमृतस्य रक्षिता
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | rajāṁsi | amimīta | su-kratuḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | vi | divaḥ | rocanā | kaviḥ || pari | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanāni | paprathe | adabdhaḥ | gopāḥ | amr̥tasya | rakṣitā ||6.7.7||

IAST: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū sahaḥ pra nu vocaṁ vidathā jātavedasaḥ
Griffith: AT Jatavedas' holy gathering I will tell aloud the conquering might of the swift red-hued Steer.
Devanāgarī: पृक्षस्य वृष्णो अरुषस्य नू सहः प्र नु वोचं विदथा जातवेदसः
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aruṣasya | nu | sahaḥ | pra | nu | vocam | vidathā | jāta-vedasaḥ || vaiśvānarāya | matiḥ | navyasī | śuciḥ | somaḥ-iva | pavate | cāruḥ | agnaye ||6.8.1||

IAST: vaiśvānarāya matir navyasī śuciḥ soma iva pavate cārur agnaye
Griffith: A pure and fresher hymn flows to Vaisvanara, even as for Agni lovely Soma is made pure.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानराय मतिर्नव्यसी शुचिः सोम इव पवते चारुरग्नये
pada pāṭha: pr̥kṣasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | aruṣasya | nu | sahaḥ | pra | nu | vocam | vidathā | jāta-vedasaḥ || vaiśvānarāya | matiḥ | navyasī | śuciḥ | somaḥ-iva | pavate | cāruḥ | agnaye ||6.8.1||

IAST: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratāny agnir vratapā arakṣata
Griffith: That Agni, when in loftiest heaven he sprang to life, Guardian of Holy Laws, kept and observed them well.
Devanāgarī: स जायमानः परमे व्योमनि व्रतान्यग्निर्व्रतपा अरक्षत
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyamānaḥ | parame | vi-omani | vratāni | agniḥ | vrata-pāḥ | arakṣata || vi | antarikṣam | amimīta | su-kratuḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | mahinā | nākam | aspr̥śat ||6.8.2||

IAST: vy antarikṣam amimīta sukratur vaiśvānaro mahinā nākam aspṛśat
Griffith: Exceeding wise, he measured out the firmament. Vaisvanara attained to heaven by mightiness.
Devanāgarī: व्यन्तरिक्षममिमीत सुक्रतुर्वैश्वानरो महिना नाकमस्पृशत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyamānaḥ | parame | vi-omani | vratāni | agniḥ | vrata-pāḥ | arakṣata || vi | antarikṣam | amimīta | su-kratuḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | mahinā | nākam | aspr̥śat ||6.8.2||

IAST: vy astabhnād rodasī mitro adbhuto 'ntarvāvad akṛṇoj jyotiṣā tamaḥ
Griffith: Wonderful Mitra propped the heaven and earth apart, and covered and concealed the darkness with his light.
Devanāgarī: व्यस्तभ्नाद्रोदसी मित्रो अद्भुतोऽन्तर्वावदकृणोज्ज्योतिषा तमः
pada pāṭha: vi | astabhnāt | rodasī iti | mitraḥ | adbhutaḥ | antaḥ-vāvat | akr̥ṇot | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || vi | carmaṇī iveti carmaṇī-iva | dhiṣaṇe iti | avartayat | vaiśvānaraḥ | viśvam | adhatta | vr̥ṣṇyam ||6.8.3||

IAST: vi carmaṇīva dhiṣaṇe avartayad vaiśvānaro viśvam adhatta vṛṣṇyam
Griffith: He made the two bowls part asunder like two skins. Vaisvanara put forth all his creative power.
Devanāgarī: वि चर्मणीव धिषणे अवर्तयद्वैश्वानरो विश्वमधत्त वृष्ण्यम्
pada pāṭha: vi | astabhnāt | rodasī iti | mitraḥ | adbhutaḥ | antaḥ-vāvat | akr̥ṇot | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || vi | carmaṇī iveti carmaṇī-iva | dhiṣaṇe iti | avartayat | vaiśvānaraḥ | viśvam | adhatta | vr̥ṣṇyam ||6.8.3||

IAST: apām upasthe mahiṣā agṛbhṇata viśo rājānam upa tasthur ṛgmiyam
Griffith: The Migbty seized him in the bosom of the floods: the people waited on the King who should be praised.
Devanāgarī: अपामुपस्थे महिषा अगृभ्णत विशो राजानमुप तस्थुरृग्मियम्
pada pāṭha: apām | upa-sthe | mahiṣāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | viśaḥ | rājānam | upa | tasthuḥ | r̥gmiyam || ā | dūtaḥ | agnim | abharat | vivasvataḥ | vaiśvānaram | mātariśvā | parā-vataḥ ||6.8.4||

IAST: ā dūto agnim abharad vivasvato vaiśvānaram mātariśvā parāvataḥ
Griffith: As envoy of Vivasvan MatariSvan brought Agni Vaisvanara hither from far away.
Devanāgarī: आ दूतो अग्निमभरद्विवस्वतो वैश्वानरं मातरिश्वा परावतः
pada pāṭha: apām | upa-sthe | mahiṣāḥ | agr̥bhṇata | viśaḥ | rājānam | upa | tasthuḥ | r̥gmiyam || ā | dūtaḥ | agnim | abharat | vivasvataḥ | vaiśvānaram | mātariśvā | parā-vataḥ ||6.8.4||

IAST: yuge-yuge vidathyaṁ gṛṇadbhyo 'gne rayiṁ yaśasaṁ dhehi navyasīm
Griffith: In every age bestow upon the singers wealth, worthy of holy synods, glorious, ever new.
Devanāgarī: युगेयुगे विदथ्यं गृणद्भ्योऽग्ने रयिं यशसं धेहि नव्यसीम्
pada pāṭha: yuge-yuge | vidathyam | gr̥ṇat-bhyaḥ | agne | rayim | yaśasam | dhehi | navyasīm || pavyā-iva | rājan | agha-śaṁsam | ajara | nīcā | ni | vr̥śca | vaninam | na | tejasā ||6.8.5||

IAST: pavyeva rājann aghaśaṁsam ajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninaṁ na tejasā
Griffith: King, undecaying, as it were with sharpened bolt, smite down the sinner like a tree with lightning-flas
Devanāgarī: पव्येव राजन्नघशंसमजर नीचा नि वृश्च वनिनं न तेजसा
pada pāṭha: yuge-yuge | vidathyam | gr̥ṇat-bhyaḥ | agne | rayim | yaśasam | dhehi | navyasīm || pavyā-iva | rājan | agha-śaṁsam | ajara | nīcā | ni | vr̥śca | vaninam | na | tejasā ||6.8.5||

IAST: asmākam agne maghavatsu dhārayānāmi kṣatram ajaraṁ suvīryam
Griffith: Do thou bestow, O Agni, on our wealthy chiefs, rule, with good heroes, undecaying, bending not.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमग्ने मघवत्सु धारयानामि क्षत्रमजरं सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | agne | maghavat-su | dhāraya | anāmi | kṣatram | ajaram | su-vīryam || vayam | jayema | śatinam | sahasriṇam | vaiśvānara | vājam | agne | tava | ūti-bhiḥ ||6.8.6||

IAST: vayaṁ jayema śatinaṁ sahasriṇaṁ vaiśvānara vājam agne tavotibhiḥ
Griffith: So may we win for us strength. O Vaisvanara, hundredfold, thousandfold, O Agni, by thy help.
Devanāgarī: वयं जयेम शतिनं सहस्रिणं वैश्वानर वाजमग्ने तवोतिभिः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | agne | maghavat-su | dhāraya | anāmi | kṣatram | ajaram | su-vīryam || vayam | jayema | śatinam | sahasriṇam | vaiśvānara | vājam | agne | tava | ūti-bhiḥ ||6.8.6||

IAST: adabdhebhis tava gopābhir iṣṭe 'smākam pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn
Griffith: O thou who dwellest in three places, Helper, keep with effective guards our princely patrons.
Devanāgarī: अदब्धेभिस्तव गोपाभिरिष्टेऽस्माकं पाहि त्रिषधस्थ सूरीन्
pada pāṭha: adabdhebhiḥ | tava | gopābhiḥ | iṣṭe | asmākam | pāhi | tri-sadhastha | sūrīn || rakṣa | ca | naḥ | daduṣām | śardhaḥ | agne | vaiśvānara | pra | ca | tārīḥ | stavānaḥ ||6.8.7||

IAST: rakṣā ca no daduṣāṁ śardho agne vaiśvānara pra ca tārīḥ stavānaḥ
Griffith: Keep our band, Agni, who have brought thee presents. Lengthen their lives, Vaisvanara, when lauded.
Devanāgarī: रक्षा च नो ददुषां शर्धो अग्ने वैश्वानर प्र च तारीः स्तवानः
pada pāṭha: adabdhebhiḥ | tava | gopābhiḥ | iṣṭe | asmākam | pāhi | tri-sadhastha | sūrīn || rakṣa | ca | naḥ | daduṣām | śardhaḥ | agne | vaiśvānara | pra | ca | tārīḥ | stavānaḥ ||6.8.7||

IAST: ahaś ca kṛṣṇam ahar arjunaṁ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ
Griffith: ONE half of day is dark, and bright the other: both atmospheres move on by sage devices.
Devanāgarī: अहश्च कृष्णमहरर्जुनं च वि वर्तेते रजसी वेद्याभिः
pada pāṭha: ahaḥ | ca | kr̥ṣṇam | ahaḥ | arjunam | ca | vi | vartete iti | rajasī iti | vedyābhiḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | jāyamānaḥ | na | rājā | ava | atirat | jyotiṣā | agniḥ | tamāṁsi ||6.9.1||

IAST: vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātiraj jyotiṣāgnis tamāṁsi
Griffith: Agni Vaisvanara, when born as Sovran, hath with his lustre overcome the darkness.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरो जायमानो न राजावातिरज्ज्योतिषाग्निस्तमांसि
pada pāṭha: ahaḥ | ca | kr̥ṣṇam | ahaḥ | arjunam | ca | vi | vartete iti | rajasī iti | vedyābhiḥ || vaiśvānaraḥ | jāyamānaḥ | na | rājā | ava | atirat | jyotiṣā | agniḥ | tamāṁsi ||6.9.1||

IAST: nāhaṁ tantuṁ na vi jānāmy otuṁ na yaṁ vayanti samare 'tamānāḥ
Griffith: I know not either warp or woof, I know not the web they weave when moving to the contest.
Devanāgarī: नाहं तन्तुं न वि जानाम्योतुं न यं वयन्ति समरेऽतमानाः
pada pāṭha: na | aham | tantum | na | vi | jānāmi | otum | na | yam | vayanti | sam-are | atamānāḥ || kasya | svit | putraḥ | iha | vaktvāni | paraḥ | vadāti | avareṇa | pitrā ||6.9.2||

IAST: kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadāty avareṇa pitrā
Griffith: Whose son shall here speak words that must be spoken without assistance from the Father near him?
Devanāgarī: कस्य स्वित्पुत्र इह वक्त्वानि परो वदात्यवरेण पित्रा
pada pāṭha: na | aham | tantum | na | vi | jānāmi | otum | na | yam | vayanti | sam-are | atamānāḥ || kasya | svit | putraḥ | iha | vaktvāni | paraḥ | vadāti | avareṇa | pitrā ||6.9.2||

IAST: sa it tantuṁ sa vi jānāty otuṁ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti
Griffith: For both the warp and woof he understandeth, and in due time shall speak what should be spoken,
Devanāgarī: स इत्तन्तुं स वि जानात्योतुं स वक्त्वान्यृतुथा वदाति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | tantum | saḥ | vi | jānāti | otum | saḥ | vaktvāni | r̥tu-thā | vadāti || yaḥ | īm | ciketat | amr̥tasya | gopāḥ | avaḥ | caran | paraḥ | anyena | paśyan ||6.9.3||

IAST: ya īṁ ciketad amṛtasya gopā avaś caran paro anyena paśyan
Griffith: Who knoweth as the immortal world's Protector, descending, seeing with no aid from other.
Devanāgarī: य ईं चिकेतदमृतस्य गोपा अवश्चरन्परो अन्येन पश्यन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | tantum | saḥ | vi | jānāti | otum | saḥ | vaktvāni | r̥tu-thā | vadāti || yaḥ | īm | ciketat | amr̥tasya | gopāḥ | avaḥ | caran | paraḥ | anyena | paśyan ||6.9.3||

IAST: ayaṁ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemam idaṁ jyotir amṛtam martyeṣu
Griffith: He is the Priest, the first of all: behold him. Mid mortal men he is the light immortal.
Devanāgarī: अयं होता प्रथमः पश्यतेममिदं ज्योतिरमृतं मर्त्येषु
pada pāṭha: ayam | hotā | prathamaḥ | paśyata | imam | idam | jyotiḥ | amr̥tam | martyeṣu || ayam | saḥ | jajñe | dhruvaḥ | ā | ni-sattaḥ | amartyaḥ | tanvā | vardhamānaḥ ||6.9.4||

IAST: ayaṁ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto 'martyas tanvā vardhamānaḥ
Griffith: Here was he born, firm-seated in his station Immortal, ever waxing in his body.
Devanāgarī: अयं स जज्ञे ध्रुव आ निषत्तोऽमर्त्यस्तन्वा वर्धमानः
pada pāṭha: ayam | hotā | prathamaḥ | paśyata | imam | idam | jyotiḥ | amr̥tam | martyeṣu || ayam | saḥ | jajñe | dhruvaḥ | ā | ni-sattaḥ | amartyaḥ | tanvā | vardhamānaḥ ||6.9.4||

IAST: dhruvaṁ jyotir nihitaṁ dṛśaye kam mano javiṣṭham patayatsv antaḥ
Griffith: A firm light hath been set for men to look on: among all things that fly the mind is swiftest.
Devanāgarī: ध्रुवं ज्योतिर्निहितं दृशये कं मनो जविष्ठं पतयत्स्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | jyotiḥ | ni-hitam | dr̥śaye | kam | manaḥ | javiṣṭham | patayat-su | antariti || viśve | devāḥ | sa-manasaḥ | sa-ketāḥ | ekam | kratum | abhi | vi | yanti | sādhu ||6.9.5||

IAST: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṁ kratum abhi vi yanti sādhu
Griffith: All Gods of one accord, with one intention, move unobstructed to a single purpose.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवाः समनसः सकेता एकं क्रतुमभि वि यन्ति साधु
pada pāṭha: dhruvam | jyotiḥ | ni-hitam | dr̥śaye | kam | manaḥ | javiṣṭham | patayat-su | antariti || viśve | devāḥ | sa-manasaḥ | sa-ketāḥ | ekam | kratum | abhi | vi | yanti | sādhu ||6.9.5||

IAST: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣur vīdaṁ jyotir hṛdaya āhitaṁ yat
Griffith: Mine ears unclose to hear, mine eye to see him; the light that harbours in my spirit broadens.
Devanāgarī: वि मे कर्णा पतयतो वि चक्षुर्वीदं ज्योतिर्हृदय आहितं यत्
pada pāṭha: vi | me | karṇā | patayataḥ | vi | cakṣuḥ | vi | idam | jyotiḥ | hr̥daye | ā-hitam | yat || vi | me | manaḥ | carati | dūre-ādhīḥ | kim | svit | vakṣyāmi | kim | ūm̐ iti | nu | maniṣye ||6.9.6||

IAST: vi me manaś carati dūraādhīḥ kiṁ svid vakṣyāmi kim u nū maniṣye
Griffith: Far roams my mind whose thoughts are in the distance. What shall I speak, what shall I now imagine?
Devanāgarī: वि मे मनश्चरति दूरआधीः किं स्विद्वक्ष्यामि किमु नू मनिष्ये
pada pāṭha: vi | me | karṇā | patayataḥ | vi | cakṣuḥ | vi | idam | jyotiḥ | hr̥daye | ā-hitam | yat || vi | me | manaḥ | carati | dūre-ādhīḥ | kim | svit | vakṣyāmi | kim | ūm̐ iti | nu | maniṣye ||6.9.6||

IAST: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānās tvām agne tamasi tasthivāṁsam
Griffith: All the Gods bowed them down in fear before thee, Agni, when thou wast dwelling in the darkness.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा अनमस्यन्भियानास्त्वामग्ने तमसि तस्थिवांसम्
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | anamasyan | bhiyānāḥ | tvām | agne | tamasi | tasthi-vāṁsam || vaiśvānaraḥ | avatu | ūtaye | naḥ | amartyaḥ | avatu | ūtaye | naḥ ||6.9.7||

IAST: vaiśvānaro 'vatūtaye no 'martyo 'vatūtaye naḥ
Griffith: Vaisvanara be gracious to assist us, may the Immortal favour us and help us.
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानरोऽवतूतये नोऽमर्त्योऽवतूतये नः
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | anamasyan | bhiyānāḥ | tvām | agne | tamasi | tasthi-vāṁsam || vaiśvānaraḥ | avatu | ūtaye | naḥ | amartyaḥ | avatu | ūtaye | naḥ ||6.9.7||

IAST: puro vo mandraṁ divyaṁ suvṛktim prayati yajñe agnim adhvare dadhidhvam
Griffith: INSTALL at sacrifice, while the rite advances, your pleasant, heavenly Agni, meet for praises.
Devanāgarī: पुरो वो मन्द्रं दिव्यं सुवृक्तिं प्रयति यज्ञे अग्निमध्वरे दधिध्वम्
pada pāṭha: puraḥ | vaḥ | mandram | divyam | su-vr̥ktim | pra-yati | yajñe | agnim | adhvare | dadhidhvam || puraḥ | ukthebhiḥ | saḥ | hi | naḥ | vibhā-vā | su-adhvarā | karati | jāta-vedāḥ ||6.10.1||

IAST: pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ
Griffith: With hymns-for he illumines us-install him. He, Jatavedas, makes our rites successful.
Devanāgarī: पुर उक्थेभिः स हि नो विभावा स्वध्वरा करति जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: puraḥ | vaḥ | mandram | divyam | su-vr̥ktim | pra-yati | yajñe | agnim | adhvare | dadhidhvam || puraḥ | ukthebhiḥ | saḥ | hi | naḥ | vibhā-vā | su-adhvarā | karati | jāta-vedāḥ ||6.10.1||

IAST: tam u dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotar agne agnibhir manuṣa idhānaḥ
Griffith: Hear this laud, Radiant Priest of many aspects, O Agni with the fires of man enkindled,
Devanāgarī: तमु द्युमः पुर्वणीक होतरग्ने अग्निभिर्मनुष इधानः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | dyu-maḥ | puru-anīka | hotaḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | manuṣaḥ | idhānaḥ || stomam | yam | asmai | mamatā-iva | śūṣam | ghr̥tam | na | śuci | matayaḥ | pavante ||6.10.2||

IAST: stomaṁ yam asmai mamateva śūṣaṁ ghṛtaṁ na śuci matayaḥ pavante
Griffith: Laud which bards send forth pure as sacred butter, strength to this man, as 'twere for self-advantage.
Devanāgarī: स्तोमं यमस्मै ममतेव शूषं घृतं न शुचि मतयः पवन्ते
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | dyu-maḥ | puru-anīka | hotaḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | manuṣaḥ | idhānaḥ || stomam | yam | asmai | mamatā-iva | śūṣam | ghr̥tam | na | śuci | matayaḥ | pavante ||6.10.2||

IAST: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo agnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ
Griffith: Mid mortal men that singer thrives in glory who offers gifts with hymns of praise to Agni,
Devanāgarī: पीपाय स श्रवसा मर्त्येषु यो अग्नये ददाश विप्र उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: pīpāya | saḥ | śravasā | martyeṣu | yaḥ | agnaye | dadāśa | vipraḥ | ukthaiḥ || citrābhiḥ | tam | ūti-bhiḥ | citra-śociḥ | vrajasya | sātā | go-mataḥ | dadhāti ||6.10.3||

IAST: citrābhis tam ūtibhiś citraśocir vrajasya sātā gomato dadhāti
Griffith: And the God, wondrous bright, with wondrous succours helps him to win a stable filled with cattle.
Devanāgarī: चित्राभिस्तमूतिभिश्चित्रशोचिर्व्रजस्य साता गोमतो दधाति
pada pāṭha: pīpāya | saḥ | śravasā | martyeṣu | yaḥ | agnaye | dadāśa | vipraḥ | ukthaiḥ || citrābhiḥ | tam | ūti-bhiḥ | citra-śociḥ | vrajasya | sātā | go-mataḥ | dadhāti ||6.10.3||

IAST: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamāna urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇādhvā
Griffith: He, at his birth, whose path is black behind him, filled heaven and earth with far-apparent splendour:
Devanāgarī: आ यः पप्रौ जायमान उर्वी दूरेदृशा भासा कृष्णाध्वा
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | paprau | jāyamānaḥ | urvī iti | dūre-dr̥śā | bhāsā | kr̥ṣṇa-adhvā || adha | bahu | cit | tamaḥ | ūrmyāyāḥ | tiraḥ | śociṣā | dadr̥śe | pāvakaḥ ||6.10.4||

IAST: adha bahu cit tama ūrmyāyās tiraḥ śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ
Griffith: And he himself hath been. through night's thick darkness, made manifest by light, the Purifier.
Devanāgarī: अध बहु चित्तम ऊर्म्यायास्तिरः शोचिषा ददृशे पावकः
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | paprau | jāyamānaḥ | urvī iti | dūre-dr̥śā | bhāsā | kr̥ṣṇa-adhvā || adha | bahu | cit | tamaḥ | ūrmyāyāḥ | tiraḥ | śociṣā | dadr̥śe | pāvakaḥ ||6.10.4||

IAST: nū naś citram puruvājābhir ūtī agne rayim maghavadbhyaś ca dhehi
Griffith: With thy most mighty aid, confer, O Agni, wonderful wealth on us and on our princes,
Devanāgarī: नू नश्चित्रं पुरुवाजाभिरूती अग्ने रयिं मघवद्भ्यश्च धेहि
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | citram | puru-vājābhiḥ | ūtī | agne | rayim | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | dhehi || ye | rādhasā | śravasā | ca | ati | anyān | su-vīryebhiḥ | ca | abhi | santi | janān ||6.10.5||

IAST: ye rādhasā śravasā cāty anyān suvīryebhiś cābhi santi janān
Griffith: Who stand preeminent, surpassing others in liberal gifts, in fame, and hero virtues.
Devanāgarī: ये राधसा श्रवसा चात्यन्यान्सुवीर्येभिश्चाभि सन्ति जनान्
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | citram | puru-vājābhiḥ | ūtī | agne | rayim | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | dhehi || ye | rādhasā | śravasā | ca | ati | anyān | su-vīryebhiḥ | ca | abhi | santi | janān ||6.10.5||

IAST: imaṁ yajñaṁ cano dhā agna uśan yaṁ ta āsāno juhute haviṣmān
Griffith: Agni, accept this sacrifice with gladness, which, seated here, the worshipper presenteth.
Devanāgarī: इमं यज्ञं चनो धा अग्न उशन्यं त आसानो जुहुते हविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | canaḥ | dhāḥ | agne | uśan | yam | te | āsānaḥ | juhute | haviṣmān || bharat-vājeṣu | dadhiṣe | su-vr̥ktim | avīḥ | vājasya | gadhyasya | sātau ||6.10.6||

IAST: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktim avīr vājasya gadhyasya sātau
Griffith: Fair hymns hadst thou among the Bharadvajas, and holpest them to gain abundant vigour.
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजेषु दधिषे सुवृक्तिमवीर्वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | canaḥ | dhāḥ | agne | uśan | yam | te | āsānaḥ | juhute | haviṣmān || bharat-vājeṣu | dadhiṣe | su-vr̥ktim | avīḥ | vājasya | gadhyasya | sātau ||6.10.6||

IAST: vi dveṣāṁsīnuhi vardhayeḻām madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Scatter our foes, increase our store. May we he glad a hundred winters with brave sons.
Devanāgarī: वि द्वेषांसीनुहि वर्धयेळां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: vi | dveṣāṁsi | inuhi | vardhaya | iḷām | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.10.7||

IAST: yajasva hotar iṣito yajīyān agne bādho marutāṁ na prayukti
Griffith: EAGERLY Sacrifice thou, most skilful, Agni! Priest, pressing on as if the Maruts sent thee.
Devanāgarī: आ नो मित्रावरुणा नासत्या द्यावा होत्राय पृथिवी ववृत्याः
pada pāṭha: yajasva | hotaḥ | iṣitaḥ | yajīyān | agne | bādhaḥ | marutām | na | pra-yukti || ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | nāsatyā | dyāvā | hotrāya | pr̥thivī iti | vavr̥tyāḥ ||6.11.1||

IAST: ā no mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ
Griffith: To our oblation bring the two Nasatyas, Mitra and Varuna and Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: यजस्व होतरिषितो यजीयानग्ने बाधो मरुतां न प्रयुक्ति
pada pāṭha: yajasva | hotaḥ | iṣitaḥ | yajīyān | agne | bādhaḥ | marutām | na | pra-yukti || ā | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | nāsatyā | dyāvā | hotrāya | pr̥thivī iti | vavr̥tyāḥ ||6.11.1||

IAST: tvaṁ hotā mandratamo no adhrug antar devo vidathā martyeṣu
Griffith: Thou art our guileless, most delightful Herald, the God, among mankind, of holy synods.
Devanāgarī: पावकया जुह्वा वह्निरासाग्ने यजस्व तन्वं तव स्वाम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | hotā | mandra-tamaḥ | naḥ | adhruk | antaḥ | devaḥ | vidathā | martyeṣu || pāvakayā | juhvā | vahniḥ | āsā | agne | yajasva | tanvam | tava | svām ||6.11.2||

IAST: pāvakayā juhvā vahnir āsāgne yajasva tanvaṁ tava svām
Griffith: A Priest with purifying tongue, O Agni, sacrifice with thy mouth to thine own body.
Devanāgarī: त्वं होता मन्द्रतमो नो अध्रुगन्तर्देवो विदथा मर्त्येषु
pada pāṭha: tvam | hotā | mandra-tamaḥ | naḥ | adhruk | antaḥ | devaḥ | vidathā | martyeṣu || pāvakayā | juhvā | vahniḥ | āsā | agne | yajasva | tanvam | tava | svām ||6.11.2||

IAST: dhanyā cid dhi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devāñ janma gṛṇate yajadhyai
Griffith: For even the blessed longing that is in thee would bring the Gods down to the singer's worship,
Devanāgarī: वेपिष्ठो अङ्गिरसां यद्ध विप्रो मधु च्छन्दो भनति रेभ इष्टौ
pada pāṭha: dhanyā | cit | hi | tve iti | dhiṣaṇā | vaṣṭi | pra | devān | janma | gr̥ṇate | yajadhyai || vepiṣṭhaḥ | aṅgirasām | yat | ha | vipraḥ | madhu | chandaḥ | bhanati | rebhaḥ | iṣṭau ||6.11.3||

IAST: vepiṣṭho aṅgirasāṁ yad dha vipro madhu cchando bhanati rebha iṣṭau
Griffith: When the Angirases' sagest Sage, the Poet, sings the sweet measure at the solemn service.
Devanāgarī: धन्या चिद्धि त्वे धिषणा वष्टि प्र देवाञ्जन्म गृणते यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: dhanyā | cit | hi | tve iti | dhiṣaṇā | vaṣṭi | pra | devān | janma | gr̥ṇate | yajadhyai || vepiṣṭhaḥ | aṅgirasām | yat | ha | vipraḥ | madhu | chandaḥ | bhanati | rebhaḥ | iṣṭau ||6.11.3||

IAST: adidyutat sv apāko vibhāvāgne yajasva rodasī urūcī
Griffith: Bright hath he beamed, the wise, the far-refulgent. Worship the two widespreading Worlds, O Agni,
Devanāgarī: आयुं न यं नमसा रातहव्या अञ्जन्ति सुप्रयसं पञ्च जनाः
pada pāṭha: adidyutat | su | apākaḥ | vi-bhāvā | agne | yajasva | rodasī iti | urūcī iti || āyum | na | yam | namasā | rāta-havyāḥ | añjanti | su-prayasam | pañca | janāḥ ||6.11.4||

IAST: āyuṁ na yaṁ namasā rātahavyā añjanti suprayasam pañca janāḥ
Griffith: Whom as the Living One rich in oblations the Five Tribes, bringing gifts, adorn with homage.
Devanāgarī: अदिद्युतत्स्वपाको विभावाग्ने यजस्व रोदसी उरूची
pada pāṭha: adidyutat | su | apākaḥ | vi-bhāvā | agne | yajasva | rodasī iti | urūcī iti || āyum | na | yam | namasā | rāta-havyāḥ | añjanti | su-prayasam | pañca | janāḥ ||6.11.4||

IAST: vṛñje ha yan namasā barhir agnāv ayāmi srug ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ
Griffith: When I with reverence clip the grass for Agni, when the trimmed ladle, fullof oil, is lifted,
Devanāgarī: अम्यक्षि सद्म सदने पृथिव्या अश्रायि यज्ञः सूर्ये न चक्षुः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ñje | ha | yat | namasā | barhiḥ | agnau | ayāmi | sruk | ghr̥ta-vatī | su-vr̥ktiḥ || amyakṣi | sadma | sadane | pr̥thivyāḥ | aśrāyi | yajñaḥ | sūrye | na | cakṣuḥ ||6.11.5||

IAST: amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyā aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ
Griffith: Firm on the seat of earth is based the altar: eye-like, the sacrifice is directed Sun-ward.
Devanāgarī: वृञ्जे ह यन्नमसा बर्हिरग्नावयामि स्रुग्घृतवती सुवृक्तिः
pada pāṭha: vr̥ñje | ha | yat | namasā | barhiḥ | agnau | ayāmi | sruk | ghr̥ta-vatī | su-vr̥ktiḥ || amyakṣi | sadma | sadane | pr̥thivyāḥ | aśrāyi | yajñaḥ | sūrye | na | cakṣuḥ ||6.11.5||

IAST: daśasyā naḥ purvaṇīka hotar devebhir agne agnibhir idhānaḥ
Griffith: Enrich us, O thou Priest of many aspects, with the Gods, Agni, with thy fires, enkindled.
Devanāgarī: रायः सूनो सहसो वावसाना अति स्रसेम वृजनं नांहः
pada pāṭha: daśasya | naḥ | puru-aṇīka | hotaḥ | devebhiḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | idhānaḥ || rāyaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vavasānāḥ | ati | srasema | vr̥janam | na | aṁhaḥ ||6.11.6||

IAST: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso vāvasānā ati srasema vṛjanaṁ nāṁhaḥ
Griffith: O Son of Strength, clad in the robe of riches, may we escape from woe as from a prison
Devanāgarī: दशस्या नः पुर्वणीक होतर्देवेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः
pada pāṭha: daśasya | naḥ | puru-aṇīka | hotaḥ | devebhiḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | idhānaḥ || rāyaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vavasānāḥ | ati | srasema | vr̥janam | na | aṁhaḥ ||6.11.6||

IAST: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḻ agnis todasya rodasī yajadhyai
Griffith: KING of trimmed grass, Herald within the dwelling, may Agni worship the Impeller's World-halves.
Devanāgarī: अयं स सूनुः सहस ऋतावा दूरात्सूर्यो न शोचिषा ततान
pada pāṭha: madhye | hotā | duroṇe | barhiṣaḥ | rāṭ | agniḥ | todasya | rodasī iti | yajadhyai || ayam | saḥ | sūnuḥ | sahasaḥ | r̥ta-vā | dūrāt | sūryaḥ | na | śociṣā | tatāna ||6.12.1||

IAST: ayaṁ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna
Griffith: He, Son of Strength, the Holy, from a distance hath spread himself abroad with light like Surya.
Devanāgarī: मध्ये होता दुरोणे बर्हिषो राळग्निस्तोदस्य रोदसी यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: madhye | hotā | duroṇe | barhiṣaḥ | rāṭ | agniḥ | todasya | rodasī iti | yajadhyai || ayam | saḥ | sūnuḥ | sahasaḥ | r̥ta-vā | dūrāt | sūryaḥ | na | śociṣā | tatāna ||6.12.1||

IAST: ā yasmin tve sv apāke yajatra yakṣad rājan sarvatāteva nu dyauḥ
Griffith: In thee, most wise, shall Dyaus, for full perfection, King! Holy One! pronounce the call to worship.
Devanāgarī: त्रिषधस्थस्ततरुषो न जंहो हव्या मघानि मानुषा यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | tve iti | su | apāke | yajatra | yakṣat | rājan | sarvatātā-iva | nu | dyauḥ || tri-sadhasthaḥ | tataruṣaḥ | na | jaṁhaḥ | havyā | maghāni | mānuṣā | yajadhyai ||6.12.2||

IAST: triṣadhasthas tataruṣo na jaṁho havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai
Griffith: Found in three places, like the Speeder's footstep, come to present men's riches as oblations!
Devanāgarī: आ यस्मिन्त्वे स्वपाके यजत्र यक्षद्राजन्सर्वतातेव नु द्यौः
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | tve iti | su | apāke | yajatra | yakṣat | rājan | sarvatātā-iva | nu | dyauḥ || tri-sadhasthaḥ | tataruṣaḥ | na | jaṁhaḥ | havyā | maghāni | mānuṣā | yajadhyai ||6.12.2||

IAST: tejiṣṭhā yasyāratir vanerāṭ todo adhvan na vṛdhasāno adyaut
Griffith: Whose blaze most splendid, sovran in the forest, shines waxing on his way like the - Impeller.
Devanāgarī: अद्रोघो न द्रविता चेतति त्मन्नमर्त्योऽवर्त्र ओषधीषु
pada pāṭha: tejiṣṭhā | yasya | aratiḥ | vane-rāṭ | todaḥ | adhvan | na | vr̥dhasānaḥ | adyaut || adroghaḥ | na | dravitā | cetati | tman | amartyaḥ | avartraḥ | oṣadhīṣu ||6.12.3||

IAST: adrogho na dravitā cetati tmann amartyo 'vartra oṣadhīṣu
Griffith: He knows himself, like as a guileless smelter, not to be stayed among the plants, Immortal.
Devanāgarī: तेजिष्ठा यस्यारतिर्वनेराट् तोदो अध्वन्न वृधसानो अद्यौत्
pada pāṭha: tejiṣṭhā | yasya | aratiḥ | vane-rāṭ | todaḥ | adhvan | na | vr̥dhasānaḥ | adyaut || adroghaḥ | na | dravitā | cetati | tman | amartyaḥ | avartraḥ | oṣadhīṣu ||6.12.3||

IAST: sāsmākebhir etarī na śūṣair agniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Our friends extol him like a steed for vigour even Agni in the dwelling, jatave~as.
Devanāgarī: द्र्वन्नो वन्वन्क्रत्वा नार्वोस्रः पितेव जारयायि यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmākebhiḥ | etari | na | śūṣaiḥ | agniḥ | stave | dame | ā | jāta-vedāḥ || dru-annaḥ | vanvan | kratvā | na | arvā | usraḥ | pitā-iva | jārayāyi | yajñaiḥ ||6.12.4||

IAST: drvanno vanvan kratvā nārvosraḥ piteva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ
Griffith: Trce-fed, he fights with power as doth a champion, like Dawn's Sire to be praised with sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: सास्माकेभिरेतरी न शूषैरग्निः ष्टवे दम आ जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | asmākebhiḥ | etari | na | śūṣaiḥ | agniḥ | stave | dame | ā | jāta-vedāḥ || dru-annaḥ | vanvan | kratvā | na | arvā | usraḥ | pitā-iva | jārayāyi | yajñaiḥ ||6.12.4||

IAST: adha smāsya panayanti bhāso vṛthā yat takṣad anuyāti pṛthvīm
Griffith: Men wonder at his shining glows when, paring the woods with case, o'er the broad earth he goeth,
Devanāgarī: सद्यो यः स्यन्द्रो विषितो धवीयानृणो न तायुरति धन्वा राट्
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | asya | panayanti | bhāsaḥ | vr̥thā | yat | takṣat | anu-yāti | pr̥thvīm || sadyaḥ | yaḥ | spandraḥ | vi-sitaḥ | dhavīyān | r̥ṇaḥ | na | tāyuḥ | ati | dhanva | rāṭ ||6.12.5||

IAST: sadyo yaḥ syandro viṣito dhavīyān ṛṇo na tāyur ati dhanvā rāṭ
Griffith: And, like a rushing flood, loosed quickly, burneth, swift as a guilty thief, o'er desert places.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मास्य पनयन्ति भासो वृथा यत्तक्षदनुयाति पृथ्वीम्
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | asya | panayanti | bhāsaḥ | vr̥thā | yat | takṣat | anu-yāti | pr̥thvīm || sadyaḥ | yaḥ | spandraḥ | vi-sitaḥ | dhavīyān | r̥ṇaḥ | na | tāyuḥ | ati | dhanva | rāṭ ||6.12.5||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no arvan nidāyā viśvebhir agne agnibhir idhānaḥ
Griffith: So mighty thou protectest us from slander, O Champion, Agni! with all fires enkindled.
Devanāgarī: वेषि रायो वि यासि दुच्छुना मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | arvan | nidāyāḥ | viśvebhiḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | idhānaḥ || veṣi | rāyaḥ | vi | yāsi | ducchunāḥ | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.12.6||

IAST: veṣi rāyo vi yāsi ducchunā madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: Bring opulence and drive away affliction. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो अर्वन्निदाया विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | arvan | nidāyāḥ | viśvebhiḥ | agne | agni-bhiḥ | idhānaḥ || veṣi | rāyaḥ | vi | yāsi | ducchunāḥ | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.12.6||

IAST: tvad viśvā subhaga saubhagāny agne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ
Griffith: FROM thee, as branches from a tree, O Agni, from thee, Auspicious God! spring all our blessings-
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्टी रयिर्वाजो वृत्रतूर्ये दिवो वृष्टिरीड्यो रीतिरपाम् .
pada pāṭha: tvat | viśvā | su-bhaga | saubhagāni | agne | vi | yanti | vaninaḥ | na | vayāḥ || śruṣṭī | rayiḥ | vājaḥ | vr̥tra-tūrye | divaḥ | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | īḍyaḥ | rītiḥ | apām ||6.13.1||

IAST: śruṣṭī rayir vājo vṛtratūrye divo vṛṣṭir īḍyo rītir apām
Griffith: Wealth swiftly, strength in battle with our foemen, the rain besought of heaven, the flow of waters.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्विश्वा सुभग सौभगान्यग्ने वि यन्ति वनिनो न वयाः
pada pāṭha: tvat | viśvā | su-bhaga | saubhagāni | agne | vi | yanti | vaninaḥ | na | vayāḥ || śruṣṭī | rayiḥ | vājaḥ | vr̥tra-tūrye | divaḥ | vr̥ṣṭiḥ | īḍyaḥ | rītiḥ | apām ||6.13.1||

IAST: tvam bhago na ā hi ratnam iṣe parijmeva kṣayasi dasmavarcāḥ
Griffith: Thou art our Bhaga to send wealth thou dwellest, like circumambient air, with wondrous splendour.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने मित्रो न बृहत ऋतस्यासि क्षत्ता वामस्य देव भूरेः .
pada pāṭha: tvam | bhagaḥ | naḥ | ā | hi | ratnam | iṣe | parijmā-iva | kṣayasi | dasma-varcāḥ || agne | mitraḥ | na | br̥hataḥ | r̥tasya | asi | kṣattā | vāmasya | deva | bhūreḥ ||6.13.2||

IAST: agne mitro na bṛhata ṛtasyāsi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ
Griffith: Friend art thou of the lofty Law, like Mitra, Controller, Agni! God! of many a blessing.
Devanāgarī: त्वं भगो न आ हि रत्नमिषे परिज्मेव क्षयसि दस्मवर्चाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | bhagaḥ | naḥ | ā | hi | ratnam | iṣe | parijmā-iva | kṣayasi | dasma-varcāḥ || agne | mitraḥ | na | br̥hataḥ | r̥tasya | asi | kṣattā | vāmasya | deva | bhūreḥ ||6.13.2||

IAST: sa satpatiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram agne vipro vi paṇer bharti vājam
Griffith: Agni! the hero slays with might his foeman; the singer bears away the Pani's booty-
Devanāgarī: यं त्वं प्रचेत ऋतजात राया सजोषा नप्त्रापां हिनोषि .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sat-patiḥ | śavasā | hanti | vr̥tram | agne | vipraḥ | vi | paṇeḥ | bharti | vājam || yam | tvam | pra-cetaḥ | r̥ta-jāta | rāyā | sa-joṣāḥ | naptrā | apām | hinoṣi ||6.13.3||

IAST: yaṁ tvam praceta ṛtajāta rāyā sajoṣā naptrāpāṁ hinoṣi
Griffith: Even he whom thou, Sage, born in Law, incitest by wealth, accordant with the Child of Waters.
Devanāgarī: स सत्पतिः शवसा हन्ति वृत्रमग्ने विप्रो वि पणेर्भर्ति वाजम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sat-patiḥ | śavasā | hanti | vr̥tram | agne | vipraḥ | vi | paṇeḥ | bharti | vājam || yam | tvam | pra-cetaḥ | r̥ta-jāta | rāyā | sa-joṣāḥ | naptrā | apām | hinoṣi ||6.13.3||

IAST: yas te sūno sahaso gīrbhir ukthair yajñair marto niśitiṁ vedyānaṭ
Griffith: The man who, Son of Strength with sacrifices, hymns, lauds, attracts thy fervour to the altar,
Devanāgarī: विश्वं स देव प्रति वारमग्ने धत्ते धान्यं पत्यते वसव्यैः .
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | yajñaiḥ | martaḥ | ni-śitim | vedyā | ānaṭ || viśvam | saḥ | deva | prati | vā | aram | agne | dhatte | dhānyam | patyate | vasavyaiḥ ||6.13.4||
