IAST: viśvaṁ sa deva prati vāram agne dhatte dhānyam patyate vasavyaiḥ
Griffith: Enjoys each precious thing, O God, O Agni, gains wealth of corn and is the lord of treasures.
Devanāgarī: यस्ते सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैर्यज्ञैर्मर्तो निशितिं वेद्यानट्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | yajñaiḥ | martaḥ | ni-śitim | vedyā | ānaṭ || viśvam | saḥ | deva | prati | vā | aram | agne | dhatte | dhānyam | patyate | vasavyaiḥ ||6.13.4||

IAST: tā nṛbhya ā sauśravasā suvīrāgne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyase dhāḥ
Griffith: Grant, Son of Strength, to men for their subsistence such things as bring high fame and hero children.
Devanāgarī: कृणोषि यच्छवसा भूरि पश्वो वयो वृकायारये जसुरये .
pada pāṭha: tā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | sauśravasā | su-vīrā | agne | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | puṣyase | dhāḥ || kr̥ṇoṣi | yat | śavasā | bhūri | paśvaḥ | vayaḥ | vr̥kāya | araye | jasuraye ||6.13.5||

IAST: kṛṇoṣi yac chavasā bhūri paśvo vayo vṛkāyāraye jasuraye
Griffith: For thou with might givest much food in cattle even to the wicked wolf when he is hungry.
Devanāgarī: ता नृभ्य आ सौश्रवसा सुवीराग्ने सूनो सहसः पुष्यसे धाः
pada pāṭha: tā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | ā | sauśravasā | su-vīrā | agne | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | puṣyase | dhāḥ || kr̥ṇoṣi | yat | śavasā | bhūri | paśvaḥ | vayaḥ | vr̥kāya | araye | jasuraye ||6.13.5||

IAST: vadmā sūno sahaso no vihāyā agne tokaṁ tanayaṁ vāji no dāḥ
Griffith: Eloquent, Son of Strength, Most Mighty, Agni, vouchsafe us seed and offspring, full of vigour.
Devanāgarī: विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरभि पूर्तिमश्यां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः .
pada pāṭha: vadmā | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | vi-hāyāḥ | agne | tokam | tanayam | vāji | naḥ | dāḥ || viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | pūrtim | aśyām | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.13.6||

IAST: viśvābhir gīrbhir abhi pūrtim aśyām madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: May I by all my songs obtain abundance. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: वद्मा सूनो सहसो नो विहाया अग्ने तोकं तनयं वाजि नो दाः
pada pāṭha: vadmā | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | vi-hāyāḥ | agne | tokam | tanayam | vāji | naḥ | dāḥ || viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | pūrtim | aśyām | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.13.6||

IAST: agnā yo martyo duvo dhiyaṁ jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: WHOSO to Agni hath endeared his thought and service by his hymns,
Devanāgarī: भसन्नु ष प्र पूर्व्य इषं वुरीतावसे .
pada pāṭha: agnā | yaḥ | martyaḥ | duvaḥ | dhiyam | jujoṣa | dhīti-bhiḥ || bhasat | nu | saḥ | pra | pūrvyaḥ | iṣam | vurīta | avase ||6.14.1||

IAST: bhasan nu ṣa pra pūrvya iṣaṁ vurītāvase
Griffith: That mortal cats before the rest, and finds sufficiency of food.
Devanāgarī: अग्ना यो मर्त्यो दुवो धियं जुजोष धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: agnā | yaḥ | martyaḥ | duvaḥ | dhiyam | jujoṣa | dhīti-bhiḥ || bhasat | nu | saḥ | pra | pūrvyaḥ | iṣam | vurīta | avase ||6.14.1||

IAST: agnir id dhi pracetā agnir vedhastama ṛṣiḥ
Griffith: Agni, in truth, is passing wise, most skilled in ordering, a Seer.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं होतारमीळते यज्ञेषु मनुषो विशः .
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | it | hi | pra-cetāḥ | agniḥ | vedhaḥ-tamaḥ | r̥ṣiḥ || agnim | hotāram | īḷate | yajñeṣu | manuṣaḥ | viśaḥ ||6.14.2||

IAST: agniṁ hotāram īḻate yajñeṣu manuṣo viśaḥ
Griffith: At sacrifices Manus' sons glorify Agni as their Priest.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरिद्धि प्रचेता अग्निर्वेधस्तम ऋषिः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | it | hi | pra-cetāḥ | agniḥ | vedhaḥ-tamaḥ | r̥ṣiḥ || agnim | hotāram | īḷate | yajñeṣu | manuṣaḥ | viśaḥ ||6.14.2||

IAST: nānā hy agne 'vase spardhante rāyo aryaḥ
Griffith: The foeman's wealth in many a place, Agni, is emulous to help.
Devanāgarī: तूर्वन्तो दस्युमायवो व्रतैः सीक्षन्तो अव्रतम् .
pada pāṭha: nānā | hi | agne | avase | spardhante | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || tūrvantaḥ | dasyum | āyavaḥ | vrataiḥ | sīkṣantaḥ | avratam ||6.14.3||

IAST: tūrvanto dasyum āyavo vrataiḥ sīkṣanto avratam
Griffith: Men fight the fiend, and seek by rites to overcome the riteless foe.
Devanāgarī: नाना ह्यग्नेऽवसे स्पर्धन्ते रायो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: nānā | hi | agne | avase | spardhante | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || tūrvantaḥ | dasyum | āyavaḥ | vrataiḥ | sīkṣantaḥ | avratam ||6.14.3||

IAST: agnir apsām ṛtīṣahaṁ vīraṁ dadāti satpatim
Griffith: Agni bestows the hero chief, winner of waters, firm in fray.
Devanāgarī: यस्य त्रसन्ति शवसः संचक्षि शत्रवो भिया .
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | apsām | r̥ti-saham | vīram | dadāti | sat-patim || yasya | trasanti | śavasaḥ | sam-cakṣi | śatravaḥ | bhiyā ||6.14.4||

IAST: yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṁcakṣi śatravo bhiyā
Griffith: Soon as they look upon his might his enemies tremble in alarm.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरप्सामृतीषहं वीरं ददाति सत्पतिम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | apsām | r̥ti-saham | vīram | dadāti | sat-patim || yasya | trasanti | śavasaḥ | sam-cakṣi | śatravaḥ | bhiyā ||6.14.4||

IAST: agnir hi vidmanā nido devo martam uruṣyati
Griffith: For with his wisdom Agni, God, protects the mortal from reproach,
Devanāgarī: सहावा यस्यावृतो रयिर्वाजेष्ववृतः .
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hi | vidmanā | nidaḥ | devaḥ | martam | uruṣyati || saha-vā | yasya | avr̥taḥ | rayiḥ | vājeṣu | avr̥taḥ ||6.14.5||

IAST: sahāvā yasyāvṛto rayir vājeṣv avṛtaḥ
Griffith: Whose conquering wealth is never checked, is never checked in deeds of might.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्हि विद्मना निदो देवो मर्तमुरुष्यति
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hi | vidmanā | nidaḥ | devaḥ | martam | uruṣyati || saha-vā | yasya | avr̥taḥ | rayiḥ | vājeṣu | avr̥taḥ ||6.14.5||

IAST: acchā no mitramaho deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatiṁ rodasyoḥ
Griffith: O Agni, God with Mitra's might call hither the favour of the Gods from earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: वीहि स्वस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄन्द्विषो अंहांसि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम .
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | deva | devān | agne | vocaḥ | su-matim | rodasyoḥ || vīhi | svastim | su-kṣitim | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | dviṣaḥ | aṁhāṁsi | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.14.6||

IAST: vīhi svastiṁ sukṣitiṁ divo nṝn dviṣo aṁhāṁsi duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema
Griffith: Bring weal from heaven that men may dwell securely. May we o'ercome the foe's malign oppressions, may we
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | deva | devān | agne | vocaḥ | su-matim | rodasyoḥ || vīhi | svastim | su-kṣitim | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | dviṣaḥ | aṁhāṁsi | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.14.6||

IAST: imam ū ṣu vo atithim uṣarbudhaṁ viśvāsāṁ viśām patim ṛñjase girā
Griffith: WITH this my song I strive to reach this guest of yours, who wakes at early morn, the Lord of all the tri
Devanāgarī: वेतीद्दिवो जनुषा कच्चिदा शुचिर्ज्योक्चिदत्ति गर्भो यदच्युतम्
pada pāṭha: imam | ūm̐ iti | su | vaḥ | atithim | uṣaḥ-budham | viśvāsām | viśām | patim | r̥ñjase | girā || veti | it | divaḥ | januṣā | kat | cit | ā | śuciḥ | jyok | cit | atti | garbhaḥ | yat | acyutam ||6.15.1||

IAST: vetīd divo januṣā kac cid ā śucir jyok cid atti garbho yad acyutam
Griffith: Each time he comes from heaven, the Pure One from of old: from ancient days the Child cats everlasting f
Devanāgarī: इममू षु वो अतिथिमुषर्बुधं विश्वासां विशां पतिमृञ्जसे गिरा
pada pāṭha: imam | ūm̐ iti | su | vaḥ | atithim | uṣaḥ-budham | viśvāsām | viśām | patim | r̥ñjase | girā || veti | it | divaḥ | januṣā | kat | cit | ā | śuciḥ | jyok | cit | atti | garbhaḥ | yat | acyutam ||6.15.1||

IAST: mitraṁ na yaṁ sudhitam bhṛgavo dadhur vanaspatāv īḍyam ūrdhvaśociṣam
Griffith: Whom, well-dis sed, the Blirgus stablished as a rriend, whom men must glorify, high-flaming in the wood.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं सुप्रीतो वीतहव्ये अद्भुत प्रशस्तिभिर्महयसे दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: mitram | na | yam | su-dhitam | bhr̥gavaḥ | dadhuḥ | vanaspatau | īḍyam | ūrdhva-śociṣam || saḥ | tvam | su-prītaḥ | vīta-havye | adbhuta | praśasti-bhiḥ | mahayase | dive-dive ||6.15.2||

IAST: sa tvaṁ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhir mahayase dive-dive
Griffith: As such, most friendly, thou art every day extolled in lauds by Vitahavya, O thou wondrous God.
Devanāgarī: मित्रं न यं सुधितं भृगवो दधुर्वनस्पतावीड्यमूर्ध्वशोचिषम्
pada pāṭha: mitram | na | yam | su-dhitam | bhr̥gavaḥ | dadhuḥ | vanaspatau | īḍyam | ūrdhva-śociṣam || saḥ | tvam | su-prītaḥ | vīta-havye | adbhuta | praśasti-bhiḥ | mahayase | dive-dive ||6.15.2||

IAST: sa tvaṁ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūr aryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ
Griffith: Be thou the foeless helper of the skilful man, subduer of the enemy near or far away.
Devanāgarī: रायः सूनो सहसो मर्त्येष्वा छर्दिर्यच्छ वीतहव्याय सप्रथो भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | dakṣasya | avr̥kaḥ | vr̥dhaḥ | bhūḥ | aryaḥ | parasya | antarasya | taruṣaḥ || rāyaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | martyeṣu | ā | chardiḥ | yaccha | vīta-havyāya | sa-prathaḥ | bharat-vājāya | sa-prathaḥ ||6.15.3||

IAST: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣv ā chardir yaccha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ
Griffith: Bestow a wealthy home on men, O Son of Strength. Give Vitahavya riches spreading far and wide, give Bha
Devanāgarī: स त्वं दक्षस्यावृको वृधो भूरर्यः परस्यान्तरस्य तरुषः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | dakṣasya | avr̥kaḥ | vr̥dhaḥ | bhūḥ | aryaḥ | parasya | antarasya | taruṣaḥ || rāyaḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | martyeṣu | ā | chardiḥ | yaccha | vīta-havyāya | sa-prathaḥ | bharat-vājāya | sa-prathaḥ ||6.15.3||

IAST: dyutānaṁ vo atithiṁ svarṇaram agniṁ hotāram manuṣaḥ svadhvaram
Griffith: Him, your refulgent guest, Agni who comes from heaven, the Herald of mankind, well-skilled in sacred rites
Devanāgarī: विप्रं न द्युक्षवचसं सुवृक्तिभिर्हव्यवाहमरतिं देवमृञ्जसे
pada pāṭha: dyutānam | vaḥ | atithim | svaḥ-naram | agnim | hotāram | manuṣaḥ | su-adhvaram || vipram | na | dyukṣa-vacasam | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | havya-vāham | aratim | devam | r̥ñjase ||6.15.4||

IAST: vipraṁ na dyukṣavacasaṁ suvṛktibhir havyavāham aratiṁ devam ṛñjase
Griffith: Who, like a holy singer, utters heavenly words, oblation-bearer, envoy, God, I seek with hymns.
Devanāgarī: द्युतानं वो अतिथिं स्वर्णरमग्निं होतारं मनुषः स्वध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: dyutānam | vaḥ | atithim | svaḥ-naram | agnim | hotāram | manuṣaḥ | su-adhvaram || vipram | na | dyukṣa-vacasam | suvr̥kti-bhiḥ | havya-vāham | aratim | devam | r̥ñjase ||6.15.4||

IAST: pāvakayā yaś citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā
Griffith: Who with his purifying, eye-attracting form hath shone upon the earth as with the light of Dawn;
Devanāgarī: तूर्वन्न यामन्नेतशस्य नू रण आ यो घृणे न ततृषाणो अजरः
pada pāṭha: pāvakayā | yaḥ | citayantyā | kr̥pā | kṣāman | ruruce | uṣasaḥ | na | bhānunā || tūrvan | na | yāman | etaśasya | nu | raṇe | ā | yaḥ | ghr̥ṇe | na | tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ | ajaraḥ ||6.15.5||

IAST: tūrvan na yāmann etaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ
Griffith: Who speeding on, as in the fight of Etaia, cometh, untouched by age, as one athirst in heat.
Devanāgarī: पावकया यश्चितयन्त्या कृपा क्षामन्रुरुच उषसो न भानुना
pada pāṭha: pāvakayā | yaḥ | citayantyā | kr̥pā | kṣāman | ruruce | uṣasaḥ | na | bhānunā || tūrvan | na | yāman | etaśasya | nu | raṇe | ā | yaḥ | ghr̥ṇe | na | tatr̥ṣāṇaḥ | ajaraḥ ||6.15.5||

IAST: agnim-agniṁ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam-priyaṁ vo atithiṁ gṛṇīṣaṇi
Griffith: Worship ye Agni, Agni, with your log of wood; praise your beloved, your beloved guest with songs.
Devanāgarī: उप वो गीर्भिरमृतं विवासत देवो देवेषु वनते हि वार्यं देवो देवेषु वनते हि नो दुवः

IAST: upa vo gīrbhir amṛtaṁ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṁ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ
Griffith: Invite ye the Immortal hither with your hymns. A God among the Gods, he loveth what is choice, loveth o
Devanāgarī: अग्निमग्निं वः समिधा दुवस्यत प्रियम्प्रियं वो अतिथिं गृणीषणि
pada pāṭha: agnim-agnim | vaḥ | sam-idhā | duvasyata | priyam-priyam | vaḥ | atithim | gr̥ṇīṣaṇi || upa | vaḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | amr̥tam | vivāsata | devaḥ | deveṣu | vanate | hi | vāryam | devaḥ | deveṣu | vanate | hi | naḥ | duvaḥ ||6.15.6||

IAST: samiddham agniṁ samidhā girā gṛṇe śucim pāvakam puro adhvare dhruvam
Griffith: Agni inflamed with fuel in my song I sing, pure, Cleanser, steadlast, set in tront at sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: विप्रं होतारं पुरुवारमद्रुहं कविं सुम्नैरीमहे जातवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddham | agnim | sam-idhā | girā | gr̥ṇe | śucim | pāvakam | puraḥ | adhvare | dhruvam || vipram | hotāram | puru-vāram | adruham | kavim | sumnaiḥ | īmahe | jāta-vedasam ||6.15.7||

IAST: vipraṁ hotāram puruvāram adruhaṁ kaviṁ sumnair īmahe jātavedasam
Griffith: Wise Jatavedas we implore with prayers for bliss the Priest, the holy Singer, bounteous, void of guile.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धमग्निं समिधा गिरा गृणे शुचिं पावकं पुरो अध्वरे ध्रुवम्
pada pāṭha: sam-iddham | agnim | sam-idhā | girā | gr̥ṇe | śucim | pāvakam | puraḥ | adhvare | dhruvam || vipram | hotāram | puru-vāram | adruham | kavim | sumnaiḥ | īmahe | jāta-vedasam ||6.15.7||

IAST: tvāṁ dūtam agne amṛtaṁ yuge-yuge havyavāhaṁ dadhire pāyum īḍyam
Griffith: Men, Agni, in each age have made thee, Deathiess One, their envoy, offering-bearer, guard adorable.
Devanāgarī: देवासश्च मर्तासश्च जागृविं विभुं विश्पतिं नमसा नि षेदिरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | dūtam | agne | amr̥tam | yuge-yuge | havya-vāham | dadhire | pāyum | īḍyam || devāsaḥ | ca | martāsaḥ | ca | jāgr̥vim | vi-bhum | viśpatim | namasā | ni | sedire ||6.15.8||

IAST: devāsaś ca martāsaś ca jāgṛviṁ vibhuṁ viśpatiṁ namasā ni ṣedire
Griffith: With reverence Gods and mortals have established thee, the ever-watchful, omnipresent Household Lord.
Devanāgarī: त्वां दूतमग्ने अमृतं युगेयुगे हव्यवाहं दधिरे पायुमीड्यम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | dūtam | agne | amr̥tam | yuge-yuge | havya-vāham | dadhire | pāyum | īḍyam || devāsaḥ | ca | martāsaḥ | ca | jāgr̥vim | vi-bhum | viśpatim | namasā | ni | sedire ||6.15.8||

IAST: vibhūṣann agna ubhayām̐ anu vratā dūto devānāṁ rajasī sam īyase
Griffith: Thou, Agni, ordering the works and ways of both, as envoy of the Gods traversest both the worlds.
Devanāgarī: यत्ते धीतिं सुमतिमावृणीमहेऽध स्मा नस्त्रिवरूथः शिवो भव
pada pāṭha: vi-bhūṣan | agne | ubhayān | anu | vratā | dūtaḥ | devānām | rajasī iti | sam | īyase || yat | te | dhītim | su-matim | ā-vr̥ṇīmahe | adha | sma | naḥ | tri-varūthaḥ | śivaḥ | bhava ||6.15.9||

IAST: yat te dhītiṁ sumatim āvṛṇīmahe 'dha smā nas trivarūthaḥ śivo bhava
Griffith: When we lay claim to thy regard and gracious fare, be thou to us a thriceprotecting friendly guard.
Devanāgarī: विभूषन्नग्न उभयाँ अनु व्रता दूतो देवानां रजसी समीयसे
pada pāṭha: vi-bhūṣan | agne | ubhayān | anu | vratā | dūtaḥ | devānām | rajasī iti | sam | īyase || yat | te | dhītim | su-matim | ā-vr̥ṇīmahe | adha | sma | naḥ | tri-varūthaḥ | śivaḥ | bhava ||6.15.9||

IAST: taṁ supratīkaṁ sudṛśaṁ svañcam avidvāṁso viduṣṭaraṁ sapema
Griffith: Him fair of face, rapid, and fair to look on, him very wise may we who know not follow.
Devanāgarī: स यक्षद्विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान्प्र हव्यमग्निरमृतेषु वोचत्
pada pāṭha: tam | su-pratīkam | su-dr̥śam | su-añcam | avidvāṁsaḥ | viduḥ-taram | sapema || saḥ | yakṣat | viśvā | vayunāni | vidvān | pra | havyam | agniḥ | amr̥teṣu | vocat ||6.15.10||

IAST: sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyam agnir amṛteṣu vocat
Griffith: Let him who knows all rules invite for worship, Agru announce our offering to the Immortals.
Devanāgarī: तं सुप्रतीकं सुदृशं स्वञ्चमविद्वांसो विदुष्टरं सपेम
pada pāṭha: tam | su-pratīkam | su-dr̥śam | su-añcam | avidvāṁsaḥ | viduḥ-taram | sapema || saḥ | yakṣat | viśvā | vayunāni | vidvān | pra | havyam | agniḥ | amr̥teṣu | vocat ||6.15.10||

IAST: tam agne pāsy uta tam piparṣi yas ta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim
Griffith: Him, Agni, thou deliverest and savest who brings him prayer to thee the Wise, O Hero,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञस्य वा निशितिं वोदितिं वा तमित्पृणक्षि शवसोत राया
pada pāṭha: tam | agne | pāsi | uta | tam | piparṣi | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | kavaye | śūra | dhītim || yajñasya | vā | ni-śitim | vā | ut-itim | vā | tam | it | pr̥ṇakṣi | śavasā | uta | rāyā ||6.15.11||

IAST: yajñasya vā niśitiṁ voditiṁ vā tam it pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā
Griffith: The end of sacrifice or its inception; yea, thou endowest him with power and riches.
Devanāgarī: तमग्ने पास्युत तं पिपर्षि यस्त आनट् कवये शूर धीतिम्
pada pāṭha: tam | agne | pāsi | uta | tam | piparṣi | yaḥ | te | ānaṭ | kavaye | śūra | dhītim || yajñasya | vā | ni-śitim | vā | ut-itim | vā | tam | it | pr̥ṇakṣi | śavasā | uta | rāyā ||6.15.11||

IAST: tvam agne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvann avadyāt
Griffith: Guard us from him who would assail us, Agni; preserve us, O thou Victor, from dishonour.
Devanāgarī: सं त्वा ध्वस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयिः स्पृहयाय्यः सहस्री
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pāhi | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | sahasā-van | avadyāt || sam | tvā | dhvasman-vat | abhi | etu | pāthaḥ | sam | rayiḥ | spr̥hayāyyaḥ | sahasrī ||6.15.12||

IAST: saṁ tvā dhvasmanvad abhy etu pāthaḥ saṁ rayiḥ spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī
Griffith: Here let the place of darkening come upon thee: may wealth be ours, desirable in thousands.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि त्वमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात्
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vanuṣyataḥ | ni | pāhi | tvam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | sahasā-van | avadyāt || sam | tvā | dhvasman-vat | abhi | etu | pāthaḥ | sam | rayiḥ | spr̥hayāyyaḥ | sahasrī ||6.15.12||

IAST: agnir hotā gṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Agni, the Priest, is King, Lord of the homestead, he, Jatayedas, knows all generations.
Devanāgarī: देवानामुत यो मर्त्यानां यजिष्ठः स प्र यजतामृतावा
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | gr̥ha-patiḥ | saḥ | rājā | viśvā | veda | janima | jāta-vedāḥ || devānām | uta | yaḥ | martyānām | yajiṣṭhaḥ | saḥ | pra | yajatām | r̥ta-vā ||6.15.13||

IAST: devānām uta yo martyānāṁ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatām ṛtāvā
Griffith: Most skilful worshipper mid Gods and mortals, may he begin the sacrifice, the Holy.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्होता गृहपतिः स राजा विश्वा वेद जनिमा जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | gr̥ha-patiḥ | saḥ | rājā | viśvā | veda | janima | jāta-vedāḥ || devānām | uta | yaḥ | martyānām | yajiṣṭhaḥ | saḥ | pra | yajatām | r̥ta-vā ||6.15.13||

IAST: agne yad adya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṁ hi yajvā
Griffith: Whate'er to-day thou, bright-flamed Priest, enjoyest from the man's rite-for thou art sacrificer-
Devanāgarī: ऋता यजासि महिना वि यद्भूर्हव्या वह यविष्ठ या ते अद्य
pada pāṭha: agne | yat | adya | viśaḥ | adhvarasya | hotariti | pāvaka-śoce | veḥ | tvam | hi | yajvā || r̥tā | yajāsi | mahinā | vi | yat | bhūḥ | havyā | vaha | yaviṣṭha | yā | te | adya ||6.15.14||

IAST: ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yad bhūr havyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya
Griffith: Worship, for duly dost thou spread in greatness: bear off thine ofrerings of to-day, Most Youthful.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यदद्य विशो अध्वरस्य होतः पावकशोचे वेष्ट्वं हि यज्वा
pada pāṭha: agne | yat | adya | viśaḥ | adhvarasya | hotariti | pāvaka-śoce | veḥ | tvam | hi | yajvā || r̥tā | yajāsi | mahinā | vi | yat | bhūḥ | havyā | vaha | yaviṣṭha | yā | te | adya ||6.15.14||

IAST: abhi prayāṁsi sudhitāni hi khyo ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai
Griffith: Look thou upon the viands duly laid for thee. Fain would he set thee here to worship Heaven and,Earth.
Devanāgarī: अवा नो मघवन्वाजसातावग्ने विश्वानि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम
pada pāṭha: abhi | prayāṁsi | su-dhitāni | hi | khyaḥ | ni | tvā | dadhīta | rodasī iti | yajadhyai || ava | naḥ | magha-van | vāja-sātau | agne | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.15.15||

IAST: avā no maghavan vājasātāv agne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema
Griffith: Help us, O liberal Agni, in the strife for spoil, so that we may o'ercome all things that trouble us, o
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रयांसि सुधितानि हि ख्यो नि त्वा दधीत रोदसी यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: abhi | prayāṁsi | su-dhitāni | hi | khyaḥ | ni | tvā | dadhīta | rodasī iti | yajadhyai || ava | naḥ | magha-van | vāja-sātau | agne | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | tarema | tā | tarema | tava | avasā | tarema ||6.15.15||

IAST: agne viśvebhiḥ svanīka devair ūrṇāvantam prathamaḥ sīda yonim
Griffith: Together with all Gods, O fair-faced Agni, be seated first upon the woollined altar,
Devanāgarī: कुलायिनं घृतवन्तं सवित्रे यज्ञं नय यजमानाय साधु
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvebhiḥ | su-anīka | devaiḥ | ūrṇā-vantam | prathamaḥ | sīda | yonim || kulāyinam | ghr̥ta-vantam | savitre | yajñam | naya | yajamānāya | sādhu ||6.15.16||

IAST: kulāyinaṁ ghṛtavantaṁ savitre yajñaṁ naya yajamānāya sādhu
Griffith: Nest-like, bedewed with oil. Bear this our worship to Savitar who sacrifices rightly.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने विश्वेभिः स्वनीक देवैरूर्णावन्तं प्रथमः सीद योनिम्
pada pāṭha: agne | viśvebhiḥ | su-anīka | devaiḥ | ūrṇā-vantam | prathamaḥ | sīda | yonim || kulāyinam | ghr̥ta-vantam | savitre | yajñam | naya | yajamānāya | sādhu ||6.15.16||

IAST: imam u tyam atharvavad agnim manthanti vedhasaḥ
Griffith: Here the arranging priests, as did Atharvan, rub this Agni forth,
Devanāgarī: यमङ्कूयन्तमानयन्नमूरं श्याव्याभ्यः
pada pāṭha: imam | ūm̐ iti | tyam | atharva-vat | agnim | manthanti | vedhasaḥ || yam | aṅku-yantam | ā | anayan | amūram | śyāvyābhyaḥ ||6.15.17||

IAST: yam aṅkūyantam ānayann amūraṁ śyāvyābhyaḥ
Griffith: Whom, not bewildered, as he moved in winding ways, they brought from gloom.
Devanāgarī: इममु त्यमथर्ववदग्निं मन्थन्ति वेधसः
pada pāṭha: imam | ūm̐ iti | tyam | atharva-vat | agnim | manthanti | vedhasaḥ || yam | aṅku-yantam | ā | anayan | amūram | śyāvyābhyaḥ ||6.15.17||

IAST: janiṣvā devavītaye sarvatātā svastaye
Griffith: For the Gods' banquet be thou born, for full perfection and for weal.
Devanāgarī: आ देवान्वक्ष्यमृताँ ऋतावृधो यज्ञं देवेषु पिस्पृशः
pada pāṭha: janiṣva | deva-vītaye | sarva-tātā | svastaye || ā | devān | vakṣi | amr̥tān | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | yajñam | deveṣu | pispr̥śaḥ ||6.15.18||

IAST: ā devān vakṣy amṛtām̐ ṛtāvṛdho yajñaṁ deveṣu pispṛśaḥ
Griffith: Bring the Immortal Gods who strengthen holy Law: so let our sacrifice reach the Gods.
Devanāgarī: जनिष्वा देववीतये सर्वताता स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: janiṣva | deva-vītaye | sarva-tātā | svastaye || ā | devān | vakṣi | amr̥tān | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | yajñam | deveṣu | pispr̥śaḥ ||6.15.18||

IAST: vayam u tvā gṛhapate janānām agne akarma samidhā bṛhantam
Griffith: O Agni, Lord and Master of men's homesteads, with kindled fuel we have made thee mighty.
Devanāgarī: अस्थूरि नो गार्हपत्यानि सन्तु तिग्मेन नस्तेजसा सं शिशाधि
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | gr̥ha-pate | janānām | agne | akarma | sam-idhā | br̥hantam || asthūri | naḥ | gārha-patyāni | santu | tigmena | naḥ | tejasā | sam | śiśādhi ||6.15.19||

IAST: asthūri no gārhapatyāni santu tigmena nas tejasā saṁ śiśādhi
Griffith: Let not our household gear be found defective. Sharpen us with thy penetrating splendour.
Devanāgarī: वयमु त्वा गृहपते जनानामग्ने अकर्म समिधा बृहन्तम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | gr̥ha-pate | janānām | agne | akarma | sam-idhā | br̥hantam || asthūri | naḥ | gārha-patyāni | santu | tigmena | naḥ | tejasā | sam | śiśādhi ||6.15.19||

IAST: tvam agne yajñānāṁ hotā viśveṣāṁ hitaḥ
Griffith: PRIEST of all sacrifices hast thou been appointed by the Gods,
Devanāgarī: देवेभिर्मानुषे जने
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | yajñānām | hotā | viśveṣām | hitaḥ || devebhiḥ | mānuṣe | jane ||6.16.1||

IAST: devebhir mānuṣe jane
Griffith: Agni, amid the race of man.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने यज्ञानां होता विश्वेषां हितः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | yajñānām | hotā | viśveṣām | hitaḥ || devebhiḥ | mānuṣe | jane ||6.16.1||

IAST: sa no mandrābhir adhvare jihvābhir yajā mahaḥ
Griffith: So with thy joyous tongues for us sacrifice nobly in this rite.
Devanāgarī: आ देवान्वक्षि यक्षि च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | mandrābhiḥ | adhvare | jihvābhiḥ | yaja | mahaḥ || ā | devān | vakṣi | yakṣi | ca ||6.16.2||

IAST: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
Griffith: Bring thou the Gods and worship them.
Devanāgarī: स नो मन्द्राभिरध्वरे जिह्वाभिर्यजा महः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | mandrābhiḥ | adhvare | jihvābhiḥ | yaja | mahaḥ || ā | devān | vakṣi | yakṣi | ca ||6.16.2||

IAST: vetthā hi vedho adhvanaḥ pathaś ca devāñjasā
Griffith: For well, O God, Disposer, thou knowest, straight on, the paths and ways,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यज्ञेषु सुक्रतो
pada pāṭha: vettha | hi | vedhaḥ | adhvanaḥ | pathaḥ | ce | deva | añjasā || agne | yajñeṣu | sukrato iti su-krato ||6.16.3||

IAST: agne yajñeṣu sukrato
Griffith: Agni, most wise in sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: वेत्था हि वेधो अध्वनः पथश्च देवाञ्जसा
pada pāṭha: vettha | hi | vedhaḥ | adhvanaḥ | pathaḥ | ce | deva | añjasā || agne | yajñeṣu | sukrato iti su-krato ||6.16.3||

IAST: tvām īḻe adha dvitā bharato vājibhiḥ śunam
Griffith: Thee, too, hath Bharata of old, with mighty men, implored for bliss.
Devanāgarī: ईजे यज्ञेषु यज्ञियम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | īḷe | adha | dvitā | bharataḥ | vāji-bhiḥ | śunam || īje | yajñeṣu | yajñiyam ||6.16.4||

IAST: īje yajñeṣu yajñiyam
Griffith: And worshipped thee the worshipful.
Devanāgarī: त्वामीळे अध द्विता भरतो वाजिभिः शुनम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | īḷe | adha | dvitā | bharataḥ | vāji-bhiḥ | śunam || īje | yajñeṣu | yajñiyam ||6.16.4||

IAST: tvam imā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate
Griffith: Thou givest these abundant boons to Divodasa pouring forth,
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजाय दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: tvam | imā | vāryā | puru | divaḥ-dāsāya | sunvate || bharat-vājāya | dāśuṣe ||6.16.5||

IAST: bharadvājāya dāśuṣe
Griffith: To Bharadvaja offering gifts.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिमा वार्या पुरु दिवोदासाय सुन्वते
pada pāṭha: tvam | imā | vāryā | puru | divaḥ-dāsāya | sunvate || bharat-vājāya | dāśuṣe ||6.16.5||

IAST: tvaṁ dūto amartya ā vahā daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: Do thou, Immortal Messenger, bring hither the Celestial Folk;
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्विप्रस्य सुष्टुतिम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | dūtaḥ | amartyaḥ | ā | vaha | daivyam | janam || śr̥ṇvan | viprasya | su-stutim ||6.16.6||

IAST: śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim
Griffith: Hearing the singer's eulogy.
Devanāgarī: त्वं दूतो अमर्त्य आ वहा दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | dūtaḥ | amartyaḥ | ā | vaha | daivyam | janam || śr̥ṇvan | viprasya | su-stutim ||6.16.6||

IAST: tvām agne svādhyo martāso devavītaye
Griffith: Mortals with pious thought implore thee, Agni, God, at holy rites,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञेषु देवमीळते
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | martāsaḥ | deva-vītaye || yajñeṣu | devam | īḷate ||6.16.7||

IAST: yajñeṣu devam īḻate
Griffith: To come unto the feast of Gods.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने स्वाध्यो मर्तासो देववीतये
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | su-ādhyaḥ | martāsaḥ | deva-vītaye || yajñeṣu | devam | īḷate ||6.16.7||

IAST: tava pra yakṣi saṁdṛśam uta kratuṁ sudānavaḥ
Griffith: I glorify thine aspect and the might of thee the Bountilul.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे जुषन्त कामिनः
pada pāṭha: tava | pra | yakṣi | sam-dr̥śam | uta | kratum | su-dānavaḥ || viśve | juṣanta | kāminaḥ ||6.16.8||

IAST: viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ
Griffith: All those who love shall joy in thee,
Devanāgarī: तव प्र यक्षि संदृशमुत क्रतुं सुदानवः
pada pāṭha: tava | pra | yakṣi | sam-dr̥śam | uta | kratum | su-dānavaḥ || viśve | juṣanta | kāminaḥ ||6.16.8||

IAST: tvaṁ hotā manurhito vahnir āsā viduṣṭaraḥ
Griffith: Invoker placed by Manus, thou, Agni, art near, the wisest Priest:
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यक्षि दिवो विशः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hotā | manuḥ-hitaḥ | vahniḥ | āsā | viduḥ-taraḥ || agne | yakṣi | divaḥ | viśaḥ ||6.16.9||

IAST: agne yakṣi divo viśaḥ
Griffith: Pay worship to the Tribes of Heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वं होता मनुर्हितो वह्निरासा विदुष्टरः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hotā | manuḥ-hitaḥ | vahniḥ | āsā | viduḥ-taraḥ || agne | yakṣi | divaḥ | viśaḥ ||6.16.9||

IAST: agna ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇāno havyadātaye
Griffith: Come, Agni, lauded, to the feast; come to the offering of the gifts.
Devanāgarī: नि होता सत्सि बर्हिषि
pada pāṭha: agne | ā | yāhi | vītaye | gr̥ṇānaḥ | havya-dātaye || ni | hotā | satsi | barhiṣi ||6.16.10||

IAST: ni hotā satsi barhiṣi
Griffith: As Priest be seated on the grass.
Devanāgarī: अग्न आ याहि वीतये गृणानो हव्यदातये
pada pāṭha: agne | ā | yāhi | vītaye | gr̥ṇānaḥ | havya-dātaye || ni | hotā | satsi | barhiṣi ||6.16.10||

IAST: taṁ tvā samidbhir aṅgiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi
Griffith: So, Angiras, we make thee strong with fuel and with holy oil.
Devanāgarī: बृहच्छोचा यविष्ठ्य
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | samit-bhiḥ | aṅgiraḥ | ghr̥tena | vardhayāmasi || br̥hat | śoca | yaviṣṭhya ||6.16.11||

IAST: bṛhac chocā yaviṣṭhya
Griffith: Blaze high, thou youngest of the Gods.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा समिद्भिरङ्गिरो घृतेन वर्धयामसि
pada pāṭha: tam | tvā | samit-bhiḥ | aṅgiraḥ | ghr̥tena | vardhayāmasi || br̥hat | śoca | yaviṣṭhya ||6.16.11||

IAST: sa naḥ pṛthu śravāyyam acchā deva vivāsasi
Griffith: For us thou winnest, Agni, God, heroic strength exceeding great,
Devanāgarī: बृहदग्ने सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | pr̥thu | śravāyyam | accha | deva | vivāsasi || br̥hat | agne | su-vīryam ||6.16.12||

IAST: bṛhad agne suvīryam
Griffith: Far-spreading and of high renown.
Devanāgarī: स नः पृथु श्रवाय्यमच्छा देव विवाससि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | pr̥thu | śravāyyam | accha | deva | vivāsasi || br̥hat | agne | su-vīryam ||6.16.12||

IAST: tvām agne puṣkarād adhy atharvā nir amanthata
Griffith: Agni, Atharvan brought thee forth, by rubbing, from the lotus-flower,
Devanāgarī: मूर्ध्नो विश्वस्य वाघतः
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | puṣkarāt | adhi | atharvā | niḥ | amanthata || mūrdhnaḥ | viśvasya | vāghataḥ ||6.16.13||

IAST: mūrdhno viśvasya vāghataḥ
Griffith: The head of Visva, of the Priest.
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने पुष्करादध्यथर्वा निरमन्थत
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | puṣkarāt | adhi | atharvā | niḥ | amanthata || mūrdhnaḥ | viśvasya | vāghataḥ ||6.16.13||

IAST: tam u tvā dadhyaṅṅ ṛṣiḥ putra īdhe atharvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Thee. Vrtra's slayer, breaker down of castles, hath Atharvan's son,
Devanāgarī: वृत्रहणं पुरंदरम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | dadhyaṅ | r̥ṣiḥ | putraḥ | īdhe | atharvaṇaḥ || vr̥tra-hanam | puram-daram ||6.16.14||

IAST: vṛtrahaṇam puraṁdaram
Griffith: Dadhyac the Rsi, lighted up.
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा दध्यङ्ङृषिः पुत्र ईधे अथर्वणः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | dadhyaṅ | r̥ṣiḥ | putraḥ | īdhe | atharvaṇaḥ || vr̥tra-hanam | puram-daram ||6.16.14||

IAST: tam u tvā pāthyo vṛṣā sam īdhe dasyuhantamam
Griffith: The hero Pathya kindled thee the Dasyus'. most destructive foe,
Devanāgarī: धनंजयं रणेरणे
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | pāthyaḥ | vr̥ṣā | sam | īdhe | dasyuhan-tamam || dhanam-jayam | raṇe-raṇe ||6.16.15||

IAST: dhanaṁjayaṁ raṇe-raṇe
Griffith: Winner of spoil in every fight.
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा पाथ्यो वृषा समीधे दस्युहन्तमम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | pāthyaḥ | vr̥ṣā | sam | īdhe | dasyuhan-tamam || dhanam-jayam | raṇe-raṇe ||6.16.15||

IAST: ehy ū ṣu bravāṇi te 'gna itthetarā giraḥ
Griffith: Come, here, O Agni, will I sing verily other songs to thee,
Devanāgarī: एभिर्वर्धास इन्दुभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | ihi | ūm̐ iti | su | bravāṇi | te | agne | itthā | itarāḥ | giraḥ || ebhiḥ | vardhāse | indu-bhiḥ ||6.16.16||

IAST: ebhir vardhāsa indubhiḥ
Griffith: And with these drops shalt thou grow strong.
Devanāgarī: एह्यू षु ब्रवाणि तेऽग्न इत्थेतरा गिरः
pada pāṭha: ā | ihi | ūm̐ iti | su | bravāṇi | te | agne | itthā | itarāḥ | giraḥ || ebhiḥ | vardhāse | indu-bhiḥ ||6.16.16||

IAST: yatra kva ca te mano dakṣaṁ dadhasa uttaram
Griffith: Where'er tby mind applies itself, vigour preeminent bast thou:
Devanāgarī: तत्रा सदः कृणवसे
pada pāṭha: yatra | kva | ca | te | manaḥ | dakṣam | dadhase | ut-taram || tatra | sadaḥ | kr̥ṇavase ||6.16.17||

IAST: tatrā sadaḥ kṛṇavase
Griffith: There wilt thou gain a dwelling-place.
Devanāgarī: यत्र क्व च ते मनो दक्षं दधस उत्तरम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | kva | ca | te | manaḥ | dakṣam | dadhase | ut-taram || tatra | sadaḥ | kr̥ṇavase ||6.16.17||

IAST: nahi te pūrtam akṣipad bhuvan nemānāṁ vaso
Griffith: Not for a moment only lasts thy bounty, good to many a one!
Devanāgarī: अथा दुवो वनवसे
pada pāṭha: nahi | te | pūram | akṣi-pat | bhuvat | nemānām | vaso iti || atha | duvaḥ | vanavase ||6.16.18||

IAST: athā duvo vanavase
Griffith: Our service therefore shalt thou gain.
Devanāgarī: नहि ते पूर्तमक्षिपद्भुवन्नेमानां वसो
pada pāṭha: nahi | te | pūram | akṣi-pat | bhuvat | nemānām | vaso iti || atha | duvaḥ | vanavase ||6.16.18||

IAST: āgnir agāmi bhārato vṛtrahā purucetanaḥ
Griffith: Agni, the Bharata, hath been sought, the Vrtra-slayer, marked of all,
Devanāgarī: दिवोदासस्य सत्पतिः
pada pāṭha: ā | agniḥ | agāmi | bhārataḥ | vr̥tra-hā | puru-cetanaḥ || divaḥ-dāsasya | sat-patiḥ ||6.16.19||

IAST: divodāsasya satpatiḥ
Griffith: Yea, Divodasa's Hero Lord.
Devanāgarī: आग्निरगामि भारतो वृत्रहा पुरुचेतनः
pada pāṭha: ā | agniḥ | agāmi | bhārataḥ | vr̥tra-hā | puru-cetanaḥ || divaḥ-dāsasya | sat-patiḥ ||6.16.19||

IAST: sa hi viśvāti pārthivā rayiṁ dāśan mahitvanā
Griffith: For he gave riches that surpass in greatness all the things of earth,
Devanāgarī: वन्वन्नवातो अस्तृतः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | viśvā | ati | pārthivā | rayim | dāśat | mahi-tvanā || vanvan | avātaḥ | astr̥taḥ ||6.16.20||

IAST: vanvann avāto astṛtaḥ
Griffith: Fighting untroubled, unsubdued.
Devanāgarī: स हि विश्वाति पार्थिवा रयिं दाशन्महित्वना
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | viśvā | ati | pārthivā | rayim | dāśat | mahi-tvanā || vanvan | avātaḥ | astr̥taḥ ||6.16.20||

IAST: sa pratnavan navīyasāgne dyumnena saṁyatā
Griffith: Thou, Agni, as in days of old, with recent glory, gathered light,
Devanāgarī: बृहत्ततन्थ भानुना
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pratna-vat | navīyasā | agne | dyumnena | sam-yatā || br̥hat | tatantha | bhānunā ||6.16.21||

IAST: bṛhat tatantha bhānunā
Griffith: Hast overspread the lofty heaven.
Devanāgarī: स प्रत्नवन्नवीयसाग्ने द्युम्नेन संयता
pada pāṭha: saḥ | pratna-vat | navīyasā | agne | dyumnena | sam-yatā || br̥hat | tatantha | bhānunā ||6.16.21||

IAST: pra vaḥ sakhāyo agnaye stomaṁ yajñaṁ ca dhṛṣṇuyā
Griffith: Bring to your Agni, O my friends, boldly your laud and sacrifice:
Devanāgarī: अर्च गाय च वेधसे
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | agnaye | stomam | yajñam | ca | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || arca | gāya | ca | vedhase ||6.16.22||

IAST: arca gāya ca vedhase
Griffith: Give the Disposer praise and song.
Devanāgarī: प्र वः सखायो अग्नये स्तोमं यज्ञं च धृष्णुया
pada pāṭha: pra | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | agnaye | stomam | yajñam | ca | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || arca | gāya | ca | vedhase ||6.16.22||

IAST: sa hi yo mānuṣā yugā sīdad dhotā kavikratuḥ
Griffith: For as sagacious Herald he hath sat through every age of man,
Devanāgarī: दूतश्च हव्यवाहनः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | yaḥ | mānuṣā | yugā | sīdat | hotā | kavi-kratuḥ || dūtaḥ | ca | havya-vāhanaḥ ||6.16.23||

IAST: dūtaś ca havyavāhanaḥ
Griffith: Oblation-bearing messenger.
Devanāgarī: स हि यो मानुषा युगा सीदद्धोता कविक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | yaḥ | mānuṣā | yugā | sīdat | hotā | kavi-kratuḥ || dūtaḥ | ca | havya-vāhanaḥ ||6.16.23||

IAST: tā rājānā śucivratādityān mārutaṁ gaṇam
Griffith: Bring those Two Kings whose ways are pure, Adityas, and the Marut host,
Devanāgarī: वसो यक्षीह रोदसी
pada pāṭha: tā | rājānā | śuci-vratā | ādityān | mārutam | gaṇam || vaso iti | yakṣi | iha | rodasī iti ||6.16.24||

IAST: vaso yakṣīha rodasī
Griffith: Excellent God! and Heaven and Earth.
Devanāgarī: ता राजाना शुचिव्रतादित्यान्मारुतं गणम्
pada pāṭha: tā | rājānā | śuci-vratā | ādityān | mārutam | gaṇam || vaso iti | yakṣi | iha | rodasī iti ||6.16.24||

IAST: vasvī te agne saṁdṛṣṭir iṣayate martyāya
Griffith: For strong and active mortal man, excellent, Agni,
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जो नपादमृतस्य
pada pāṭha: vasvī | te | agne | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | iṣa-yate | martyāya || ūrjaḥ | napāt | amr̥tasya ||6.16.25||

IAST: ūrjo napād amṛtasya
Griffith: is the look Of thee Immortal, Son of Strength
Devanāgarī: वस्वी ते अग्ने संदृष्टिरिषयते मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: vasvī | te | agne | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | iṣa-yate | martyāya || ūrjaḥ | napāt | amr̥tasya ||6.16.25||

IAST: kratvā dā astu śreṣṭho 'dya tvā vanvan surekṇāḥ
Griffith: Rich through his wisdom, noblest be the giver serving thee to-day:
Devanāgarī: मर्त आनाश सुवृक्तिम्
pada pāṭha: kratvā | dāḥ | astu | śreṣṭhaḥ | adya | tvā | vanvan | su-rekṇāḥ || martaḥ | ānāśa | su-vr̥ktim ||6.16.26||

IAST: marta ānāśa suvṛktim
Griffith: The man hath brought his hymn of praise.
Devanāgarī: क्रत्वा दा अस्तु श्रेष्ठोऽद्य त्वा वन्वन्सुरेक्णाः
pada pāṭha: kratvā | dāḥ | astu | śreṣṭhaḥ | adya | tvā | vanvan | su-rekṇāḥ || martaḥ | ānāśa | su-vr̥ktim ||6.16.26||

IAST: te te agne tvotā iṣayanto viśvam āyuḥ
Griffith: These, Agni, these are helped by thee, who strong and active all their lives,
Devanāgarī: तरन्तो अर्यो अरातीर्वन्वन्तो अर्यो अरातीः
pada pāṭha: te | te | agne | tvā-ūtāḥ | iṣayantaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ || tarantaḥ | aryaḥ | arātīḥ | vanvantaḥ | aryaḥ | arātīḥ ||6.16.27||

IAST: taranto aryo arātīr vanvanto aryo arātīḥ
Griffith: O'ercome the malice of the foe, fight down the malice of the foe.
Devanāgarī: ते ते अग्ने त्वोता इषयन्तो विश्वमायुः
pada pāṭha: te | te | agne | tvā-ūtāḥ | iṣayantaḥ | viśvam | āyuḥ || tarantaḥ | aryaḥ | arātīḥ | vanvantaḥ | aryaḥ | arātīḥ ||6.16.27||

IAST: agnis tigmena śociṣā yāsad viśvaṁ ny atriṇam
Griffith: May Agni with his pointed blaze cast down each fierce devouring fiend
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्नो वनते रयिम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | tigmena | śociṣā | yāsat | viśvam | ni | atriṇam || agniḥ | naḥ | vanate | rayim ||6.16.28||

IAST: agnir no vanate rayim
Griffith: May Agni win us wealth by war.
Devanāgarī: अग्निस्तिग्मेन शोचिषा यासद्विश्वं न्यत्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | tigmena | śociṣā | yāsat | viśvam | ni | atriṇam || agniḥ | naḥ | vanate | rayim ||6.16.28||

IAST: suvīraṁ rayim ā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe
Griffith: O active Jatavedas, bring riches with store of hero sons:
Devanāgarī: जहि रक्षांसि सुक्रतो
pada pāṭha: su-vīram | rayim | ā | bhara | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || jahi | rakṣāṁsi | sukrato iti su-krato ||6.16.29||

IAST: jahi rakṣāṁsi sukrato
Griffith: Slay thou the demons, O Most Wise.
Devanāgarī: सुवीरं रयिमा भर जातवेदो विचर्षणे
pada pāṭha: su-vīram | rayim | ā | bhara | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || jahi | rakṣāṁsi | sukrato iti su-krato ||6.16.29||

IAST: tvaṁ naḥ pāhy aṁhaso jātavedo aghāyataḥ
Griffith: Keep us, O Jatavedas, from the troubling of the man of sin:
Devanāgarī: रक्षा णो ब्रह्मणस्कवे
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | agha-yataḥ || rakṣa | naḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | kave ||6.16.30||

IAST: rakṣā ṇo brahmaṇas kave
Griffith: Guard us thou Sage who knowest prayer.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नः पाह्यंहसो जातवेदो अघायतः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | agha-yataḥ || rakṣa | naḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | kave ||6.16.30||

IAST: yo no agne dureva ā marto vadhāya dāśati
Griffith: Whatever sinner, Agni, brings oblations to procure our death,
Devanāgarī: तस्मान्नः पाह्यंहसः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | agne | duḥ-evaḥ | ā | martaḥ | vadhāya | dāśati || tasmāt | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ ||6.16.31||

IAST: tasmān naḥ pāhy aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: Save us from woe that he would work.
Devanāgarī: यो नो अग्ने दुरेव आ मर्तो वधाय दाशति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | agne | duḥ-evaḥ | ā | martaḥ | vadhāya | dāśati || tasmāt | naḥ | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ ||6.16.31||

IAST: tvaṁ taṁ deva jihvayā pari bādhasva duṣkṛtam
Griffith: Drive from us with thy tongue, O God, the man who doeth evil deeds,
Devanāgarī: मर्तो यो नो जिघांसति
pada pāṭha: tvam | tam | deva | jihvayā | pari | bādhasva | duḥ-kr̥tam || martaḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | jighāṁsati ||6.16.32||

IAST: marto yo no jighāṁsati
Griffith: The mortal who would strike us dead.
Devanāgarī: त्वं तं देव जिह्वया परि बाधस्व दुष्कृतम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | tam | deva | jihvayā | pari | bādhasva | duḥ-kr̥tam || martaḥ | yaḥ | naḥ | jighāṁsati ||6.16.32||

IAST: bharadvājāya saprathaḥ śarma yaccha sahantya
Griffith: Give shelter reaching far and wide to Bharadvaja, conquering Lord!
Devanāgarī: अग्ने वरेण्यं वसु
pada pāṭha: bharat-vājāya | sa-prathaḥ | śarma | yaccha | sahantya || agne | vareṇyam | vasu ||6.16.33||

IAST: agne vareṇyaṁ vasu
Griffith: Agni, send wealth most excellent.
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः शर्म यच्छ सहन्त्य
pada pāṭha: bharat-vājāya | sa-prathaḥ | śarma | yaccha | sahantya || agne | vareṇyam | vasu ||6.16.33||

IAST: agnir vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad draviṇasyur vipanyayā
Griffith: May Agni slay the Vrtras,-fain for riches, through the lord of song,
Devanāgarī: समिद्धः शुक्र आहुतः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jaṅghanat | draviṇasyuḥ | vipanyayā || sam-iddhaḥ | śukraḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||6.16.34||

IAST: samiddhaḥ śukra āhutaḥ
Griffith: Served with oblation, kindled, bright.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्वृत्राणि जङ्घनद्द्रविणस्युर्विपन्यया
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jaṅghanat | draviṇasyuḥ | vipanyayā || sam-iddhaḥ | śukraḥ | ā-hutaḥ ||6.16.34||

IAST: garbhe mātuḥ pituṣ pitā vididyutāno akṣare
Griffith: His Father's Father, shining in his Mother's everlasting side,
Devanāgarī: सीदन्नृतस्य योनिमा
pada pāṭha: garbhe | mātuḥ | pituḥ | pitā | vi-didyutānaḥ | akṣare || sīdan | r̥tasya | yonim | ā ||6.16.35||

IAST: sīdann ṛtasya yonim ā
Griffith: Set on the seat of holy Law.
Devanāgarī: गर्भे मातुः पितुष्पिता विदिद्युतानो अक्षरे
pada pāṭha: garbhe | mātuḥ | pituḥ | pitā | vi-didyutānaḥ | akṣare || sīdan | r̥tasya | yonim | ā ||6.16.35||

IAST: brahma prajāvad ā bhara jātavedo vicarṣaṇe
Griffith: O active Jatavedas, bring devotion that wins progeny,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने यद्दीदयद्दिवि
pada pāṭha: brahma | prajā-vat | ā | bhara | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || agne | yat | dīdayat | divi ||6.16.36||

IAST: agne yad dīdayad divi
Griffith: Agni, that it may shine to heaven.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्म प्रजावदा भर जातवेदो विचर्षणे
pada pāṭha: brahma | prajā-vat | ā | bhara | jāta-vedaḥ | vi-carṣaṇe || agne | yat | dīdayat | divi ||6.16.36||

IAST: upa tvā raṇvasaṁdṛśam prayasvantaḥ sahaskṛta
Griffith: O Child of Strength, to thee whose look is lovely we with dainty food,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने ससृज्महे गिरः
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | raṇva-saṁdr̥śam | prayasvantaḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || agne | sasr̥jmahe | giraḥ ||6.16.37||

IAST: agne sasṛjmahe giraḥ
Griffith: O Agni, have poured forth our songs.
Devanāgarī: उप त्वा रण्वसंदृशं प्रयस्वन्तः सहस्कृत
pada pāṭha: upa | tvā | raṇva-saṁdr̥śam | prayasvantaḥ | sahaḥ-kr̥ta || agne | sasr̥jmahe | giraḥ ||6.16.37||

IAST: upa cchāyām iva ghṛṇer aganma śarma te vayam
Griffith: To thee for shelter are we come, as to the shade from fervent heat
Devanāgarī: अग्ने हिरण्यसंदृशः
pada pāṭha: upa | chāyām-iva | ghr̥ṇeḥ | aganma | śarma | te | vayam || agne | hiraṇya-saṁdr̥śaḥ ||6.16.38||

IAST: agne hiraṇyasaṁdṛśaḥ
Griffith: Agni, who glitterest like gold.
Devanāgarī: उप च्छायामिव घृणेरगन्म शर्म ते वयम्
pada pāṭha: upa | chāyām-iva | ghr̥ṇeḥ | aganma | śarma | te | vayam || agne | hiraṇya-saṁdr̥śaḥ ||6.16.38||

IAST: ya ugra iva śaryahā tigmaśṛṅgo na vaṁsagaḥ
Griffith: Mighty as one who slays with shafts, or like a bull with sharpened horn,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने पुरो रुरोजिथ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ugraḥ-iva | śarya-hā | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | na | vaṁsagaḥ || agne | puraḥ | rurojitha ||6.16.39||

IAST: agne puro rurojitha
Griffith: Agni, thou breakest down the forts.
Devanāgarī: य उग्र इव शर्यहा तिग्मशृङ्गो न वंसगः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ugraḥ-iva | śarya-hā | tigma-śr̥ṅgaḥ | na | vaṁsagaḥ || agne | puraḥ | rurojitha ||6.16.39||

IAST: ā yaṁ haste na khādinaṁ śiśuṁ jātaṁ na bibhrati
Griffith: Whom, like an infant newly born, devourer, in their arms they bear,
Devanāgarī: विशामग्निं स्वध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yam | haste | na | khādinam | śiśum | jātam | na | bibhrati || viśām | agnim | su-adhvaram ||6.16.40||

IAST: viśām agniṁ svadhvaram
Griffith: Men's Agni, skilled in holy rites.
Devanāgarī: आ यं हस्ते न खादिनं शिशुं जातं न बिभ्रति
pada pāṭha: ā | yam | haste | na | khādinam | śiśum | jātam | na | bibhrati || viśām | agnim | su-adhvaram ||6.16.40||

IAST: pra devaṁ devavītaye bharatā vasuvittamam
Griffith: Bear to the banquet of the Gods the God best finder-out of wealth,
Devanāgarī: आ स्वे योनौ नि षीदतु
pada pāṭha: pra | devam | deva-vītaye | bharata | vasuvit-tamam || ā | sve | yonau | ni | sīdatu ||6.16.41||

IAST: ā sve yonau ni ṣīdatu
Griffith: Let him he seated in his place.
Devanāgarī: प्र देवं देववीतये भरता वसुवित्तमम्
pada pāṭha: pra | devam | deva-vītaye | bharata | vasuvit-tamam || ā | sve | yonau | ni | sīdatu ||6.16.41||

IAST: ā jātaṁ jātavedasi priyaṁ śiśītātithim
Griffith: In Jatavedas kindle ye the dear guest who hath now appeared
Devanāgarī: स्योन आ गृहपतिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | jātam | jāta-vedasi | priyam | śiśīta | atithim || syone | ā | gr̥ha-patim ||6.16.42||

IAST: syona ā gṛhapatim
Griffith: In a soft place, the homestead's Lord.
Devanāgarī: आ जातं जातवेदसि प्रियं शिशीतातिथिम्
pada pāṭha: ā | jātam | jāta-vedasi | priyam | śiśīta | atithim || syone | ā | gr̥ha-patim ||6.16.42||

IAST: agne yukṣvā hi ye tavāśvāso deva sādhavaḥ
Griffith: Harness, O Agni, O thou God, thy steeds which are most excellent:
Devanāgarī: अरं वहन्ति मन्यवे
pada pāṭha: agne | yukṣva | hi | ye | tava | aśvāsaḥ | deva | sādhavaḥ || aram | vahanti | manyave ||6.16.43||

IAST: araṁ vahanti manyave
Griffith: They bear thee as thy spirit wills.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने युक्ष्वा हि ये तवाश्वासो देव साधवः
pada pāṭha: agne | yukṣva | hi | ye | tava | aśvāsaḥ | deva | sādhavaḥ || aram | vahanti | manyave ||6.16.43||

IAST: acchā no yāhy ā vahābhi prayāṁsi vītaye
Griffith: Come hither, bring the Gods to us to taste the sacrificial feast,
Devanāgarī: आ देवान्सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | yāhi | ā | vaha | abhi | prayāṁsi | vītaye || ā | devān | soma-pītaye ||6.16.44||

IAST: ā devān somapītaye
Griffith: To drink the draught of Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा नो याह्या वहाभि प्रयांसि वीतये
pada pāṭha: accha | naḥ | yāhi | ā | vaha | abhi | prayāṁsi | vītaye || ā | devān | soma-pītaye ||6.16.44||

IAST: ud agne bhārata dyumad ajasreṇa davidyutat
Griffith: O Agni of the Bharatas, blaze high with everlasting might,
Devanāgarī: शोचा वि भाह्यजर
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | bhārata | dyu-mat | ajasreṇa | davidyutat || śoca | vi | bhāhi | ajara ||6.16.45||

IAST: śocā vi bhāhy ajara
Griffith: Shine forth and gleam, Eternal One.
Devanāgarī: उदग्ने भारत द्युमदजस्रेण दविद्युतत्
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | bhārata | dyu-mat | ajasreṇa | davidyutat || śoca | vi | bhāhi | ajara ||6.16.45||

IAST: vītī yo devam marto duvasyed agnim īḻītādhvare haviṣmān
Griffith: The mortal man who serves the God with banquet, and, bringing gifts at sacrifice, lauds Agni,
Devanāgarī: होतारं सत्ययजं रोदस्योरुत्तानहस्तो नमसा विवासेत्
pada pāṭha: vītī | yaḥ | devam | martaḥ | duvasyet | agnim | īḷīta | adhvare | haviṣmān || hotāram | satya-yajam | rodasyoḥ | uttāna-hastaḥ | namasā | ā | vivāset ||6.16.46||

IAST: hotāraṁ satyayajaṁ rodasyor uttānahasto namasā vivāset
Griffith: May well attract, with prayer and hands uplifted, the Priest of Heaven and Earth, true Sacrificer.
Devanāgarī: वीती यो देवं मर्तो दुवस्येदग्निमीळीताध्वरे हविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: vītī | yaḥ | devam | martaḥ | duvasyet | agnim | īḷīta | adhvare | haviṣmān || hotāram | satya-yajam | rodasyoḥ | uttāna-hastaḥ | namasā | ā | vivāset ||6.16.46||

IAST: ā te agna ṛcā havir hṛdā taṣṭam bharāmasi
Griffith: Agni, we bring thee, with our hymn, oblation fashioned in the heart.
Devanāgarī: ते ते भवन्तूक्षण ऋषभासो वशा उत
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | r̥cā | haviḥ | hr̥dā | taṣṭam | bharāmasi || te | te | bhavantu | ukṣaṇaḥ | r̥ṣabhāsaḥ | vaśāḥ | uta ||6.16.47||

IAST: te te bhavantūkṣaṇa ṛṣabhāso vaśā uta
Griffith: Let these be oxen unto thee, let these be bulls and kine to thee.
Devanāgarī: आ ते अग्न ऋचा हविर्हृदा तष्टं भरामसि
pada pāṭha: ā | te | agne | r̥cā | haviḥ | hr̥dā | taṣṭam | bharāmasi || te | te | bhavantu | ukṣaṇaḥ | r̥ṣabhāsaḥ | vaśāḥ | uta ||6.16.47||

IAST: agniṁ devāso agriyam indhate vṛtrahantamam
Griffith: The Gods enkindle Agni, best slayer of Vrtra, first in rank,
Devanāgarī: येना वसून्याभृता तृळ्हा रक्षांसि वाजिना
pada pāṭha: agnim | devāsaḥ | agriyam | indhate | vr̥trahan-tamam || yena | vasūni | ā-bhr̥tā | tr̥ḷhā | rakṣāṁsi | vājinā ||6.16.48||

IAST: yenā vasūny ābhṛtā tṛḻhā rakṣāṁsi vājinā
Griffith: The Mighty, One who brings us wealth and crushes down the Raksasas.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं देवासो अग्रियमिन्धते वृत्रहन्तमम्
pada pāṭha: agnim | devāsaḥ | agriyam | indhate | vr̥trahan-tamam || yena | vasūni | ā-bhr̥tā | tr̥ḷhā | rakṣāṁsi | vājinā ||6.16.48||

IAST: pibā somam abhi yam ugra tarda ūrvaṁ gavyam mahi gṛṇāna indra
Griffith: DRINK Soma, Mighty One, for which, when lauded, thou breakest through the cattle-stall, O Indra;
Devanāgarī: वि यो धृष्णो वधिषो वज्रहस्त विश्वा वृत्रममित्रिया शवोभिः
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | abhi | yam | ugra | tardaḥ | ūrvam | gavyam | mahi | gr̥ṇānaḥ | indra || vi | yaḥ | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | vadhiṣaḥ | vajra-hasta | viśvā | vr̥tram | amitriyā | śavaḥ-bhiḥ ||6.17.1||

IAST: vi yo dhṛṣṇo vadhiṣo vajrahasta viśvā vṛtram amitriyā śavobhiḥ
Griffith: Thou who, O Bold One, armed with thunder smotest Vrtra with might, and every hostile being.
Devanāgarī: पिबा सोममभि यमुग्र तर्द ऊर्वं गव्यं महि गृणान इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: piba | somam | abhi | yam | ugra | tardaḥ | ūrvam | gavyam | mahi | gr̥ṇānaḥ | indra || vi | yaḥ | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | vadhiṣaḥ | vajra-hasta | viśvā | vr̥tram | amitriyā | śavaḥ-bhiḥ ||6.17.1||

IAST: sa īm pāhi ya ṛjīṣī tarutro yaḥ śipravān vṛṣabho yo matīnām
Griffith: Drink it thou God who art impetuous victor, Lord of our hymns, with beauteousjaws, the Hero,
Devanāgarī: यो गोत्रभिद्वज्रभृद्यो हरिष्ठाः स इन्द्र चित्राँ अभि तृन्धि वाजान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | pāhi | yaḥ | r̥jīṣī | tarutraḥ | yaḥ | śipra-vān | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yaḥ | matīnām || yaḥ | gotra-bhit | vajra-bhr̥t | yaḥ | hari-sthāḥ | saḥ | indra | citrān | abhi | tr̥ndhi | vājān ||6.17.2||

IAST: yo gotrabhid vajrabhṛd yo hariṣṭhāḥ sa indra citrām̐ abhi tṛndhi vājān
Griffith: Render of kine-stalls, car-borne, thunder-wielding, so pierce thy way to wondrous strength, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: स ईं पाहि य ऋजीषी तरुत्रो यः शिप्रवान्वृषभो यो मतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | pāhi | yaḥ | r̥jīṣī | tarutraḥ | yaḥ | śipra-vān | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | yaḥ | matīnām || yaḥ | gotra-bhit | vajra-bhr̥t | yaḥ | hari-sthāḥ | saḥ | indra | citrān | abhi | tr̥ndhi | vājān ||6.17.2||

IAST: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvota gīrbhiḥ
Griffith: Drink as of old, and let the draught delight thee. hear thou our prayer and let our songs exalt thee.
Devanāgarī: आविः सूर्यं कृणुहि पीपिहीषो जहि शत्रूँरभि गा इन्द्र तृन्धि
pada pāṭha: eva | pāhi | pratna-thā | mandatu | tvā | śrudhi | brahma | vavr̥dhasva | uta | gīḥ-bhiḥ || āviḥ | sūryam | kr̥ṇuhi | pīpihi | iṣaḥ | jahi | śatrūn | abhi | gāḥ | indra | tr̥ndhi ||6.17.3||

IAST: āviḥ sūryaṁ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūm̐r abhi gā indra tṛndhi
Griffith: Make the Sun visible, make food abundant, slaughter the foes, pierce through and free the cattle.
Devanāgarī: एवा पाहि प्रत्नथा मन्दतु त्वा श्रुधि ब्रह्म वावृधस्वोत गीर्भिः
pada pāṭha: eva | pāhi | pratna-thā | mandatu | tvā | śrudhi | brahma | vavr̥dhasva | uta | gīḥ-bhiḥ || āviḥ | sūryam | kr̥ṇuhi | pīpihi | iṣaḥ | jahi | śatrūn | abhi | gāḥ | indra | tr̥ndhi ||6.17.3||

IAST: te tvā madā bṛhad indra svadhāva ime pītā ukṣayanta dyumantam
Griffith: These gladdening drops, O Indra, Self-sustainer, quaffed shall augment thee in thy mighty splendour.
Devanāgarī: महामनूनं तवसं विभूतिं मत्सरासो जर्हृषन्त प्रसाहम्
pada pāṭha: te | tvā | madāḥ | br̥hat | indra | svadhā-vaḥ | ime | pītāḥ | ukṣayanta | dyu-mantam || mahām | anūnam | tavasam | vi-bhūtim | matsarāsaḥ | jarhr̥ṣanta | pra-saham ||6.17.4||

IAST: mahām anūnaṁ tavasaṁ vibhūtim matsarāso jarhṛṣanta prasāham
Griffith: Yea, let the cheering drops delight thee greatly, great, perfect, strong, powerful, all-subduing.
Devanāgarī: ते त्वा मदा बृहदिन्द्र स्वधाव इमे पीता उक्षयन्त द्युमन्तम्
pada pāṭha: te | tvā | madāḥ | br̥hat | indra | svadhā-vaḥ | ime | pītāḥ | ukṣayanta | dyu-mantam || mahām | anūnam | tavasam | vi-bhūtim | matsarāsaḥ | jarhr̥ṣanta | pra-saham ||6.17.4||

IAST: yebhiḥ sūryam uṣasam mandasāno 'vāsayo 'pa dṛḻhāni dardrat
Griffith: Gladdened whereby, bursting the firm enclosures, thou gavest splendour to the Sun and Morning.
Devanāgarī: महामद्रिं परि गा इन्द्र सन्तं नुत्था अच्युतं सदसस्परि स्वात्
pada pāṭha: yebhiḥ | sūryam | uṣasam | mandasānaḥ | avāsayaḥ | apa | dr̥ḷhāni | dardrat || mahām | adrim | pari | gāḥ | indra | santam | nutthāḥ | acyutam | sadasaḥ | pari | svāt ||6.17.5||

IAST: mahām adrim pari gā indra santaṁ nutthā acyutaṁ sadasas pari svāt
Griffith: The mighty rock that compassed in the cattle, ne'er moved, thou shookest from its seat, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: येभिः सूर्यमुषसं मन्दसानोऽवासयोऽप दृळ्हानि दर्द्रत्
pada pāṭha: yebhiḥ | sūryam | uṣasam | mandasānaḥ | avāsayaḥ | apa | dr̥ḷhāni | dardrat || mahām | adrim | pari | gāḥ | indra | santam | nutthāḥ | acyutam | sadasaḥ | pari | svāt ||6.17.5||

IAST: tava kratvā tava tad daṁsanābhir āmāsu pakvaṁ śacyā ni dīdhaḥ
Griffith: Thou with thy wisdom, power, and works of wonder, hast stored the ripe milk in the raw cows' udders
Devanāgarī: और्णोर्दुर उस्रियाभ्यो वि दृळ्होदूर्वाद्गा असृजो अङ्गिरस्वान्
pada pāṭha: tava | kratvā | tava | tat | daṁsanābhiḥ | āmāsu | pakvam | śacyā | ni | dīdhariti dīdhaḥ || aurṇoḥ | duraḥ | usriyābhyaḥ | vi | dr̥ḷhā | ut | ūrvāt | gāḥ | asr̥jaḥ | aṅgirasvān ||6.17.6||

IAST: aurṇor dura usriyābhyo vi dṛḻhod ūrvād gā asṛjo aṅgirasvān
Griffith: Unbarred the firm doors for the kine of Morning, and, with the Angirases, set free the cattle.
Devanāgarī: तव क्रत्वा तव तद्दंसनाभिरामासु पक्वं शच्या नि दीधः
pada pāṭha: tava | kratvā | tava | tat | daṁsanābhiḥ | āmāsu | pakvam | śacyā | ni | dīdhariti dīdhaḥ || aurṇoḥ | duraḥ | usriyābhyaḥ | vi | dr̥ḷhā | ut | ūrvāt | gāḥ | asr̥jaḥ | aṅgirasvān ||6.17.6||

IAST: paprātha kṣām mahi daṁso vy urvīm upa dyām ṛṣvo bṛhad indra stabhāyaḥ
Griffith: Thou hast spread out wide earth, a mighty marvel, and, high thyself, propped lofty heaven, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अधारयो रोदसी देवपुत्रे प्रत्ने मातरा यह्वी ऋतस्य
pada pāṭha: paprātha | kṣām | mahi | daṁsaḥ | vi | urvīm | upa | dyām | r̥ṣvaḥ | br̥hat | indra | stabhāyaḥ || adhārayaḥ | rodasī iti | devaputre iti deva-putre | pratne iti | mātarā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya ||6.17.7||

IAST: adhārayo rodasī devaputre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya
Griffith: Both worlds, whose Sons are Gods, thou hast supported, young, Mothers from old time ofholy Order.
Devanāgarī: पप्राथ क्षां महि दंसो व्युर्वीमुप द्यामृष्वो बृहदिन्द्र स्तभायः
pada pāṭha: paprātha | kṣām | mahi | daṁsaḥ | vi | urvīm | upa | dyām | r̥ṣvaḥ | br̥hat | indra | stabhāyaḥ || adhārayaḥ | rodasī iti | devaputre iti deva-putre | pratne iti | mātarā | yahvī iti | r̥tasya ||6.17.7||

IAST: adha tvā viśve pura indra devā ekaṁ tavasaṁ dadhire bharāya
Griffith: Yea, Indra, all the Deities installed thee their one strong Champion in the van for battle.
Devanāgarī: अदेवो यदभ्यौहिष्ट देवान्स्वर्षाता वृणत इन्द्रमत्र
pada pāṭha: adha | tvā | viśve | puraḥ | indra | devāḥ | ekam | tavasam | dadhire | bharāya || adevaḥ | yat | abhi | auhiṣṭa | devān | svaḥ-sātā | vr̥ṇate | indram | atra ||6.17.8||

IAST: adevo yad abhy auhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇata indram atra
Griffith: What time the godless was the Gods' assailant, Indra they chose to win the light of heaven.
Devanāgarī: अध त्वा विश्वे पुर इन्द्र देवा एकं तवसं दधिरे भराय
pada pāṭha: adha | tvā | viśve | puraḥ | indra | devāḥ | ekam | tavasam | dadhire | bharāya || adevaḥ | yat | abhi | auhiṣṭa | devān | svaḥ-sātā | vr̥ṇate | indram | atra ||6.17.8||

IAST: adha dyauś cit te apa sā nu vajrād dvitānamad bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ
Griffith: Yea, e'en that heaven itself of old bent backward before thy bolt, in terror of its anger,
Devanāgarī: अहिं यदिन्द्रो अभ्योहसानं नि चिद्विश्वायुः शयथे जघान
pada pāṭha: adha | dyauḥ | cit | te | apa | sā | nu | vajrāt | dvitā | anamat | bhiyasā | svasya | manyoḥ || ahim | yat | indraḥ | abhi | ohasānam | ni | cit | viśva-āyuḥ | śayathe | jaghāna ||6.17.9||

IAST: ahiṁ yad indro abhy ohasānaṁ ni cid viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna
Griffith: When Indra, life of every living creature, smote down within his lair the assailing Dragon.
Devanāgarī: अध द्यौश्चित्ते अप सा नु वज्राद्द्वितानमद्भियसा स्वस्य मन्योः
pada pāṭha: adha | dyauḥ | cit | te | apa | sā | nu | vajrāt | dvitā | anamat | bhiyasā | svasya | manyoḥ || ahim | yat | indraḥ | abhi | ohasānam | ni | cit | viśva-āyuḥ | śayathe | jaghāna ||6.17.9||

IAST: adha tvaṣṭā te maha ugra vajraṁ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṁ vavṛtac chatāśrim
Griffith: Yea, Strong One! Tvastar turned for thee, the Mighty, the bolt with thousand spikes and hundred edges,
Devanāgarī: निकाममरमणसं येन नवन्तमहिं सं पिणगृजीषिन्
pada pāṭha: adha | tvaṣṭā | te | mahaḥ | ugra | vajram | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭim | vavr̥tat | śata-aśrim || ni-kāmam | ara-manasam | yena | navantam | ahim | sam | piṇak | r̥jīṣin ||6.17.10||

IAST: nikāmam aramaṇasaṁ yena navantam ahiṁ sam piṇag ṛjīṣin
Griffith: Eager and prompt at will, wherewith thou crushedst the boasting Dragon, O impetuous Hero.
Devanāgarī: अध त्वष्टा ते मह उग्र वज्रं सहस्रभृष्टिं ववृतच्छताश्रिम्
pada pāṭha: adha | tvaṣṭā | te | mahaḥ | ugra | vajram | sahasra-bhr̥ṣṭim | vavr̥tat | śata-aśrim || ni-kāmam | ara-manasam | yena | navantam | ahim | sam | piṇak | r̥jīṣin ||6.17.10||

IAST: vardhān yaṁ viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacac chatam mahiṣām̐ indra tubhyam
Griffith: He dressed a hundred buffaloes, O Indra, for thee whom all accordant Maruts strengthen.
Devanāgarī: पूषा विष्णुस्त्रीणि सरांसि धावन्वृत्रहणं मदिरमंशुमस्मै
pada pāṭha: vardhān | yam | viśve | marutaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | pacat | śatam | mahiṣān | indra | tubhyam || pūṣā | viṣṇuḥ | trīṇi | sarāṁsi | dhāvan | vr̥tra-hanam | madiram | aṁśum | asmai ||6.17.11||

IAST: pūṣā viṣṇus trīṇi sarāṁsi dhāvan vṛtrahaṇam madiram aṁśum asmai
Griffith: He, Pusan Visnu, poured forth three great vessels to him, the juice that cheers, that slaughters Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: वर्धान्यं विश्वे मरुतः सजोषाः पचच्छतं महिषाँ इन्द्र तुभ्यम्
pada pāṭha: vardhān | yam | viśve | marutaḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | pacat | śatam | mahiṣān | indra | tubhyam || pūṣā | viṣṇuḥ | trīṇi | sarāṁsi | dhāvan | vr̥tra-hanam | madiram | aṁśum | asmai ||6.17.11||

IAST: ā kṣodo mahi vṛtaṁ nadīnām pariṣṭhitam asṛja ūrmim apām
Griffith: Thou settest free the rushing wave of waters, the floods' great swell encompassed and obstructed.
Devanāgarī: तासामनु प्रवत इन्द्र पन्थां प्रार्दयो नीचीरपसः समुद्रम्
pada pāṭha: ā | kṣodaḥ | mahi | vr̥tam | nadīnām | pari-sthitam | asr̥jaḥ | ūrmim | apām || tāsām | anu | pra-vataḥ | indra | panthām | pra | ārdayaḥ | nīcīḥ | apasaḥ | samudram ||6.17.12||

IAST: tāsām anu pravata indra panthām prārdayo nīcīr apasaḥ samudram
Griffith: Along steep slopes their course thou tumedst, Indra, directed downward, speeding to the ocean.
Devanāgarī: आ क्षोदो महि वृतं नदीनां परिष्ठितमसृज ऊर्मिमपाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | kṣodaḥ | mahi | vr̥tam | nadīnām | pari-sthitam | asr̥jaḥ | ūrmim | apām || tāsām | anu | pra-vataḥ | indra | panthām | pra | ārdayaḥ | nīcīḥ | apasaḥ | samudram ||6.17.12||

IAST: evā tā viśvā cakṛvāṁsam indram mahām ugram ajuryaṁ sahodām
Griffith: So may our new prayer bring thee to protect us, thee well-armed Hero with thy bolt of thunder,
Devanāgarī: सुवीरं त्वा स्वायुधं सुवज्रमा ब्रह्म नव्यमवसे ववृत्यात्
pada pāṭha: eva | tā | viśvā | cakr̥-vāṁsam | indram | mahām | ugram | ajuryam | sahaḥ-dām || su-vīram | tvā | su-āyudham | su-vajram | ā | brahma | navyam | avase | vavr̥tyāt ||6.17.13||

IAST: suvīraṁ tvā svāyudhaṁ suvajram ā brahma navyam avase vavṛtyāt
Griffith: Indra, who made these worlds, the Strong, the ty, who never groweth old, the victory-giver.
Devanāgarī: एवा ता विश्वा चकृवांसमिन्द्रं महामुग्रमजुर्यं सहोदाम्
pada pāṭha: eva | tā | viśvā | cakr̥-vāṁsam | indram | mahām | ugram | ajuryam | sahaḥ-dām || su-vīram | tvā | su-āyudham | su-vajram | ā | brahma | navyam | avase | vavr̥tyāt ||6.17.13||

IAST: sa no vājāya śravasa iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumata indra viprān
Griffith: So, Indra, form us brilliant holy singers for strength, for glory, and for food and riches.
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजे नृवत इन्द्र सूरीन्दिवि च स्मैधि पार्ये न इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vājāya | śravase | iṣe | ca | rāye | dhehi | dyu-mataḥ | indra | viprān || bharat-vāje | nr̥-vataḥ | indra | sūrīn | divi | ca | sma | edhi | pārye | naḥ | indra ||6.17.14||

IAST: bharadvāje nṛvata indra sūrīn divi ca smaidhi pārye na indra
Griffith: Give Bharadvaja hero patrons, Indra Indra, be ours upon the day of trial.
Devanāgarī: स नो वाजाय श्रवस इषे च राये धेहि द्युमत इन्द्र विप्रान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | vājāya | śravase | iṣe | ca | rāye | dhehi | dyu-mataḥ | indra | viprān || bharat-vāje | nr̥-vataḥ | indra | sūrīn | divi | ca | sma | edhi | pārye | naḥ | indra ||6.17.14||

IAST: ayā vājaṁ devahitaṁ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: With this may we obtain strength God-appointed, and brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: अया वाजं देवहितं सनेम मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः
pada pāṭha: ayā | vājam | deva-hitam | sanema | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.17.15||

IAST: tam u ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvann avātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ
Griffith: GLORIFY him whose might is all-surpassing, Indra the much-invoked who fights uninjured.
Devanāgarī: तमु ष्टुहि यो अभिभूत्योजा वन्वन्नवातः पुरुहूत इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | yaḥ | abhibhūti-ojāḥ | vanvan | avātaḥ | puru-hūtaḥ | indraḥ || aṣāḷham | ugram | sahamānam | ābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vardha | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām ||6.18.1||

IAST: aṣāḻham ugraṁ sahamānam ābhir gīrbhir vardha vṛṣabhaṁ carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: Magnify with these songs the never-vanquished, the Strong, the Bull of men, the Mighty Victor.
Devanāgarī: अषाळ्हमुग्रं सहमानमाभिर्गीर्भिर्वर्ध वृषभं चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | yaḥ | abhibhūti-ojāḥ | vanvan | avātaḥ | puru-hūtaḥ | indraḥ || aṣāḷham | ugram | sahamānam | ābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vardha | vr̥ṣabham | carṣaṇīnām ||6.18.1||

IAST: sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumām̐ ṛjīṣī
Griffith: He, Champion, Hero, Warrior, Lord of battles, impetuous, loudly roaring, great destroyer,
Devanāgarī: स युध्मः सत्वा खजकृत्समद्वा तुविम्रक्षो नदनुमाँ ऋजीषी
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yudhmaḥ | satvā | khaja-kr̥t | samat-vā | tuvi-mrakṣaḥ | nadanu-mān | r̥jīṣī || br̥hat-reṇuḥ | cyavanaḥ | mānuṣīṇām | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīnām | abhavat | saha-vā ||6.18.2||

IAST: bṛhadreṇuś cyavano mānuṣīṇām ekaḥ kṛṣṭīnām abhavat sahāvā
Griffith: Who whirls the dust on high, alone, oerthrower, hath made all races of mankind his subjects.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्रेणुश्च्यवनो मानुषीणामेकः कृष्टीनामभवत्सहावा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yudhmaḥ | satvā | khaja-kr̥t | samat-vā | tuvi-mrakṣaḥ | nadanu-mān | r̥jīṣī || br̥hat-reṇuḥ | cyavanaḥ | mānuṣīṇām | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīnām | abhavat | saha-vā ||6.18.2||

IAST: tvaṁ ha nu tyad adamāyo dasyūm̐r ekaḥ kṛṣṭīr avanor āryāya
Griffith: Thou, thou alone, hast tamed the Dasyus; singly thou hast subdued the people for the Arya.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह नु त्यददमायो दस्यूँरेकः कृष्टीरवनोरार्याय
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | nu | tyat | adamayaḥ | dasyūn | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | avanoḥ | āryāya || asti | svit | nu | vīryam | tat | te | indra | na | svit | asti | tat | r̥tu-thā | vi | vocaḥ ||6.18.3||

IAST: asti svin nu vīryaṁ tat ta indra na svid asti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ
Griffith: In this, or is it not, thine hero exploit, Indra? Declare it at the proper season.
Devanāgarī: अस्ति स्विन्नु वीर्यं तत्त इन्द्र न स्विदस्ति तदृतुथा वि वोचः
pada pāṭha: tvam | ha | nu | tyat | adamayaḥ | dasyūn | ekaḥ | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | avanoḥ | āryāya || asti | svit | nu | vīryam | tat | te | indra | na | svit | asti | tat | r̥tu-thā | vi | vocaḥ ||6.18.3||

IAST: sad id dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatas turasya
Griffith: For true, I deem, thy strength is, thine the Mighty, thine, O Most Potent, thine the Conquering Victor;
Devanāgarī: सदिद्धि ते तुविजातस्य मन्ये सहः सहिष्ठ तुरतस्तुरस्य
pada pāṭha: sat | it | hi | te | tuvi-jātasya | manye | sahaḥ | sahiṣṭha | turataḥ | turasya || ugram | ugrasya | tavasaḥ | tavīyaḥ | aradhrasya | radhra-turaḥ | babhūva ||6.18.4||

IAST: ugram ugrasya tavasas tavīyo 'radhrasya radhraturo babhūva
Griffith: Strong, of the strong, Most Mighty, of the mighty, thine, driver of the churl to acts of bounty.
Devanāgarī: उग्रमुग्रस्य तवसस्तवीयोऽरध्रस्य रध्रतुरो बभूव
pada pāṭha: sat | it | hi | te | tuvi-jātasya | manye | sahaḥ | sahiṣṭha | turataḥ | turasya || ugram | ugrasya | tavasaḥ | tavīyaḥ | aradhrasya | radhra-turaḥ | babhūva ||6.18.4||

IAST: tan naḥ pratnaṁ sakhyam astu yuṣme itthā vadadbhir valam aṅgirobhiḥ
Griffith: Be this our ancient bond of friendship with you and with Angirases here who speak of Vala.
Devanāgarī: तन्नः प्रत्नं सख्यमस्तु युष्मे इत्था वदद्भिर्वलमङ्गिरोभिः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | pratnam | sakhyam | astu | yuṣme iti | itthā | vadat-bhiḥ | valam | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ || han | acyuta-cyut | dasma | iṣayantam | r̥ṇoḥ | puraḥ | vi | duraḥ | asya | viśvāḥ ||6.18.5||

IAST: hann acyutacyud dasmeṣayantam ṛṇoḥ puro vi duro asya viśvāḥ
Griffith: Thou, Wondrous, Shaker of things firm, didst smite him in his fresh strength, and force his doors and ca
Devanāgarī: हन्नच्युतच्युद्दस्मेषयन्तमृणोः पुरो वि दुरो अस्य विश्वाः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | pratnam | sakhyam | astu | yuṣme iti | itthā | vadat-bhiḥ | valam | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ || han | acyuta-cyut | dasma | iṣayantam | r̥ṇoḥ | puraḥ | vi | duraḥ | asya | viśvāḥ ||6.18.5||

IAST: sa hi dhībhir havyo asty ugra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye
Griffith: With holy thoughts must he be called, the Mighty, showing his power in the great fight with Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: स हि धीभिर्हव्यो अस्त्युग्र ईशानकृन्महति वृत्रतूर्ये
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | dhībhiḥ | havyaḥ | asti | ugraḥ | īśāna-kr̥t | mahati | vr̥tra-tūrye || saḥ | toka-sātā | tanaye | saḥ | vajrī | vitantasāyyaḥ | abhavat | samat-su ||6.18.6||

IAST: sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu
Griffith: He must be called to give us seed and offspring, the Thunderer must he moved and sped to battle.
Devanāgarī: स तोकसाता तनये स वज्री वितन्तसाय्यो अभवत्समत्सु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | dhībhiḥ | havyaḥ | asti | ugraḥ | īśāna-kr̥t | mahati | vr̥tra-tūrye || saḥ | toka-sātā | tanaye | saḥ | vajrī | vitantasāyyaḥ | abhavat | samat-su ||6.18.6||

IAST: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇām amartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre
Griffith: He in his might, with name that lives for ever, hath far surpassed all human generations.
Devanāgarī: स मज्मना जनिम मानुषाणाममर्त्येन नाम्नाति प्र सर्स्रे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | majmanā | janima | mānuṣāṇām | amartyena | nāmnā | ati | pra | sarsre || saḥ | dyumnena | saḥ | śavasā | uta | rāyā | saḥ | vīryeṇa | nr̥-tamaḥ | sam-okāḥ ||6.18.7||

IAST: sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ
Griffith: He, most heroic, hath his home with splendour, with glory and with riches and with valour.
Devanāgarī: स द्युम्नेन स शवसोत राया स वीर्येण नृतमः समोकाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | majmanā | janima | mānuṣāṇām | amartyena | nāmnā | ati | pra | sarsre || saḥ | dyumnena | saḥ | śavasā | uta | rāyā | saḥ | vīryeṇa | nr̥-tamaḥ | sam-okāḥ ||6.18.7||

IAST: sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṁ dhuniṁ ca
Griffith: Stranger to guile, who ne'er was false or faithless, bearing a name that may be well remembered,
Devanāgarī: स यो न मुहे न मिथू जनो भूत्सुमन्तुनामा चुमुरिं धुनिं च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yaḥ | na | muhe | na | mithu | janaḥ | bhūt | sumantu-nāmā | cumurim | dhunim | ca || vr̥ṇak | piprum | śambaram | śuṣṇam | indraḥ | purām | cyautnāya | śayathāya | nu | cit ||6.18.8||

IAST: vṛṇak pipruṁ śambaraṁ śuṣṇam indraḥ purāṁ cyautnāya śayathāya nū cit
Griffith: Indra crushed Cumuri, Dhuni, Sambara, Pipru, and Susna, that their castles fell in ruin.
Devanāgarī: वृणक्पिप्रुं शम्बरं शुष्णमिन्द्रः पुरां च्यौत्नाय शयथाय नू चित्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | yaḥ | na | muhe | na | mithu | janaḥ | bhūt | sumantu-nāmā | cumurim | dhunim | ca || vr̥ṇak | piprum | śambaram | śuṣṇam | indraḥ | purām | cyautnāya | śayathāya | nu | cit ||6.18.8||

IAST: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya ratham indra tiṣṭha
Griffith: With saving might that must be praised and lauded, Indra, ascend thy car to smite down Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: उदावता त्वक्षसा पन्यसा च वृत्रहत्याय रथमिन्द्र तिष्ठ
pada pāṭha: ut-avatā | tvakṣasā | panyasā | ca | vr̥tra-hatyāya | ratham | indra | tiṣṭha || dhiṣva | vajram | haste | ā | dakṣiṇa-trā | abhi | pra | manda | puru-datra | māyāḥ ||6.18.9||

IAST: dhiṣva vajraṁ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ
Griffith: In thy right hand hold fast thy bolt of thunder, and weaken, Bounteous Lord, his art and magic.
Devanāgarī: धिष्व वज्रं हस्त आ दक्षिणत्राभि प्र मन्द पुरुदत्र मायाः
pada pāṭha: ut-avatā | tvakṣasā | panyasā | ca | vr̥tra-hatyāya | ratham | indra | tiṣṭha || dhiṣva | vajram | haste | ā | dakṣiṇa-trā | abhi | pra | manda | puru-datra | māyāḥ ||6.18.9||

IAST: agnir na śuṣkaṁ vanam indra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣy aśanir na bhīmā
Griffith: As Agni, as the dart burns the dry forest, like the dread shaft burn down the fiends, O Indra;
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्न शुष्कं वनमिन्द्र हेती रक्षो नि धक्ष्यशनिर्न भीमा
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | na | śuṣkam | vanam | indra | hetī | rakṣaḥ | ni | dhakṣi | aśaniḥ | na | bhīmā || gambhīrayā | r̥ṣvayā | yaḥ | ruroja | adhvanayat | duḥ-itā | dambhayat | ca ||6.18.10||

IAST: gambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayac ca
Griffith: Thou who with high deep-reaching spear hast broken, hast covered over mischief and destroyed it.
Devanāgarī: गम्भीरय ऋष्वया यो रुरोजाध्वानयद्दुरिता दम्भयच्च
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | na | śuṣkam | vanam | indra | hetī | rakṣaḥ | ni | dhakṣi | aśaniḥ | na | bhīmā || gambhīrayā | r̥ṣvayā | yaḥ | ruroja | adhvanayat | duḥ-itā | dambhayat | ca ||6.18.10||

IAST: ā sahasram pathibhir indra rāyā tuvidyumna tuvivājebhir arvāk
Griffith: With wealth, by thousand paths come hither, Agni, paths that bring ample strength, O thou Most Splendid.
Devanāgarī: आ सहस्रं पथिभिरिन्द्र राया तुविद्युम्न तुविवाजेभिरर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ā | sahasram | pathi-bhiḥ | indra | rāyā | tuvi-dyumna | tuvi-vājebhiḥ | arvāk || yāhi | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yasya | nu | cit | adevaḥ | īśe | puru-hūta | yotoḥ ||6.18.11||

IAST: yāhi sūno sahaso yasya nū cid adeva īśe puruhūta yotoḥ
Griffith: Come, Son of Strength, o'er whom, Invoked of many! the godless hath no power to keep thee distant.
Devanāgarī: याहि सूनो सहसो यस्य नू चिददेव ईशे पुरुहूत योतोः
pada pāṭha: ā | sahasram | pathi-bhiḥ | indra | rāyā | tuvi-dyumna | tuvi-vājebhiḥ | arvāk || yāhi | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yasya | nu | cit | adevaḥ | īśe | puru-hūta | yotoḥ ||6.18.11||

IAST: pra tuvidyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣver divo rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ
Griffith: From heaven, from earth is bruited forth the greatness of him the firm, the fiery, the resplendent.
Devanāgarī: प्र तुविद्युम्नस्य स्थविरस्य घृष्वेर्दिवो ररप्शे महिमा पृथिव्याः
pada pāṭha: pra | tuvi-dyumnasya | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ | divaḥ | rarapśe | mahimā | pr̥thivyāḥ || na | asya | śatruḥ | na | prati-mānam | asti | na | prati-sthiḥ | puru-māyasya | sahyoḥ ||6.18.12||

IAST: nāsya śatrur na pratimānam asti na pratiṣṭhiḥ purumāyasya sahyoḥ
Griffith: No foe hath he, no counterpart, no refuge is there from him the Conqueror full of wisdom
Devanāgarī: नास्य शत्रुर्न प्रतिमानमस्ति न प्रतिष्ठिः पुरुमायस्य सह्योः
pada pāṭha: pra | tuvi-dyumnasya | sthavirasya | ghr̥ṣveḥ | divaḥ | rarapśe | mahimā | pr̥thivyāḥ || na | asya | śatruḥ | na | prati-mānam | asti | na | prati-sthiḥ | puru-māyasya | sahyoḥ ||6.18.12||

IAST: pra tat te adyā karaṇaṁ kṛtam bhūt kutsaṁ yad āyum atithigvam asmai
Griffith: This day the deed that thou hast done is famous, when thou, for him, with many thousand others
Devanāgarī: प्र तत्ते अद्या करणं कृतं भूत्कुत्सं यदायुमतिथिग्वमस्मै
pada pāṭha: pra | tat | te | adya | karaṇam | kr̥tam | bhūt | kutsam | yat | āyum | atithi-gvam | asmai || puru | sahasrā | ni | śiśāḥ | abhi | kṣām | ut | tūrvayāṇam | dhr̥ṣatā | ninetha ||6.18.13||

IAST: purū sahasrā ni śiśā abhi kṣām ut tūrvayāṇaṁ dhṛṣatā ninetha
Griffith: Laidest low Kutsa, Ayu, Atithigva, and boldly didst deliver Turvayana.
Devanāgarī: पुरू सहस्रा नि शिशा अभि क्षामुत्तूर्वयाणं धृषता निनेथ
pada pāṭha: pra | tat | te | adya | karaṇam | kr̥tam | bhūt | kutsam | yat | āyum | atithi-gvam | asmai || puru | sahasrā | ni | śiśāḥ | abhi | kṣām | ut | tūrvayāṇam | dhr̥ṣatā | ninetha ||6.18.13||

IAST: anu tvāhighne adha deva devā madan viśve kavitamaṁ kavīnām
Griffith: In thee, O God, the wisest of the Sages, all Gods were joyful when thou slewest Ahi.
Devanāgarī: अनु त्वाहिघ्ने अध देव देवा मदन्विश्वे कवितमं कवीनाम्
pada pāṭha: anu | tvā | ahi-ghne | adha | deva | devāḥ | madan | viśve | kavi-tamam | kavīnām || karaḥ | yatra | varivaḥ | bādhitāya | dive | janāya | tanve | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||6.18.14||

IAST: karo yatra varivo bādhitāya dive janāya tanve gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: When lauded for thyself, thou gavest freedom to sore-afflicted Heaven and to the people.
Devanāgarī: करो यत्र वरिवो बाधिताय दिवे जनाय तन्वे गृणानः
pada pāṭha: anu | tvā | ahi-ghne | adha | deva | devāḥ | madan | viśve | kavi-tamam | kavīnām || karaḥ | yatra | varivaḥ | bādhitāya | dive | janāya | tanve | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||6.18.14||

IAST: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat ta ojo 'martyā jihata indra devāḥ
Griffith: This power of thine both heaven and earth acknowledge, the deathless Gods acknowledge it, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अनु द्यावापृथिवी तत्त ओजोऽमर्त्या जिहत इन्द्र देवाः
pada pāṭha: anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | tat | te | ojaḥ | amartyāḥ | jihate | indra | devāḥ || kr̥ṣva | kr̥tno iti | akr̥tam | yat | te | asti | uktham | navīyaḥ | janayasva | yajñaiḥ ||6.18.15||

IAST: kṛṣvā kṛtno akṛtaṁ yat te asty ukthaṁ navīyo janayasva yajñaiḥ
Griffith: Do what thou ne'er hast done, O Mighty Worker: beget a new hymn at thy sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: कृष्वा कृत्नो अकृतं यत्ते अस्त्युक्थं नवीयो जनयस्व यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: anu | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | tat | te | ojaḥ | amartyāḥ | jihate | indra | devāḥ || kr̥ṣva | kr̥tno iti | akr̥tam | yat | te | asti | uktham | navīyaḥ | janayasva | yajñaiḥ ||6.18.15||

IAST: mahām̐ indro nṛvad ā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ
Griffith: GREAT, hero-like controlling men is Indra, unwasting in his powers, doubled in vastness.
Devanāgarī: महाँ इन्द्रो नृवदा चर्षणिप्रा उत द्विबर्हा अमिनः सहोभिः
pada pāṭha: mahān | indraḥ | nr̥-vat | ā | carṣaṇi-prāḥ | uta | dvi-barhāḥ | aminaḥ | sahaḥ-bhiḥ || asmadryak | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | uruḥ | pr̥thuḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | kartr̥-bhiḥ | bhūt ||6.19.1||

IAST: asmadryag vāvṛdhe vīryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhir bhūt
Griffith: He, turned to us, hath grown to hero vigour: broad, wide, he hath been decked by those who serve him.
Devanāgarī: अस्मद्र्यग्वावृधे वीर्यायोरुः पृथुः सुकृतः कर्तृभिर्भूत्
pada pāṭha: mahān | indraḥ | nr̥-vat | ā | carṣaṇi-prāḥ | uta | dvi-barhāḥ | aminaḥ | sahaḥ-bhiḥ || asmadryak | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | uruḥ | pr̥thuḥ | su-kr̥taḥ | kartr̥-bhiḥ | bhūt ||6.19.1||

IAST: indram eva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhād bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṁ yuvānam
Griffith: The bowl made Indra swift to gather booty, the High, the Lofty, Youthful, Undecaying,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमेव धिषणा सातये धाद्बृहन्तमृष्वमजरं युवानम्
pada pāṭha: indram | eva | dhiṣaṇā | sātaye | dhāt | br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | yuvānam || aṣāḷhena | śavasā | śūśu-vāṁsam | sadyaḥ | cit | yaḥ | vavr̥dhe | asāmi ||6.19.2||

IAST: aṣāḻhena śavasā śūśuvāṁsaṁ sadyaś cid yo vāvṛdhe asāmi
Griffith: Him who hath waxed by strength which none may conquer, and even at once grown to complete perfection.
Devanāgarī: अषाळ्हेन शवसा शूशुवांसं सद्यश्चिद्यो वावृधे असामि
pada pāṭha: indram | eva | dhiṣaṇā | sātaye | dhāt | br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | yuvānam || aṣāḷhena | śavasā | śūśu-vāṁsam | sadyaḥ | cit | yaḥ | vavr̥dhe | asāmi ||6.19.2||

IAST: pṛthū karasnā bahulā gabhastī asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṁsi
Griffith: Stretch out those hands of thine, extend to us-ward thy wide capacious arms, and grant us glory.
Devanāgarī: पृथू करस्ना बहुला गभस्ती अस्मद्र्यक्सं मिमीहि श्रवांसि
pada pāṭha: pr̥thū iti | karasnā | bahulā | gabhastī iti | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi || yūthā-iva | paśvaḥ | paśu-pāḥ | damūnāḥ | asmān | indra | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | ājau ||6.19.3||

IAST: yūtheva paśvaḥ paśupā damūnā asmām̐ indrābhy ā vavṛtsvājau
Griffith: Like as the household herdsman guards the cattle, so move thou round about us in the combat.
Devanāgarī: यूथेव पश्वः पशुपा दमूना अस्माँ इन्द्राभ्या ववृत्स्वाजौ
pada pāṭha: pr̥thū iti | karasnā | bahulā | gabhastī iti | asmadryak | sam | mimīhi | śravāṁsi || yūthā-iva | paśvaḥ | paśu-pāḥ | damūnāḥ | asmān | indra | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | ājau ||6.19.3||

IAST: taṁ va indraṁ catinam asya śākair iha nūnaṁ vājayanto huvema
Griffith: Now, fain for strength, let us invite your Indra hither, who lieth hidden with his Heroes,-
Devanāgarī: तं व इन्द्रं चतिनमस्य शाकैरिह नूनं वाजयन्तो हुवेम
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | indram | catinam | asya | śākaiḥ | iha | nūnam | vāja-yantaḥ | huvema || yathā | cit | pūrve | jaritāraḥ | āsuḥ | anedyāḥ | anavadyāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||6.19.4||

IAST: yathā cit pūrve jaritāra āsur anedyā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ
Griffith: Free from all blame, without reproach, uninjured, e'en as were those who sang, of old, his praises.
Devanāgarī: यथा चित्पूर्वे जरितार आसुरनेद्या अनवद्या अरिष्टाः
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | indram | catinam | asya | śākaiḥ | iha | nūnam | vāja-yantaḥ | huvema || yathā | cit | pūrve | jaritāraḥ | āsuḥ | anedyāḥ | anavadyāḥ | ariṣṭāḥ ||6.19.4||

IAST: dhṛtavrato dhanadāḥ somavṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ
Griffith: With steadfast laws, wealth-giver, strong through Soma, he hath much fair and precious food to feed us.
Devanāgarī: धृतव्रतो धनदाः सोमवृद्धः स हि वामस्य वसुनः पुरुक्षुः
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | dhana-dāḥ | soma-vr̥ddhaḥ | saḥ | hi | vāmasya | vasunaḥ | puru-kṣuḥ || sam | jagmire | pathyāḥ | rāyaḥ | asmin | samudre | na | sindhavaḥ | yādamānāḥ ||6.19.5||

IAST: saṁ jagmire pathyā rāyo asmin samudre na sindhavo yādamānāḥ
Griffith: In him unite all paths that lead to riches, like rivers that commingle with the ocean.
Devanāgarī: सं जग्मिरे पथ्या रायो अस्मिन्समुद्रे न सिन्धवो यादमानाः
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | dhana-dāḥ | soma-vr̥ddhaḥ | saḥ | hi | vāmasya | vasunaḥ | puru-kṣuḥ || sam | jagmire | pathyāḥ | rāyaḥ | asmin | samudre | na | sindhavaḥ | yādamānāḥ ||6.19.5||

IAST: śaviṣṭhaṁ na ā bhara śūra śava ojiṣṭham ojo abhibhūta ugram
Griffith: Bring unto us the mightiest might, O Hero, strong and most potent force, thou great Subduer!
Devanāgarī: शविष्ठं न आ भर शूर शव ओजिष्ठमोजो अभिभूत उग्रम्
pada pāṭha: śaviṣṭham | naḥ | ā | bhara | śūra | śavaḥ | ojiṣṭham | ojaḥ | abhi-bhūte | ugram || viśvā | dyumnā | vr̥ṣṇyā | mānuṣāṇām | asmabhyam | dāḥ | hari-vaḥ | mādayadhyai ||6.19.6||

IAST: viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇām asmabhyaṁ dā harivo mādayadhyai
Griffith: All splendid vigorous powers of men vouchsafe us, Lord of Bay Steeds, that they may make us joyful.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा द्युम्ना वृष्ण्या मानुषाणामस्मभ्यं दा हरिवो मादयध्यै
pada pāṭha: śaviṣṭham | naḥ | ā | bhara | śūra | śavaḥ | ojiṣṭham | ojaḥ | abhi-bhūte | ugram || viśvā | dyumnā | vr̥ṣṇyā | mānuṣāṇām | asmabhyam | dāḥ | hari-vaḥ | mādayadhyai ||6.19.6||

IAST: yas te madaḥ pṛtanāṣāḻ amṛdhra indra taṁ na ā bhara śūśuvāṁsam
Griffith: Bring us, grown mighty in its strength, O Indra, thy friendly rapturous joy that wins the battle,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते मदः पृतनाषाळमृध्र इन्द्र तं न आ भर शूशुवांसम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | amr̥dhraḥ | indra | tam | naḥ | ā | bhara | śūśu-vāṁsam || yena | tokasya | tanayasya | sātau | maṁsīmahi | jigīvāṁsaḥ | tvā-ūtāḥ ||6.19.7||

IAST: yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṁsīmahi jigīvāṁsas tvotāḥ
Griffith: Wherewith by thee assisted and triumphant, we may laud thee in gaining seed and offspring.
Devanāgarī: येन तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ मंसीमहि जिगीवांसस्त्वोताः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | madaḥ | pr̥tanāṣāṭ | amr̥dhraḥ | indra | tam | naḥ | ā | bhara | śūśu-vāṁsam || yena | tokasya | tanayasya | sātau | maṁsīmahi | jigīvāṁsaḥ | tvā-ūtāḥ ||6.19.7||

IAST: ā no bhara vṛṣaṇaṁ śuṣmam indra dhanaspṛtaṁ śūśuvāṁsaṁ sudakṣam
Griffith: Indra, bestow on us the power heroic skilled and exceeding strong, that wins the booty,
Devanāgarī: आ नो भर वृषणं शुष्ममिन्द्र धनस्पृतं शूशुवांसं सुदक्षम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | bhara | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indra | dhana-spr̥tam | śūśu-vāṁsam | su-dakṣam || yena | vaṁsāma | pr̥tanāsu | śatrūn | tava | ūti-bhiḥ | uta | jāmīn | ajāmīn ||6.19.8||

IAST: yena vaṁsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tavotibhir uta jāmīm̐r ajāmīn
Griffith: Wherewith, by thine assistance, we may conquer our foes in battle, be they kin or stranger.
Devanāgarī: येन वंसाम पृतनासु शत्रून्तवोतिभिरुत जामीँरजामीन्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | bhara | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indra | dhana-spr̥tam | śūśu-vāṁsam | su-dakṣam || yena | vaṁsāma | pr̥tanāsu | śatrūn | tava | ūti-bhiḥ | uta | jāmīn | ajāmīn ||6.19.8||

IAST: ā te śuṣmo vṛṣabha etu paścād ottarād adharād ā purastāt
Griffith: Let thine heroic strength come from behind us, before us, from above us or below us.
Devanāgarī: आ ते शुष्मो वृषभ एतु पश्चादोत्तरादधरादा पुरस्तात्
