pada pāṭha: ā | te | śuṣmaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | etu | paścāt | ā | uttarāt | adharāt | ā | purastāt || ā | viśvataḥ | abhi | sam | etu | arvāṅ | indra | dyumnam | svaḥ-vat | dhehi | asme iti ||6.19.9||

IAST: ā viśvato abhi sam etv arvāṅ indra dyumnaṁ svarvad dhehy asme
Griffith: From every side may it approach us, Indra. Give us the glory of the realm of splendour.
Devanāgarī: आ विश्वतो अभि समेत्वर्वाङिन्द्र द्युम्नं स्वर्वद्धेह्यस्मे
pada pāṭha: ā | te | śuṣmaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | etu | paścāt | ā | uttarāt | adharāt | ā | purastāt || ā | viśvataḥ | abhi | sam | etu | arvāṅ | indra | dyumnam | svaḥ-vat | dhehi | asme iti ||6.19.9||

IAST: nṛvat ta indra nṛtamābhir ūtī vaṁsīmahi vāmaṁ śromatebhiḥ
Griffith: With most heroic aid from thee, like heroes Indra, may we win wealth by deeds glory.
Devanāgarī: नृवत्त इन्द्र नृतमाभिरूती वंसीमहि वामं श्रोमतेभिः
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | te | indra | nr̥-tamābhiḥ | ūtī | vaṁsīmahi | vāmam | śromatebhiḥ || īkṣe | hi | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | rājan | dhāḥ | ratnam | mahi | sthūram | br̥hantam ||6.19.10||

IAST: īkṣe hi vasva ubhayasya rājan dhā ratnam mahi sthūram bṛhantam
Griffith: Thou, King, art Lord of earthly, heavenly treasure: vouchsafe us riches vast, sublime, and lasting.
Devanāgarī: ईक्षे हि वस्व उभयस्य राजन्धा रत्नं महि स्थूरं बृहन्तम्
pada pāṭha: nr̥-vat | te | indra | nr̥-tamābhiḥ | ūtī | vaṁsīmahi | vāmam | śromatebhiḥ || īkṣe | hi | vasvaḥ | ubhayasya | rājan | dhāḥ | ratnam | mahi | sthūram | br̥hantam ||6.19.10||

IAST: marutvantaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ vāvṛdhānam akavāriṁ divyaṁ śāsam indram
Griffith: The Bull, whose strength hath waxed, whom Maruts follow, free-giving Indra, the Celestial Ruler,
Devanāgarī: मरुत्वन्तं वृषभं वावृधानमकवारिं दिव्यं शासमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: marutvantam | vr̥ṣabham | vavr̥dhānam | akava-arim | divyam | śāsam | indram || viśva-saham | avase | nūtanāya | ugram | sahaḥ-dām | iha | tam | huvema ||6.19.11||

IAST: viśvāsāham avase nūtanāyograṁ sahodām iha taṁ huvema
Griffith: Mighty, all-conquering, the victory-giver, him let us call to grant us new protection.
Devanāgarī: विश्वासाहमवसे नूतनायोग्रं सहोदामिह तं हुवेम
pada pāṭha: marutvantam | vr̥ṣabham | vavr̥dhānam | akava-arim | divyam | śāsam | indram || viśva-saham | avase | nūtanāya | ugram | sahaḥ-dām | iha | tam | huvema ||6.19.11||

IAST: janaṁ vajrin mahi cin manyamānam ebhyo nṛbhyo randhayā yeṣv asmi
Griffith: Give up the people who are high and haughty to these men and to me, O Thunder-wielder!
Devanāgarī: जनं वज्रिन्महि चिन्मन्यमानमेभ्यो नृभ्यो रन्धया येष्वस्मि
pada pāṭha: janam | vajrin | mahi | cit | manyamānam | ebhyaḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | randhaya | yeṣu | asmi || adha | hi | tvā | pr̥thivyām | śūra-sātau | havāmahe | tanaye | goṣu | ap-su ||6.19.12||

IAST: adhā hi tvā pṛthivyāṁ śūrasātau havāmahe tanaye goṣv apsu
Griffith: Therefore upon the earth do we invoke thee, where heroes win, for sons and kine and waters.
Devanāgarī: अधा हि त्वा पृथिव्यां शूरसातौ हवामहे तनये गोष्वप्सु
pada pāṭha: janam | vajrin | mahi | cit | manyamānam | ebhyaḥ | nr̥-bhyaḥ | randhaya | yeṣu | asmi || adha | hi | tvā | pr̥thivyām | śūra-sātau | havāmahe | tanaye | goṣu | ap-su ||6.19.12||

IAST: vayaṁ ta ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥ-śatror uttara it syāma
Griffith: Through these thy friendships, God invoked of many! may we be victors over every foeman.
Devanāgarī: वयं त एभिः पुरुहूत सख्यैः शत्रोःशत्रोरुत्तर इत्स्याम
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | ebhiḥ | puru-hūta | sakhyaiḥ | śatroḥ-śatroḥ | ut-tare | it | syāma || ghnantaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | ubhayāni | śūra | rāyā | madema | br̥hatā | tvā-ūtāḥ ||6.19.13||

IAST: ghnanto vṛtrāṇy ubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatā tvotāḥ
Griffith: Slaying both kinds of foe, may we, O Hero, be happy, helped by thee, with ample riches.
Devanāgarī: घ्नन्तो वृत्राण्युभयानि शूर राया मदेम बृहता त्वोताः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | ebhiḥ | puru-hūta | sakhyaiḥ | śatroḥ-śatroḥ | ut-tare | it | syāma || ghnantaḥ | vr̥trāṇi | ubhayāni | śūra | rāyā | madema | br̥hatā | tvā-ūtāḥ ||6.19.13||

IAST: dyaur na ya indrābhi bhūmāryas tasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān
Griffith: GIVE us wealth, Indra, that with might, as heaven o'ertops the earth, o'ercomes our foes in battle
Devanāgarī: द्यौर्न य इन्द्राभि भूमार्यस्तस्थौ रयिः शवसा पृत्सु जनान्
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | na | yaḥ | indra | abhi | bhūma | aryaḥ | tasthau | rayiḥ | śavasā | pr̥t-su | janān || tam | naḥ | sahasra-bharam | urvarā-sām | daddhi | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vr̥tra-turam ||6.20.1||

IAST: taṁ naḥ sahasrabharam urvarāsāṁ daddhi sūno sahaso vṛtraturam
Griffith: Wealth that brings thousands and that wins the corn-lands, wealth, Son of Strength! that vanquishes the
Devanāgarī: तं नः सहस्रभरमुर्वरासां दद्धि सूनो सहसो वृत्रतुरम्
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | na | yaḥ | indra | abhi | bhūma | aryaḥ | tasthau | rayiḥ | śavasā | pr̥t-su | janān || tam | naḥ | sahasra-bharam | urvarā-sām | daddhi | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | vr̥tra-turam ||6.20.1||

IAST: divo na tubhyam anv indra satrāsuryaṁ devebhir dhāyi viśvam
Griffith: Even as the power of Dyaus, to thee, O Indra, all Asura sway was by the Gods entrusted,
Devanāgarī: दिवो न तुभ्यमन्विन्द्र सत्रासुर्यं देवेभिर्धायि विश्वम्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | tubhyam | anu | indra | satrā | asuryam | devebhiḥ | dhāyi | viśvam || ahim | yat | vr̥tram | apaḥ | vavri-vāṁsam | han | r̥jīṣin | viṣṇunā | sacānaḥ ||6.20.2||

IAST: ahiṁ yad vṛtram apo vavrivāṁsaṁ hann ṛjīṣin viṣṇunā sacānaḥ
Griffith: When thou, Impetuous! leagued with Visnu, slewest Vrtra the Dragon who enclosed the waters.
Devanāgarī: अहिं यद्वृत्रमपो वव्रिवांसं हन्नृजीषिन्विष्णुना सचानः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | na | tubhyam | anu | indra | satrā | asuryam | devebhiḥ | dhāyi | viśvam || ahim | yat | vr̥tram | apaḥ | vavri-vāṁsam | han | r̥jīṣin | viṣṇunā | sacānaḥ ||6.20.2||

IAST: tūrvann ojīyān tavasas tavīyān kṛtabrahmendro vṛddhamahāḥ
Griffith: Indra, Strong, Victor, Mightier than the mighty, addressed with prayer and perfect in his splendour,
Devanāgarī: तूर्वन्नोजीयान्तवसस्तवीयान्कृतब्रह्मेन्द्रो वृद्धमहाः
pada pāṭha: tūrvan | ojīyān | tavasaḥ | tavīyān | kr̥ta-brahmā | indraḥ | vr̥ddha-mahāḥ || rājā | abhavat | madhunaḥ | somyasya | viśvāsām | yat | purām | dartnum | āvat ||6.20.3||

IAST: rājābhavan madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsāṁ yat purāṁ dartnum āvat
Griffith: Lord of the bolt that breaketh forts in pieces, became the King of the sweet juice of Soma..
Devanāgarī: राजाभवन्मधुनः सोम्यस्य विश्वासां यत्पुरां दर्त्नुमावत्
pada pāṭha: tūrvan | ojīyān | tavasaḥ | tavīyān | kr̥ta-brahmā | indraḥ | vr̥ddha-mahāḥ || rājā | abhavat | madhunaḥ | somyasya | viśvāsām | yat | purām | dartnum | āvat ||6.20.3||

IAST: śatair apadran paṇaya indrātra daśoṇaye kavaye 'rkasātau
Griffith: There, Indra, while the light was won, the Panis fed, 'neath a hundred blows, for wise Dasoni,
Devanāgarī: शतैरपद्रन्पणय इन्द्रात्र दशोणये कवयेऽर्कसातौ
pada pāṭha: śataiḥ | apadran | paṇayaḥ | indra | atra | daśa-oṇaye | kavaye | arka-sātau || vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇasya | aśuṣasya | māyāḥ | pitvaḥ | na | arirecīt | kim | cana | pra ||6.20.4||

IAST: vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasyāśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvo nārirecīt kiṁ cana pra
Griffith: And greedy Susna's magical devices nor left he any of their food remaining.
Devanāgarī: वधैः शुष्णस्याशुषस्य मायाः पित्वो नारिरेचीत्किं चन प्र
pada pāṭha: śataiḥ | apadran | paṇayaḥ | indra | atra | daśa-oṇaye | kavaye | arka-sātau || vadhaiḥ | śuṣṇasya | aśuṣasya | māyāḥ | pitvaḥ | na | arirecīt | kim | cana | pra ||6.20.4||

IAST: maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ
Griffith: What time the thunder fell and Susna perished, all life's support from the great Druh was taken.
Devanāgarī: महो द्रुहो अप विश्वायु धायि वज्रस्य यत्पतने पादि शुष्णः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | druhaḥ | apa | viśva-āyu | dhāyi | vajrasya | yat | patane | pādi | śuṣṇaḥ || uru | saḥ | sa-ratham | sārathaye | kaḥ | indraḥ | kutsāya | sūryasya | sātau ||6.20.5||

IAST: uru ṣa sarathaṁ sārathaye kar indraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau
Griffith: Indra made room for his car-drivcr Kutsa who sate beside him, when he gained the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: उरु ष सरथं सारथये करिन्द्रः कुत्साय सूर्यस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | druhaḥ | apa | viśva-āyu | dhāyi | vajrasya | yat | patane | pādi | śuṣṇaḥ || uru | saḥ | sa-ratham | sārathaye | kaḥ | indraḥ | kutsāya | sūryasya | sātau ||6.20.5||

IAST: pra śyeno na madiram aṁśum asmai śiro dāsasya namucer mathāyan
Griffith: As the Hawk rent for him the stalk that gladdens, he wrenched the head from Namuci the Dasa.
Devanāgarī: प्र श्येनो न मदिरमंशुमस्मै शिरो दासस्य नमुचेर्मथायन्
pada pāṭha: pra | śyenaḥ | na | madiram | aṁśum | asmai | śiraḥ | dāsasya | namuceḥ | mathāyan || pra | āvat | namīm | sāpyam | sasantam | pr̥ṇak | rāyā | sam | iṣā | sam | svasti ||6.20.6||

IAST: prāvan namīṁ sāpyaṁ sasantam pṛṇag rāyā sam iṣā saṁ svasti
Griffith: He guarded Nam, Sayya's son, in slumber, and sated him with food, success, and riches.
Devanāgarī: प्रावन्नमीं साप्यं ससन्तं पृणग्राया समिषा सं स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | śyenaḥ | na | madiram | aṁśum | asmai | śiraḥ | dāsasya | namuceḥ | mathāyan || pra | āvat | namīm | sāpyam | sasantam | pr̥ṇak | rāyā | sam | iṣā | sam | svasti ||6.20.6||

IAST: vi pipror ahimāyasya dṛḻhāḥ puro vajriñ chavasā na dardaḥ
Griffith: Thou, thunder-armed, with thy great might hast shattered Pipru's strong forts who knew the wiles of serpe
Devanāgarī: वि पिप्रोरहिमायस्य दृळ्हाः पुरो वज्रिञ्छवसा न दर्दः
pada pāṭha: vi | piproḥ | ahi-māyasya | dr̥ḷhāḥ | puraḥ | vajrin | śavasā | na | dardariti dardaḥ || su-dāman | tat | rekṇaḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam | r̥jiśvane | dātram | dāśuṣe | dāḥ ||6.20.7||

IAST: sudāman tad rekṇo apramṛṣyam ṛjiśvane dātraṁ dāśuṣe dāḥ
Griffith: Thou gavest to thy worshipper Rjisvan imperishable Wealth, O Bounteous Giver.
Devanāgarī: सुदामन्तद्रेक्णो अप्रमृष्यमृजिश्वने दात्रं दाशुषे दाः
pada pāṭha: vi | piproḥ | ahi-māyasya | dr̥ḷhāḥ | puraḥ | vajrin | śavasā | na | dardariti dardaḥ || su-dāman | tat | rekṇaḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam | r̥jiśvane | dātram | dāśuṣe | dāḥ ||6.20.7||

IAST: sa vetasuṁ daśamāyaṁ daśoṇiṁ tūtujim indraḥ svabhiṣṭisumnaḥ
Griffith: The crafty Vetasu, the swift Dasni, and Tugra speedily with all his servants,
Devanāgarī: स वेतसुं दशमायं दशोणिं तूतुजिमिन्द्रः स्वभिष्टिसुम्नः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vetasum | daśa-māyam | daśa-oṇim | tūtujim | indraḥ | svabhiṣṭi-sumnaḥ || ā | tugram | śaśvat | ibham | dyotanāya | mātuḥ | na | sīm | upa | sr̥ja | iyadhyai ||6.20.8||

IAST: ā tugraṁ śaśvad ibhaṁ dyotanāya mātur na sīm upa sṛjā iyadhyai
Griffith: Hath Indra, gladdening with strong assistance, forced near as 'twere to glorify the Mother.
Devanāgarī: आ तुग्रं शश्वदिभं द्योतनाय मातुर्न सीमुप सृजा इयध्यै
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vetasum | daśa-māyam | daśa-oṇim | tūtujim | indraḥ | svabhiṣṭi-sumnaḥ || ā | tugram | śaśvat | ibham | dyotanāya | mātuḥ | na | sīm | upa | sr̥ja | iyadhyai ||6.20.8||

IAST: sa īṁ spṛdho vanate apratīto bibhrad vajraṁ vṛtrahaṇaṁ gabhastau
Griffith: Resistless, with the hosts he battles, bearing in both his arms the Vrtra-slaying thunder.
Devanāgarī: स ईं स्पृधो वनते अप्रतीतो बिभ्रद्वज्रं वृत्रहणं गभस्तौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | spr̥dhaḥ | vanate | aprati-itaḥ | bibhrat | vajram | vr̥tra-hanam | gabhastau || tiṣṭhat | harī iti | adhi | astā-iva | garte | vacaḥ-yujā | vahataḥ | indram | r̥ṣvam ||6.20.9||

IAST: tiṣṭhad dharī adhy asteva garte vacoyujā vahata indram ṛṣvam
Griffith: He mounts his Bays, as the car-seat an archer: yoked at a word they bear the lofty Indra.
Devanāgarī: तिष्ठद्धरी अध्यस्तेव गर्ते वचोयुजा वहत इन्द्रमृष्वम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | īm | spr̥dhaḥ | vanate | aprati-itaḥ | bibhrat | vajram | vr̥tra-hanam | gabhastau || tiṣṭhat | harī iti | adhi | astā-iva | garte | vacaḥ-yujā | vahataḥ | indram | r̥ṣvam ||6.20.9||

IAST: sanema te 'vasā navya indra pra pūravaḥ stavanta enā yajñaiḥ
Griffith: May we, O Indra, gain by thy new favour: so Parus laud thee, with their sacrifices,
Devanāgarī: सनेम तेऽवसा नव्य इन्द्र प्र पूरवः स्तवन्त एना यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: sanema | te | avasā | navyaḥ | indra | pra | pūravaḥ | stavante | enā | yajñaiḥ || sapta | yat | puraḥ | śarma | śāradīḥ | dart | han | dāsīḥ | puru-kutsāya | śikṣan ||6.20.10||

IAST: sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīr dard dhan dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan
Griffith: That thou hast wrecked seven autumn forts, their shelter, slain Dasa tribes and aided Purukutsa.
Devanāgarī: सप्त यत्पुरः शर्म शारदीर्दर्द्धन्दासीः पुरुकुत्साय शिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: sanema | te | avasā | navyaḥ | indra | pra | pūravaḥ | stavante | enā | yajñaiḥ || sapta | yat | puraḥ | śarma | śāradīḥ | dart | han | dāsīḥ | puru-kutsāya | śikṣan ||6.20.10||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛdha indra pūrvyo bhūr varivasyann uśane kāvyāya
Griffith: Favouring Usana the son of Kavi, thou wast his ancient strengthener, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वृध इन्द्र पूर्व्यो भूर्वरिवस्यन्नुशने काव्याय
pada pāṭha: tvam | vr̥dhaḥ | indra | pūrvyaḥ | bhūḥ | varivasyan | uśane | kāvyāya || parā | nava-vāstvam | anu-deyam | mahe | pitre | dadātha | svam | napātam ||6.20.11||

IAST: parā navavāstvam anudeyam mahe pitre dadātha svaṁ napātam
Griffith: Thou gavest Navavastva. as a present, to the great father gavest back his grandson.
Devanāgarī: परा नववास्त्वमनुदेयं महे पित्रे ददाथ स्वं नपातम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | vr̥dhaḥ | indra | pūrvyaḥ | bhūḥ | varivasyan | uśane | kāvyāya || parā | nava-vāstvam | anu-deyam | mahe | pitre | dadātha | svam | napātam ||6.20.11||

IAST: tvaṁ dhunir indra dhunimatīr ṛṇor apaḥ sīrā na sravantīḥ
Griffith: Thou, roaring Indra, drovest on the waters that made a roaring sound like rushing rivers,
Devanāgarī: त्वं धुनिरिन्द्र धुनिमतीरृणोरपः सीरा न स्रवन्तीः
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhuniḥ | indra | dhuni-matīḥ | r̥ṇoḥ | apaḥ | sīrāḥ | na | sravantīḥ || pra | yat | samudram | ati | śūra | parṣi | pāraya | turvaśam | yadum | svasti ||6.20.12||

IAST: pra yat samudram ati śūra parṣi pārayā turvaśaṁ yaduṁ svasti
Griffith: What time, O Hero, o'er the sea thou broughtest, in safety broughtest Turvasa and Yadu.
Devanāgarī: प्र यत्समुद्रमति शूर पर्षि पारया तुर्वशं यदुं स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: tvam | dhuniḥ | indra | dhuni-matīḥ | r̥ṇoḥ | apaḥ | sīrāḥ | na | sravantīḥ || pra | yat | samudram | ati | śūra | parṣi | pāraya | turvaśam | yadum | svasti ||6.20.12||

IAST: tava ha tyad indra viśvam ājau sasto dhunīcumurī yā ha siṣvap
Griffith: This Indra, was thy work in war: thou sentest Dhuni and Cumuri to sleep and slumber.
Devanāgarī: तव ह त्यदिन्द्र विश्वमाजौ सस्तो धुनीचुमुरी या ह सिष्वप्
pada pāṭha: tava | ha | tyat | indra | viśvam | ājau | sastaḥ | dhunīcumurī iti | yā | ha | sisvap || dīdayat | it | tubhyam | somebhiḥ | sunvan | dabhītiḥ | idhma-bhr̥tiḥ | pakthī | arkaiḥ ||6.20.13||

IAST: dīdayad it tubhyaṁ somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītir idhmabhṛtiḥ pakthy arkaiḥ
Griffith: Dabhiti lit the flame for thee, and worshipped with fuel, hymns, poured Soma, dressed oblations.
Devanāgarī: दीदयदित्तुभ्यं सोमेभिः सुन्वन्दभीतिरिध्मभृतिः पक्थ्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: tava | ha | tyat | indra | viśvam | ājau | sastaḥ | dhunīcumurī iti | yā | ha | sisvap || dīdayat | it | tubhyam | somebhiḥ | sunvan | dabhītiḥ | idhma-bhr̥tiḥ | pakthī | arkaiḥ ||6.20.13||

IAST: imā u tvā purutamasya kāror havyaṁ vīra havyā havante
Griffith: THESE the most constant singer's invocations call thee who art to be invoked, O Hero;
Devanāgarī: इमा उ त्वा पुरुतमस्य कारोर्हव्यं वीर हव्या हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puru-tamasya | kāroḥ | havyam | vīra | havyāḥ | havante || dhiyaḥ | rathe-sthām | ajaram | navīyaḥ | rayiḥ | vi-bhūtiḥ | īyate | vacasyā ||6.21.1||

IAST: dhiyo ratheṣṭhām ajaraṁ navīyo rayir vibhūtir īyate vacasyā
Griffith: Hymns call anew the chariot-borne, Eternal: by eloquence men gain abundant riches.
Devanāgarī: धियो रथेष्ठामजरं नवीयो रयिर्विभूतिरीयते वचस्या
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puru-tamasya | kāroḥ | havyam | vīra | havyāḥ | havante || dhiyaḥ | rathe-sthām | ajaram | navīyaḥ | rayiḥ | vi-bhūtiḥ | īyate | vacasyā ||6.21.1||

IAST: tam u stuṣa indraṁ yo vidāno girvāhasaṁ gīrbhir yajñavṛddham
Griffith: I praise that Indra, known to all men, honoured with songs, extolled with hymns at sacrifices,
Devanāgarī: तमु स्तुष इन्द्रं यो विदानो गिर्वाहसं गीर्भिर्यज्ञवृद्धम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuṣe | indram | yaḥ | vidānaḥ | girvāhasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yajña-vr̥ddham || yasya | divam | ati | mahnā | pr̥thivyāḥ | puru-māyasya | ririce | mahi-tvam ||6.21.2||

IAST: yasya divam ati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya ririce mahitvam
Griffith: Whose majesty, rich in wondrous arts, surpasseth the magnitude of earth, and heaven in greatness.
Devanāgarī: यस्य दिवमति मह्ना पृथिव्याः पुरुमायस्य रिरिचे महित्वम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | stuṣe | indram | yaḥ | vidānaḥ | girvāhasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | yajña-vr̥ddham || yasya | divam | ati | mahnā | pr̥thivyāḥ | puru-māyasya | ririce | mahi-tvam ||6.21.2||

IAST: sa it tamo 'vayunaṁ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavac cakāra
Griffith: He hath made pathways, with the Sun to aid him, throughout the darkness that extended pathless.
Devanāgarī: स इत्तमोऽवयुनं ततन्वत्सूर्येण वयुनवच्चकार
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | tamaḥ | avayunam | tatanvat | sūryeṇa | vayuna-vat | cakāra || kadā | te | martāḥ | amr̥tasya | dhāma | iyakṣantaḥ | na | minanti | svadhā-vaḥ ||6.21.3||

IAST: kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ
Griffith: Mortals who yearn to worship ne'er dishonour, O Mighty God, thy Law who art Immortal.
Devanāgarī: कदा ते मर्ता अमृतस्य धामेयक्षन्तो न मिनन्ति स्वधावः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | tamaḥ | avayunam | tatanvat | sūryeṇa | vayuna-vat | cakāra || kadā | te | martāḥ | amr̥tasya | dhāma | iyakṣantaḥ | na | minanti | svadhā-vaḥ ||6.21.3||

IAST: yas tā cakāra sa kuha svid indraḥ kam ā janaṁ carati kāsu vikṣu
Griffith: And he who did these things, where is that Indra? among what tribes? what people doth he visit?
Devanāgarī: यस्ता चकार स कुह स्विदिन्द्रः कमा जनं चरति कासु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tā | cakāra | saḥ | kuha | svit | indraḥ | kam | ā | janam | carati | kāsu | vikṣu || kaḥ | te | yajñaḥ | manase | śam | varāya | kaḥ | arkaḥ | indra | katamaḥ | saḥ | hotā ||6.21.4||

IAST: kas te yajño manase śaṁ varāya ko arka indra katamaḥ sa hotā
Griffith: What sacrifice contents thy mind , and wishes? What priest among them all? what hymn, O Indra?
Devanāgarī: कस्ते यज्ञो मनसे शं वराय को अर्क इन्द्र कतमः स होता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tā | cakāra | saḥ | kuha | svit | indraḥ | kam | ā | janam | carati | kāsu | vikṣu || kaḥ | te | yajñaḥ | manase | śam | varāya | kaḥ | arkaḥ | indra | katamaḥ | saḥ | hotā ||6.21.4||

IAST: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ
Griffith: Yea, here were they who, born of old, have served thee, thy friends of ancient time, thou active Worker.
Devanāgarī: इदा हि ते वेविषतः पुराजाः प्रत्नास आसुः पुरुकृत्सखायः
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | te | veviṣataḥ | purā-jāḥ | pratnāsaḥ | āsuḥ | puru-kr̥t | sakhāyaḥ || ye | madyamāsaḥ | uta | nūtanāsaḥ | uta | avamasya | puru-hūta | bodhi ||6.21.5||

IAST: ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi
Griffith: Bethink thee now of these, Invoked of many! the midmost and the recent, and the youngest.
Devanāgarī: ये मध्यमास उत नूतनास उतावमस्य पुरुहूत बोधि
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | te | veviṣataḥ | purā-jāḥ | pratnāsaḥ | āsuḥ | puru-kr̥t | sakhāyaḥ || ye | madyamāsaḥ | uta | nūtanāsaḥ | uta | avamasya | puru-hūta | bodhi ||6.21.5||

IAST: tam pṛcchanto 'varāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ
Griffith: Inquiring after him, thy later servants, Indra, have gained thy former old traditions.
Devanāgarī: तं पृच्छन्तोऽवरासः पराणि प्रत्ना त इन्द्र श्रुत्यानु येमुः
pada pāṭha: tam | pr̥cchantaḥ | avarāsaḥ | parāṇi | pratnā | te | indra | śrutyā | anu | yemuḥ || arcāmasi | vīra | brahma-vāhaḥ | yāt | eva | vidma | tāt | tvā | mahāntam ||6.21.6||

IAST: arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yād eva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam
Griffith: Hero, to whom the prayer is brought, we praise thee as great for that wherein we know thee mighty.
Devanāgarī: अर्चामसि वीर ब्रह्मवाहो यादेव विद्म तात्त्वा महान्तम्
pada pāṭha: tam | pr̥cchantaḥ | avarāsaḥ | parāṇi | pratnā | te | indra | śrutyā | anu | yemuḥ || arcāmasi | vīra | brahma-vāhaḥ | yāt | eva | vidma | tāt | tvā | mahāntam ||6.21.6||

IAST: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānam abhi tat su tiṣṭha
Griffith: The demon's strength is gathered fast against thee: great as that strength hath grown, go forth to meet i
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा पाजो रक्षसो वि तस्थे महि जज्ञानमभि तत्सु तिष्ठ
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | pājaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | vi | tasthe | mahi | jajñānam | abhi | tat | su | tiṣṭha || tava | pratnena | yujyena | sakhyā | vajreṇa | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | apa | tā | nudasva ||6.21.7||

IAST: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apa tā nudasva
Griffith: With thine own ancient friend and companion, the thunderbolt, brave Champion! drive it backward.
Devanāgarī: तव प्रत्नेन युज्येन सख्या वज्रेण धृष्णो अप ता नुदस्व
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | pājaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | vi | tasthe | mahi | jajñānam | abhi | tat | su | tiṣṭha || tava | pratnena | yujyena | sakhyā | vajreṇa | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | apa | tā | nudasva ||6.21.7||

IAST: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ
Griffith: Hear, too, the prayer of this thy present beadsman, O Indra, Hero, cherishing the singer.
Devanāgarī: स तु श्रुधीन्द्र नूतनस्य ब्रह्मण्यतो वीर कारुधायः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | śrudhi | indra | nūtanasya | brahmaṇyataḥ | vīra | kāru-dhāyaḥ || tvam | hi | āpiḥ | pra-divi | pitr̥̄ṇām | śaśvat | babhūtha | su-havaḥ | ā-iṣṭau ||6.21.8||

IAST: tvaṁ hy āpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṁ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau
Griffith: For thou wast aye our fathers' Friend aforetime, still swift to listen to their supplication.
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्यापिः प्रदिवि पितॄणां शश्वद्बभूथ सुहव एष्टौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | śrudhi | indra | nūtanasya | brahmaṇyataḥ | vīra | kāru-dhāyaḥ || tvam | hi | āpiḥ | pra-divi | pitr̥̄ṇām | śaśvat | babhūtha | su-havaḥ | ā-iṣṭau ||6.21.8||

IAST: protaye varuṇam mitram indram marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya
Griffith: Bring to our help this day, for our protection, Varuna, Mitra , Indra, and the Maruts,
Devanāgarī: प्रोतये वरुणं मित्रमिन्द्रं मरुतः कृष्वावसे नो अद्य
pada pāṭha: pra | ūtaye | varuṇam | mitram | indram | marutaḥ | kr̥ṣva | avase | naḥ | adya || pra | pūṣaṇam | viṣṇum | agnim | puram-dhim | savitāram | oṣadhīḥ | parvatān | ca ||6.21.9||

IAST: pra pūṣaṇaṁ viṣṇum agnim puraṁdhiṁ savitāram oṣadhīḥ parvatām̐ś ca
Griffith: Pusan and Visnu, Agni and Purandhi, Savitar also, and the Plants and Mountains.
Devanāgarī: प्र पूषणं विष्णुमग्निं पुरंधिं सवितारमोषधीः पर्वताँश्च
pada pāṭha: pra | ūtaye | varuṇam | mitram | indram | marutaḥ | kr̥ṣva | avase | naḥ | adya || pra | pūṣaṇam | viṣṇum | agnim | puram-dhim | savitāram | oṣadhīḥ | parvatān | ca ||6.21.9||

IAST: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhy arcanty arkaiḥ
Griffith: The singers here exalt with hymns and praises thee who art very Mighty and Most Holy.
Devanāgarī: इम उ त्वा पुरुशाक प्रयज्यो जरितारो अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: ime | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puru-śāka | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo | jaritāraḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || śrudhi | havam | ā | huvataḥ | huvānaḥ | na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | amr̥ta | tvat | asti ||6.21.10||

IAST: śrudhī havam ā huvato huvāno na tvāvām̐ anyo amṛta tvad asti
Griffith: Hear, when invoked, the invoker's invocation. Beside thee there is nonelike thee, Immortal!
Devanāgarī: श्रुधी हवमा हुवतो हुवानो न त्वावाँ अन्यो अमृत त्वदस्ति
pada pāṭha: ime | ūm̐ iti | tvā | puru-śāka | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo | jaritāraḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || śrudhi | havam | ā | huvataḥ | huvānaḥ | na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | amr̥ta | tvat | asti ||6.21.10||

IAST: nū ma ā vācam upa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajatraiḥ
Griffith: Now to my words come quickly thou who knowest, O Son of Strength, with all who claim our worship,
Devanāgarī: नू म आ वाचमुप याहि विद्वान्विश्वेभिः सूनो सहसो यजत्रैः
pada pāṭha: nu | me | ā | vācam | upa | yāhi | vidvān | viśvebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yajatraiḥ || ye | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | āsuḥ | ye | manum | cakruḥ | uparam | dasāya ||6.21.11||

IAST: ye agnijihvā ṛtasāpa āsur ye manuṁ cakrur uparaṁ dasāya
Griffith: Who visit sacred rites, whose tongue is Agni, Gods who made Manu stronger than the Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: ये अग्निजिह्वा ऋतसाप आसुर्ये मनुं चक्रुरुपरं दसाय
pada pāṭha: nu | me | ā | vācam | upa | yāhi | vidvān | viśvebhiḥ | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | yajatraiḥ || ye | agni-jihvāḥ | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | āsuḥ | ye | manum | cakruḥ | uparam | dasāya ||6.21.11||

IAST: sa no bodhi puraetā sugeṣūta durgeṣu pathikṛd vidānaḥ
Griffith: On good and evil ways be thou our Leader, thou who art known to all as Path-preparer.
Devanāgarī: स नो बोधि पुरएता सुगेषूत दुर्गेषु पथिकृद्विदानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | puraḥ-etā | su-geṣu | uta | duḥ-geṣu | pathi-kr̥t | vidānaḥ || ye | aśramāsaḥ | uravaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ | tebhiḥ | naḥ | indra | abhi | vakṣi | vājam ||6.21.12||

IAST: ye aśramāsa uravo vahiṣṭhās tebhir na indrābhi vakṣi vājam
Griffith: Bring power to us, O Indra, with thy Horses, Steeds that are best to draw, broad-backed, unwearied.
Devanāgarī: ये अश्रमास उरवो वहिष्ठास्तेभिर्न इन्द्राभि वक्षि वाजम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | puraḥ-etā | su-geṣu | uta | duḥ-geṣu | pathi-kr̥t | vidānaḥ || ye | aśramāsaḥ | uravaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ | tebhiḥ | naḥ | indra | abhi | vakṣi | vājam ||6.21.12||

IAST: ya eka id dhavyaś carṣaṇīnām indraṁ taṁ gīrbhir abhy arca ābhiḥ
Griffith: WITH these my hymns I glorify that Indra who is alone to be invoked by mortals,
Devanāgarī: य एक इद्धव्यश्चर्षणीनामिन्द्रं तं गीर्भिरभ्यर्च आभिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | havyaḥ | carṣaṇīnām | indram | tam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | arce | ābhiḥ || yaḥ | patyate | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vr̥ṣṇya-vān | satyaḥ | satvā | puru-māyaḥ | sahasvān ||6.22.1||

IAST: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān
Griffith: The Lord, the Mighty One, of manly vigour, victorious, Hero, true, and full of wisdom.
Devanāgarī: यः पत्यते वृषभो वृष्ण्यावान्सत्यः सत्वा पुरुमायः सहस्वान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | havyaḥ | carṣaṇīnām | indram | tam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | arce | ābhiḥ || yaḥ | patyate | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vr̥ṣṇya-vān | satyaḥ | satvā | puru-māyaḥ | sahasvān ||6.22.1||

IAST: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaro navagvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ
Griffith: Our sires of old,. Navagvas, sages seven, while urging him to show his might, extolled him,
Devanāgarī: तमु नः पूर्वे पितरो नवग्वाः सप्त विप्रासो अभि वाजयन्तः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | pūrve | pitaraḥ | nava-gvāḥ | sapta | viprāsaḥ | abhi | vājayantaḥ || nakṣat-dābham | taturim | parvate-sthām | adrogha-vācam | mati-bhiḥ | śaviṣṭham ||6.22.2||

IAST: nakṣaddābhaṁ taturim parvateṣṭhām adroghavācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
Griffith: Dwelling on heights, swift, smiting down opponents, guileless in word, and in his thoughts most mighty.
Devanāgarī: नक्षद्दाभं ततुरिं पर्वतेष्ठामद्रोघवाचं मतिभिः शविष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | pūrve | pitaraḥ | nava-gvāḥ | sapta | viprāsaḥ | abhi | vājayantaḥ || nakṣat-dābham | taturim | parvate-sthām | adrogha-vācam | mati-bhiḥ | śaviṣṭham ||6.22.2||

IAST: tam īmaha indram asya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
Griffith: We seek that Indra to obtain his riches that bring much food, and men, and store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: तमीमह इन्द्रमस्य रायः पुरुवीरस्य नृवतः पुरुक्षोः
pada pāṭha: tam | īmahe | indram | asya | rāyaḥ | puru-vīrasya | nr̥-vataḥ | puru-kṣoḥ || yaḥ | askr̥dhoyuḥ | ajaraḥ | svaḥ-vān | tam | ā | bhara | hari-vaḥ | mādayadhyai ||6.22.3||

IAST: yo askṛdhoyur ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivo mādayadhyai
Griffith: Bring us, Lord of Bay Steeds, to make us joyful, celestial wealth, abundant, undecaying.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्कृधोयुरजरः स्वर्वान्तमा भर हरिवो मादयध्यै
pada pāṭha: tam | īmahe | indram | asya | rāyaḥ | puru-vīrasya | nr̥-vataḥ | puru-kṣoḥ || yaḥ | askr̥dhoyuḥ | ajaraḥ | svaḥ-vān | tam | ā | bhara | hari-vaḥ | mādayadhyai ||6.22.3||

IAST: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cij jaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnam indra
Griffith: Tell thou us this, if at thy hand aforetime the earlier singers have obtained good fortune,
Devanāgarī: तन्नो वि वोचो यदि ते पुरा चिज्जरितार आनशुः सुम्नमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | vi | vocaḥ | yadi | te | purā | cit | jaritāraḥ | ānaśuḥ | sumnam | indra || kaḥ | te | bhāgaḥ | kim | vayaḥ | dudhra | khidvaḥ | puru-hūta | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | asura-ghnaḥ ||6.22.4||

IAST: kas te bhāgaḥ kiṁ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnaḥ
Griffith: What is thy share and portion, Strong Subduer, Asura-slayer, rich, invoked of many?
Devanāgarī: कस्ते भागः किं वयो दुध्र खिद्वः पुरुहूत पुरूवसोऽसुरघ्नः
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | vi | vocaḥ | yadi | te | purā | cit | jaritāraḥ | ānaśuḥ | sumnam | indra || kaḥ | te | bhāgaḥ | kim | vayaḥ | dudhra | khidvaḥ | puru-hūta | puruvaso iti puru-vaso | asura-ghnaḥ ||6.22.4||

IAST: tam pṛcchantī vajrahastaṁ ratheṣṭhām indraṁ vepī vakvarī yasya nū gīḥ
Griffith: He who for car-borne Indra, armed with thunder, hath a hymn, craving, deeply-piercing, fluent,
Devanāgarī: तं पृच्छन्ती वज्रहस्तं रथेष्ठामिन्द्रं वेपी वक्वरी यस्य नू गीः
pada pāṭha: tam | pr̥cchantī | vajra-hastam | rathe-sthām | indram | vepī | vakvarī | yasya | nu | gīḥ || tuvi-grābham | tuvi-kūrmim | rabhaḥ-dām | gātum | iṣe | nakṣate | tumram | accha ||6.22.5||

IAST: tuvigrābhaṁ tuvikūrmiṁ rabhodāṁ gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram accha
Griffith: Who sends a song effectual, firmly-grasping, and strength-bestowing, he comes near the mighty.
Devanāgarī: तुविग्राभं तुविकूर्मिं रभोदां गातुमिषे नक्षते तुम्रमच्छ
pada pāṭha: tam | pr̥cchantī | vajra-hastam | rathe-sthām | indram | vepī | vakvarī | yasya | nu | gīḥ || tuvi-grābham | tuvi-kūrmim | rabhaḥ-dām | gātum | iṣe | nakṣate | tumram | accha ||6.22.5||

IAST: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena
Griffith: Strong of thyself, thou by this art hast shattered, with thought-swift Parvata, him who waxed against thee
Devanāgarī: अया ह त्यं मायया वावृधानं मनोजुवा स्वतवः पर्वतेन
pada pāṭha: ayā | ha | tyam | māyayā | vavr̥dhānam | manaḥ-juvā | sva-tavaḥ | parvatena || acyutā | cit | vīḷitā | su-ojaḥ | rujaḥ | vi | dr̥ḷhā | dhr̥ṣatā | vi-rapśin ||6.22.6||

IAST: acyutā cid vīḻitā svojo rujo vi dṛḻhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
Griffith: And, Mightiest! roaring! boldly rent in pieces things that were firmly fixed and never shaken.
Devanāgarī: अच्युता चिद्वीळिता स्वोजो रुजो वि दृळ्हा धृषता विरप्शिन्
pada pāṭha: ayā | ha | tyam | māyayā | vavr̥dhānam | manaḥ-juvā | sva-tavaḥ | parvatena || acyutā | cit | vīḷitā | su-ojaḥ | rujaḥ | vi | dr̥ḷhā | dhr̥ṣatā | vi-rapśin ||6.22.6||

IAST: taṁ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnam pratnavat paritaṁsayadhyai
Griffith: Him will we fit for you with new devotion, the strongest Ancient One, in ancient manner.
Devanāgarī: तं वो धिया नव्यस्या शविष्ठं प्रत्नं प्रत्नवत्परितंसयध्यै
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dhiyā | navyasyā | śaviṣṭham | pratnam | pratna-vat | pari-taṁsayadhyai || saḥ | naḥ | vakṣat | ani-mānaḥ | su-vahmā | indraḥ | viśvāni | ati | duḥ-gahāni ||6.22.7||

IAST: sa no vakṣad animānaḥ suvahmendro viśvāny ati durgahāṇi
Griffith: So may that Indra, boundless, faithful Leader, conduct us o'er all places hard to traverse.
Devanāgarī: स नो वक्षदनिमानः सुवह्मेन्द्रो विश्वान्यति दुर्गहाणि
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dhiyā | navyasyā | śaviṣṭham | pratnam | pratna-vat | pari-taṁsayadhyai || saḥ | naḥ | vakṣat | ani-mānaḥ | su-vahmā | indraḥ | viśvāni | ati | duḥ-gahāni ||6.22.7||

IAST: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo 'ntarikṣā
Griffith: Thou for the people who oppress hast kindled the earthly firmament and that of heaven.
Devanāgarī: आ जनाय द्रुह्वणे पार्थिवानि दिव्यानि दीपयोऽन्तरिक्षा
pada pāṭha: ā | janāya | druhvaṇe | pārthivāni | divyāni | dīpayaḥ | antarikṣā || tapa | vr̥ṣan | viśvataḥ | śociṣā | tān | brahma-dviṣe | śocaya | kṣām | apaḥ | ca ||6.22.8||

IAST: tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣām apaś ca
Griffith: With heat, O Bull, on every side consume them: heat earth and flood for him who hates devotion.
Devanāgarī: तपा वृषन्विश्वतः शोचिषा तान्ब्रह्मद्विषे शोचय क्षामपश्च
pada pāṭha: ā | janāya | druhvaṇe | pārthivāni | divyāni | dīpayaḥ | antarikṣā || tapa | vr̥ṣan | viśvataḥ | śociṣā | tān | brahma-dviṣe | śocaya | kṣām | apaḥ | ca ||6.22.8||

IAST: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagatas tveṣasaṁdṛk
Griffith: Of all the Heavenly Folk, of earthly creatures thou art the King, O God of splendid aspect.
Devanāgarī: भुवो जनस्य दिव्यस्य राजा पार्थिवस्य जगतस्त्वेषसंदृक्
pada pāṭha: bhuvaḥ | janasya | divyasya | rājā | pārthivasya | jagataḥ | tveṣa-saṁdr̥k || dhiṣva | vajram | dakṣiṇe | indra | haste | viśvāḥ | ajurya | dayase | vi | māyāḥ ||6.22.9||

IAST: dhiṣva vajraṁ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ
Griffith: In thy right hand, O Indra, grasp die thunder: Eternal! thou destroyest all enchantments.
Devanāgarī: धिष्व वज्रं दक्षिण इन्द्र हस्ते विश्वा अजुर्य दयसे वि मायाः
pada pāṭha: bhuvaḥ | janasya | divyasya | rājā | pārthivasya | jagataḥ | tveṣa-saṁdr̥k || dhiṣva | vajram | dakṣiṇe | indra | haste | viśvāḥ | ajurya | dayase | vi | māyāḥ ||6.22.9||

IAST: ā saṁyatam indra ṇaḥ svastiṁ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām
Griffith: Give us confirmed prosperity, O Indra, vast and exhaustless for the foe's subduing.
Devanāgarī: आ संयतमिन्द्र णः स्वस्तिं शत्रुतूर्याय बृहतीममृध्राम्
pada pāṭha: ā | sam-yatam | indra | naḥ | svastim | śatru-tūryāya | br̥hatīm | amr̥dhrām || yayā | dāsāni | āryāṇi | vr̥trā | karaḥ | vajrin | su-tukā | nāhuṣāṇi ||6.22.10||

IAST: yayā dāsāny āryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi
Griffith: Strengthen therewith the Arya's hate and Dasa's, and let the arms of Nahusas be mighty.
Devanāgarī: यया दासान्यार्याणि वृत्रा करो वज्रिन्सुतुका नाहुषाणि
pada pāṭha: ā | sam-yatam | indra | naḥ | svastim | śatru-tūryāya | br̥hatīm | amr̥dhrām || yayā | dāsāni | āryāṇi | vr̥trā | karaḥ | vajrin | su-tukā | nāhuṣāṇi ||6.22.10||

IAST: sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhir ā gahi prayajyo
Griffith: Come with thy team which brings all blessings hither, Disposer, much-invoked, exceeding holy.
Devanāgarī: स नो नियुद्भिः पुरुहूत वेधो विश्ववाराभिरा गहि प्रयज्यो
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | vedhaḥ | viśva-vārābhiḥ | ā | gahi | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo || na | yāḥ | adevaḥ | varate | na | devaḥ | ā | ābhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam | ā | madryadrik ||6.22.11||

IAST: na yā adevo varate na deva ābhir yāhi tūyam ā madryadrik
Griffith: Thou whom no fiend, no God can stay or hinder, come swittly with these Steeds in my direction.
Devanāgarī: न या अदेवो वरते न देव आभिर्याहि तूयमा मद्र्यद्रिक्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | puru-hūta | vedhaḥ | viśva-vārābhiḥ | ā | gahi | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo || na | yāḥ | adevaḥ | varate | na | devaḥ | ā | ābhiḥ | yāhi | tūyam | ā | madryadrik ||6.22.11||

IAST: suta it tvaṁ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamāna ukthe
Griffith: THOU art attached to pressed-out Soma, Indra, at laud, at prayer, and when the hymn is chanted;
Devanāgarī: सुत इत्त्वं निमिश्ल इन्द्र सोमे स्तोमे ब्रह्मणि शस्यमान उक्थे
pada pāṭha: sute | it | tvam | ni-miślaḥ | indra | some | stome | brahmaṇi | śasyamāne | ukthe || yat | vā | yuktābhyām | magha-van | hari-bhyām | bibhrat | vajram | bāhvoḥ | indra | yāsi ||6.23.1||

IAST: yad vā yuktābhyām maghavan haribhyām bibhrad vajram bāhvor indra yāsi
Griffith: Or when with yoked Bays, Maghavan, thou comest, O Indra, bearing in thine arms the thunder.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा युक्ताभ्यां मघवन्हरिभ्यां बिभ्रद्वज्रं बाह्वोरिन्द्र यासि .
pada pāṭha: sute | it | tvam | ni-miślaḥ | indra | some | stome | brahmaṇi | śasyamāne | ukthe || yat | vā | yuktābhyām | magha-van | hari-bhyām | bibhrat | vajram | bāhvoḥ | indra | yāsi ||6.23.1||

IAST: yad vā divi pārye suṣvim indra vṛtrahatye 'vasi śūrasātau
Griffith: Or when on that decisive day thou holpest the presser of the juice at Vrtra's slaughter;
Devanāgarī: यद्वा दिवि पार्ये सुष्विमिन्द्र वृत्रहत्येऽवसि शूरसातौ
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | divi | pārye | susvim | indra | vr̥tra-hatye | avasi | śūra-sātau || yat | vā | dakṣasya | bibhyuṣaḥ | abibhyat | arandhayaḥ | śardhataḥ | indra | dasyūn ||6.23.2||

IAST: yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyad arandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn
Griffith: Or when thou, while the strong one feared, undaunted, gavest to death, Indra, the daring Dasyus.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा दक्षस्य बिभ्युषो अबिभ्यदरन्धयः शर्धत इन्द्र दस्यून् .
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | divi | pārye | susvim | indra | vr̥tra-hatye | avasi | śūra-sātau || yat | vā | dakṣasya | bibhyuṣaḥ | abibhyat | arandhayaḥ | śardhataḥ | indra | dasyūn ||6.23.2||

IAST: pātā sutam indro astu somam praṇenīr ugro jaritāram ūtī
Griffith: Let Indra drink the pressed-out Soma, Helper and mighty Guide of him who sings his praises.
Devanāgarī: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं प्रणेनीरुग्रो जरितारमूती
pada pāṭha: pātā | sutam | indraḥ | astu | somam | pra-nenīḥ | ugraḥ | jaritāram | ūtī || kartā | vīrāya | susvaye | ūm̐ iti | lokam | dātā | vasu | stuvate | kīraye | cit ||6.23.3||

IAST: kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṁ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit
Griffith: He gives the hero room who pours oblations, and treasure even to the lowly singer.
Devanāgarī: कर्ता वीराय सुष्वय उ लोकं दाता वसु स्तुवते कीरये चित् .
pada pāṭha: pātā | sutam | indraḥ | astu | somam | pra-nenīḥ | ugraḥ | jaritāram | ūtī || kartā | vīrāya | susvaye | ūm̐ iti | lokam | dātā | vasu | stuvate | kīraye | cit ||6.23.3||

IAST: ganteyānti savanā haribhyām babhrir vajram papiḥ somaṁ dadir gāḥ
Griffith: E'en humble rites with his Bay steeds he visits: he wields the bolt, drinks Soma, gives us cattle.
Devanāgarī: गन्तेयान्ति सवना हरिभ्यां बभ्रिर्वज्रं पपिः सोमं ददिर्गाः
pada pāṭha: gantā | iyanti | savanā | hari-bhyām | babhriḥ | vajram | papiḥ | somam | dadiḥ | gāḥ || kartā | vīram | naryam | sarva-vīram | śrotā | havam | gr̥ṇataḥ | stoma-vāhāḥ ||6.23.4||

IAST: kartā vīraṁ naryaṁ sarvavīraṁ śrotā havaṁ gṛṇataḥ stomavāhāḥ
Griffith: He makes the valiant rich in store of heroes, accepts our praise and hears the singer's calling.
Devanāgarī: कर्ता वीरं नर्यं सर्ववीरं श्रोता हवं गृणतः स्तोमवाहाः .
pada pāṭha: gantā | iyanti | savanā | hari-bhyām | babhriḥ | vajram | papiḥ | somam | dadiḥ | gāḥ || kartā | vīram | naryam | sarva-vīram | śrotā | havam | gr̥ṇataḥ | stoma-vāhāḥ ||6.23.4||

IAST: asmai vayaṁ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ
Griffith: What he hath longed for we have brought to Indra, who from the days of old hath done us service.
Devanāgarī: अस्मै वयं यद्वावान तद्विविष्म इन्द्राय यो नः प्रदिवो अपस्कः
pada pāṭha: asmai | vayam | yat | vavāna | tat | viviṣmaḥ | indrāya | yaḥ | naḥ | pra-divaḥ | apaḥ | kariti kaḥ || sute | some | stumasi | śaṁsat | ukthā | indrāya | brahma | vardhanam | yathā | asat ||6.23.5||

IAST: sute some stumasi śaṁsad ukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṁ yathāsat
Griffith: While Soma flows we will sing hymn, and laud him, so that our prayer may streng. then Indra's vigour.
Devanāgarī: सुते सोमे स्तुमसि शंसदुक्थेन्द्राय ब्रह्म वर्धनं यथासत् .
pada pāṭha: asmai | vayam | yat | vavāna | tat | viviṣmaḥ | indrāya | yaḥ | naḥ | pra-divaḥ | apaḥ | kariti kaḥ || sute | some | stumasi | śaṁsat | ukthā | indrāya | brahma | vardhanam | yathā | asat ||6.23.5||

IAST: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhir viviṣmaḥ
Griffith: Thou hast made prayer the means of thine exalting, therefore we wait on thee with hymns, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माणि हि चकृषे वर्धनानि तावत्त इन्द्र मतिभिर्विविष्मः
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇi | hi | cakr̥ṣe | vardhanāni | tāvat | te | indra | mati-bhiḥ | viviṣmaḥ || sute | some | suta-pāḥ | śam-tamāni | rāndryā | kriyāsma | vakṣaṇāni | yajñaiḥ ||6.23.6||

IAST: sute some sutapāḥ śaṁtamāni rāṇḍyā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ
Griffith: May we, by the pressed Soma, Somadrinker! bring thee, with sacrifice, blissful sweet refreshment.
Devanāgarī: सुते सोमे सुतपाः शंतमानि राण्ड्या क्रियास्म वक्षणानि यज्ञैः .
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇi | hi | cakr̥ṣe | vardhanāni | tāvat | te | indra | mati-bhiḥ | viviṣmaḥ || sute | some | suta-pāḥ | śam-tamāni | rāndryā | kriyāsma | vakṣaṇāni | yajñaiḥ ||6.23.6||

IAST: sa no bodhi puroḻāśaṁ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṁ goṛjīkam indra
Griffith: Mark well our sacrificial cake, delighted Indra, drink Soma and the milk commingled.
Devanāgarī: स नो बोधि पुरोळाशं रराणः पिबा तु सोमं गोऋजीकमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | puroḷāśam | rarāṇaḥ | piba | tu | somam | go-r̥jīkam | indra || ā | idam | barhiḥ | yajamānasya | sīda | urum | kr̥dhi | tvā-yataḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||6.23.7||

IAST: edam barhir yajamānasya sīdoruṁ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam
Griffith: Here on the sacrificer's grass be seated: give ample room to thy devoted servant.
Devanāgarī: एदं बर्हिर्यजमानस्य सीदोरुं कृधि त्वायत उ लोकम् .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | bodhi | puroḷāśam | rarāṇaḥ | piba | tu | somam | go-r̥jīkam | indra || ā | idam | barhiḥ | yajamānasya | sīda | urum | kr̥dhi | tvā-yataḥ | ūm̐ iti | lokam ||6.23.7||

IAST: sa mandasvā hy anu joṣam ugra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu
Griffith: O Mighty One, be joyful as thou willest. Let these our sacrifices reach and find thee;
Devanāgarī: स मन्दस्वा ह्यनु जोषमुग्र प्र त्वा यज्ञास इमे अश्नुवन्तु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | anu | joṣam | ugra | pra | tvā | yajñāsaḥ | ime | aśnuvantu || pra | ime | havāsaḥ | puru-hūtam | asme iti | ā | tvā | iyam | dhīḥ | avase | indra | yamyāḥ ||6.23.8||

IAST: preme havāsaḥ puruhūtam asme ā tveyaṁ dhīr avasa indra yamyāḥ
Griffith: And may this hymn and these our invocations turn thee, whom many men invoke, to help us.
Devanāgarī: प्रेमे हवासः पुरुहूतमस्मे आ त्वेयं धीरवस इन्द्र यम्याः .
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | anu | joṣam | ugra | pra | tvā | yajñāsaḥ | ime | aśnuvantu || pra | ime | havāsaḥ | puru-hūtam | asme iti | ā | tvā | iyam | dhīḥ | avase | indra | yamyāḥ ||6.23.8||

IAST: taṁ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṁ yathā suteṣu somebhir īm pṛṇatā bhojam indram
Griffith: Friends, when thejuices flow, replenish duly your own, your bounteous Indra with the Soma.
Devanāgarī: तं वः सखायः सं यथा सुतेषु सोमेभिरीं पृणता भोजमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | sam | yathā | suteṣu | somebhiḥ | īm | pr̥ṇata | bhojam | indram || kuvit | tasmai | asati | naḥ | bharāya | na | susvim | indraḥ | avase | mr̥dhāti ||6.23.9||

IAST: kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvim indro 'vase mṛdhāti
Griffith: Will it not aid him to support us? Indra. spares him who sheds the juice to win his favour.
Devanāgarī: कुवित्तस्मा असति नो भराय न सुष्विमिन्द्रोऽवसे मृधाति .
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | sakhāyaḥ | sam | yathā | suteṣu | somebhiḥ | īm | pr̥ṇata | bhojam | indram || kuvit | tasmai | asati | naḥ | bharāya | na | susvim | indraḥ | avase | mr̥dhāti ||6.23.9||

IAST: eved indraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayad in maghonaḥ
Griffith: While Soma flowed, thus Indra hath been lauded, Ruler of nobles, mid the Bharadvajas,
Devanāgarī: एवेदिन्द्रः सुते अस्तावि सोमे भरद्वाजेषु क्षयदिन्मघोनः
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indraḥ | sute | astāvi | some | bharat-vājeṣu | kṣayat | it | maghonaḥ || asat | yathā | jaritre | uta | sūriḥ | indraḥ | rāyaḥ | viśva-vārasya | dātā ||6.23.10||

IAST: asad yathā jaritra uta sūrir indro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā
Griffith: That Indra may become the singer's patron and give him wealth in every kind of treasure.
Devanāgarī: असद्यथा जरित्र उत सूरिरिन्द्रो रायो विश्ववारस्य दाता .
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indraḥ | sute | astāvi | some | bharat-vājeṣu | kṣayat | it | maghonaḥ || asat | yathā | jaritre | uta | sūriḥ | indraḥ | rāyaḥ | viśva-vārasya | dātā ||6.23.10||

IAST: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī
Griffith: STRONG rapturous joy, praise, glory are with Indra: impetuous God, he quaffs the juice of Soma:
Devanāgarī: वृषा मद इन्द्रे श्लोक उक्था सचा सोमेषु सुतपा ऋजीषी
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | indre | ślokaḥ | ukthā | sacā | someṣu | suta-pāḥ | r̥jīṣī || arcatryaḥ | magha-vā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | ukthaiḥ | dyukṣaḥ | rājā | girām | akṣita-ūtiḥ ||6.24.1||

IAST: arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthair dyukṣo rājā girām akṣitotiḥ
Griffith: That Maghavan whom men must laud with singing, Heaven-dweller, King of songs, whose help is lasting.
Devanāgarī: अर्चत्र्यो मघवा नृभ्य उक्थैर्द्युक्षो राजा गिरामक्षितोतिः .
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | madaḥ | indre | ślokaḥ | ukthā | sacā | someṣu | suta-pāḥ | r̥jīṣī || arcatryaḥ | magha-vā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | ukthaiḥ | dyukṣaḥ | rājā | girām | akṣita-ūtiḥ ||6.24.1||

IAST: taturir vīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṁ gṛṇata urvyūtiḥ
Griffith: He, Friend of man, most wise, victorious Hero, hears, with far-reaching aid, the singer call him.
Devanāgarī: ततुरिर्वीरो नर्यो विचेताः श्रोता हवं गृणत उर्व्यूतिः
pada pāṭha: taturiḥ | vīraḥ | naryaḥ | vi-cetāḥ | śrotā | havam | gr̥ṇataḥ | urvi-ūtiḥ || vasuḥ | śaṁsaḥ | narām | kāru-dhāyāḥ | vājī | stutaḥ | vidathe | dāti | vājam ||6.24.2||

IAST: vasuḥ śaṁso narāṁ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam
Griffith: Excellent, Praise of Men, the bard's Supporter, Strong, he gives strength, extolled in holy synod.
Devanāgarī: वसुः शंसो नरां कारुधाया वाजी स्तुतो विदथे दाति वाजम् .
pada pāṭha: taturiḥ | vīraḥ | naryaḥ | vi-cetāḥ | śrotā | havam | gr̥ṇataḥ | urvi-ūtiḥ || vasuḥ | śaṁsaḥ | narām | kāru-dhāyāḥ | vājī | stutaḥ | vidathe | dāti | vājam ||6.24.2||

IAST: akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ
Griffith: The lofty axle of thy wheels, O Hero, is not surpassed by heaven and earth in greatness.
Devanāgarī: अक्षो न चक्र्योः शूर बृहन्प्र ते मह्ना रिरिचे रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: akṣaḥ | na | cakryoḥ | śūra | br̥han | pra | te | mahnā | ririce | rodasyoḥ || vr̥kṣasya | nu | te | puru-hūta | vayāḥ | vi | ūtayaḥ | ruruhuḥ | indra | pūrvīḥ ||6.24.3||

IAST: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vy ūtayo ruruhur indra pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Like branches of a tree, Invoked of many manifold aids spring forth from thee, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: वृक्षस्य नु ते पुरुहूत वया व्यूतयो रुरुहुरिन्द्र पूर्वीः .
pada pāṭha: akṣaḥ | na | cakryoḥ | śūra | br̥han | pra | te | mahnā | ririce | rodasyoḥ || vr̥kṣasya | nu | te | puru-hūta | vayāḥ | vi | ūtayaḥ | ruruhuḥ | indra | pūrvīḥ ||6.24.3||

IAST: śacīvatas te puruśāka śākā gavām iva srutayaḥ saṁcaraṇīḥ
Griffith: Strong Lord, thine energies, endowed with vigour, are like the paths of kine converging homeward.
Devanāgarī: शचीवतस्ते पुरुशाक शाका गवामिव स्रुतयः संचरणीः
pada pāṭha: śacī-vataḥ | te | puru-śāka | śākāḥ | gavām-iva | srutayaḥ | sam-caraṇīḥ || vatsānām | na | tantayaḥ | te | indra | dāman-vantaḥ | adāmānaḥ | su-dāman ||6.24.4||

IAST: vatsānāṁ na tantayas ta indra dāmanvanto adāmānaḥ sudāman
Griffith: Like bonds of cord, Indra, that bind the younglings, no bonds are they, O thou of boundless bounty.
Devanāgarī: वत्सानां न तन्तयस्त इन्द्र दामन्वन्तो अदामानः सुदामन् .
pada pāṭha: śacī-vataḥ | te | puru-śāka | śākāḥ | gavām-iva | srutayaḥ | sam-caraṇīḥ || vatsānām | na | tantayaḥ | te | indra | dāman-vantaḥ | adāmānaḥ | su-dāman ||6.24.4||

IAST: anyad adya karvaram anyad u śvo 'sac ca san muhur ācakrir indraḥ
Griffith: One act to-day, another act tomorrow oft Indra makes what is not yet existeni.
Devanāgarī: अन्यदद्य कर्वरमन्यदु श्वोऽसच्च सन्मुहुराचक्रिरिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: anyat | adya | karvaram | anyat | ūm̐ iti | śvaḥ | asat | ca | sat | muhuḥ | ā-cakriḥ | indraḥ || mitraḥ | naḥ | atra | varuṇaḥ | ca | pūṣā | aryaḥ | vaśasya | pari-etā | asti ||6.24.5||

IAST: mitro no atra varuṇaś ca pūṣāryo vaśasya paryetāsti
Griffith: Here have we Mitra, Varuna, and Pusan to overcome the foeman's domination.
Devanāgarī: मित्रो नो अत्र वरुणश्च पूषार्यो वशस्य पर्येतास्ति .
pada pāṭha: anyat | adya | karvaram | anyat | ūm̐ iti | śvaḥ | asat | ca | sat | muhuḥ | ā-cakriḥ | indraḥ || mitraḥ | naḥ | atra | varuṇaḥ | ca | pūṣā | aryaḥ | vaśasya | pari-etā | asti ||6.24.5||

IAST: vi tvad āpo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhād ukthebhir indrānayanta yajñaiḥ
Griffith: By song and sacrifice men brought the waters from thee, as from a mountain's ridge, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: वि त्वदापो न पर्वतस्य पृष्ठादुक्थेभिरिन्द्रानयन्त यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: vi | tvat | āpaḥ | na | parvatasya | pr̥ṣṭhāt | ukthebhiḥ | indra | anayanta | yajñaiḥ || tam | tvā | ābhiḥ | sustuti-bhiḥ | vājayantaḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | girvāhaḥ | aśvāḥ ||6.24.6||

IAST: taṁ tvābhiḥ suṣṭutibhir vājayanta ājiṁ na jagmur girvāho aśvāḥ
Griffith: Urging thy might, with these fair lauds they seek thee, O theme of song, as horses rush tobattle.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वाभिः सुष्टुतिभिर्वाजयन्त आजिं न जग्मुर्गिर्वाहो अश्वाः .
pada pāṭha: vi | tvat | āpaḥ | na | parvatasya | pr̥ṣṭhāt | ukthebhiḥ | indra | anayanta | yajñaiḥ || tam | tvā | ābhiḥ | sustuti-bhiḥ | vājayantaḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | girvāhaḥ | aśvāḥ ||6.24.6||

IAST: na yaṁ jaranti śarado na māsā na dyāva indram avakarśayanti
Griffith: That Indra whom nor months nor autumn seasons wither with age, nor fleeting days enfeeble,-
Devanāgarī: न यं जरन्ति शरदो न मासा न द्याव इन्द्रमवकर्शयन्ति
pada pāṭha: na | yam | jaranti | śaradaḥ | na | māsāḥ | na | dyāvaḥ | indram | ava-karśayanti || vr̥ddhasya | cit | vardhatām | asya | tanūḥ | stomebhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | ca | śasyamānā ||6.24.7||

IAST: vṛddhasya cid vardhatām asya tanūḥ stomebhir ukthaiś ca śasyamānā
Griffith: Still may his body Wax, e'en now so mighty, glorified by the lauds and hymns that praise him.
Devanāgarī: वृद्धस्य चिद्वर्धतामस्य तनूः स्तोमेभिरुक्थैश्च शस्यमाना .
pada pāṭha: na | yam | jaranti | śaradaḥ | na | māsāḥ | na | dyāvaḥ | indram | ava-karśayanti || vr̥ddhasya | cit | vardhatām | asya | tanūḥ | stomebhiḥ | ukthaiḥ | ca | śasyamānā ||6.24.7||

IAST: na vīḻave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyujūtāya stavān
Griffith: Extolled, he bends not to the strong, the steadfast, nor to the bold incited by the Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: न वीळवे नमते न स्थिराय न शर्धते दस्युजूताय स्तवान्
pada pāṭha: na | vīḷave | namate | na | sthirāya | na | śardhate | dasyu-jūtāya | stavān || ajrāḥ | indrasya | girayaḥ | cit | r̥ṣvāḥ | gambhīre | cit | bhavati | gādham | asmai ||6.24.8||

IAST: ajrā indrasya girayaś cid ṛṣvā gambhīre cid bhavati gādham asmai
Griffith: High mountains are as level plains to Indra: even in the deep he finds firm ground to rest on.
Devanāgarī: अज्रा इन्द्रस्य गिरयश्चिदृष्वा गम्भीरे चिद्भवति गाधमस्मै .
pada pāṭha: na | vīḷave | namate | na | sthirāya | na | śardhate | dasyu-jūtāya | stavān || ajrāḥ | indrasya | girayaḥ | cit | r̥ṣvāḥ | gambhīre | cit | bhavati | gādham | asmai ||6.24.8||

IAST: gambhīreṇa na uruṇāmatrin preṣo yandhi sutapāvan vājān
Griffith: Impetuous Speeder through all depth and distance, give strengthening food, thou drinker of the juices.
Devanāgarī: गम्भीरेण न उरुणामत्रिन्प्रेषो यन्धि सुतपावन्वाजान्
pada pāṭha: gambhīreṇa | naḥ | uruṇā | amatrin | pra | iṣaḥ | yandhi | suta-pāvan | vājān || sthāḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | ūrdhvaḥ | ūtī | ariṣaṇyan | aktoḥ | vi-uṣṭau | pari-takmyāyām ||6.24.9||

IAST: sthā ū ṣu ūrdhva ūtī ariṣaṇyann aktor vyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām
Griffith: Stand up erect to help us, unreluctant, what time the gloom of night brightens to morning.
Devanāgarī: स्था ऊ षु ऊर्ध्व ऊती अरिषण्यन्नक्तोर्व्युष्टौ परितक्म्यायाम् .
pada pāṭha: gambhīreṇa | naḥ | uruṇā | amatrin | pra | iṣaḥ | yandhi | suta-pāvan | vājān || sthāḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | ūrdhvaḥ | ūtī | ariṣaṇyan | aktoḥ | vi-uṣṭau | pari-takmyāyām ||6.24.9||

IAST: sacasva nāyam avase abhīka ito vā tam indra pāhi riṣaḥ
Griffith: Hasting to help, come hither and protect him, keep him from harm when he is here, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: सचस्व नायमवसे अभीक इतो वा तमिन्द्र पाहि रिषः
pada pāṭha: sacasva | nāyam | avase | abhīke | itaḥ | vā | tam | indra | pāhi | riṣaḥ || amā | ca | enam | araṇye | pāhi | riṣaḥ | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.24.10||

IAST: amā cainam araṇye pāhi riṣo madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
Griffith: At home, abroad, from injury preserve him. May brave sons gladden us through a hundred winters.
Devanāgarī: अमा चैनमरण्ये पाहि रिषो मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः .
pada pāṭha: sacasva | nāyam | avase | abhīke | itaḥ | vā | tam | indra | pāhi | riṣaḥ || amā | ca | enam | araṇye | pāhi | riṣaḥ | madema | śata-himāḥ | su-vīrāḥ ||6.24.10||

IAST: yā ta ūtir avamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminn asti
Griffith: WITH thine assistance, O thou Mighty Indra, be it the least, the midmost, or the highest,-
Devanāgarī: या त ऊतिरवमा या परमा या मध्यमेन्द्र शुष्मिन्नस्ति
pada pāṭha: yā | te | ūtiḥ | avamā | yā | paramā | yā | madhyamā | indra | śuṣmin | asti || tābhiḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | vr̥tra-hatye | avīḥ | naḥ | ebhiḥ | ca | vājaiḥ | mahān | naḥ | ugra ||6.25.1||

IAST: tābhir ū ṣu vṛtrahatye 'vīr na ebhiś ca vājair mahān na ugra
Griffith: Great with those aids and by these powers support us, Strong God! in battle that subdues our foemen.
Devanāgarī: ताभिरू षु वृत्रहत्येऽवीर्न एभिश्च वाजैर्महान्न उग्र
pada pāṭha: yā | te | ūtiḥ | avamā | yā | paramā | yā | madhyamā | indra | śuṣmin | asti || tābhiḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | vr̥tra-hatye | avīḥ | naḥ | ebhiḥ | ca | vājaiḥ | mahān | naḥ | ugra ||6.25.1||

IAST: ābhiḥ spṛdho mithatīr ariṣaṇyann amitrasya vyathayā manyum indra
Griffith: With these discomfit hosts that fight against us, and check the opponent's wrath, thyself uninjured.
Devanāgarī: आभिः स्पृधो मिथतीररिषण्यन्नमित्रस्य व्यथया मन्युमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | mithatīḥ | ariṣaṇyan | amitrasya | vyathaya | manyum | indra || ābhiḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | viṣūcīḥ | āryāya | viśaḥ | ava | tārīḥ | dāsīḥ ||6.25.2||

IAST: ābhir viśvā abhiyujo viṣūcīr āryāya viśo 'va tārīr dāsīḥ
Griffith: With these chase all our foes to every quarter: subdue the tribes of Dasas to the Arya.
Devanāgarī: आभिर्विश्वा अभियुजो विषूचीरार्याय विशोऽव तारीर्दासीः
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | mithatīḥ | ariṣaṇyan | amitrasya | vyathaya | manyum | indra || ābhiḥ | viśvāḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | viṣūcīḥ | āryāya | viśaḥ | ava | tārīḥ | dāsīḥ ||6.25.2||

IAST: indra jāmaya uta ye 'jāmayo 'rvācīnāso vanuṣo yuyujre
Griffith: Those who array themselves as foes to smite us, O Indra, be they kin or be they strangers,-
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र जामय उत येऽजामयोऽर्वाचीनासो वनुषो युयुज्रे
pada pāṭha: indra | jāmayaḥ | uta | ye | ajāmayaḥ | arvācīnāsaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | yuyujre || tvam | eṣām | vithurā | śavāṁsi | jahi | vr̥ṣṇyāni | kr̥ṇuhi | parācaḥ ||6.25.3||

IAST: tvam eṣāṁ vithurā śavāṁsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhī parācaḥ
Griffith: Strike thou their manly strength that it be feeble, and drive in headlong flight our foemen backward.
Devanāgarī: त्वमेषां विथुरा शवांसि जहि वृष्ण्यानि कृणुही पराचः
pada pāṭha: indra | jāmayaḥ | uta | ye | ajāmayaḥ | arvācīnāsaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | yuyujre || tvam | eṣām | vithurā | śavāṁsi | jahi | vr̥ṣṇyāni | kr̥ṇuhi | parācaḥ ||6.25.3||

IAST: śūro vā śūraṁ vanate śarīrais tanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite
Griffith: With strength of limb the hero slays the hero, when bright in arms they range them for the combat.
Devanāgarī: शूरो वा शूरं वनते शरीरैस्तनूरुचा तरुषि यत्कृण्वैते
pada pāṭha: śūraḥ | vā | śūram | vanate | śarīraiḥ | tanū-rucā | taruṣi | yat | kr̥ṇvaite iti || toke | vā | goṣu | tanaye | yat | ap-su | vi | krandasī iti | urvarāsu | bravaite iti ||6.25.4||

IAST: toke vā goṣu tanaye yad apsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite
Griffith: When two opposing hosts contend in battle for seed and offspring, waters, kine, or corn-lands.
Devanāgarī: तोके वा गोषु तनये यदप्सु वि क्रन्दसी उर्वरासु ब्रवैते
pada pāṭha: śūraḥ | vā | śūram | vanate | śarīraiḥ | tanū-rucā | taruṣi | yat | kr̥ṇvaite iti || toke | vā | goṣu | tanaye | yat | ap-su | vi | krandasī iti | urvarāsu | bravaite iti ||6.25.4||

IAST: nahi tvā śūro na turo na dhṛṣṇur na tvā yodho manyamāno yuyodha
Griffith: Yet no strong man hath conquered thee, no hero, no brave, no warrior trusting in his valour.
Devanāgarī: नहि त्वा शूरो न तुरो न धृष्णुर्न त्वा योधो मन्यमानो युयोध
pada pāṭha: nahi | tvā | śūraḥ | na | turaḥ | na | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ | na | tvā | yodhaḥ | manyamānaḥ | yuyodha || indra | nakiḥ | tvā | prati | asti | eṣām | viśvā | jātāni | abhi | asi | tāni ||6.25.5||

IAST: indra nakiṣ ṭvā praty asty eṣāṁ viśvā jātāny abhy asi tāni
Griffith: Not one of these is match for thee, O Indra. Thou far surpassest all these living creatures.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र नकिष्ट्वा प्रत्यस्त्येषां विश्वा जातान्यभ्यसि तानि
pada pāṭha: nahi | tvā | śūraḥ | na | turaḥ | na | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ | na | tvā | yodhaḥ | manyamānaḥ | yuyodha || indra | nakiḥ | tvā | prati | asti | eṣām | viśvā | jātāni | abhi | asi | tāni ||6.25.5||

IAST: sa patyata ubhayor nṛmṇam ayor yadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante
Griffith: He is the Lord of both these armies' valour when the commanders call them to the conflict:
Devanāgarī: स पत्यत उभयोर्नृम्णमयोर्यदी वेधसः समिथे हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | patyate | ubhayoḥ | nr̥mṇam | ayoḥ | yadi | vedhasaḥ | sam-ithe | havante || vr̥tre | vā | mahaḥ | nr̥-vati | kṣaye | vā | vyacasvantā | yadi | vitantasaite iti ||6.25.6||

IAST: vṛtre vā maho nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite
Griffith: When with their ranks expanded they are fighting with a great foe or for a home with heroes.
Devanāgarī: वृत्रे वा महो नृवति क्षये वा व्यचस्वन्ता यदि वितन्तसैते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | patyate | ubhayoḥ | nr̥mṇam | ayoḥ | yadi | vedhasaḥ | sam-ithe | havante || vr̥tre | vā | mahaḥ | nr̥-vati | kṣaye | vā | vyacasvantā | yadi | vitantasaite iti ||6.25.6||

IAST: adha smā te carṣaṇayo yad ejān indra trātota bhavā varūtā
Griffith: And when the people stir themselves for battle, be thou their saviour, Indra, and protector,
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा ते चर्षणयो यदेजानिन्द्र त्रातोत भवा वरूता
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | te | carṣaṇayaḥ | yat | ejān | indra | trātā | uta | bhava | varūtā || asmākāsaḥ | ye | nr̥-tamāsaḥ | aryaḥ | indra | sūrayaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ | naḥ ||6.25.7||

IAST: asmākāso ye nṛtamāso arya indra sūrayo dadhire puro naḥ
Griffith: And theirs, thy manliest of our friends, the pious, the chiefs who have installed us priests, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकासो ये नृतमासो अर्य इन्द्र सूरयो दधिरे पुरो नः
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | te | carṣaṇayaḥ | yat | ejān | indra | trātā | uta | bhava | varūtā || asmākāsaḥ | ye | nr̥-tamāsaḥ | aryaḥ | indra | sūrayaḥ | dadhire | puraḥ | naḥ ||6.25.7||

IAST: anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viśvam anu vṛtrahatye
Griffith: To thee for high dominion hath been for evermore, for slaughtering the Vrtras,
Devanāgarī: अनु ते दायि मह इन्द्रियाय सत्रा ते विश्वमनु वृत्रहत्ये
pada pāṭha: anu | te | dāyi | mahe | indriyāya | satrā | te | viśvam | anu | vr̥tra-hatye || anu | kṣatram | anu | sahaḥ | yajatra | indra | devebhiḥ | anu | te | nr̥-sahye ||6.25.8||

IAST: anu kṣatram anu saho yajatrendra devebhir anu te nṛṣahye
Griffith: All lordly power and might, O Holy Indra, given by Gods for victory in battle.
Devanāgarī: अनु क्षत्रमनु सहो यजत्रेन्द्र देवेभिरनु ते नृषह्ये
pada pāṭha: anu | te | dāyi | mahe | indriyāya | satrā | te | viśvam | anu | vr̥tra-hatye || anu | kṣatram | anu | sahaḥ | yajatra | indra | devebhiḥ | anu | te | nr̥-sahye ||6.25.8||

IAST: evā naḥ spṛdhaḥ sam ajā samatsv indra rārandhi mithatīr adevīḥ
Griffith: So urge our hosts together in the combats: yield up the godless bands that fight against us.
Devanāgarī: एवा नः स्पृधः समजा समत्स्विन्द्र रारन्धि मिथतीरदेवीः
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | sam | aja | samat-su | indra | rarandhi | mithatīḥ | adevīḥ || vidyāma | vastoḥ | avasā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | bharat-vājāḥ | uta | te | indra | nūnam ||6.25.9||

IAST: vidyāma vastor avasā gṛṇanto bharadvājā uta ta indra nūnam
Griffith: Singing, at morn may we find thee with favour, yea, Indra, and e'en now, we Bharadvajas.
Devanāgarī: विद्याम वस्तोरवसा गृणन्तो भरद्वाजा उत त इन्द्र नूनम्
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | spr̥dhaḥ | sam | aja | samat-su | indra | rarandhi | mithatīḥ | adevīḥ || vidyāma | vastoḥ | avasā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | bharat-vājāḥ | uta | te | indra | nūnam ||6.25.9||

IAST: śrudhī na indra hvayāmasi tvā maho vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ
Griffith: O INDRA, hear us. Raining down the Soma, we call on thee to win us mighty valour.
Devanāgarī: श्रुधी न इन्द्र ह्वयामसि त्वा महो वाजस्य सातौ वावृषाणाः
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | naḥ | indra | hvayāmasi | tvā | mahaḥ | vājasya | sātau | vavr̥ṣāṇāḥ || sam | yat | viśaḥ | ayanta | śūra-sātau | ugram | naḥ | avaḥ | pārye | ahan | dāḥ ||6.26.1||

IAST: saṁ yad viśo 'yanta śūrasātā ugraṁ no 'vaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ
Griffith: Give us strong succour on the day of trial, when the tribes gather on the field of battle.
Devanāgarī: सं यद्विशोऽयन्त शूरसाता उग्रं नोऽवः पार्ये अहन्दाः
pada pāṭha: śrudhi | naḥ | indra | hvayāmasi | tvā | mahaḥ | vājasya | sātau | vavr̥ṣāṇāḥ || sam | yat | viśaḥ | ayanta | śūra-sātau | ugram | naḥ | avaḥ | pārye | ahan | dāḥ ||6.26.1||

IAST: tvāṁ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya gadhyasya sātau
Griffith: The warrior, son of warrior sire, invokes thee, to gain great strength that may be won as booty:
Devanāgarī: त्वां वाजी हवते वाजिनेयो महो वाजस्य गध्यस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: tvām | vājī | havate | vājineyaḥ | mahaḥ | vājasya | gadhyasya | sātau || tvām | vr̥treṣu | indra | sat-patim | tarutram | tvām | caṣṭe | muṣṭi-hā | goṣu | yudhyan ||6.26.2||

IAST: tvāṁ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṁ tarutraṁ tvāṁ caṣṭe muṣṭihā goṣu yudhyan
Griffith: To thee, the brave man's Lord, the fiends' subduer, he looks when fighting hand to hand for cattle.
Devanāgarī: त्वां वृत्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं तरुत्रं त्वां चष्टे मुष्टिहा गोषु युध्यन्
pada pāṭha: tvām | vājī | havate | vājineyaḥ | mahaḥ | vājasya | gadhyasya | sātau || tvām | vr̥treṣu | indra | sat-patim | tarutram | tvām | caṣṭe | muṣṭi-hā | goṣu | yudhyan ||6.26.2||

IAST: tvaṁ kaviṁ codayo 'rkasātau tvaṁ kutsāya śuṣṇaṁ dāśuṣe vark
Griffith: Thou didst impel the sage to win the daylight, didst ruin Susna for the pious Kutsa.
Devanāgarī: त्वं कविं चोदयोऽर्कसातौ त्वं कुत्साय शुष्णं दाशुषे वर्क्
pada pāṭha: tvam | kavim | codayaḥ | arka-sātau | tvam | kutsāya | śuṣṇam | dāśuṣe | vark || tvam | śiraḥ | amarmaṇaḥ | parā | ahan | atithi-gvāya | śaṁsyam | kariṣyan ||6.26.3||

IAST: tvaṁ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhann atithigvāya śaṁsyaṁ kariṣyan
Griffith: The invulnerable demon's head thou clavest when thou wouldst win the praise of Atithigva.
Devanāgarī: त्वं शिरो अमर्मणः पराहन्नतिथिग्वाय शंस्यं करिष्यन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | kavim | codayaḥ | arka-sātau | tvam | kutsāya | śuṣṇam | dāśuṣe | vark || tvam | śiraḥ | amarmaṇaḥ | parā | ahan | atithi-gvāya | śaṁsyam | kariṣyan ||6.26.3||

IAST: tvaṁ ratham pra bharo yodham ṛṣvam āvo yudhyantaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ daśadyum
Griffith: The lofty battle-car thou broughtest forward; thou holpest Dasadyu the strong when fighting.
Devanāgarī: त्वं रथं प्र भरो योधमृष्वमावो युध्यन्तं वृषभं दशद्युम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | ratham | pra | bharaḥ | yodham | r̥ṣvam | āvaḥ | yudhyantam | vr̥ṣabham | daśa-dyum || tvam | tugram | vetasave | sacā | ahan | tvam | tujim | gr̥ṇantam | indra | tūtoriti tūtoḥ ||6.26.4||

IAST: tvaṁ tugraṁ vetasave sacāhan tvaṁ tujiṁ gṛṇantam indra tūtoḥ
Griffith: Along with Vetasu thou slewest Tugra, and madest Tuji strong, who praised thee, Indra.
Devanāgarī: त्वं तुग्रं वेतसवे सचाहन्त्वं तुजिं गृणन्तमिन्द्र तूतोः
pada pāṭha: tvam | ratham | pra | bharaḥ | yodham | r̥ṣvam | āvaḥ | yudhyantam | vr̥ṣabham | daśa-dyum || tvam | tugram | vetasave | sacā | ahan | tvam | tujim | gr̥ṇantam | indra | tūtoriti tūtoḥ ||6.26.4||

IAST: tvaṁ tad uktham indra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yac chatā sahasrā śūra darṣi
Griffith: Thou madest good the laud, what time thou rentest a hundred thousand fighting foes, O Hero,
Devanāgarī: त्वं तदुक्थमिन्द्र बर्हणा कः प्र यच्छता सहस्रा शूर दर्षि
pada pāṭha: tvam | tat | uktham | indra | barhaṇā | kariti kaḥ | pra | yat | śatā | sahasrā | śūra | darṣi || ava | gireḥ | dāsam | śambaram | han | pra | āvaḥ | divaḥ-dāsam | citrābhiḥ | ūtī ||6.26.5||

IAST: ava girer dāsaṁ śambaraṁ han prāvo divodāsaṁ citrābhir ūtī
Griffith: Slewest the Dasa Sambara of the mountain, and with strange aids didst succour Divodasa.
Devanāgarī: अव गिरेर्दासं शम्बरं हन्प्रावो दिवोदासं चित्राभिरूती
pada pāṭha: tvam | tat | uktham | indra | barhaṇā | kariti kaḥ | pra | yat | śatā | sahasrā | śūra | darṣi || ava | gireḥ | dāsam | śambaram | han | pra | āvaḥ | divaḥ-dāsam | citrābhiḥ | ūtī ||6.26.5||

IAST: tvaṁ śraddhābhir mandasānaḥ somair dabhītaye cumurim indra siṣvap
Griffith: Made glad with Soma-draughts and faith, thou sentest Cumuri to his sleep, to please Dabhiti.
Devanāgarī: त्वं श्रद्धाभिर्मन्दसानः सोमैर्दभीतये चुमुरिमिन्द्र सिष्वप्
pada pāṭha: tvam | śraddhābhiḥ | mandasānaḥ | somaiḥ | dabhītaye | cumurim | indra | sisvap || tvam | rajim | piṭhīnase | daśasyan | ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | śacyā | sacā | ahan ||6.26.6||

IAST: tvaṁ rajim piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṁ sahasrā śacyā sacāhan
Griffith: Thou, kindly giving Raji to Pithinas, slewest with might, at once, the sixty thousand.
Devanāgarī: त्वं रजिं पिठीनसे दशस्यन्षष्टिं सहस्रा शच्या सचाहन्
pada pāṭha: tvam | śraddhābhiḥ | mandasānaḥ | somaiḥ | dabhītaye | cumurim | indra | sisvap || tvam | rajim | piṭhīnase | daśasyan | ṣaṣṭim | sahasrā | śacyā | sacā | ahan ||6.26.6||

IAST: ahaṁ cana tat sūribhir ānaśyāṁ tava jyāya indra sumnam ojaḥ
Griffith: May I too, with the liberal chiefs, O Indra, acquire thy blin supreme and domination,
Devanāgarī: अहं चन तत्सूरिभिरानश्यां तव ज्याय इन्द्र सुम्नमोजः
pada pāṭha: aham | cana | tat | sūri-bhiḥ | ānaśyām | tava | jyāyaḥ | indra | sumnam | ojaḥ || tvayā | yat | stavante | sadha-vīra | vīrāḥ | tri-varūthena | nahuṣā | śaviṣṭha ||6.26.7||

IAST: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrās trivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha
Griffith: When, Mightiest! Hero-girt! Nahusa heroes boast them in thee, the triply-strong Defender.
Devanāgarī: त्वया यत्स्तवन्ते सधवीर वीरास्त्रिवरूथेन नहुषा शविष्ठ
pada pāṭha: aham | cana | tat | sūri-bhiḥ | ānaśyām | tava | jyāyaḥ | indra | sumnam | ojaḥ || tvayā | yat | stavante | sadha-vīra | vīrāḥ | tri-varūthena | nahuṣā | śaviṣṭha ||6.26.7||

IAST: vayaṁ te asyām indra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: So may we he thy friends, thy best beloved, O Indra, at this holy invocation.
Devanāgarī: वयं ते अस्यामिन्द्र द्युम्नहूतौ सखायः स्याम महिन प्रेष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asyām | indra | dyumna-hūtau | sakhāyaḥ | syāma | mahina | preṣṭhāḥ || prātardaniḥ | kṣatra-śrīḥ | astu | śreṣṭhaḥ | ghane | vr̥trāṇām | sanaye | dhanānām ||6.26.8||

IAST: prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīr astu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṁ sanaye dhanānām
Griffith: Best be Pratardani, illustrious ruler, in slaying foemen and in gaining riches.
Devanāgarī: प्रातर्दनिः क्षत्रश्रीरस्तु श्रेष्ठो घने वृत्राणां सनये धनानाम्
pada pāṭha: vayam | te | asyām | indra | dyumna-hūtau | sakhāyaḥ | syāma | mahina | preṣṭhāḥ || prātardaniḥ | kṣatra-śrīḥ | astu | śreṣṭhaḥ | ghane | vr̥trāṇām | sanaye | dhanānām ||6.26.8||

IAST: kim asya made kim v asya pītāv indraḥ kim asya sakhye cakāra
Griffith: WHAT deed hath Indra done in the wild transport, in quaffing or in friendship with, the Soma?
Devanāgarī: किमस्य मदे किम्वस्य पीताविन्द्रः किमस्य सख्ये चकार
pada pāṭha: kim | asya | made | kim | ūm̐ iti | asya | pītau | indraḥ | kim | asya | sakhye | cakāra || raṇāḥ | vā | ye | ni-sadi | kim | te | asya | purā | vividre | kim | ūm̐ iti | nūtanāsaḥ ||6.27.1||

IAST: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṁ te asya purā vividre kim u nūtanāsaḥ
Griffith: What joys have men of ancient times or recent obtained within the chamber of libation?
Devanāgarī: रणा वा ये निषदि किं ते अस्य पुरा विविद्रे किमु नूतनासः
pada pāṭha: kim | asya | made | kim | ūm̐ iti | asya | pītau | indraḥ | kim | asya | sakhye | cakāra || raṇāḥ | vā | ye | ni-sadi | kim | te | asya | purā | vividre | kim | ūm̐ iti | nūtanāsaḥ ||6.27.1||

IAST: sad asya made sad v asya pītāv indraḥ sad asya sakhye cakāra
Griffith: In its wild joy Indra hath proved him faithful, faithful in quaffing, faithful in its friendship.
Devanāgarī: सदस्य मदे सद्वस्य पीताविन्द्रः सदस्य सख्ये चकार
pada pāṭha: sat | asya | made | sat | ūm̐ iti | asya | pītau | indraḥ | sat | asya | sakhye | cakāra || raṇāḥ | vā | ye | ni-sadi | sat | te | asya | purā | vividre | sat | ūm̐ iti | nūtanāsaḥ ||6.27.2||

IAST: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya purā vividre sad u nūtanāsaḥ
Griffith: His truth is the delight that in this chamber the men of old and recent times have tasted.
Devanāgarī: रणा वा ये निषदि सत्ते अस्य पुरा विविद्रे सदु नूतनासः
pada pāṭha: sat | asya | made | sat | ūm̐ iti | asya | pītau | indraḥ | sat | asya | sakhye | cakāra || raṇāḥ | vā | ye | ni-sadi | sat | te | asya | purā | vividre | sat | ūm̐ iti | nūtanāsaḥ ||6.27.2||

IAST: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma
Griffith: All thy vast power, O Maghavan, we know not, know not the riches of thy full abundance.
Devanāgarī: नहि नु ते महिमनः समस्य न मघवन्मघवत्त्वस्य विद्म
pada pāṭha: nahi | nu | te | mahimanaḥ | samasya | na | magha-van | maghavat-tvasya | vidma || na | rādhasaḥ-rādhasaḥ | nūtanasya | indra | nakiḥ | dadr̥śe | indriyam | te ||6.27.3||

IAST: na rādhaso-rādhaso nūtanasyendra nakir dadṛśa indriyaṁ te
Griffith: No one hath seen that might of thine, productive of bounty every day renewed, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: न राधसोराधसो नूतनस्येन्द्र नकिर्ददृश इन्द्रियं ते
pada pāṭha: nahi | nu | te | mahimanaḥ | samasya | na | magha-van | maghavat-tvasya | vidma || na | rādhasaḥ-rādhasaḥ | nūtanasya | indra | nakiḥ | dadr̥śe | indriyam | te ||6.27.3||

IAST: etat tyat ta indriyam aceti yenāvadhīr varaśikhasya śeṣaḥ
Griffith: This one great power of thine our eyes have witnessed, wherewith thou slewest Varasikha's children,
Devanāgarī: एतत्त्यत्त इन्द्रियमचेति येनावधीर्वरशिखस्य शेषः
pada pāṭha: etat | tyat | te | indriyam | aceti | yena | avadhīḥ | vara-śikhasya | śeṣaḥ || vajrasya | yat | te | ni-hatasya | śuṣmāt | svanāt | cit | indra | paramaḥ | dadāra ||6.27.4||

IAST: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāc cid indra paramo dadāra
Griffith: When by the force of thy descending thunder, at the mere solund, their boldest was demolished.
Devanāgarī: वज्रस्य यत्ते निहतस्य शुष्मात्स्वनाच्चिदिन्द्र परमो ददार
pada pāṭha: etat | tyat | te | indriyam | aceti | yena | avadhīḥ | vara-śikhasya | śeṣaḥ || vajrasya | yat | te | ni-hatasya | śuṣmāt | svanāt | cit | indra | paramaḥ | dadāra ||6.27.4||

IAST: vadhīd indro varaśikhasya śeṣo 'bhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan
Griffith: In aid of Abhyavartin Cayamana, Indra destroyed the seed of Varasikha.
Devanāgarī: वधीदिन्द्रो वरशिखस्य शेषोऽभ्यावर्तिने चायमानाय शिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: vadhīt | indraḥ | vara-śikhasya | śeṣaḥ | abhi-āvartine | cāyamānāya | śikṣan || vr̥cīvataḥ | yat | hari-yūpīyāyām | han | pūrve | ardhe | bhiyasā | aparaḥ | dart ||6.27.5||

IAST: vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṁ han pūrve ardhe bhiyasāparo dart
Griffith: At Hariyupiya he smote the vanguard of the Vrcivans, and the rear fled frighted.
Devanāgarī: वृचीवतो यद्धरियूपीयायां हन्पूर्वे अर्धे भियसापरो दर्त्
pada pāṭha: vadhīt | indraḥ | vara-śikhasya | śeṣaḥ | abhi-āvartine | cāyamānāya | śikṣan || vr̥cīvataḥ | yat | hari-yūpīyāyām | han | pūrve | ardhe | bhiyasā | aparaḥ | dart ||6.27.5||

IAST: triṁśacchataṁ varmiṇa indra sākaṁ yavyāvatyām puruhūta śravasyā
Griffith: Three thousand, mailed, in quest of fame, together, on the Yavyavati, O much-sought Indra,
Devanāgarī: त्रिंशच्छतं वर्मिण इन्द्र साकं यव्यावत्यां पुरुहूत श्रवस्या
pada pāṭha: triṁśat-śatam | varmiṇaḥ | indra | sākam | yavyā-vatyām | puru-hūta | śravasyā || vr̥cīvantaḥ | śarave | patyamānāḥ | pātrā | bhindānāḥ | ni-arthāni | āyan ||6.27.6||

IAST: vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānā nyarthāny āyan
Griffith: Vrcivan's sons, falling before the arrow, like bursting vessels went to their destruction.
Devanāgarī: वृचीवन्तः शरवे पत्यमानाः पात्रा भिन्दाना न्यर्थान्यायन्
pada pāṭha: triṁśat-śatam | varmiṇaḥ | indra | sākam | yavyā-vatyām | puru-hūta | śravasyā || vr̥cīvantaḥ | śarave | patyamānāḥ | pātrā | bhindānāḥ | ni-arthāni | āyan ||6.27.6||

IAST: yasya gāvāv aruṣā sūyavasyū antar ū ṣu carato rerihāṇā
Griffith: He, whose two red Steers, seeking goodly pasture, plying their tongues move on 'twixt earth and heaven,
Devanāgarī: यस्य गावावरुषा सूयवस्यू अन्तरू षु चरतो रेरिहाणा
pada pāṭha: yasya | gāvau | aruṣā | suyavasyū iti su-yavasyū | antaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | carataḥ | rerihāṇā || saḥ | sr̥ñjayāya | turvaśam | parā | adāt | vr̥cīvataḥ | daiva-vātāya | śikṣan ||6.27.7||

IAST: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśam parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāya śikṣan
Griffith: Gave Turvasa to Srnjaya, and, to aid him, gave the Vrcivans up to Daivavata.
Devanāgarī: स सृञ्जयाय तुर्वशं परादाद्वृचीवतो दैववाताय शिक्षन्
pada pāṭha: yasya | gāvau | aruṣā | suyavasyū iti su-yavasyū | antaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | carataḥ | rerihāṇā || saḥ | sr̥ñjayāya | turvaśam | parā | adāt | vr̥cīvataḥ | daiva-vātāya | śikṣan ||6.27.7||

IAST: dvayām̐ agne rathino viṁśatiṁ gā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṁ samrāṭ
Griffith: Two wagon-teams, with damsels, twenty oxen, O Agni, Abhydvartin Cayamdna,
Devanāgarī: द्वयाँ अग्ने रथिनो विंशतिं गा वधूमतो मघवा मह्यं सम्राट्
pada pāṭha: dvayān | agne | rathinaḥ | viṁśatim | gāḥ | vadhū-mataḥ | magha-vā | mahyam | sam-rāṭ || abhi-āvartī | cāyamānaḥ | dadāti | duḥ-nāśā | iyam | dakṣiṇā | pārthavānām ||6.27.8||

IAST: abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṁ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām
Griffith: The liberal Sovran, giveth me. This guerdon of Prthu's seed is hard to win from others.
Devanāgarī: अभ्यावर्ती चायमानो ददाति दूणाशेयं दक्षिणा पार्थवानाम्
pada pāṭha: dvayān | agne | rathinaḥ | viṁśatim | gāḥ | vadhū-mataḥ | magha-vā | mahyam | sam-rāṭ || abhi-āvartī | cāyamānaḥ | dadāti | duḥ-nāśā | iyam | dakṣiṇā | pārthavānām ||6.27.8||

IAST: ā gāvo agmann uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantv asme
Griffith: I. THE Kine have come and brought good fortune: let them rest in the cow-pen and be happy near us.
Devanāgarī: आ गावो अग्मन्नुत भद्रमक्रन्सीदन्तु गोष्ठे रणयन्त्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: ā | gāvaḥ | agman | uta | bhadram | akran | sīdantu | go-sthe | raṇayantu | asme iti || prajā-vatīḥ | puru-rūpāḥ | iha | syuḥ | indrāya | pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | duhānāḥ ||6.28.1||

IAST: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syur indrāya pūrvīr uṣaso duhānāḥ
Griffith: Here let them stay prolific, many-coloured, and yield through many morns their milk for Indra.
Devanāgarī: प्रजावतीः पुरुरूपा इह स्युरिन्द्राय पूर्वीरुषसो दुहानाः
pada pāṭha: ā | gāvaḥ | agman | uta | bhadram | akran | sīdantu | go-sthe | raṇayantu | asme iti || prajā-vatīḥ | puru-rūpāḥ | iha | syuḥ | indrāya | pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | duhānāḥ ||6.28.1||

IAST: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣaty uped dadāti na svam muṣāyati
Griffith: Indra aids him who offers sacrifice and gifts: he takes not what is his, and gives him more thereto.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो यज्वने पृणते च शिक्षत्युपेद्ददाति न स्वं मुषायति
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | yajvane | pr̥ṇate | ca | śikṣati | upa | it | dadāti | na | svam | muṣāyati || bhūyaḥ-bhūyaḥ | rayim | it | asya | vardhayan | abhinne | khilye | ni | dadhāti | deva-yum ||6.28.2||

IAST: bhūyo-bhūyo rayim id asya vardhayann abhinne khilye ni dadhāti devayum
Griffith: Increasing ever more and ever more his wealth, he makes the pious dwell within unbroken bounds.
Devanāgarī: भूयोभूयो रयिमिदस्य वर्धयन्नभिन्ने खिल्ये नि दधाति देवयुम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | yajvane | pr̥ṇate | ca | śikṣati | upa | it | dadāti | na | svam | muṣāyati || bhūyaḥ-bhūyaḥ | rayim | it | asya | vardhayan | abhinne | khilye | ni | dadhāti | deva-yum ||6.28.2||

IAST: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsām āmitro vyathir ā dadharṣati
Griffith: These are ne'er lost, no robber ever injures them: no evil-minded foe attempts to harass them.
Devanāgarī: न ता नशन्ति न दभाति तस्करो नासामामित्रो व्यथिरा दधर्षति
pada pāṭha: na | tāḥ | naśanti | na | dabhāti | taskaraḥ | na | āsām | āmitraḥ | vyathiḥ | ā | dadharṣati || devān | ca | yābhiḥ | yajate | dadāti | ca | jyok | it | tābhiḥ | sacate | go-patiḥ | saha ||6.28.3||

IAST: devām̐ś ca yābhir yajate dadāti ca jyog it tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha
Griffith: The master of the Kine lives many a year with these, the Cows whereby he pours his gifts and serves the
Devanāgarī: देवाँश्च याभिर्यजते ददाति च ज्योगित्ताभिः सचते गोपतिः सह
pada pāṭha: na | tāḥ | naśanti | na | dabhāti | taskaraḥ | na | āsām | āmitraḥ | vyathiḥ | ā | dadharṣati || devān | ca | yābhiḥ | yajate | dadāti | ca | jyok | it | tābhiḥ | sacate | go-patiḥ | saha ||6.28.3||

IAST: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṁskṛtatram upa yanti tā abhi
Griffith: The charger with his dusty brow o'ertakes them not, and never to the shambles do they take their way.
Devanāgarī: न ता अर्वा रेणुककाटो अश्नुते न संस्कृतत्रमुप यन्ति ता अभि
pada pāṭha: na | tāḥ | arvā | reṇu-kakāṭaḥ | aśnute | na | saṁskr̥ta-tram | upa | yanti | tāḥ | abhi || uru-gāyam | abhayam | tasya | tāḥ | anu | gāvaḥ | martasya | vi | caranti | yajvanaḥ ||6.28.4||

IAST: urugāyam abhayaṁ tasya tā anu gāvo martasya vi caranti yajvanaḥ
Griffith: These Cows, the cattle of the pious worshipper, roam over widespread pasture where no danger is.
Devanāgarī: उरुगायमभयं तस्य ता अनु गावो मर्तस्य वि चरन्ति यज्वनः
pada pāṭha: na | tāḥ | arvā | reṇu-kakāṭaḥ | aśnute | na | saṁskr̥ta-tram | upa | yanti | tāḥ | abhi || uru-gāyam | abhayam | tasya | tāḥ | anu | gāvaḥ | martasya | vi | caranti | yajvanaḥ ||6.28.4||

IAST: gāvo bhago gāva indro me acchān gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ
Griffith: To me the Cows seem Bhaga, they seem Indra, they seem a portion of the first-poured Soma.
Devanāgarī: गावो भगो गाव इन्द्रो मे अच्छान्गावः सोमस्य प्रथमस्य भक्षः
pada pāṭha: gāvaḥ | bhagaḥ | gāvaḥ | indraḥ | me | acchān | gāvaḥ | somasya | prathamasya | bhakṣaḥ || imāḥ | yāḥ | gāvaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ | icchāmi | it | hr̥dā | manasā | cit | indram ||6.28.5||

IAST: imā yā gāvaḥ sa janāsa indra icchāmīd dhṛdā manasā cid indram
Griffith: These present Cows, they, O ye Indra. I long for Indra with my heart and spirit.
Devanāgarī: इमा या गावः स जनास इन्द्र इच्छामीद्धृदा मनसा चिदिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: gāvaḥ | bhagaḥ | gāvaḥ | indraḥ | me | acchān | gāvaḥ | somasya | prathamasya | bhakṣaḥ || imāḥ | yāḥ | gāvaḥ | saḥ | janāsaḥ | indraḥ | icchāmi | it | hr̥dā | manasā | cit | indram ||6.28.5||

IAST: yūyaṁ gāvo medayathā kṛśaṁ cid aśrīraṁ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam
Griffith: O Cows, ye fatten e'en the worn and wasted, and make the unlovely beautiful tolook on.
Devanāgarī: यूयं गावो मेदयथा कृशं चिदश्रीरं चित्कृणुथा सुप्रतीकम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | gāvaḥ | medayatha | kr̥śam | cit | aśrīram | cit | kr̥ṇutha | su-pratīkam || bhadram | gr̥ham | kr̥ṇutha | bhadra-vācaḥ | br̥hat | vaḥ | vayaḥ | ucyate | sabhāsu ||6.28.6||

IAST: bhadraṁ gṛhaṁ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu
Griffith: Prosper my house, ye with auspicious voices. Your power is glorified in our assemblies.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं गृहं कृणुथ भद्रवाचो बृहद्वो वय उच्यते सभासु
pada pāṭha: yūyam | gāvaḥ | medayatha | kr̥śam | cit | aśrīram | cit | kr̥ṇutha | su-pratīkam || bhadram | gr̥ham | kr̥ṇutha | bhadra-vācaḥ | br̥hat | vaḥ | vayaḥ | ucyate | sabhāsu ||6.28.6||

IAST: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṁ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇe pibantīḥ
Griffith: Crop goodly pasturage and be prolific drink pure sweet water at good drinking places.
Devanāgarī: प्रजावतीः सूयवसं रिशन्तीः शुद्धा अपः सुप्रपाणे पिबन्तीः
pada pāṭha: prajā-vatīḥ | su-yavasam | riśantīḥ | śuddhāḥ | apaḥ | su-prapāne | pibantīḥ || mā | vaḥ | stenaḥ | īśata | mā | agha-śaṁsaḥ | pari | vaḥ | hetiḥ | rudrasya | vr̥jyāḥ ||6.28.7||

IAST: mā vaḥ stena īśata māghaśaṁsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ
Griffith: Never be thief or sinful man your matter, and may the dart of Rudra still avoid you.
Devanāgarī: मा वः स्तेन ईशत माघशंसः परि वो हेती रुद्रस्य वृज्याः
pada pāṭha: prajā-vatīḥ | su-yavasam | riśantīḥ | śuddhāḥ | apaḥ | su-prapāne | pibantīḥ || mā | vaḥ | stenaḥ | īśata | mā | agha-śaṁsaḥ | pari | vaḥ | hetiḥ | rudrasya | vr̥jyāḥ ||6.28.7||

IAST: upedam upaparcanam āsu goṣūpa pṛcyatām
Griffith: Now let this close admixture be close intermigled with these Cows,
Devanāgarī: उपेदमुपपर्चनमासु गोषूप पृच्यताम्
pada pāṭha: upa | idam | upa-parcanam | āsu | goṣu | upa | pr̥cyatām || upa | r̥ṣabhasya | retasi | upa | indra | tava | vīrye ||6.28.8||

IAST: upa ṛṣabhasya retasy upendra tava vīrye
Griffith: Mixt with the Steer's prolific flow, and, Indra, with thy hero might.
Devanāgarī: उप ऋषभस्य रेतस्युपेन्द्र तव वीर्ये
pada pāṭha: upa | idam | upa-parcanam | āsu | goṣu | upa | pr̥cyatām || upa | r̥ṣabhasya | retasi | upa | indra | tava | vīrye ||6.28.8||

IAST: indraṁ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepur maho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ
Griffith: YOUR men have followed Indra for his friendship, and for his loving-kindness glorified him.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं वो नरः सख्याय सेपुर्महो यन्तः सुमतये चकानाः
pada pāṭha: indram | vaḥ | naraḥ | sakhyāya | sepuḥ | mahaḥ | yantaḥ | su-mataye | cakānāḥ || mahaḥ | hi | dātā | vajra-hastaḥ | asti | mahām | ūm̐ iti | raṇvam | avase | yajadhvam ||6.29.1||

IAST: maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahām u raṇvam avase yajadhvam
