Griffith: For he bestows great wealth, the Thunder-wielder: worship him, Great and Kind, to win his favour.
Devanāgarī: महो हि दाता वज्रहस्तो अस्ति महामु रण्वमवसे यजध्वम्
pada pāṭha: indram | vaḥ | naraḥ | sakhyāya | sepuḥ | mahaḥ | yantaḥ | su-mataye | cakānāḥ || mahaḥ | hi | dātā | vajra-hastaḥ | asti | mahām | ūm̐ iti | raṇvam | avase | yajadhvam ||6.29.1||

IAST: ā yasmin haste naryā mimikṣur ā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Him to whose hand, men closely cling, and drivers stand on his golden chariot firmly stationed.
Devanāgarī: आ यस्मिन्हस्ते नर्या मिमिक्षुरा रथे हिरण्यये रथेष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | haste | naryāḥ | mimikṣuḥ | ā | rathe | hiraṇyaye | rathe-sthāḥ || ā | raśmayaḥ | gabhastyoḥ | sthūrayoḥ | ā | adhvan | aśvāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yujānāḥ ||6.29.2||

IAST: ā raśmayo gabhastyoḥ sthūrayor ādhvann aśvāso vṛṣaṇo yujānāḥ
Griffith: With his firm arms he holds the reins; his Horses, the Stallions, are yoked ready for the journey.
Devanāgarī: आ रश्मयो गभस्त्योः स्थूरयोराध्वन्नश्वासो वृषणो युजानाः
pada pāṭha: ā | yasmin | haste | naryāḥ | mimikṣuḥ | ā | rathe | hiraṇyaye | rathe-sthāḥ || ā | raśmayaḥ | gabhastyoḥ | sthūrayoḥ | ā | adhvan | aśvāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yujānāḥ ||6.29.2||

IAST: śriye te pādā duva ā mimikṣur dhṛṣṇur vajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān
Griffith: Thy devotees embrace thy feet for glory. Bold, thunder-armed, rich, through thy strength, in guerdon,
Devanāgarī: श्रिये ते पादा दुव आ मिमिक्षुर्धृष्णुर्वज्री शवसा दक्षिणावान्
pada pāṭha: śriye | te | pādā | duvaḥ | ā | mimikṣuḥ | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ | vajrī | śavasā | dakṣiṇa-vān || vasānaḥ | atkam | surabhim | dr̥śe | kam | svaḥ | na | nr̥to iti | iṣiraḥ | babhūtha ||6.29.3||

IAST: vasāno atkaṁ surabhiṁ dṛśe kaṁ svar ṇa nṛtav iṣiro babhūtha
Griffith: Robed in a garment fair as heaven to look on, thou hast displayed thee like an active dancer.
Devanāgarī: वसानो अत्कं सुरभिं दृशे कं स्वर्ण नृतविषिरो बभूथ
pada pāṭha: śriye | te | pādā | duvaḥ | ā | mimikṣuḥ | dhr̥ṣṇuḥ | vajrī | śavasā | dakṣiṇa-vān || vasānaḥ | atkam | surabhim | dr̥śe | kam | svaḥ | na | nr̥to iti | iṣiraḥ | babhūtha ||6.29.3||

IAST: sa soma āmiślatamaḥ suto bhūd yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santi dhānāḥ
Griffith: That Soma when effused hath best consistence, for which the food is dressed and grain is mingled;
Devanāgarī: स सोम आमिश्लतमः सुतो भूद्यस्मिन्पक्तिः पच्यते सन्ति धानाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | somaḥ | āmiśla-tamaḥ | sutaḥ | bhūt | yasmin | paktiḥ | pacyate | santi | dhānāḥ || indram | naraḥ | stuvantaḥ | brahma-kārāḥ | ukthā | śaṁsantaḥ | devavāta-tamāḥ ||6.29.4||

IAST: indraṁ naraḥ stuvanto brahmakārā ukthā śaṁsanto devavātatamāḥ
Griffith: By which the men who pray, extolling Indra chief favourites of Gods, recite their praises.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं नरः स्तुवन्तो ब्रह्मकारा उक्था शंसन्तो देववाततमाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | somaḥ | āmiśla-tamaḥ | sutaḥ | bhūt | yasmin | paktiḥ | pacyate | santi | dhānāḥ || indram | naraḥ | stuvantaḥ | brahma-kārāḥ | ukthā | śaṁsantaḥ | devavāta-tamāḥ ||6.29.4||

IAST: na te antaḥ śavaso dhāyy asya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā
Griffith: No limit of thy might hath been appointed, which by its greatness sundered earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: न ते अन्तः शवसो धाय्यस्य वि तु बाबधे रोदसी महित्वा
pada pāṭha: na | te | antaḥ | śavasaḥ | dhāyi | asya | vi | tu | bābadhe | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || ā | tā | sūriḥ | pr̥ṇati | tūtujānaḥ | yūthā-iva | ap-su | sam-ījamānaḥ | ūtī ||6.29.5||

IAST: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujāno yūthevāpsu samījamāna ūtī
Griffith: These the Prince filleth full with strong endeavour, driving, as 'twere, with help his flocks to waters
Devanāgarī: आ ता सूरिः पृणति तूतुजानो यूथेवाप्सु समीजमान ऊती
pada pāṭha: na | te | antaḥ | śavasaḥ | dhāyi | asya | vi | tu | bābadhe | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || ā | tā | sūriḥ | pr̥ṇati | tūtujānaḥ | yūthā-iva | ap-su | sam-ījamānaḥ | ūtī ||6.29.5||

IAST: eved indraḥ suhava ṛṣvo astūtī anūtī hiriśipraḥ satvā
Griffith: So be the lofty Indra prompt to listen, Helper unaided, golden-visored Hero.
Devanāgarī: एवेदिन्द्रः सुहव ऋष्वो अस्तूती अनूती हिरिशिप्रः सत्वा
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indraḥ | su-havaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | astu | ūtī | anūtī | hiri-śipraḥ | satvā || eva | hi | jātaḥ | asamāti-ojāḥ | puru | ca | vr̥trā | hanati | ni | dasyūn ||6.29.6||

IAST: evā hi jāto asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn
Griffith: Yea, so may he, shown forth in might unequalled, smite down the many Vrtras and the Dasyus.
Devanāgarī: एवा हि जातो असमात्योजाः पुरू च वृत्रा हनति नि दस्यून्
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indraḥ | su-havaḥ | r̥ṣvaḥ | astu | ūtī | anūtī | hiri-śipraḥ | satvā || eva | hi | jātaḥ | asamāti-ojāḥ | puru | ca | vr̥trā | hanati | ni | dasyūn ||6.29.6||

IAST: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyam̐ eko ajuryo dayate vasūni
Griffith: INDRA hath waxed yet more for hero prowess, alone, Eternal, he bestoweth treasures.
Devanāgarī: भूय इद्वावृधे वीर्यायँ एको अजुर्यो दयते वसूनि
pada pāṭha: bhūyaḥ | it | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | ekaḥ | ajuryaḥ | dayate | vasūni || pra | ririce | divaḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | ardham | it | asya | prati | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||6.30.1||

IAST: pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardham id asya prati rodasī ubhe
Griffith: Indra transcendeth both the worlds in greatness: one half of him equalleth earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: प्र रिरिचे दिव इन्द्रः पृथिव्या अर्धमिदस्य प्रति रोदसी उभे
pada pāṭha: bhūyaḥ | it | vavr̥dhe | vīryāya | ekaḥ | ajuryaḥ | dayate | vasūni || pra | ririce | divaḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | ardham | it | asya | prati | rodasī iti | ubhe iti ||6.30.1||

IAST: adhā manye bṛhad asuryam asya yāni dādhāra nakir ā mināti
Griffith: Yea, mighty I esteem his Godlike nature: none hindereth what he hath once determined.
Devanāgarī: अधा मन्ये बृहदसुर्यमस्य यानि दाधार नकिरा मिनाति
pada pāṭha: adha | manye | br̥hat | asuryam | asya | yāni | dādhāra | nakiḥ | ā | mināti || dive-dive | sūryaḥ | darśataḥ | bhūt | vi | sadmāni | urviyā | su-kratuḥ | dhāt ||6.30.2||

IAST: dive-dive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmāny urviyā sukratur dhāt
Griffith: Near and afar he spread and set the regions, and every day the Sun became apparent.
Devanāgarī: दिवेदिवे सूर्यो दर्शतो भूद्वि सद्मान्युर्विया सुक्रतुर्धात्
pada pāṭha: adha | manye | br̥hat | asuryam | asya | yāni | dādhāra | nakiḥ | ā | mināti || dive-dive | sūryaḥ | darśataḥ | bhūt | vi | sadmāni | urviyā | su-kratuḥ | dhāt ||6.30.2||

IAST: adyā cin nū cit tad apo nadīnāṁ yad ābhyo arado gātum indra
Griffith: E'en now endures thine exploit of the Rivers, when, Indra, for their floods thou clavest passage.
Devanāgarī: अद्या चिन्नू चित्तदपो नदीनां यदाभ्यो अरदो गातुमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: adya | cit | nu | cit | tat | apaḥ | nadīnām | yat | ābhyaḥ | aradaḥ | gātum | indra || ni | parvatāḥ | adma-sadaḥ | na | seduḥ | tvayā | dr̥ḷhāni | sukrato iti su-krato | rajāṁsi ||6.30.3||

IAST: ni parvatā admasado na sedus tvayā dṛḻhāni sukrato rajāṁsi
Griffith: Like men who sit at meat the mountains settled: by thee, Most Wise! the regions were made steadfast.
Devanāgarī: नि पर्वता अद्मसदो न सेदुस्त्वया दृळ्हानि सुक्रतो रजांसि
pada pāṭha: adya | cit | nu | cit | tat | apaḥ | nadīnām | yat | ābhyaḥ | aradaḥ | gātum | indra || ni | parvatāḥ | adma-sadaḥ | na | seduḥ | tvayā | dr̥ḷhāni | sukrato iti su-krato | rajāṁsi ||6.30.3||

IAST: satyam it tan na tvāvām̐ anyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān
Griffith: This is the truth, none else is like thee, Indra, no God superior to thee, no mortal.
Devanāgarī: सत्यमित्तन्न त्वावाँ अन्यो अस्तीन्द्र देवो न मर्त्यो ज्यायान्
pada pāṭha: satyam | it | tat | na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | asti | indra | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ | jyāyān || ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | ava | asr̥jaḥ | apaḥ | accha | samudram ||6.30.4||

IAST: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇo 'vāsṛjo apo acchā samudram
Griffith: Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and lettest loose the streams to hurry seaward.
Devanāgarī: अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णोऽवासृजो अपो अच्छा समुद्रम्
pada pāṭha: satyam | it | tat | na | tvā-vān | anyaḥ | asti | indra | devaḥ | na | martyaḥ | jyāyān || ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | ava | asr̥jaḥ | apaḥ | accha | samudram ||6.30.4||

IAST: tvam apo vi duro viṣūcīr indra dṛḻham arujaḥ parvatasya
Griffith: Indra, thou breakest up the floods and portals on all sides, and the firmness of the mountain.
Devanāgarī: त्वमपो वि दुरो विषूचीरिन्द्र दृळ्हमरुजः पर्वतस्य
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | vi | duraḥ | viṣūcīḥ | indra | dr̥ḷham | arujaḥ | parvatasya || rājā | abhavaḥ | jagataḥ | carṣaṇīnām | sākam | sūryam | janayan | dyām | uṣasam ||6.30.5||

IAST: rājābhavo jagataś carṣaṇīnāṁ sākaṁ sūryaṁ janayan dyām uṣāsam
Griffith: Thou art the King of men, of all that liveth, engendering at once Sun, Heaven, and Morning.
Devanāgarī: राजाभवो जगतश्चर्षणीनां साकं सूर्यं जनयन्द्यामुषासम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | apaḥ | vi | duraḥ | viṣūcīḥ | indra | dr̥ḷham | arujaḥ | parvatasya || rājā | abhavaḥ | jagataḥ | carṣaṇīnām | sākam | sūryam | janayan | dyām | uṣasam ||6.30.5||

IAST: abhūr eko rayipate rayīṇām ā hastayor adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
Griffith: SOLE Lord of wealth art thou, O Lord of riches: thou in thine hands hast held the people, Indra!
Devanāgarī: अभूरेको रयिपते रयीणामा हस्तयोरधिथा इन्द्र कृष्टीः
pada pāṭha: abhūḥ | ekaḥ | rayi-pate | rayīṇām | ā | hastayoḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ || vi | toke | ap-su | tanaye | ca | sūre | avocanta | carṣaṇayaḥ | vi-vācaḥ ||6.31.1||

IAST: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre 'vocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ
Griffith: Men have invoked thee with contending voices for seed and waters, progeny and sunlight.
Devanāgarī: वि तोके अप्सु तनये च सूरेऽवोचन्त चर्षणयो विवाचः
pada pāṭha: abhūḥ | ekaḥ | rayi-pate | rayīṇām | ā | hastayoḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ || vi | toke | ap-su | tanaye | ca | sūre | avocanta | carṣaṇayaḥ | vi-vācaḥ ||6.31.1||

IAST: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā cic cyāvayante rajāṁsi
Griffith: Through fear of thee, O Indra, all the regions of earth, though naught may move them, shake and tremble.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्भियेन्द्र पार्थिवानि विश्वाच्युता चिच्च्यावयन्ते रजांसि
pada pāṭha: tvat | bhiyā | indra | pārthivāni | viśvā | acyutā | cit | cyavayante | rajāṁsi || dyāvākṣāmā | parvatāsaḥ | vanāni | viśvam | dr̥ḷham | bhayate | ajman | ā | te ||6.31.2||

IAST: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāso vanāni viśvaṁ dṛḻham bhayate ajmann ā te
Griffith: All that is firm is frightened at thy coming, -the earth, the heaven, the mountain, and the forest.
Devanāgarī: द्यावाक्षामा पर्वतासो वनानि विश्वं दृळ्हं भयते अज्मन्ना ते
pada pāṭha: tvat | bhiyā | indra | pārthivāni | viśvā | acyutā | cit | cyavayante | rajāṁsi || dyāvākṣāmā | parvatāsaḥ | vanāni | viśvam | dr̥ḷham | bhayate | ajman | ā | te ||6.31.2||

IAST: tvaṁ kutsenābhi śuṣṇam indrāśuṣaṁ yudhya kuyavaṁ gaviṣṭau
Griffith: With Kutsa, Indra! thou didst conquer Susna, voracious, bane of crops, in fight for cattle.
Devanāgarī: त्वं कुत्सेनाभि शुष्णमिन्द्राशुषं युध्य कुयवं गविष्टौ
pada pāṭha: tvam | kutsena | abhi | śuṣṇam | indra | aśuṣam | yudhya | kuyavam | go-iṣṭau || daśa | pra-pitve | adha | sūryasya | muṣāyaḥ | cakram | aviveḥ | rapāṁsi ||6.31.3||

IAST: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaś cakram avive rapāṁsi
Griffith: In the close fray thou rentest him: thou stolest the Sun's wheel and didst drive away misfortunes.
Devanāgarī: दश प्रपित्वे अध सूर्यस्य मुषायश्चक्रमविवे रपांसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | kutsena | abhi | śuṣṇam | indra | aśuṣam | yudhya | kuyavam | go-iṣṭau || daśa | pra-pitve | adha | sūryasya | muṣāyaḥ | cakram | aviveḥ | rapāṁsi ||6.31.3||

IAST: tvaṁ śatāny ava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni dasyoḥ
Griffith: Thou smotest to the ground the hundred castles, impregnable, of Sambara the Dasyu,
Devanāgarī: त्वं शतान्यव शम्बरस्य पुरो जघन्थाप्रतीनि दस्योः
pada pāṭha: tvam | śatāni | ava | śambarasya | puraḥ | jaghantha | apratīni | dasyoḥ || aśikṣaḥ | yatra | śacyā | śacī-vaḥ | divaḥ-dāsāya | sunvate | suta-kre | bharat-vājāya | gr̥ṇate | vasūni ||6.31.4||

IAST: aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya gṛṇate vasūni
Griffith: When, Strong, with might thou holpest Divodasa who poured libations out, O Soma-buyer, and madest Bharad
Devanāgarī: अशिक्षो यत्र शच्या शचीवो दिवोदासाय सुन्वते सुतक्रे भरद्वाजाय गृणते वसूनि
pada pāṭha: tvam | śatāni | ava | śambarasya | puraḥ | jaghantha | apratīni | dasyoḥ || aśikṣaḥ | yatra | śacyā | śacī-vaḥ | divaḥ-dāsāya | sunvate | suta-kre | bharat-vājāya | gr̥ṇate | vasūni ||6.31.4||

IAST: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya ratham ā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam
Griffith: As such, true Hero, for great joy of battle mount thy terrific car, O Brave and Manly.
Devanāgarī: स सत्यसत्वन्महते रणाय रथमा तिष्ठ तुविनृम्ण भीमम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | satya-satvan | mahate | raṇāya | ratham | ā | tiṣṭha | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | bhīmam || yāhi | pra-pathin | avasā | upa | madrik | pra | ca | śruta | śravaya | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ ||6.31.5||

IAST: yāhi prapathinn avasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ
Griffith: Come with thine help to me, thou distant Roamer, and, glorious God, spread among men my glory.
Devanāgarī: याहि प्रपथिन्नवसोप मद्रिक्प्र च श्रुत श्रावय चर्षणिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | satya-satvan | mahate | raṇāya | ratham | ā | tiṣṭha | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | bhīmam || yāhi | pra-pathin | avasā | upa | madrik | pra | ca | śruta | śravaya | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ ||6.31.5||

IAST: apūrvyā purutamāny asmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya
Griffith: I WITH my lips have fashioned for this Hero words never matched, most plentiful and auspicious,
Devanāgarī: अपूर्व्या पुरुतमान्यस्मै महे वीराय तवसे तुराय
pada pāṭha: apūrvyā | puru-tamāni | asmai | mahe | vīrāya | tavase | turāya || vi-rapśine | vajriṇe | śam-tamāni | vacāṁsi | āsā | sthavirāya | takṣam ||6.32.1||

IAST: virapśine vajriṇe śaṁtamāni vacāṁsy āsā sthavirāya takṣam
Griffith: For him the Ancient, Great, Strong, Energetic, the very mighty Wielder of the Thunder.
Devanāgarī: विरप्शिने वज्रिणे शंतमानि वचांस्यासा स्थविराय तक्षम्
pada pāṭha: apūrvyā | puru-tamāni | asmai | mahe | vīrāya | tavase | turāya || vi-rapśine | vajriṇe | śam-tamāni | vacāṁsi | āsā | sthavirāya | takṣam ||6.32.1||

IAST: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnām avāsayad rujad adriṁ gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: Amid the sages, with the Sun he brightened the Parents: glorified, he burst the mountain;
Devanāgarī: स मातरा सूर्येणा कवीनामवासयद्रुजदद्रिं गृणानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | sūryeṇa | kavīnām | avāsayat | rujat | adrim | gr̥ṇānaḥ || su-ādhībhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | ut | usriyāṇām | asr̥jat | ni-dānam ||6.32.2||

IAST: svādhībhir ṛkvabhir vāvaśāna ud usriyāṇām asṛjan nidānam
Griffith: And, roaring with the holy-thoughted singers, he loosed the bond that held the beams of Morning.
Devanāgarī: स्वाधीभिरृक्वभिर्वावशान उदुस्रियाणामसृजन्निदानम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mātarā | sūryeṇa | kavīnām | avāsayat | rujat | adrim | gr̥ṇānaḥ || su-ādhībhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | vāvaśānaḥ | ut | usriyāṇām | asr̥jat | ni-dānam ||6.32.2||

IAST: sa vahnibhir ṛkvabhir goṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jigāya
Griffith: Famed for great deeds, with priests who kneel and laud him, he still hath conquered in the frays for cattl
Devanāgarī: स वह्निभिरृक्वभिर्गोषु शश्वन्मितज्ञुभिः पुरुकृत्वा जिगाय
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vahni-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | goṣu | śaśvat | mitajñu-bhiḥ | puru-kr̥tvā | jigāya || puraḥ | puraḥ-hā | sakhi-bhiḥ | sakhi-yan | dr̥ḷhāḥ | ruroja | kavi-bhiḥ | kaviḥ | san ||6.32.3||

IAST: puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḻhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
Griffith: And broken down the forts, the Fort-destroyer, a Friend with friends, a Sage among the sages.
Devanāgarī: पुरः पुरोहा सखिभिः सखीयन्दृळ्हा रुरोज कविभिः कविः सन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vahni-bhiḥ | r̥kva-bhiḥ | goṣu | śaśvat | mitajñu-bhiḥ | puru-kr̥tvā | jigāya || puraḥ | puraḥ-hā | sakhi-bhiḥ | sakhi-yan | dr̥ḷhāḥ | ruroja | kavi-bhiḥ | kaviḥ | san ||6.32.3||

IAST: sa nīvyābhir jaritāram acchā maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ
Griffith: Come with thy girthed mares, with abundant vigour and plenteous strength to him who sings thy praises.
Devanāgarī: स नीव्याभिर्जरितारमच्छा महो वाजेभिर्महद्भिश्च शुष्मैः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | nīvyābhiḥ | jaritāram | accha | mahaḥ | vājebhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | ca | śuṣmaiḥ || puru-vīrābhiḥ | vr̥ṣabha | kṣitīnām | ā | girvaṇaḥ | suvitāya | pra | yāhi ||6.32.4||

IAST: puruvīrābhir vṛṣabha kṣitīnām ā girvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi
Griffith: Come hither, borne by mares with many heroes, Lover of song! Steer! for the people's welfare.
Devanāgarī: पुरुवीराभिर्वृषभ क्षितीनामा गिर्वणः सुविताय प्र याहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | nīvyābhiḥ | jaritāram | accha | mahaḥ | vājebhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | ca | śuṣmaiḥ || puru-vīrābhiḥ | vr̥ṣabha | kṣitīnām | ā | girvaṇaḥ | suvitāya | pra | yāhi ||6.32.4||

IAST: sa sargeṇa śavasā takto atyair apa indro dakṣiṇatas turāṣāṭ
Griffith: Indra with rush and might, sped by his Coursers, hath swiftly won the waters from the southward.
Devanāgarī: स सर्गेण शवसा तक्तो अत्यैरप इन्द्रो दक्षिणतस्तुराषाट्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sargeṇa | śavasā | taktaḥ | atyaiḥ | apaḥ | indraḥ | dakṣiṇataḥ | turāṣāṭ || itthā | sr̥jānāḥ | anapa-vr̥t | artham | dive-dive | viviṣuḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam ||6.32.5||

IAST: itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛd arthaṁ dive-dive viviṣur apramṛṣyam
Griffith: Thus set at liberty the rivers daily flow to their goal, incessant and exhaustless.
Devanāgarī: इत्था सृजाना अनपावृदर्थं दिवेदिवे विविषुरप्रमृष्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sargeṇa | śavasā | taktaḥ | atyaiḥ | apaḥ | indraḥ | dakṣiṇataḥ | turāṣāṭ || itthā | sr̥jānāḥ | anapa-vr̥t | artham | dive-dive | viviṣuḥ | apra-mr̥ṣyam ||6.32.5||

IAST: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṁ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭir dāsvān
Griffith: GIVE us the rapture that is mightiest, Indra, prompt to bestow and swift to aid, O Hero,
Devanāgarī: य ओजिष्ठ इन्द्र तं सु नो दा मदो वृषन्स्वभिष्टिर्दास्वान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ojiṣṭhaḥ | indra | tam | su | naḥ | dāḥ | madaḥ | vr̥ṣan | su-abhiṣṭiḥ | dāsvān || sauvaśvyam | yaḥ | vanavat | su-aśvaḥ | vr̥trā | samat-su | sasahat | amitrān ||6.33.1||

IAST: sauvaśvyaṁ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahad amitrān
Griffith: That wins with brave steeds where brave steeds encounter, and quells the Vrtras and the foes in battle.
Devanāgarī: सौवश्व्यं यो वनवत्स्वश्वो वृत्रा समत्सु सासहदमित्रान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ojiṣṭhaḥ | indra | tam | su | naḥ | dāḥ | madaḥ | vr̥ṣan | su-abhiṣṭiḥ | dāsvān || sauvaśvyam | yaḥ | vanavat | su-aśvaḥ | vr̥trā | samat-su | sasahat | amitrān ||6.33.1||

IAST: tvāṁ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau
Griffith: For with loud voice the tribes invoke thee, Indra, to aid them in the battlefield of heroes.
Devanāgarī: त्वां हीन्द्रावसे विवाचो हवन्ते चर्षणयः शूरसातौ
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | indra | avase | vi-vācaḥ | havante | carṣaṇayaḥ | śūra-sātau || tvam | viprebhiḥ | vi | paṇīn | aśāyaḥ | tvā-ūtaḥ | it | sanitā | vājam | arvā ||6.33.2||

IAST: tvaṁ viprebhir vi paṇīm̐r aśāyas tvota it sanitā vājam arvā
Griffith: Thou, with the singers, hast pierced through the Panis: the charger whom thou aidest wins the booty.
Devanāgarī: त्वं विप्रेभिर्वि पणीँरशायस्त्वोत इत्सनिता वाजमर्वा
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | indra | avase | vi-vācaḥ | havante | carṣaṇayaḥ | śūra-sātau || tvam | viprebhiḥ | vi | paṇīn | aśāyaḥ | tvā-ūtaḥ | it | sanitā | vājam | arvā ||6.33.2||

IAST: tvaṁ tām̐ indrobhayām̐ amitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇy āryā ca śūra
Griffith: Both races, Indra, of opposing foemen, O Hero, both the Arya and the Dasa,
Devanāgarī: त्वं ताँ इन्द्रोभयाँ अमित्रान्दासा वृत्राण्यार्या च शूर
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | indra | ubhayān | amitrān | dāsā | vr̥trāṇi | āryā | ca | śūra || vadhīḥ | vanā-iva | su-dhitebhiḥ | atkaiḥ | ā | pr̥t-su | darṣi | nr̥ṇām | nr̥-tama ||6.33.3||

IAST: vadhīr vaneva sudhitebhir atkair ā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṁ nṛtama
Griffith: Hast thou struck down like woods with well-shot lightnings: thou rentest them in fight, most manly Chief
Devanāgarī: वधीर्वनेव सुधितेभिरत्कैरा पृत्सु दर्षि नृणां नृतम
pada pāṭha: tvam | tān | indra | ubhayān | amitrān | dāsā | vr̥trāṇi | āryā | ca | śūra || vadhīḥ | vanā-iva | su-dhitebhiḥ | atkaiḥ | ā | pr̥t-su | darṣi | nr̥ṇām | nr̥-tama ||6.33.3||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na indrākavābhir ūtī sakhā viśvāyur avitā vṛdhe bhūḥ
Griffith: Indra, befriend us with no scanty succour, prosper and aid us, Loved of all that liveth,
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न इन्द्राकवाभिरूती सखा विश्वायुरविता वृधे भूः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | akavābhiḥ | ūtī | sakhā | viśva-āyuḥ | avitā | vr̥dhe | bhūḥ || svaḥ-sātā | yat | hvayāmasi | tvā | yudhyantaḥ | nema-dhitā | pr̥t-su | śūra ||6.33.4||

IAST: svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitā pṛtsu śūra
Griffith: When, fighting for the sunlight, we invoke thee, O Hero, in the fray, in war's division.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्षाता यद्ध्वयामसि त्वा युध्यन्तो नेमधिता पृत्सु शूर
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | akavābhiḥ | ūtī | sakhā | viśva-āyuḥ | avitā | vr̥dhe | bhūḥ || svaḥ-sātā | yat | hvayāmasi | tvā | yudhyantaḥ | nema-dhitā | pr̥t-su | śūra ||6.33.4||

IAST: nūnaṁ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḻīka uta no abhiṣṭau
Griffith: Be ours, O Indra, now and for the future, be graciously inclined and near to help us.
Devanāgarī: नूनं न इन्द्रापराय च स्या भवा मृळीक उत नो अभिष्टौ
pada pāṭha: nūnam | naḥ | indra | aparāya | ca | syāḥ | bhava | mr̥ḷīkaḥ | uta | naḥ | abhiṣṭau || itthā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | mahinasya | śarman | divi | syāma | pārye | gosa-tamāḥ ||6.33.5||

IAST: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye goṣatamāḥ
Griffith: Thus may we, singing, sheltered by the Mighty, win many cattle on the day of trial.
Devanāgarī: इत्था गृणन्तो महिनस्य शर्मन्दिवि ष्याम पार्ये गोषतमाः
pada pāṭha: nūnam | naḥ | indra | aparāya | ca | syāḥ | bhava | mr̥ḷīkaḥ | uta | naḥ | abhiṣṭau || itthā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | mahinasya | śarman | divi | syāma | pārye | gosa-tamāḥ ||6.33.5||

IAST: saṁ ca tve jagmur gira indra pūrvīr vi ca tvad yanti vibhvo manīṣāḥ
Griffith: FULL Many songs have met in thee, O Indra, and many a noble thought from thee proceedeth.
Devanāgarī: सं च त्वे जग्मुर्गिर इन्द्र पूर्वीर्वि च त्वद्यन्ति विभ्वो मनीषाः
pada pāṭha: sam | ca | tve iti | jagmuḥ | giraḥ | indra | pūrvīḥ | vi | ca | tvat | yanti | vi-bhvaḥ | manīṣāḥ || purā | nūnam | ca | stutayaḥ | r̥ṣīṇām | paspr̥dhre | indre | adhi | uktha-arkā ||6.34.1||

IAST: purā nūnaṁ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇām paspṛdhra indre adhy ukthārkā
Griffith: Now and of old the eulogies of sages, their holy hymns and lauds, have yearned for Indra.
Devanāgarī: पुरा नूनं च स्तुतय ऋषीणां पस्पृध्र इन्द्रे अध्युक्थार्का
pada pāṭha: sam | ca | tve iti | jagmuḥ | giraḥ | indra | pūrvīḥ | vi | ca | tvat | yanti | vi-bhvaḥ | manīṣāḥ || purā | nūnam | ca | stutayaḥ | r̥ṣīṇām | paspr̥dhre | indre | adhi | uktha-arkā ||6.34.1||

IAST: puruhūto yaḥ purugūrta ṛbhvām̐ ekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ
Griffith: He, praised of many, bold, invoked of many, alone is glorified at sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: पुरुहूतो यः पुरुगूर्त ऋभ्वाँ एकः पुरुप्रशस्तो अस्ति यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: puru-hūtaḥ | yaḥ | puru-gūrtaḥ | r̥bhvā | ekaḥ | puru-praśastaḥ | asti | yajñaiḥ || rathaḥ | na | mahe | śavase | yujānaḥ | asmābhiḥ | indraḥ | anu-mādyaḥ | bhūt ||6.34.2||

IAST: ratho na mahe śavase yujāno 'smābhir indro anumādyo bhūt
Griffith: Like a car harnessed for some great achievement, Indra must be the cause of our rejoicing.
Devanāgarī: रथो न महे शवसे युजानोऽस्माभिरिन्द्रो अनुमाद्यो भूत्
pada pāṭha: puru-hūtaḥ | yaḥ | puru-gūrtaḥ | r̥bhvā | ekaḥ | puru-praśastaḥ | asti | yajñaiḥ || rathaḥ | na | mahe | śavase | yujānaḥ | asmābhiḥ | indraḥ | anu-mādyaḥ | bhūt ||6.34.2||

IAST: na yaṁ hiṁsanti dhītayo na vāṇīr indraṁ nakṣantīd abhi vardhayantīḥ
Griffith: They make their way to Indra and exalt him, bim whom no prayers and no laudations trouble;
Devanāgarī: न यं हिंसन्ति धीतयो न वाणीरिन्द्रं नक्षन्तीदभि वर्धयन्तीः
pada pāṭha: na | yam | hiṁsanti | dhītayaḥ | na | vāṇīḥ | indram | nakṣanti | it | abhi | vardhayantīḥ || yadi | stotāraḥ | śatam | yat | sahasram | gr̥ṇanti | girvaṇasam | śam | tat | asmai ||6.34.3||

IAST: yadi stotāraḥ śataṁ yat sahasraṁ gṛṇanti girvaṇasaṁ śaṁ tad asmai
Griffith: For when a hundred or a thousand singers. laud him who loves the song their praise delights him.
Devanāgarī: यदि स्तोतारः शतं यत्सहस्रं गृणन्ति गिर्वणसं शं तदस्मै
pada pāṭha: na | yam | hiṁsanti | dhītayaḥ | na | vāṇīḥ | indram | nakṣanti | it | abhi | vardhayantīḥ || yadi | stotāraḥ | śatam | yat | sahasram | gr̥ṇanti | girvaṇasam | śam | tat | asmai ||6.34.3||

IAST: asmā etad divy arceva māsā mimikṣa indre ny ayāmi somaḥ
Griffith: As brightness mingles with the Moon in heaven, the offered Soma yearns to mix with Indra.
Devanāgarī: अस्मा एतद्दिव्यर्चेव मासा मिमिक्ष इन्द्रे न्ययामि सोमः
pada pāṭha: asmai | etat | divi | arcā-iva | māsā | mimikṣaḥ | indre | ni | ayāmi | somaḥ || janam | na | dhanvan | abhi | sam | yat | āpaḥ | satrā | vavr̥dhuḥ | havanāni | yajñaiḥ ||6.34.4||

IAST: janaṁ na dhanvann abhi saṁ yad āpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhur havanāni yajñaiḥ
Griffith: Like water brought to men in desert places, our gifts at sacrifice have still refreshed him.
Devanāgarī: जनं न धन्वन्नभि सं यदापः सत्रा वावृधुर्हवनानि यज्ञैः
pada pāṭha: asmai | etat | divi | arcā-iva | māsā | mimikṣaḥ | indre | ni | ayāmi | somaḥ || janam | na | dhanvan | abhi | sam | yat | āpaḥ | satrā | vavr̥dhuḥ | havanāni | yajñaiḥ ||6.34.4||

IAST: asmā etan mahy āṅgūṣam asmā indrāya stotram matibhir avāci
Griffith: To him this mighty eulogy, to Indra hath this our laud been uttered by the poets,
Devanāgarī: अस्मा एतन्मह्याङ्गूषमस्मा इन्द्राय स्तोत्रं मतिभिरवाचि
pada pāṭha: asmai | etat | mahi | āṅgūṣam | asmai | indrāya | stotram | mati-bhiḥ | avāci || asat | yathā | mahati | vr̥tra-tūrye | indraḥ | viśva-āyuḥ | avitā | vr̥dhaḥ | ca ||6.34.5||

IAST: asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyur avitā vṛdhaś ca
Griffith: That in the great encounter with the foemen, Loved of all life, Indra may guard and help us.
Devanāgarī: असद्यथा महति वृत्रतूर्य इन्द्रो विश्वायुरविता वृधश्च
pada pāṭha: asmai | etat | mahi | āṅgūṣam | asmai | indrāya | stotram | mati-bhiḥ | avāci || asat | yathā | mahati | vr̥tra-tūrye | indraḥ | viśva-āyuḥ | avitā | vr̥dhaḥ | ca ||6.34.5||

IAST: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyaṁ dāḥ
Griffith: WHEN shall our prayers rest in thy car beside thee? When dost thou give the singer food for thousands?
Devanāgarī: कदा भुवन्रथक्षयाणि ब्रह्म कदा स्तोत्रे सहस्रपोष्यं दाः
pada pāṭha: kadā | bhuvan | ratha-kṣayāṇi | brahma | kadā | stotre | sahasra-poṣyam | dāḥ || kadā | stomam | vāsayaḥ | asya | rāyā | kadā | dhiyaḥ | karasi | vāja-ratnāḥ ||6.35.1||

IAST: kadā stomaṁ vāsayo 'sya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ
Griffith: When wilt thou clothe this poet's laud with plenty, and when wilt thou enrich our hymns with booty?
Devanāgarī: कदा स्तोमं वासयोऽस्य राया कदा धियः करसि वाजरत्नाः
pada pāṭha: kadā | bhuvan | ratha-kṣayāṇi | brahma | kadā | stotre | sahasra-poṣyam | dāḥ || kadā | stomam | vāsayaḥ | asya | rāyā | kadā | dhiyaḥ | karasi | vāja-ratnāḥ ||6.35.1||

IAST: karhi svit tad indra yan nṛbhir nṝn vīrair vīrān nīḻayāse jayājīn
Griffith: When wilt thou gatber men with men, O Indra, heroes with heroes, and prevail in combat?
Devanāgarī: कर्हि स्वित्तदिन्द्र यन्नृभिर्नॄन्वीरैर्वीरान्नीळयासे जयाजीन्
pada pāṭha: karhi | svit | tat | indra | yat | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥̄n | vīraiḥ | vīrān | nīḷayāse | jaya | ājīn || tri-dhātu | gāḥ | adhi | jayāsi | goṣu | indra | dyumnam | svaḥ-vat | dhehi | asme iti ||6.35.2||

IAST: tridhātu gā adhi jayāsi goṣv indra dyumnaṁ svarvad dhehy asme
Griffith: Thou shalt win triply kine in frays for cattle, so, Indra, give thou us celestial glory.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधातु गा अधि जयासि गोष्विन्द्र द्युम्नं स्वर्वद्धेह्यस्मे
pada pāṭha: karhi | svit | tat | indra | yat | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥̄n | vīraiḥ | vīrān | nīḷayāse | jaya | ājīn || tri-dhātu | gāḥ | adhi | jayāsi | goṣu | indra | dyumnam | svaḥ-vat | dhehi | asme iti ||6.35.2||

IAST: karhi svit tad indra yaj jaritre viśvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha
Griffith: Yea, when wilt thou, O Indra, thou Most Mighty, make the prayer all-sustaining for the singer?
Devanāgarī: कर्हि स्वित्तदिन्द्र यज्जरित्रे विश्वप्सु ब्रह्म कृणवः शविष्ठ
pada pāṭha: karhi | svit | tat | indra | yat | jaritre | viśva-psu | brahma | kr̥ṇavaḥ | śaviṣṭha || kadā | dhiyaḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | yuvāse | kadā | go-maghā | havanāni | gacchāḥ ||6.35.3||

IAST: kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā gomaghā havanāni gacchāḥ
Griffith: When wilt thou yoke, as we yoke songs, thy Horses, and come to offerings that bring wealth in cattle?
Devanāgarī: कदा धियो न नियुतो युवासे कदा गोमघा हवनानि गच्छाः
pada pāṭha: karhi | svit | tat | indra | yat | jaritre | viśva-psu | brahma | kr̥ṇavaḥ | śaviṣṭha || kadā | dhiyaḥ | na | ni-yutaḥ | yuvāse | kadā | go-maghā | havanāni | gacchāḥ ||6.35.3||

IAST: sa gomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ
Griffith: Grant to the Singer food with store of cattle, splendid with horses and the fame of riches.
Devanāgarī: स गोमघा जरित्रे अश्वश्चन्द्रा वाजश्रवसो अधि धेहि पृक्षः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | go-maghāḥ | jaritre | aśva-candrāḥ | vāja-śravasaḥ | adhi | dhehi | pr̥kṣaḥ || pīpihi | iṣaḥ | su-dughām | indra | dhenum | bharat-vājeṣu | su-rucaḥ | rurucyāḥ ||6.35.4||

IAST: pīpihīṣaḥ sudughām indra dhenum bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ
Griffith: Send food to swell the milch-cow good at milking: bright be its shine among the Bharadvajas.
Devanāgarī: पीपिहीषः सुदुघामिन्द्र धेनुं भरद्वाजेषु सुरुचो रुरुच्याः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | go-maghāḥ | jaritre | aśva-candrāḥ | vāja-śravasaḥ | adhi | dhehi | pr̥kṣaḥ || pīpihi | iṣaḥ | su-dughām | indra | dhenum | bharat-vājeṣu | su-rucaḥ | rurucyāḥ ||6.35.4||

IAST: tam ā nūnaṁ vṛjanam anyathā cic chūro yac chakra vi duro gṛṇīṣe
Griffith: Lead otherwise this present foeman, Sakra! Hence art thou praised as Hero, foe destroyer
Devanāgarī: तमा नूनं वृजनमन्यथा चिच्छूरो यच्छक्र वि दुरो गृणीषे
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | nūnam | vr̥janam | anyathā | cit | śūraḥ | yat | śakra | vi | duraḥ | gr̥ṇīṣe || mā | niḥ | aram | śukra-dughasya | dhenoḥ | āṅgirasān | brahmaṇā | vipra | jinva ||6.35.5||

IAST: mā nir araṁ śukradughasya dhenor āṅgirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva
Griffith: Him who gives pure gifts may I praise unceasing. Sage, quicken the Angirases by devotion.
Devanāgarī: मा निररं शुक्रदुघस्य धेनोराङ्गिरसान्ब्रह्मणा विप्र जिन्व
pada pāṭha: tam | ā | nūnam | vr̥janam | anyathā | cit | śūraḥ | yat | śakra | vi | duraḥ | gr̥ṇīṣe || mā | niḥ | aram | śukra-dughasya | dhenoḥ | āṅgirasān | brahmaṇā | vipra | jinva ||6.35.5||

IAST: satrā madāsas tava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo 'dha ye pārthivāsaḥ
Griffith: THY raptures ever were for all men's profit: so evermore have been thine earthly riches.
Devanāgarī: सत्रा मदासस्तव विश्वजन्याः सत्रा रायोऽध ये पार्थिवासः
pada pāṭha: satrā | madāsaḥ | tava | viśva-janyāḥ | satrā | rāyaḥ | adha | ye | pārthivāsaḥ || satrā | vājānām | abhavaḥ | vi-bhaktā | yat | deveṣu | dhārayathāḥ | asuryam ||6.36.1||

IAST: satrā vājānām abhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam
Griffith: Thou still hast been the dealer-forth of vigour, since among Gods thou hast had power and Godhead.
Devanāgarī: सत्रा वाजानामभवो विभक्ता यद्देवेषु धारयथा असुर्यम्
pada pāṭha: satrā | madāsaḥ | tava | viśva-janyāḥ | satrā | rāyaḥ | adha | ye | pārthivāsaḥ || satrā | vājānām | abhavaḥ | vi-bhaktā | yat | deveṣu | dhārayathāḥ | asuryam ||6.36.1||

IAST: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya
Griffith: Men have obtained his strength by sacrificing, and ever urged him, on to hero valour.
Devanāgarī: अनु प्र येजे जन ओजो अस्य सत्रा दधिरे अनु वीर्याय
pada pāṭha: anu | pra | yeje | janaḥ | ojaḥ | asya | satrā | dadhire | anu | vīryāya || syūma-gr̥bhe | dudhaye | arvate | ca | kratum | vr̥ñjanti | api | vr̥tra-hatye ||6.36.2||

IAST: syūmagṛbhe dudhaye 'rvate ca kratuṁ vṛñjanty api vṛtrahatye
Griffith: For the rein-seizing, the impetuous Charger they furnished power even for Vrtra's slaughter.
Devanāgarī: स्यूमगृभे दुधयेऽर्वते च क्रतुं वृञ्जन्त्यपि वृत्रहत्ये
pada pāṭha: anu | pra | yeje | janaḥ | ojaḥ | asya | satrā | dadhire | anu | vīryāya || syūma-gr̥bhe | dudhaye | arvate | ca | kratum | vr̥ñjanti | api | vr̥tra-hatye ||6.36.2||

IAST: taṁ sadhrīcīr ūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṁsyāni niyutaḥ saścur indram
Griffith: Associate with him, as teams of horses, help, manly might, and vigour follow Indra.
Devanāgarī: तं सध्रीचीरूतयो वृष्ण्यानि पौंस्यानि नियुतः सश्चुरिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: tam | sadhrīcīḥ | ūtayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇyāni | pauṁsyāni | ni-yutaḥ | saścuḥ | indram || samudram | na | sindhavaḥ | uktha-śuṣmāḥ | uru-vyacasam | giraḥ | ā | viśanti ||6.36.3||

IAST: samudraṁ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṁ gira ā viśanti
Griffith: As rivers reach the sea, so, strong with praises, our holy songs reach him the Comprehensive.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रं न सिन्धव उक्थशुष्मा उरुव्यचसं गिर आ विशन्ति
pada pāṭha: tam | sadhrīcīḥ | ūtayaḥ | vr̥ṣṇyāni | pauṁsyāni | ni-yutaḥ | saścuḥ | indram || samudram | na | sindhavaḥ | uktha-śuṣmāḥ | uru-vyacasam | giraḥ | ā | viśanti ||6.36.3||

IAST: sa rāyas khām upa sṛjā gṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvam indra vasvaḥ
Griffith: Lauded by us, let flow the spring, O Indra, of excellent and brightly-shining riches.
Devanāgarī: स रायस्खामुप सृजा गृणानः पुरुश्चन्द्रस्य त्वमिन्द्र वस्वः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rāyaḥ | khām | upa | sr̥ja | gr̥ṇānaḥ | puru-candrasya | tvam | indra | vasvaḥ || patiḥ | babhūtha | asamaḥ | janānām | ekaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā ||6.36.4||

IAST: patir babhūthāsamo janānām eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
Griffith: For thou art Lord of men, without an equal: of all the world thou art the only Sovran.
Devanāgarī: पतिर्बभूथासमो जनानामेको विश्वस्य भुवनस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rāyaḥ | khām | upa | sr̥ja | gr̥ṇānaḥ | puru-candrasya | tvam | indra | vasvaḥ || patiḥ | babhūtha | asamaḥ | janānām | ekaḥ | viśvasya | bhuvanasya | rājā ||6.36.4||

IAST: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyur dyaur na bhūmābhi rāyo aryaḥ
Griffith: Hear what thou mayst hear, thou who, fain for worship, as heaven girds earth, guardest thy servant's treas
Devanāgarī: स तु श्रुधि श्रुत्या यो दुवोयुर्द्यौर्न भूमाभि रायो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | śrudhi | śrutyā | yaḥ | duvaḥ-yuḥ | dyauḥ | na | bhūma | abhi | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || asaḥ | yathā | naḥ | śavasā | cakānaḥ | yuge-yuge | vayasā | cekitānaḥ ||6.36.5||

IAST: aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yuge-yuge vayasā cekitānaḥ
Griffith: Tlat thou mayst be our own, joying in power, famed through thy might in every generation.
Devanāgarī: असो यथा नः शवसा चकानो युगेयुगे वयसा चेकितानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | śrudhi | śrutyā | yaḥ | duvaḥ-yuḥ | dyauḥ | na | bhūma | abhi | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || asaḥ | yathā | naḥ | śavasā | cakānaḥ | yuge-yuge | vayasā | cekitānaḥ ||6.36.5||

IAST: arvāg rathaṁ viśvavāraṁ ta ugrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu
Griffith: LET thy Bay Horses, yoked, O mighty Indra, bring thy car hither fraught with every blessing.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाग्रथं विश्ववारं त उग्रेन्द्र युक्तासो हरयो वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: arvāk | ratham | viśva-vāram | te | ugra | indra | yuktāsaḥ | harayaḥ | vahantu || kīriḥ | cit | hi | tvā | havate | svaḥ-vān | r̥dhīmahi | sadha-mādaḥ | te | adya ||6.37.1||

IAST: kīriś cid dhi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādas te adya
Griffith: For thee, the Heavenly, e'en the poor invoketh: may we this day, thy feast-companions, prosper.
Devanāgarī: कीरिश्चिद्धि त्वा हवते स्वर्वानृधीमहि सधमादस्ते अद्य
pada pāṭha: arvāk | ratham | viśva-vāram | te | ugra | indra | yuktāsaḥ | harayaḥ | vahantu || kīriḥ | cit | hi | tvā | havate | svaḥ-vān | r̥dhīmahi | sadha-mādaḥ | te | adya ||6.37.1||

IAST: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāgman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan
Griffith: Forth to the vat the brown drops flow for service, and purified proceed directly forward.
Devanāgarī: प्रो द्रोणे हरयः कर्माग्मन्पुनानास ऋज्यन्तो अभूवन्
pada pāṭha: pro iti | droṇe | harayaḥ | karma | agman | punānāsaḥ | r̥jyantaḥ | abhūvan || indraḥ | naḥ | asya | pūrvyaḥ | pāpīyāt | dyukṣaḥ | madasya | somyasya | rājā ||6.37.2||

IAST: indro no asya pūrvyaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā
Griffith: May Indra drink of this, our guest aforetime, Celestial King of the strong draught of Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो नो अस्य पूर्व्यः पपीयाद्द्युक्षो मदस्य सोम्यस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: pro iti | droṇe | harayaḥ | karma | agman | punānāsaḥ | r̥jyantaḥ | abhūvan || indraḥ | naḥ | asya | pūrvyaḥ | pāpīyāt | dyukṣaḥ | madasya | somyasya | rājā ||6.37.2||

IAST: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānam acchendraṁ sucakre rathyāso aśvāḥ
Griffith: Bringing us hitherward all-potent Indra on well-wheeled chariot, may the Steeds who bear him
Devanāgarī: आसस्राणासः शवसानमच्छेन्द्रं सुचक्रे रथ्यासो अश्वाः
pada pāṭha: ā-sasrāṇāsaḥ | śavasānam | accha | indram | su-cakre | rathyāsaḥ | aśvāḥ || abhi | śravaḥ | r̥jyantaḥ | vaheyuḥ | nu | cit | nu | vāyoḥ | amr̥tam | vi | dasyet ||6.37.3||

IAST: abhi śrava ṛjyanto vaheyur nū cin nu vāyor amṛtaṁ vi dasyet
Griffith: Convey him on the road direct to glory, and ne'er may Vayu's Amrta cease and fail him.
Devanāgarī: अभि श्रव ऋज्यन्तो वहेयुर्नू चिन्नु वायोरमृतं वि दस्येत्
pada pāṭha: ā-sasrāṇāsaḥ | śavasānam | accha | indram | su-cakre | rathyāsaḥ | aśvāḥ || abhi | śravaḥ | r̥jyantaḥ | vaheyuḥ | nu | cit | nu | vāyoḥ | amr̥tam | vi | dasyet ||6.37.3||

IAST: variṣṭho asya dakṣiṇām iyartīndro maghonāṁ tuvikūrmitamaḥ
Griffith: Supreme, he stirs this man to give the guerdon,-Indra, most efficacious of the princes,-
Devanāgarī: वरिष्ठो अस्य दक्षिणामियर्तीन्द्रो मघोनां तुविकूर्मितमः
pada pāṭha: variṣṭhaḥ | asya | dakṣiṇām | iyarti | indraḥ | maghonām | tuvikūrmi-tamaḥ || yayā | vajri-vaḥ | pari-yāsi | aṁhaḥ | maghā | ca | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dayase | vi | sūrīn ||6.37.4||

IAST: yayā vajrivaḥ pariyāsy aṁho maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn
Griffith: Wherewith, O Thunderer, thou removest sorrow, and, Bold One! partest wealth among the nobles.
Devanāgarī: यया वज्रिवः परियास्यंहो मघा च धृष्णो दयसे वि सूरीन्
pada pāṭha: variṣṭhaḥ | asya | dakṣiṇām | iyarti | indraḥ | maghonām | tuvikūrmi-tamaḥ || yayā | vajri-vaḥ | pari-yāsi | aṁhaḥ | maghā | ca | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dayase | vi | sūrīn ||6.37.4||

IAST: indro vājasya sthavirasya dātendro gīrbhir vardhatāṁ vṛddhamahāḥ
Griffith: Indra is hewho gives enduring vigour: may our songs magnify the God Most Mighty.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वाजस्य स्थविरस्य दातेन्द्रो गीर्भिर्वर्धतां वृद्धमहाः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vājasya | sthavirasya | dātā | indraḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vardhatām | vr̥ddha-mahāḥ || indraḥ | vr̥tram | haniṣṭhaḥ | astu | satvā | ā | tā | sūriḥ | pr̥ṇati | tūtujānaḥ ||6.37.5||

IAST: indro vṛtraṁ haniṣṭho astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ
Griffith: Best Vrtra-slayer be the Hero Indra these things he gives as Prince, with strong endeavour.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वृत्रं हनिष्ठो अस्तु सत्वा ता सूरिः पृणति तूतुजानः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | vājasya | sthavirasya | dātā | indraḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vardhatām | vr̥ddha-mahāḥ || indraḥ | vr̥tram | haniṣṭhaḥ | astu | satvā | ā | tā | sūriḥ | pr̥ṇati | tūtujānaḥ ||6.37.5||

IAST: apād ita ud u naś citratamo mahīm bharṣad dyumatīm indrahūtim
Griffith: HE hath drunk hence, Most Marvellous, and carried away our great and splendid call on Indra.
Devanāgarī: अपादित उदु नश्चित्रतमो महीं भर्षद्द्युमतीमिन्द्रहूतिम्
pada pāṭha: apāt | itaḥ | ut | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | citra-tamaḥ | mahīm | bharṣat | dyu-matīm | indra-hūtim || panyasīm | dhītim | daivyasya | yāman | janasya | rātim | vanate | su-dānuḥ ||6.38.1||

IAST: panyasīṁ dhītiṁ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṁ vanate sudānuḥ
Griffith: The Bounteous, when we serve the Gods, accepteth song yet more famous and the gifts we bring him.
Devanāgarī: पन्यसीं धीतिं दैव्यस्य यामञ्जनस्य रातिं वनते सुदानुः
pada pāṭha: apāt | itaḥ | ut | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | citra-tamaḥ | mahīm | bharṣat | dyu-matīm | indra-hūtim || panyasīm | dhītim | daivyasya | yāman | janasya | rātim | vanate | su-dānuḥ ||6.38.1||

IAST: dūrāc cid ā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣād indrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ
Griffith: The speaker filleth with a cry to Indra his ears who cometh nigh e'en from a distance.
Devanāgarī: दूराच्चिदा वसतो अस्य कर्णा घोषादिन्द्रस्य तन्यति ब्रुवाणः
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | cit | ā | vasataḥ | asya | karṇā | ghoṣāt | indrasya | tanyati | bruvāṇaḥ || ā | iyam | enam | deva-hūtiḥ | vavr̥tyāt | madryak | indram | iyam | r̥cyamānā ||6.38.2||

IAST: eyam enaṁ devahūtir vavṛtyān madryag indram iyam ṛcyamānā
Griffith: May this my call bring Indra to my presence, this call to Gods composed in sacred verses.
Devanāgarī: एयमेनं देवहूतिर्ववृत्यान्मद्र्यगिन्द्रमियमृच्यमाना
pada pāṭha: dūrāt | cit | ā | vasataḥ | asya | karṇā | ghoṣāt | indrasya | tanyati | bruvāṇaḥ || ā | iyam | enam | deva-hūtiḥ | vavr̥tyāt | madryak | indram | iyam | r̥cyamānā ||6.38.2||

IAST: taṁ vo dhiyā paramayā purājām ajaram indram abhy anūṣy arkaiḥ
Griffith: Him have I sung with my best song and praises, Indra of ancient birth and Everlasting.
Devanāgarī: तं वो धिया परमया पुराजामजरमिन्द्रमभ्यनूष्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dhiyā | paramayā | purā-jām | ajaram | indram | abhi | anūṣi | arkaiḥ || brahma | ca | giraḥ | dadhire | sam | asmin | mahān | ca | stomaḥ | adhi | vardhat | indre ||6.38.3||

IAST: brahmā ca giro dadhire sam asmin mahām̐ś ca stomo adhi vardhad indre
Griffith: For prayer and songs in him are concentrated: let laud wax mighty when addressed to Indra:
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मा च गिरो दधिरे समस्मिन्महाँश्च स्तोमो अधि वर्धदिन्द्रे
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | dhiyā | paramayā | purā-jām | ajaram | indram | abhi | anūṣi | arkaiḥ || brahma | ca | giraḥ | dadhire | sam | asmin | mahān | ca | stomaḥ | adhi | vardhat | indre ||6.38.3||

IAST: vardhād yaṁ yajña uta soma indraṁ vardhād brahma gira ukthā ca manma
Griffith: Indra, whom sacrifice shall strengthen, Soma, and song and hymn, and praises and devotion,
Devanāgarī: वर्धाद्यं यज्ञ उत सोम इन्द्रं वर्धाद्ब्रह्म गिर उक्था च मन्म
pada pāṭha: vardhāt | yam | yajñaḥ | uta | somaḥ | indram | vardhāt | brahma | giraḥ | ukthā | ca | manma || vardha | aha | enam | uṣasaḥ | yāman | aktoḥ | vardhān | māsāḥ | śaradaḥ | dyāvaḥ | indram ||6.38.4||

IAST: vardhāhainam uṣaso yāmann aktor vardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram
Griffith: Whom Dawns shall strengthen when the night departeth, Indra whom days shall strengthen, months, and aut
Devanāgarī: वर्धाहैनमुषसो यामन्नक्तोर्वर्धान्मासाः शरदो द्याव इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: vardhāt | yam | yajñaḥ | uta | somaḥ | indram | vardhāt | brahma | giraḥ | ukthā | ca | manma || vardha | aha | enam | uṣasaḥ | yāman | aktoḥ | vardhān | māsāḥ | śaradaḥ | dyāvaḥ | indram ||6.38.4||

IAST: evā jajñānaṁ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṁ rādhase ca śrutāya
Griffith: Him, born for conquering might in full perfection, and waxen strongfor bounty and for glory,
Devanāgarī: एवा जज्ञानं सहसे असामि वावृधानं राधसे च श्रुताय
pada pāṭha: eva | jajñānam | sahase | asāmi | vavr̥dhānam | rādhase | ca | śrutāya || mahām | ugram | avase | vipra | nūnam | ā | vivāsema | vr̥tra-tūryeṣu ||6.38.5||

IAST: mahām ugram avase vipra nūnam ā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu
Griffith: Great, Powerful, will we to-day, O singer, invite to aid. us and to quell our foemen.
Devanāgarī: महामुग्रमवसे विप्र नूनमा विवासेम वृत्रतूर्येषु
pada pāṭha: eva | jajñānam | sahase | asāmi | vavr̥dhānam | rādhase | ca | śrutāya || mahām | ugram | avase | vipra | nūnam | ā | vivāsema | vr̥tra-tūryeṣu ||6.38.5||

IAST: mandrasya kaver divyasya vahner vipramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ
Griffith: OF this our charming, our celestial Soma, eloquent, wise, Priest, with inspired devotion,
Devanāgarī: मन्द्रस्य कवेर्दिव्यस्य वह्नेर्विप्रमन्मनो वचनस्य मध्वः
pada pāṭha: mandrasya | kaveḥ | divyasya | vahneḥ | vipra-manmanaḥ | vacanasya | madhvaḥ || apāḥ | naḥ | tasya | sacanasya | deva | iṣaḥ | yuvasva | gr̥ṇate | go-agrāḥ ||6.39.1||

IAST: apā nas tasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva gṛṇate goagrāḥ
Griffith: Of this thy close attendant, hast thou drunken. God, send the singer food with milk to grace it.
Devanāgarī: अपा नस्तस्य सचनस्य देवेषो युवस्व गृणते गोअग्राः
pada pāṭha: mandrasya | kaveḥ | divyasya | vahneḥ | vipra-manmanaḥ | vacanasya | madhvaḥ || apāḥ | naḥ | tasya | sacanasya | deva | iṣaḥ | yuvasva | gr̥ṇate | go-agrāḥ ||6.39.1||

IAST: ayam uśānaḥ pary adrim usrā ṛtadhītibhir ṛtayug yujānaḥ
Griffith: Craving the kine, rushing against the mountain led on by Law, with holyminded comrades,
Devanāgarī: अयमुशानः पर्यद्रिमुस्रा ऋतधीतिभिरृतयुग्युजानः
pada pāṭha: ayam | uśānaḥ | pari | adrim | usrāḥ | r̥tadhīti-bhiḥ | r̥ta-yuk | yujānaḥ || rujat | arugṇam | vi | valasya | sānum | paṇīn | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | yodhat | indraḥ ||6.39.2||

IAST: rujad arugṇaṁ vi valasya sānum paṇīm̐r vacobhir abhi yodhad indraḥ
Griffith: He broke the never-broken ridge of Vala. With words of might Indra subdued the Panis.
Devanāgarī: रुजदरुग्णं वि वलस्य सानुं पणीँर्वचोभिरभि योधदिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: ayam | uśānaḥ | pari | adrim | usrāḥ | r̥tadhīti-bhiḥ | r̥ta-yuk | yujānaḥ || rujat | arugṇam | vi | valasya | sānum | paṇīn | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | abhi | yodhat | indraḥ ||6.39.2||

IAST: ayaṁ dyotayad adyuto vy aktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indur indra
Griffith: This Indu lighted darksome nights, O Indra, throughout the years, at morning and at evening.
Devanāgarī: अयं द्योतयदद्युतो व्यक्तून्दोषा वस्तोः शरद इन्दुरिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: ayam | dyotayat | adyutaḥ | vi | aktūn | doṣā | vastoḥ | śaradaḥ | induḥ | indra || imam | ketum | adadhuḥ | nu | cit | ahnām | śuci-janmanaḥ | uṣasaḥ | cakāra ||6.39.3||

IAST: imaṁ ketum adadhur nū cid ahnāṁ śucijanmana uṣasaś cakāra
Griffith: Him have they stablished as the days' bright ensign. He made the Mornings to be born in splendour.
Devanāgarī: इमं केतुमदधुर्नू चिदह्नां शुचिजन्मन उषसश्चकार
pada pāṭha: ayam | dyotayat | adyutaḥ | vi | aktūn | doṣā | vastoḥ | śaradaḥ | induḥ | indra || imam | ketum | adadhuḥ | nu | cit | ahnām | śuci-janmanaḥ | uṣasaḥ | cakāra ||6.39.3||

IAST: ayaṁ rocayad aruco rucāno 'yaṁ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrvīḥ
Griffith: He shone and caused to shme the worlds that shone not. By Law he lighted up the host of Mornings.
Devanāgarī: अयं रोचयदरुचो रुचानोऽयं वासयद्व्यृतेन पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: ayam | rocayat | arucaḥ | rucānaḥ | ayam | vāsayat | vi | r̥tena | pūrvīḥ || ayam | īyate | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | svaḥ-vidā | nābhinā | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||6.39.4||

IAST: ayam īyata ṛtayugbhir aśvaiḥ svarvidā nābhinā carṣaṇiprāḥ
Griffith: He moves with Steeds yoked by eternal Order, contenting men with nave that finds the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: अयमीयत ऋतयुग्भिरश्वैः स्वर्विदा नाभिना चर्षणिप्राः
pada pāṭha: ayam | rocayat | arucaḥ | rucānaḥ | ayam | vāsayat | vi | r̥tena | pūrvīḥ || ayam | īyate | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | svaḥ-vidā | nābhinā | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||6.39.4||

IAST: nū gṛṇāno gṛṇate pratna rājann iṣaḥ pinva vasudeyāya pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Now, praised, O Ancient King! fill thou the singer with plenteous food that he may deal forth treasures.
Devanāgarī: नू गृणानो गृणते प्रत्न राजन्निषः पिन्व वसुदेयाय पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | gr̥ṇate | pratna | rājan | iṣaḥ | pinva | vasu-deyāya | pūrvīḥ || apaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | aviṣā | vanāni | gāḥ | arvataḥ | nr̥̄n | r̥case | rirīhi ||6.39.5||

IAST: apa oṣadhīr aviṣā vanāni gā arvato nṝn ṛcase rirīhi
Griffith: Give waters, herbs that have no poison, forests, and kine, and steeds, and men, to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: अप ओषधीरविषा वनानि गा अर्वतो नॄनृचसे रिरीहि
pada pāṭha: nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | gr̥ṇate | pratna | rājan | iṣaḥ | pinva | vasu-deyāya | pūrvīḥ || apaḥ | oṣadhīḥ | aviṣā | vanāni | gāḥ | arvataḥ | nr̥̄n | r̥case | rirīhi ||6.39.5||

IAST: indra piba tubhyaṁ suto madāyāva sya harī vi mucā sakhāyā
Griffith: DRINK, Indra; juice is shed to make thee joyful: loose thy Bay Steeds and give thy friends their freedom.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र पिब तुभ्यं सुतो मदायाव स्य हरी वि मुचा सखाया
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | tubhyam | sutaḥ | madāya | ava | sya | harī iti | vi | muca | sakhāyā || uta | pra | gāya | gaṇe | ā | ni-sadya | atha | yajñāya | gr̥ṇate | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||6.40.1||

IAST: uta pra gāya gaṇa ā niṣadyāthā yajñāya gṛṇate vayo dhāḥ
Griffith: Begin the song, seated in our assembly. Give strength for sacrifice to him who singeth.
Devanāgarī: उत प्र गाय गण आ निषद्याथा यज्ञाय गृणते वयो धाः
pada pāṭha: indra | piba | tubhyam | sutaḥ | madāya | ava | sya | harī iti | vi | muca | sakhāyā || uta | pra | gāya | gaṇe | ā | ni-sadya | atha | yajñāya | gr̥ṇate | vayaḥ | dhāḥ ||6.40.1||

IAST: asya piba yasya jajñāna indra madāya kratve apibo virapśin
Griffith: Drink thou of this whereof at birth, O Indra, thou drankest, Mighty One for power and rapture.
Devanāgarī: अस्य पिब यस्य जज्ञान इन्द्र मदाय क्रत्वे अपिबो विरप्शिन्
pada pāṭha: asya | piba | yasya | jajñānaḥ | indra | madāya | kratve | apibaḥ | vi-rapśin || tam | ūm̐ iti | te | gāvaḥ | naraḥ | āpaḥ | adriḥ | indum | sam | ahyan | pītaye | sam | asmai ||6.40.2||

IAST: tam u te gāvo nara āpo adrir induṁ sam ahyan pītaye sam asmai
Griffith: The men, the pressing-stones, the cows, the waters have made this Soma ready for thy drinking.
Devanāgarī: तमु ते गावो नर आपो अद्रिरिन्दुं समह्यन्पीतये समस्मै
pada pāṭha: asya | piba | yasya | jajñānaḥ | indra | madāya | kratve | apibaḥ | vi-rapśin || tam | ūm̐ iti | te | gāvaḥ | naraḥ | āpaḥ | adriḥ | indum | sam | ahyan | pītaye | sam | asmai ||6.40.2||

IAST: samiddhe agnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: The fire is kindled, Soma pressed, O Indra: let thy Bays, best to draw, convey thee hither.
Devanāgarī: समिद्धे अग्नौ सुत इन्द्र सोम आ त्वा वहन्तु हरयो वहिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhe | agnau | sute | indra | some | ā | tvā | vahantu | harayaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ || tvā-yatā | manasā | johavīmi | indra | ā | yāhi | suvitāya | mahe | naḥ ||6.40.3||

IAST: tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ
Griffith: With mind devoted, Indra, I invoke thee. Come, for our great prosperity approach us.
Devanāgarī: त्वायता मनसा जोहवीमीन्द्रा याहि सुविताय महे नः
pada pāṭha: sam-iddhe | agnau | sute | indra | some | ā | tvā | vahantu | harayaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ || tvā-yatā | manasā | johavīmi | indra | ā | yāhi | suvitāya | mahe | naḥ ||6.40.3||

IAST: ā yāhi śaśvad uśatā yayāthendra mahā manasā somapeyam
Griffith: Indra, come hither: evermore thou camest through our great strong desire to drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: आ याहि शश्वदुशता ययाथेन्द्र महा मनसा सोमपेयम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | śaśvat | uśatā | yayātha | indra | mahā | manasā | soma-peyam || upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇavaḥ | imā | naḥ | atha | te | yajñaḥ | tanve | vayaḥ | dhāt ||6.40.4||

IAST: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā no 'thā te yajñas tanve vayo dhāt
Griffith: Listen and hear the prayers which now we offer, and let this sacrifice increase thy vigour.
Devanāgarī: उप ब्रह्माणि शृणव इमा नोऽथा ते यज्ञस्तन्वे वयो धात्
pada pāṭha: ā | yāhi | śaśvat | uśatā | yayātha | indra | mahā | manasā | soma-peyam || upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇavaḥ | imā | naḥ | atha | te | yajñaḥ | tanve | vayaḥ | dhāt ||6.40.4||

IAST: yad indra divi pārye yad ṛdhag yad vā sve sadane yatra vāsi
Griffith: Mayst thou, O Indra, on the day of trial, present or absent, wheresoe'er thou dwellest,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र दिवि पार्ये यदृधग्यद्वा स्वे सदने यत्र वासि
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | divi | pārye | yat | r̥dhak | yat | vā | sve | sadane | yatra | vā | asi || ataḥ | naḥ | yajñam | avase | niyutvān | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | girvaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ ||6.40.5||

IAST: ato no yajñam avase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ
Griffith: Thence, with thy team, accordant with the Maruts, Song-lover! guard our sacrifice, to help us.
Devanāgarī: अतो नो यज्ञमवसे नियुत्वान्सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | divi | pārye | yat | r̥dhak | yat | vā | sve | sadane | yatra | vā | asi || ataḥ | naḥ | yajñam | avase | niyutvān | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | girvaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ ||6.40.5||

IAST: aheḻamāna upa yāhi yajñaṁ tubhyam pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ
Griffith: COME gracious to our sacrifice, O Indra: pressed Soma-drops are purified to please thee.
Devanāgarī: अहेळमान उप याहि यज्ञं तुभ्यं पवन्त इन्दवः सुतासः
pada pāṭha: aheḷamānaḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam | tubhyam | pavante | indavaḥ | sutāsaḥ || gāvaḥ | na | vājrin | svam | okaḥ | accha | indra | ā | gahi | prathamaḥ | yajñiyānām ||6.41.1||

IAST: gāvo na vajrin svam oko acchendrā gahi prathamo yajñiyānām
Griffith: As cattle seek their home, so Thunderwielder, come, Indra, first of those who claim our worship.
Devanāgarī: गावो न वज्रिन्स्वमोको अच्छेन्द्रा गहि प्रथमो यज्ञियानाम्
pada pāṭha: aheḷamānaḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam | tubhyam | pavante | indavaḥ | sutāsaḥ || gāvaḥ | na | vājrin | svam | okaḥ | accha | indra | ā | gahi | prathamaḥ | yajñiyānām ||6.41.1||

IAST: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim
Griffith: With that well-formed most wide-extending palate, wherewith thou ever drinkest streams of sweetness,
Devanāgarī: या ते काकुत्सुकृता या वरिष्ठा यया शश्वत्पिबसि मध्व ऊर्मिम्
pada pāṭha: yā | te | kākut | su-kr̥tā | yā | variṣṭhā | yayā | śaśvat | pibasi | madhvaḥ | ūrmim || tayā | pāhi | pra | te | adhvaryuḥ | asthāt | sam | te | vajraḥ | vartatām | indra | gavyuḥ ||6.41.2||

IAST: tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryur asthāt saṁ te vajro vartatām indra gavyuḥ
Griffith: Drink thou; the Adhvaryu standeth up before thee: let thy spoil-winning thunderbolt attend thee.
Devanāgarī: तया पाहि प्र ते अध्वर्युरस्थात्सं ते वज्रो वर्ततामिन्द्र गव्युः
pada pāṭha: yā | te | kākut | su-kr̥tā | yā | variṣṭhā | yayā | śaśvat | pibasi | madhvaḥ | ūrmim || tayā | pāhi | pra | te | adhvaryuḥ | asthāt | sam | te | vajraḥ | vartatām | indra | gavyuḥ ||6.41.2||

IAST: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe sam akāri somaḥ
Griffith: This drop, steer-strong and omniform, the Soma, hath been made ready for the Bull, for India.
Devanāgarī: एष द्रप्सो वृषभो विश्वरूप इन्द्राय वृष्णे समकारि सोमः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | drapsaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | viśva-rūpaḥ | indrāya | vr̥ṣṇe | sam | akāri | somaḥ || etam | piba | hari-vaḥ | sthātaḥ | ugra | yasya | īśiṣe | pra-divi | yaḥ | te | annam ||6.41.3||

IAST: etam piba harivaḥ sthātar ugra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yas te annam
Griffith: Drink this, Lord of the Bays, thou Strong Supporter, this that is thine of old, thy food for ever.
Devanāgarī: एतं पिब हरिवः स्थातरुग्र यस्येशिषे प्रदिवि यस्ते अन्नम्
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | drapsaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | viśva-rūpaḥ | indrāya | vr̥ṣṇe | sam | akāri | somaḥ || etam | piba | hari-vaḥ | sthātaḥ | ugra | yasya | īśiṣe | pra-divi | yaḥ | te | annam ||6.41.3||

IAST: sutaḥ somo asutād indra vasyān ayaṁ śreyāñ cikituṣe raṇāya
Griffith: Soma when pressed excels the unpressed Soma, better, for one who knows, to give him pleasure.
Devanāgarī: सुतः सोमो असुतादिन्द्र वस्यानयं श्रेयाञ्चिकितुषे रणाय
pada pāṭha: sutaḥ | somaḥ | asutāt | indra | vasyān | ayam | śreyān | cikituṣe | raṇāya || etam | titirvaḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam | tena | viśvāḥ | taviṣīḥ | ā | pr̥ṇasva ||6.41.4||

IAST: etaṁ titirva upa yāhi yajñaṁ tena viśvās taviṣīr ā pṛṇasva
Griffith: Come to this sacrifice of ours, O Victor replenish all thy powers with this libation.
Devanāgarī: एतं तितिर्व उप याहि यज्ञं तेन विश्वास्तविषीरा पृणस्व
pada pāṭha: sutaḥ | somaḥ | asutāt | indra | vasyān | ayam | śreyān | cikituṣe | raṇāya || etam | titirvaḥ | upa | yāhi | yajñam | tena | viśvāḥ | taviṣīḥ | ā | pr̥ṇasva ||6.41.4||

IAST: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhy arvāṅ araṁ te somas tanve bhavāti
Griffith: We call on thee, O Indra: come thou hither: sufficient be the Soma for thy body.
Devanāgarī: ह्वयामसि त्वेन्द्र याह्यर्वाङरं ते सोमस्तन्वे भवाति
pada pāṭha: hvayāmasi | tvā | ā | indra | yāhi | arvāṅ | aram | te | somaḥ | tanve | bhavāti || śatakrato iti śata-krato | mādayasva | suteṣu | pra | asmān | ava | pr̥tanāsu | pra | vikṣu ||6.41.5||

IAST: śatakrato mādayasvā suteṣu prāsmām̐ ava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu
Griffith: Rejoice thee, Satakratu! in the juices guard us in wars, guard us among our people.
Devanāgarī: शतक्रतो मादयस्वा सुतेषु प्रास्माँ अव पृतनासु प्र विक्षु
pada pāṭha: hvayāmasi | tvā | ā | indra | yāhi | arvāṅ | aram | te | somaḥ | tanve | bhavāti || śatakrato iti śata-krato | mādayasva | suteṣu | pra | asmān | ava | pr̥tanāsu | pra | vikṣu ||6.41.5||

IAST: praty asmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara
Griffith: BRING sacrificial gifts to him, Omniscient, for he longs to drink,
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यस्मै पिपीषते विश्वानि विदुषे भर
pada pāṭha: prati | asmai | pipīṣate | viśvāni | viduṣe | bhara || aram-gamāya | jagmaye | apaścāt-daghvane | nare ||6.42.1||

IAST: araṁgamāya jagmaye 'paścāddaghvane nare
Griffith: The Wanderer who comes with speed, the Hero ever in the van.
Devanāgarī: अरंगमाय जग्मयेऽपश्चाद्दघ्वने नरे
pada pāṭha: prati | asmai | pipīṣate | viśvāni | viduṣe | bhara || aram-gamāya | jagmaye | apaścāt-daghvane | nare ||6.42.1||

IAST: em enam pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam
Griffith: With Soma go ye nigh to him chief drinker of the Soma's juice:
Devanāgarī: एमेनं प्रत्येतन सोमेभिः सोमपातमम्
pada pāṭha: ā | īm | enam | prati-etana | somebhiḥ | soma-pātamam || amatrebhiḥ | r̥jīṣiṇam | indram | sutebhiḥ | indu-bhiḥ ||6.42.2||

IAST: amatrebhir ṛjīṣiṇam indraṁ sutebhir indubhiḥ
Griffith: With beakers to the Impetuous God, to Indra with the drops effused.
Devanāgarī: अमत्रेभिरृजीषिणमिन्द्रं सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | īm | enam | prati-etana | somebhiḥ | soma-pātamam || amatrebhiḥ | r̥jīṣiṇam | indram | sutebhiḥ | indu-bhiḥ ||6.42.2||

IAST: yadī sutebhir indubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha
Griffith: What time, with Soma, with the juice effused, ye come before the God,
Devanāgarī: यदी सुतेभिरिन्दुभिः सोमेभिः प्रतिभूषथ
pada pāṭha: yadi | sutebhiḥ | indu-bhiḥ | somebhiḥ | prati-bhūṣatha || veda | viśvasya | medhiraḥ | dhr̥ṣat | tam-tam | it | ā | īṣate ||6.42.3||

IAST: vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṁ-tam id eṣate
Griffith: Full wise he knows the hope of each, and, Bold One, strikes this foe and that.
Devanāgarī: वेदा विश्वस्य मेधिरो धृषत्तंतमिदेषते
pada pāṭha: yadi | sutebhiḥ | indu-bhiḥ | somebhiḥ | prati-bhūṣatha || veda | viśvasya | medhiraḥ | dhr̥ṣat | tam-tam | it | ā | īṣate ||6.42.3||

IAST: asmā-asmā id andhaso 'dhvaryo pra bharā sutam
Griffith: To him, Adhvaryu! yea, to him give offerings of the juice expressed.
Devanāgarī: अस्माअस्मा इदन्धसोऽध्वर्यो प्र भरा सुतम्
pada pāṭha: asmai-asmai | it | andhasaḥ | adhvaryo iti | pra | bhara | sutam || kuvit | samasya | jenyasya | śardhataḥ | abhi-śasteḥ | ava-sparat ||6.42.4||

IAST: kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato 'bhiśaster avasparat
Griffith: Will he not keep us safely from the spiteful curse of each presumptuous high-born foe?
Devanāgarī: कुवित्समस्य जेन्यस्य शर्धतोऽभिशस्तेरवस्परत्
pada pāṭha: asmai-asmai | it | andhasaḥ | adhvaryo iti | pra | bhara | sutam || kuvit | samasya | jenyasya | śardhataḥ | abhi-śasteḥ | ava-sparat ||6.42.4||

IAST: yasya tyac chambaram made divodāsāya randhayaḥ
Griffith: IN whose wild joy thou madest once Sambara Divodasa's prey,
Devanāgarī: यस्य त्यच्छम्बरं मदे दिवोदासाय रन्धयः
pada pāṭha: yasya | tyat | śambaram | made | divaḥ-dāsāya | randhayaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.1||

IAST: ayaṁ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
Griffith: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!
Devanāgarī: अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब
pada pāṭha: yasya | tyat | śambaram | made | divaḥ-dāsāya | randhayaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.1||

IAST: yasya tīvrasutam madam madhyam antaṁ ca rakṣase
Griffith: Whose gladdening draught, shed from the points, thou guardest in the midst and end,
Devanāgarī: यस्य तीव्रसुतं मदं मध्यमन्तं च रक्षसे
pada pāṭha: yasya | tīvra-sutam | madam | madhyam | antam | ca | rakṣase || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.2||

IAST: ayaṁ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
Griffith: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!
Devanāgarī: अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब
pada pāṭha: yasya | tīvra-sutam | madam | madhyam | antam | ca | rakṣase || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.2||

IAST: yasya gā antar aśmano made dṛḻhā avāsṛjaḥ
Griffith: In whose wild joy thou settest free the kine held fast within the rock,
Devanāgarī: यस्य गा अन्तरश्मनो मदे दृळ्हा अवासृजः
pada pāṭha: yasya | gāḥ | antaḥ | aśmanaḥ | made | dr̥ḷhāḥ | ava-asr̥jaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.3||

IAST: ayaṁ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
Griffith: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra: drink!
Devanāgarī: अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब
pada pāṭha: yasya | gāḥ | antaḥ | aśmanaḥ | made | dr̥ḷhāḥ | ava-asr̥jaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.3||

IAST: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṁ dadhiṣe śavaḥ
Griffith: This, in whose juice delighting thou gainest the might of Maghavan,
Devanāgarī: यस्य मन्दानो अन्धसो माघोनं दधिषे शवः
pada pāṭha: yasya | mandānaḥ | andhasaḥ | māghonam | dadhiṣe | śavaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.4||

IAST: ayaṁ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
Griffith: This Soma is pressed out for thee, O Indra drink!
Devanāgarī: अयं स सोम इन्द्र ते सुतः पिब
pada pāṭha: yasya | mandānaḥ | andhasaḥ | māghonam | dadhiṣe | śavaḥ || ayam | saḥ | somaḥ | indra | te | sutaḥ | piba ||6.43.4||

IAST: yo rayivo rayiṁtamo yo dyumnair dyumnavattamaḥ
Griffith: THAT which is wealthiest, Wealthy God in splendoursmost illustrious,
Devanāgarī: यो रयिवो रयिंतमो यो द्युम्नैर्द्युम्नवत्तमः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rayi-vaḥ | rayim-tamaḥ | yaḥ | dyumnaiḥ | dyumnavat-tamaḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.1||

IAST: somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te 'sti svadhāpate madaḥ
Griffith: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र तेऽस्ति स्वधापते मदः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rayi-vaḥ | rayim-tamaḥ | yaḥ | dyumnaiḥ | dyumnavat-tamaḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.1||

IAST: yaḥ śagmas tuviśagma te rāyo dāmā matīnām
Griffith: Effectual, Most Effectual One! thine, as bestowing wealth of hymns,
Devanāgarī: यः शग्मस्तुविशग्म ते रायो दामा मतीनाम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śagmaḥ | tuvi-śagma | te | rāyaḥ | dāmā | matīnām || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.2||

IAST: somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te 'sti svadhāpate madaḥ
Griffith: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र तेऽस्ति स्वधापते मदः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | śagmaḥ | tuvi-śagma | te | rāyaḥ | dāmā | matīnām || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.2||

IAST: yena vṛddho na śavasā turo na svābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Wherewith thou art increased in strength, and conquerest with thy proper aids,
Devanāgarī: येन वृद्धो न शवसा तुरो न स्वाभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: yena | vr̥ddhaḥ | na | śavasā | turaḥ | na | svābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.3||

IAST: somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te 'sti svadhāpate madaḥ
Griffith: Soma is pressed: thy gladdening draught, Indra! libation's Lord! is this.
Devanāgarī: सोमः सुतः स इन्द्र तेऽस्ति स्वधापते मदः
pada pāṭha: yena | vr̥ddhaḥ | na | śavasā | turaḥ | na | svābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || somaḥ | sutaḥ | saḥ | indra | te | asti | svadhā-pate | madaḥ ||6.44.3||

IAST: tyam u vo aprahaṇaṁ gṛṇīṣe śavasas patim
Griffith: Him for your sake I glorify as Lord of Strength who wrongeth none,
Devanāgarī: त्यमु वो अप्रहणं गृणीषे शवसस्पतिम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | apra-hanam | gr̥ṇīṣe | śavasaḥ | patim || indram | viśva-saham | naram | maṁhiṣṭham | viśva-carṣaṇim ||6.44.4||

IAST: indraṁ viśvāsāhaṁ naram maṁhiṣṭhaṁ viśvacarṣaṇim
Griffith: The Hero Indra, conquering all, Most Bounteous, God of all the tribes.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं विश्वासाहं नरं मंहिष्ठं विश्वचर्षणिम्
pada pāṭha: tyam | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | apra-hanam | gr̥ṇīṣe | śavasaḥ | patim || indram | viśva-saham | naram | maṁhiṣṭham | viśva-carṣaṇim ||6.44.4||

IAST: yaṁ vardhayantīd giraḥ patiṁ turasya rādhasaḥ
Griffith: Those Goddesses, both Heaven and Earth, revere the power and might of him,
Devanāgarī: यं वर्धयन्तीद्गिरः पतिं तुरस्य राधसः
pada pāṭha: yam | vardhayanti | it | giraḥ | patim | turasya | rādhasaḥ || tam | it | nu | asya | rodasī iti | devī iti | śuṣmam | saparyataḥ ||6.44.5||

IAST: tam in nv asya rodasī devī śuṣmaṁ saparyataḥ
Griffith: Him whom our songs increase in strength, the Lord of bounty swift to come.
Devanāgarī: तमिन्न्वस्य रोदसी देवी शुष्मं सपर्यतः
pada pāṭha: yam | vardhayanti | it | giraḥ | patim | turasya | rādhasaḥ || tam | it | nu | asya | rodasī iti | devī iti | śuṣmam | saparyataḥ ||6.44.5||

IAST: tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi
Griffith: To seat your Indra, I will spread abroad with power this song of praise.
Devanāgarī: तद्व उक्थस्य बर्हणेन्द्रायोपस्तृणीषणि
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | ukthasya | barhaṇā | indrāya | upa-str̥ṇīṣaṇi || vipaḥ | na | yasya | ūtayaḥ | vi | yat | rohanti | sa-kṣitaḥ ||6.44.6||

IAST: vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ
Griffith: The saving succours that abide in him, like songs, extend and grow.
Devanāgarī: विपो न यस्योतयो वि यद्रोहन्ति सक्षितः
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | ukthasya | barhaṇā | indrāya | upa-str̥ṇīṣaṇi || vipaḥ | na | yasya | ūtayaḥ | vi | yat | rohanti | sa-kṣitaḥ ||6.44.6||

IAST: avidad dakṣam mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait
Griffith: A recent Friend, he found the skilful priest: he drank, and showed forth treasure from the Gods.
Devanāgarī: अविदद्दक्षं मित्रो नवीयान्पपानो देवेभ्यो वस्यो अचैत्
pada pāṭha: avidat | dakṣam | mitraḥ | navīyān | papānaḥ | devebhyaḥ | vasyaḥ | acait || sasa-vān | staulābhiḥ | dhautarībhiḥ | uruṣyā | pāyuḥ | abhavat | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||6.44.7||

IAST: sasavān staulābhir dhautarībhir uruṣyā pāyur abhavat sakhibhyaḥ
Griffith: He conquered, borne by strong all-shaking mares, and was with far-spread power his friends' Protector.
Devanāgarī: ससवान्स्तौलाभिर्धौतरीभिरुरुष्या पायुरभवत्सखिभ्यः
pada pāṭha: avidat | dakṣam | mitraḥ | navīyān | papānaḥ | devebhyaḥ | vasyaḥ | acait || sasa-vān | staulābhiḥ | dhautarībhiḥ | uruṣyā | pāyuḥ | abhavat | sakhi-bhyaḥ ||6.44.7||

IAST: ṛtasya pathi vedhā apāyi śriye manāṁsi devāso akran
Griffith: In course of Law the sapient juice was quaffed: the Deities to glory turned their mind.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य पथि वेधा अपायि श्रिये मनांसि देवासो अक्रन्
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | pathi | vedhāḥ | apāyi | śriye | manāṁsi | devāsaḥ | akran || dadhānaḥ | nāma | mahaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | vapuḥ | dr̥śaye | venyaḥ | vi | āvarityāvaḥ ||6.44.8||

IAST: dadhāno nāma maho vacobhir vapur dṛśaye venyo vy āvaḥ
Griffith: Winning through hymns a lofty title, he, the Lovely, made his beauteous form apparent.
Devanāgarī: दधानो नाम महो वचोभिर्वपुर्दृशये वेन्यो व्यावः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | pathi | vedhāḥ | apāyi | śriye | manāṁsi | devāsaḥ | akran || dadhānaḥ | nāma | mahaḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | vapuḥ | dr̥śaye | venyaḥ | vi | āvarityāvaḥ ||6.44.8||

IAST: dyumattamaṁ dakṣaṁ dhehy asme sedhā janānām pūrvīr arātīḥ
Griffith: Bestow on us the most illustrious strength ward off men's manifold malignities.
Devanāgarī: द्युमत्तमं दक्षं धेह्यस्मे सेधा जनानां पूर्वीररातीः
pada pāṭha: dyumat-tamam | dakṣam | dhehi | asme iti | sedha | janānām | pūrvīḥ | arātīḥ || varṣīyaḥ | vayaḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | śacībhiḥ | dhanasya | sātau | asmān | aviḍḍhi ||6.44.9||

IAST: varṣīyo vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhir dhanasya sātāv asmām̐ aviḍḍhi
Griffith: Give with thy might abundant vital force, and aid us graciously in gaining riches.
Devanāgarī: वर्षीयो वयः कृणुहि शचीभिर्धनस्य सातावस्माँ अविड्ढि
pada pāṭha: dyumat-tamam | dakṣam | dhehi | asme iti | sedha | janānām | pūrvīḥ | arātīḥ || varṣīyaḥ | vayaḥ | kr̥ṇuhi | śacībhiḥ | dhanasya | sātau | asmān | aviḍḍhi ||6.44.9||

IAST: indra tubhyam in maghavann abhūma vayaṁ dātre harivo mā vi venaḥ
Griffith: We turn to thee as Giver, liberal Indra. Lord of the Bay Steeds, be not thou ungracious.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र तुभ्यमिन्मघवन्नभूम वयं दात्रे हरिवो मा वि वेनः
pada pāṭha: indra | tubhyam | it | magha-van | abhūma | vayam | dātre | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ || nakiḥ | āpiḥ | dadr̥śe | martya-trā | kim | aṅga | radhra-codanam | tvā | āhuḥ ||6.44.10||

IAST: nakir āpir dadṛśe martyatrā kim aṅga radhracodanaṁ tvāhuḥ
Griffith: No friend among mankind have we to lookto: why have men called thee him who spurs the niggard?
Devanāgarī: नकिरापिर्ददृशे मर्त्यत्रा किमङ्ग रध्रचोदनं त्वाहुः
pada pāṭha: indra | tubhyam | it | magha-van | abhūma | vayam | dātre | hari-vaḥ | mā | vi | venaḥ || nakiḥ | āpiḥ | dadr̥śe | martya-trā | kim | aṅga | radhra-codanam | tvā | āhuḥ ||6.44.10||

IAST: mā jasvane vṛṣabha no rarīthā mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma
Griffith: Give us not up, Strong Hero! to the hungry: unharmed be we whom thou, so rich, befriendest.
Devanāgarī: मा जस्वने वृषभ नो ररीथा मा ते रेवतः सख्ये रिषाम
pada pāṭha: mā | jasvane | vr̥ṣabha | naḥ | rarīthāḥ | mā | te | revataḥ | sakhye | riṣāma || pūrvīḥ | te | indra | niḥ-sidhaḥ | janeṣu | jahi | asusvīn | pra | vr̥ha | apr̥ṇataḥ ||6.44.11||

IAST: pūrvīṣ ṭa indra niṣṣidho janeṣu jahy asuṣvīn pra vṛhāpṛṇataḥ
Griffith: Full many a boon hast thou for men demolish those who present no gifts nor pour oblations.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीष्ट इन्द्र निष्षिधो जनेषु जह्यसुष्वीन्प्र वृहापृणतः
pada pāṭha: mā | jasvane | vr̥ṣabha | naḥ | rarīthāḥ | mā | te | revataḥ | sakhye | riṣāma || pūrvīḥ | te | indra | niḥ-sidhaḥ | janeṣu | jahi | asusvīn | pra | vr̥ha | apr̥ṇataḥ ||6.44.11||

IAST: ud abhrāṇīva stanayann iyartīndro rādhāṁsy aśvyāni gavyā
Griffith: As Indra thundering impels the rain-clouds, so doth he send us store of kine and horses.
Devanāgarī: उदभ्राणीव स्तनयन्नियर्तीन्द्रो राधांस्यश्व्यानि गव्या
pada pāṭha: ut | abhrāṇi-iva | stanayan | iyarti | indraḥ | rādhāṁsi | aśvyāni | gavyā || tvam | asi | pra-divaḥ | kāru-dhāyāḥ | mā | tvā | adāmānaḥ | ā | dabhan | maghonaḥ ||6.44.12||

IAST: tvam asi pradivaḥ kārudhāyā mā tvādāmāna ā dabhan maghonaḥ
Griffith: Thou art of old the Cherisher of singers let not the rich who bring no gifts deceive thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वमसि प्रदिवः कारुधाया मा त्वादामान आ दभन्मघोनः
pada pāṭha: ut | abhrāṇi-iva | stanayan | iyarti | indraḥ | rādhāṁsi | aśvyāni | gavyā || tvam | asi | pra-divaḥ | kāru-dhāyāḥ | mā | tvā | adāmānaḥ | ā | dabhan | maghonaḥ ||6.44.12||

IAST: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānām indrāya bhara sa hy asya rājā
Griffith: Adbyaryu, hero, bring to mighty Indrafor he is King thereof-the pressed-out juices;
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्यो वीर प्र महे सुतानामिन्द्राय भर स ह्यस्य राजा
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | vīra | pra | mahe | sutānām | indrāya | bhara | saḥ | hi | asya | rājā || yaḥ | pūrvyābhiḥ | uta | nūtanābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vavr̥dhe | gr̥ṇatām | r̥ṣīṇām ||6.44.13||

IAST: yaḥ pūrvyābhir uta nūtanābhir gīrbhir vāvṛdhe gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
Griffith: To him exalted by the hymns and praises, ancient and modern, of the singing Rsis.
Devanāgarī: यः पूर्व्याभिरुत नूतनाभिर्गीर्भिर्वावृधे गृणतामृषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: adhvaryo iti | vīra | pra | mahe | sutānām | indrāya | bhara | saḥ | hi | asya | rājā || yaḥ | pūrvyābhiḥ | uta | nūtanābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | vavr̥dhe | gr̥ṇatām | r̥ṣīṇām ||6.44.13||

IAST: asya made puru varpāṁsi vidvān indro vṛtrāṇy apratī jaghāna
Griffith: In the wild joy of this hath Indra, knowing full many a form, struck down resistless Vrtras.
Devanāgarī: अस्य मदे पुरु वर्पांसि विद्वानिन्द्रो वृत्राण्यप्रती जघान
pada pāṭha: asya | made | puru | varpāṁsi | vidvān | indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | aprati | jaghāna || tam | ūm̐ iti | pra | hoṣi | madhu-mantam | asmai | somam | vīrāya | śipriṇe | pibadhyai ||6.44.14||

IAST: tam u pra hoṣi madhumantam asmai somaṁ vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai
Griffith: Proclaim aloud to him the savoury Soma so that the Hero, strong of jaw, may drink it.
Devanāgarī: तमु प्र होषि मधुमन्तमस्मै सोमं वीराय शिप्रिणे पिबध्यै
pada pāṭha: asya | made | puru | varpāṁsi | vidvān | indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | aprati | jaghāna || tam | ūm̐ iti | pra | hoṣi | madhu-mantam | asmai | somam | vīrāya | śipriṇe | pibadhyai ||6.44.14||

IAST: pātā sutam indro astu somaṁ hantā vṛtraṁ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ
Griffith: May Indra drink this Soma poured to please him, and cheered therewith slay Vrtra with his thunder.
Devanāgarī: पाता सुतमिन्द्रो अस्तु सोमं हन्ता वृत्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः
pada pāṭha: pātā | sutam | indraḥ | astu | somam | hantā | vr̥tram | vajreṇa | mandasānaḥ || gantā | yajñam | parā-vataḥ | cit | accha | vasuḥ | dhīnām | avitā | kāru-dhāyāḥ ||6.44.15||

IAST: gantā yajñam parāvataś cid acchā vasur dhīnām avitā kārudhāyāḥ
Griffith: Come to our sacrifice even from a distance, good lover of our songs, the bard's Supporter.
Devanāgarī: गन्ता यज्ञं परावतश्चिदच्छा वसुर्धीनामविता कारुधायाः
pada pāṭha: pātā | sutam | indraḥ | astu | somam | hantā | vr̥tram | vajreṇa | mandasānaḥ || gantā | yajñam | parā-vataḥ | cit | accha | vasuḥ | dhīnām | avitā | kāru-dhāyāḥ ||6.44.15||

IAST: idaṁ tyat pātram indrapānam indrasya priyam amṛtam apāyi
Griffith: The cup whence Indra drinks the draught is present: the Amrta dear to Indra hath been drunken,
Devanāgarī: इदं त्यत्पात्रमिन्द्रपानमिन्द्रस्य प्रियममृतमपायि
pada pāṭha: idam | tyat | pātram | indra-pānam | indrasya | priyam | amr̥tam | apāyi || matsat | yathā | saumanasāya | devam | vi | asmat | dveṣaḥ | yuyavat | vi | aṁhaḥ ||6.44.16||

IAST: matsad yathā saumanasāya devaṁ vy asmad dveṣo yuyavad vy aṁhaḥ
Griffith: That it may cheer the God to gracious favour, and keep far from us hatred and affliction.
Devanāgarī: मत्सद्यथा सौमनसाय देवं व्यस्मद्द्वेषो युयवद्व्यंहः
pada pāṭha: idam | tyat | pātram | indra-pānam | indrasya | priyam | amr̥tam | apāyi || matsat | yathā | saumanasāya | devam | vi | asmat | dveṣaḥ | yuyavat | vi | aṁhaḥ ||6.44.16||

IAST: enā mandāno jahi śūra śatrūñ jāmim ajāmim maghavann amitrān
Griffith: Therewith enraptured, Hero, slay our foemen, the unfriendly, Maghavan be they kin or strangers,
Devanāgarī: एना मन्दानो जहि शूर शत्रूञ्जामिमजामिं मघवन्नमित्रान्
pada pāṭha: enā | mandānaḥ | jahi | śūra | śatrūn | jāmim | ajāmim | magha-van | amitrān || abhi-senān | abhi | ā-dediśānān | parācaḥ | indra | pra | mr̥ṇa | jahi | ca ||6.44.17||

IAST: abhiṣeṇām̐ abhy ādediśānān parāca indra pra mṛṇā jahī ca
Griffith: Those who still aim their hostile darts to smite us, turn them to flight, O Indra, crush and kill them.
Devanāgarī: अभिषेणाँ अभ्यादेदिशानान्पराच इन्द्र प्र मृणा जही च
pada pāṭha: enā | mandānaḥ | jahi | śūra | śatrūn | jāmim | ajāmim | magha-van | amitrān || abhi-senān | abhi | ā-dediśānān | parācaḥ | indra | pra | mr̥ṇa | jahi | ca ||6.44.17||

IAST: āsu ṣmā ṇo maghavann indra pṛtsv asmabhyam mahi varivaḥ sugaṁ kaḥ
Griffith: O Indra Maghavan, in these our battles win easy paths for us and ample freedom.
Devanāgarī: आसु ष्मा णो मघवन्निन्द्र पृत्स्वस्मभ्यं महि वरिवः सुगं कः
pada pāṭha: āsu | sma | naḥ | magha-van | indra | pr̥t-su | asmabhyam | mahi | varivaḥ | su-gam | kariti kaḥ || apām | tokasya | tanayasya | jeṣe | indra | sūrīn | kr̥ṇuhi | sma | naḥ | ardham ||6.44.18||

IAST: apāṁ tokasya tanayasya jeṣa indra sūrīn kṛṇuhi smā no ardham
Griffith: That we may gain waters and seed and offspring, set thou our princes on thy side, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अपां तोकस्य तनयस्य जेष इन्द्र सूरीन्कृणुहि स्मा नो अर्धम्
pada pāṭha: āsu | sma | naḥ | magha-van | indra | pr̥t-su | asmabhyam | mahi | varivaḥ | su-gam | kariti kaḥ || apām | tokasya | tanayasya | jeṣe | indra | sūrīn | kr̥ṇuhi | sma | naḥ | ardham ||6.44.18||

IAST: ā tvā harayo vṛṣaṇo yujānā vṛṣarathāso vṛṣaraśmayo 'tyāḥ
Griffith: Let thy Bay Stallions, harnessed, bring thee hither, Steeds with strong chariot and strong reins to hold
Devanāgarī: आ त्वा हरयो वृषणो युजाना वृषरथासो वृषरश्मयोऽत्याः
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | harayaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yujānāḥ | vr̥ṣa-rathāsaḥ | vr̥ṣa-raśmayaḥ | atyāḥ || asmatrāñcaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vajra-vāhaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | madāya | su-yujaḥ | vahantu ||6.44.19||

IAST: asmatrāñco vṛṣaṇo vajravāho vṛṣṇe madāya suyujo vahantu
Griffith: Strong Horses, speeding hither, bearing thunder, well-harnessed, for the strong exciting potion.
Devanāgarī: अस्मत्राञ्चो वृषणो वज्रवाहो वृष्णे मदाय सुयुजो वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | tvā | harayaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | yujānāḥ | vr̥ṣa-rathāsaḥ | vr̥ṣa-raśmayaḥ | atyāḥ || asmatrāñcaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | vajra-vāhaḥ | vr̥ṣṇe | madāya | su-yujaḥ | vahantu ||6.44.19||

IAST: ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇo droṇam asthur ghṛtapruṣo normayo madantaḥ
Griffith: Beside the vat, Strong God! stand thy strong Horses, shining with holy oil, like waves exulting.
Devanāgarī: आ ते वृषन्वृषणो द्रोणमस्थुर्घृतप्रुषो नोर्मयो मदन्तः
pada pāṭha: ā | te | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | droṇam | asthuḥ | ghr̥ta-pruṣaḥ | na | ūrmayaḥ | madantaḥ || indra | pra | tubhyam | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | sutānām | vr̥ṣṇe | bharanti | vr̥ṣabhāya | somam ||6.44.20||

IAST: indra pra tubhyaṁ vṛṣabhiḥ sutānāṁ vṛṣṇe bharanti vṛṣabhāya somam
Griffith: Indra, they bring to thee, the Strong and Mighty, Soma of juices shed by mighty press-stones.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र प्र तुभ्यं वृषभिः सुतानां वृष्णे भरन्ति वृषभाय सोमम्
pada pāṭha: ā | te | vr̥ṣan | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | droṇam | asthuḥ | ghr̥ta-pruṣaḥ | na | ūrmayaḥ | madantaḥ || indra | pra | tubhyam | vr̥ṣa-bhiḥ | sutānām | vr̥ṣṇe | bharanti | vr̥ṣabhāya | somam ||6.44.20||

IAST: vṛṣāsi divo vṛṣabhaḥ pṛthivyā vṛṣā sindhūnāṁ vṛṣabhaḥ stiyānām
Griffith: Thou art the Bull of earth, the Bull of heaven, Bull of the rivers, Bull of standing waters.
Devanāgarī: वृषासि दिवो वृषभः पृथिव्या वृषा सिन्धूनां वृषभः स्तियानाम्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | asi | divaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | vr̥ṣā | sindhūnām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | stiyānām || vr̥ṣṇe | te | induḥ | vr̥ṣabha | pīpāya | svāduḥ | rasaḥ | madhu-peyaḥ | varāya ||6.44.21||

IAST: vṛṣṇe ta indur vṛṣabha pīpāya svādū raso madhupeyo varāya
Griffith: For thee, the Strong, O Bull, hath Indu swollen. juice pleasant, sweet to drink, for thine election.
Devanāgarī: वृष्णे त इन्दुर्वृषभ पीपाय स्वादू रसो मधुपेयो वराय
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | asi | divaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | vr̥ṣā | sindhūnām | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | stiyānām || vr̥ṣṇe | te | induḥ | vr̥ṣabha | pīpāya | svāduḥ | rasaḥ | madhu-peyaḥ | varāya ||6.44.21||

IAST: ayaṁ devaḥ sahasā jāyamāna indreṇa yujā paṇim astabhāyat
Griffith: This God, with might, when first he had his being, with Indra for ally, held fast the Pani.
Devanāgarī: अयं देवः सहसा जायमान इन्द्रेण युजा पणिमस्तभायत्
pada pāṭha: ayam | devaḥ | sahasā | jāyamānaḥ | indreṇa | yujā | paṇim | astabhāyat || ayam | svasya | pituḥ | āyudhāni | induḥ | amuṣṇāt | aśivasya | māyāḥ ||6.44.22||

IAST: ayaṁ svasya pitur āyudhānīndur amuṣṇād aśivasya māyāḥ
Griffith: This Indu stole away the warlike weapons, and foiled the arts of his malignant father.
Devanāgarī: अयं स्वस्य पितुरायुधानीन्दुरमुष्णादशिवस्य मायाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | devaḥ | sahasā | jāyamānaḥ | indreṇa | yujā | paṇim | astabhāyat || ayam | svasya | pituḥ | āyudhāni | induḥ | amuṣṇāt | aśivasya | māyāḥ ||6.44.22||

IAST: ayam akṛṇod uṣasaḥ supatnīr ayaṁ sūrye adadhāj jyotir antaḥ
Griffith: The Dawns he wedded to a glorious Consort, and set within the Sun the light that lights him.
Devanāgarī: अयमकृणोदुषसः सुपत्नीरयं सूर्ये अदधाज्ज्योतिरन्तः
pada pāṭha: ayam | akr̥ṇot | uṣasaḥ | su-patnīḥ | ayam | sūrye | adadhāt | jyotiḥ | antariti || ayam | tri-dhātu | divi | rocaneṣu | triteṣu | vindat | amr̥tam | ni-gūḷham ||6.44.23||

IAST: ayaṁ tridhātu divi rocaneṣu triteṣu vindad amṛtaṁ nigūḻham
Griffith: He found in heaven, in the third lucid regions, the threefold Amrta in its close concealment.
Devanāgarī: अयं त्रिधातु दिवि रोचनेषु त्रितेषु विन्ददमृतं निगूळ्हम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | akr̥ṇot | uṣasaḥ | su-patnīḥ | ayam | sūrye | adadhāt | jyotiḥ | antariti || ayam | tri-dhātu | divi | rocaneṣu | triteṣu | vindat | amr̥tam | ni-gūḷham ||6.44.23||

IAST: ayaṁ dyāvāpṛthivī vi ṣkabhāyad ayaṁ ratham ayunak saptaraśmim
Griffith: He stayed and held the heaven and earth asunder: the chariot with the sevenfold reins he harnessed.
Devanāgarī: अयं द्यावापृथिवी वि ष्कभायदयं रथमयुनक्सप्तरश्मिम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | skabhāyat | ayam | ratham | ayunak | sapta-raśmim || ayam | goṣu | śacyā | pakvam | antariti | somaḥ | dādhāra | daśa-yantram | utsam ||6.44.24||

IAST: ayaṁ goṣu śacyā pakvam antaḥ somo dādhāra daśayantram utsam
Griffith: This Soma Set with power within the milch-kine a spring whose ripe contents ten fingers empty.
Devanāgarī: अयं गोषु शच्या पक्वमन्तः सोमो दाधार दशयन्त्रमुत्सम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | vi | skabhāyat | ayam | ratham | ayunak | sapta-raśmim || ayam | goṣu | śacyā | pakvam | antariti | somaḥ | dādhāra | daśa-yantram | utsam ||6.44.24||

IAST: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśaṁ yadum
Griffith: THAT Indra is our youthful Friend, who with his trusty guidance led
Devanāgarī: य आनयत्परावतः सुनीती तुर्वशं यदुम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ā | anayat | parā-vataḥ | su-nītī | turvaśam | yadum || indraḥ | saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||6.45.1||

IAST: indraḥ sa no yuvā sakhā
Griffith: Turvasa, Yadu from afar.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः स नो युवा सखा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ā | anayat | parā-vataḥ | su-nītī | turvaśam | yadum || indraḥ | saḥ | naḥ | yuvā | sakhā ||6.45.1||
