IAST: avipre cid vayo dadhad anāśunā cid arvatā
Griffith: Even to the dull and uninspired Indra, gives vital power, and wins
Devanāgarī: अविप्रे चिद्वयो दधदनाशुना चिदर्वता
pada pāṭha: avipre | cit | vayaḥ | dadhat | anāśunā | cit | arvatā || indraḥ | jetā | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.2||

IAST: indro jetā hitaṁ dhanam
Griffith: Even with slow steed the offered prize.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो जेता हितं धनम्
pada pāṭha: avipre | cit | vayaḥ | dadhat | anāśunā | cit | arvatā || indraḥ | jetā | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.2||

IAST: mahīr asya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīr uta praśastayaḥ
Griffith: Great are his ways of guiding us, and!nanilbld are Ins eulogies:
Devanāgarī: महीरस्य प्रणीतयः पूर्वीरुत प्रशस्तयः
pada pāṭha: mahīḥ | asya | pra-nītayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || na | asya | kṣīyante | ūtayaḥ ||6.45.3||

IAST: nāsya kṣīyanta ūtayaḥ
Griffith: His kind protections never fail.
Devanāgarī: नास्य क्षीयन्त ऊतयः
pada pāṭha: mahīḥ | asya | pra-nītayaḥ | pūrvīḥ | uta | pra-śastayaḥ || na | asya | kṣīyante | ūtayaḥ ||6.45.3||

IAST: sakhāyo brahmavāhase 'rcata pra ca gāyata
Griffith: Friends, sing your psalm and offer praise to him to whom the prayer is brought:
Devanāgarī: सखायो ब्रह्मवाहसेऽर्चत प्र च गायत
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | brahma-vāhase | arcata | pra | ca | gāyata || saḥ | hi | naḥ | pra-matiḥ | mahī ||6.45.4||

IAST: sa hi naḥ pramatir mahī
Griffith: For our great Providence is he.
Devanāgarī: स हि नः प्रमतिर्मही
pada pāṭha: sakhāyaḥ | brahma-vāhase | arcata | pra | ca | gāyata || saḥ | hi | naḥ | pra-matiḥ | mahī ||6.45.4||

IAST: tvam ekasya vṛtrahann avitā dvayor asi
Griffith: Thou, Slaughterer of Vrtra, art Guardian and Friend of one and two,
Devanāgarī: त्वमेकस्य वृत्रहन्नविता द्वयोरसि
pada pāṭha: tvam | ekasya | vr̥tra-han | avitā | dvayoḥ | asi || uta | īdr̥śe | yathā | vayam ||6.45.5||

IAST: utedṛśe yathā vayam
Griffith: Yea, of a man like one of us.
Devanāgarī: उतेदृशे यथा वयम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | ekasya | vr̥tra-han | avitā | dvayoḥ | asi || uta | īdr̥śe | yathā | vayam ||6.45.5||

IAST: nayasīd v ati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣy ukthaśaṁsinaḥ
Griffith: Beyond men's hate thou leadest us, and givest cause to sing thy praise:
Devanāgarī: नयसीद्वति द्विषः कृणोष्युक्थशंसिनः
pada pāṭha: nayasi | it | ūm̐ iti | ati | dviṣaḥ | kr̥ṇoṣi | uktha-śaṁsinaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | su-vīraḥ | ucyase ||6.45.6||

IAST: nṛbhiḥ suvīra ucyase
Griffith: Good hero art thou called by men.
Devanāgarī: नृभिः सुवीर उच्यसे
pada pāṭha: nayasi | it | ūm̐ iti | ati | dviṣaḥ | kr̥ṇoṣi | uktha-śaṁsinaḥ || nr̥-bhiḥ | su-vīraḥ | ucyase ||6.45.6||

IAST: brahmāṇam brahmavāhasaṁ gīrbhiḥ sakhāyam ṛgmiyam
Griffith: I call with hymns, as 'twere a cow to milk, the Friend who merits praise,
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्माणं ब्रह्मवाहसं गीर्भिः सखायमृग्मियम्
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇam | brahma-vāhasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | sakhāyam | r̥gmiyam || gām | na | dohase | huve ||6.45.7||

IAST: gāṁ na dohase huve
Griffith: The Brahman who accepts the prayer.
Devanāgarī: गां न दोहसे हुवे
pada pāṭha: brahmāṇam | brahma-vāhasam | gīḥ-bhiḥ | sakhāyam | r̥gmiyam || gām | na | dohase | huve ||6.45.7||

IAST: yasya viśvāni hastayor ūcur vasūni ni dvitā
Griffith: Him in whose hands they say are stored all treasures from the days of old,
Devanāgarī: यस्य विश्वानि हस्तयोरूचुर्वसूनि नि द्विता
pada pāṭha: yasya | viśvāni | hastayoḥ | ūcuḥ | vasūni | ni | dvitā || vīrasya | pr̥tanā-sahaḥ ||6.45.8||

IAST: vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ
Griffith: The Hero, conquering in the fight.
Devanāgarī: वीरस्य पृतनाषहः
pada pāṭha: yasya | viśvāni | hastayoḥ | ūcuḥ | vasūni | ni | dvitā || vīrasya | pr̥tanā-sahaḥ ||6.45.8||

IAST: vi dṛḻhāni cid adrivo janānāṁ śacīpate
Griffith: Lord of Strength, Caster of the Stone, destroy the firm forts built by men,
Devanāgarī: वि दृळ्हानि चिदद्रिवो जनानां शचीपते
pada pāṭha: vi | dr̥ḷhāni | cit | adri-vaḥ | janānām | śacī-pate || vr̥ha | māyāḥ | anānata ||6.45.9||

IAST: vṛha māyā anānata
Griffith: And foil their arts, unbending God!
Devanāgarī: वृह माया अनानत
pada pāṭha: vi | dr̥ḷhāni | cit | adri-vaḥ | janānām | śacī-pate || vr̥ha | māyāḥ | anānata ||6.45.9||

IAST: tam u tvā satya somapā indra vājānām pate
Griffith: Thee, thee as such, O Lord of Power, O Indra, Soma-drinker, true,
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा सत्य सोमपा इन्द्र वाजानां पते
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | satya | soma-pāḥ | indra | vājānām | pate || ahūmahi | śravasyavaḥ ||6.45.10||

IAST: ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
Griffith: We, fain for glory, have invoked.
Devanāgarī: अहूमहि श्रवस्यवः
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | satya | soma-pāḥ | indra | vājānām | pate || ahūmahi | śravasyavaḥ ||6.45.10||

IAST: tam u tvā yaḥ purāsitha yo vā nūnaṁ hite dhane
Griffith: Such as thou wast of old, and art now to be called on when the prize
Devanāgarī: तमु त्वा यः पुरासिथ यो वा नूनं हिते धने
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | yaḥ | purā | āsitha | yaḥ | vā | nūnam | hite | dhane || havyaḥ | saḥ | śrudhi | havam ||6.45.11||

IAST: havyaḥ sa śrudhī havam
Griffith: lies ready, listen to our call.
Devanāgarī: हव्यः स श्रुधी हवम्
pada pāṭha: tam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | yaḥ | purā | āsitha | yaḥ | vā | nūnam | hite | dhane || havyaḥ | saḥ | śrudhi | havam ||6.45.11||

IAST: dhībhir arvadbhir arvato vājām̐ indra śravāyyān
Griffith: With hymns and coursers we will gain, Indra, through thee, both steeds and spoil
Devanāgarī: धीभिरर्वद्भिरर्वतो वाजाँ इन्द्र श्रवाय्यान्
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | arvataḥ | vājān | indra | śravāyyān || tvayā | jeṣma | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.12||

IAST: tvayā jeṣma hitaṁ dhanam
Griffith: Most glorious, and the proffered prize.
Devanāgarī: त्वया जेष्म हितं धनम्
pada pāṭha: dhībhiḥ | arvat-bhiḥ | arvataḥ | vājān | indra | śravāyyān || tvayā | jeṣma | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.12||

IAST: abhūr u vīra girvaṇo mahām̐ indra dhane hite
Griffith: Thou, Indra, Lover of the Song, whom men must stir to help, hast been
Devanāgarī: अभूरु वीर गिर्वणो महाँ इन्द्र धने हिते
pada pāṭha: abhūḥ | ūm̐ iti | vīra | girvaṇaḥ | mahān | indra | dhane | hite || bhare | vitantasāyyaḥ ||6.45.13||

IAST: bhare vitantasāyyaḥ
Griffith: Great in the contest for the prize.
Devanāgarī: भरे वितन्तसाय्यः
pada pāṭha: abhūḥ | ūm̐ iti | vīra | girvaṇaḥ | mahān | indra | dhane | hite || bhare | vitantasāyyaḥ ||6.45.13||

IAST: yā ta ūtir amitrahan makṣūjavastamāsati
Griffith: Slayer of foes, whatever aid of thine imparts the swiftest course,
Devanāgarī: या त ऊतिरमित्रहन्मक्षूजवस्तमासति
pada pāṭha: yā | te | ūtiḥ | amitra-han | makṣujavaḥ-tamā | asati || tayā | naḥ | hinuhi | ratham ||6.45.14||

IAST: tayā no hinuhī ratham
Griffith: With that impel our car to speed.
Devanāgarī: तया नो हिनुही रथम्
pada pāṭha: yā | te | ūtiḥ | amitra-han | makṣujavaḥ-tamā | asati || tayā | naḥ | hinuhi | ratham ||6.45.14||

IAST: sa rathena rathītamo 'smākenābhiyugvanā
Griffith: As skilfullest of those who drive the chariot, with our art and aim,
Devanāgarī: स रथेन रथीतमोऽस्माकेनाभियुग्वना
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rathena | rathi-tamaḥ | asmākena | abhi-yugvanā || jeṣi | jiṣṇo iti | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.15||

IAST: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṁ dhanam
Griffith: O Conqueror, win the proffered prize.
Devanāgarī: जेषि जिष्णो हितं धनम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | rathena | rathi-tamaḥ | asmākena | abhi-yugvanā || jeṣi | jiṣṇo iti | hitam | dhanam ||6.45.15||

IAST: ya eka it tam u ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṁ vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: Praise him who, Matchless and Alone, was born the Lord of living men,
Devanāgarī: य एक इत्तमु ष्टुहि कृष्टीनां विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | kr̥ṣṭīnām | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || patiḥ | jajñe | vr̥ṣa-kratuḥ ||6.45.16||

IAST: patir jajñe vṛṣakratuḥ
Griffith: Most active, with heroic soul.
Devanāgarī: पतिर्जज्ञे वृषक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | tam | ūm̐ iti | stuhi | kr̥ṣṭīnām | vi-carṣaṇiḥ || patiḥ | jajñe | vr̥ṣa-kratuḥ ||6.45.16||

IAST: yo gṛṇatām id āsithāpir ūtī śivaḥ sakhā
Griffith: Thou who hast been the singers' Friend, a Friend auspicious with thine aid,
Devanāgarī: यो गृणतामिदासिथापिरूती शिवः सखा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | gr̥ṇatām | it | āsitha | āpiḥ | ūtī | śivaḥ | sakhā || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | mr̥ḷaya ||6.45.17||

IAST: sa tvaṁ na indra mṛḻaya
Griffith: As such, O Indra, favour us.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं न इन्द्र मृळय
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | gr̥ṇatām | it | āsitha | āpiḥ | ūtī | śivaḥ | sakhā || saḥ | tvam | naḥ | indra | mr̥ḷaya ||6.45.17||

IAST: dhiṣva vajraṁ gabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ
Griffith: Grasp in thine arms the thunderbolt, O Thunder-armed, to slay the fiends:
Devanāgarī: धिष्व वज्रं गभस्त्यो रक्षोहत्याय वज्रिवः
pada pāṭha: dhiṣva | vajram | gabhastyoḥ | rakṣaḥ-hatyāya | vajri-vaḥ || sasahīṣṭhāḥ | abhi | spr̥dhaḥ ||6.45.18||

IAST: sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ
Griffith: Mayst thou subdue the foemen's host.
Devanāgarī: सासहीष्ठा अभि स्पृधः
pada pāṭha: dhiṣva | vajram | gabhastyoḥ | rakṣaḥ-hatyāya | vajri-vaḥ || sasahīṣṭhāḥ | abhi | spr̥dhaḥ ||6.45.18||

IAST: pratnaṁ rayīṇāṁ yujaṁ sakhāyaṁ kīricodanam
Griffith: I call the ancient Friend, allied with wealth, who speeds the lowly man,
Devanāgarī: प्रत्नं रयीणां युजं सखायं कीरिचोदनम्
pada pāṭha: pratnam | rayīṇām | yujam | sakhāyam | kīri-codanam || brahmavāhaḥ-tamam | huve ||6.45.19||

IAST: brahmavāhastamaṁ huve
Griffith: Him to whom chiefly prayer is brought.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्मवाहस्तमं हुवे
pada pāṭha: pratnam | rayīṇām | yujam | sakhāyam | kīri-codanam || brahmavāhaḥ-tamam | huve ||6.45.19||

IAST: sa hi viśvāni pārthivām̐ eko vasūni patyate
Griffith: For he alone is Lord of all the treasures of the earth: he speeds
Devanāgarī: स हि विश्वानि पार्थिवाँ एको वसूनि पत्यते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | viśvāni | pārthivā | ekaḥ | vasūni | patyate || girvaṇaḥ-tamaḥ | adhri-guḥ ||6.45.20||

IAST: girvaṇastamo adhriguḥ
Griffith: Hither, chief Lover of the Song.
Devanāgarī: गिर्वणस्तमो अध्रिगुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | viśvāni | pārthivā | ekaḥ | vasūni | patyate || girvaṇaḥ-tamaḥ | adhri-guḥ ||6.45.20||

IAST: sa no niyudbhir ā pṛṇa kāmaṁ vājebhir aśvibhiḥ
Griffith: So with thy yoked teams satisfy our wish with power and wealth in steeds
Devanāgarī: स नो नियुद्भिरा पृण कामं वाजेभिरश्विभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | ā | pr̥ṇa | kāmam | vājebhiḥ | aśvi-bhiḥ || gomat-bhiḥ | go-pate | dhr̥ṣat ||6.45.21||

IAST: gomadbhir gopate dhṛṣat
Griffith: And cattle, boldly, Lord of kine!
Devanāgarī: गोमद्भिर्गोपते धृषत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | ā | pr̥ṇa | kāmam | vājebhiḥ | aśvi-bhiḥ || gomat-bhiḥ | go-pate | dhr̥ṣat ||6.45.21||

IAST: tad vo gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane
Griffith: Sing this, what time the ' juice is pressed, to him your Hero, Much-invoked,
Devanāgarī: तद्वो गाय सुते सचा पुरुहूताय सत्वने
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | gāya | sute | sacā | puru-hūtāya | satvane || śam | yat | gave | na | śākine ||6.45.22||

IAST: śaṁ yad gave na śākine
Griffith: To please him as a mighty Steer.
Devanāgarī: शं यद्गवे न शाकिने
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | gāya | sute | sacā | puru-hūtāya | satvane || śam | yat | gave | na | śākine ||6.45.22||

IAST: na ghā vasur ni yamate dānaṁ vājasya gomataḥ
Griffith: He, Excellent, withholdeth not his gift of power and wealth in kine,
Devanāgarī: न घा वसुर्नि यमते दानं वाजस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: na | gha | vasuḥ | ni | yamate | dānam | vājasya | go-mataḥ || yat | sīm | upa | śravat | giraḥ ||6.45.23||

IAST: yat sīm upa śravad giraḥ
Griffith: When he hath listened to our songs.
Devanāgarī: यत्सीमुप श्रवद्गिरः
pada pāṭha: na | gha | vasuḥ | ni | yamate | dānam | vājasya | go-mataḥ || yat | sīm | upa | śravat | giraḥ ||6.45.23||

IAST: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṁ gomantaṁ dasyuhā gamat
Griffith: May he with might unclose for us the cow's stall, whosesoe'er it be,
Devanāgarī: कुवित्सस्य प्र हि व्रजं गोमन्तं दस्युहा गमत्
pada pāṭha: kuvit-sasya | pra | hi | vrajam | go-mantam | dasyu-hā | gamat || śacībhiḥ | apa | naḥ | varat ||6.45.24||

IAST: śacībhir apa no varat
Griffith: To which the Dasyu-slayer goes.
Devanāgarī: शचीभिरप नो वरत्
pada pāṭha: kuvit-sasya | pra | hi | vrajam | go-mantam | dasyu-hā | gamat || śacībhiḥ | apa | naḥ | varat ||6.45.24||

IAST: imā u tvā śatakrato 'bhi pra ṇonuvur giraḥ
Griffith: O Indra Satakratu, these our songs have called aloud to thee,
Devanāgarī: इमा उ त्वा शतक्रतोऽभि प्र णोनुवुर्गिरः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | śatakrato iti śata-krato | abhi | pra | nonuvuḥ | giraḥ || indra | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||6.45.25||

IAST: indra vatsaṁ na mātaraḥ
Griffith: Like mother cows to meet their calves.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र वत्सं न मातरः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | śatakrato iti śata-krato | abhi | pra | nonuvuḥ | giraḥ || indra | vatsam | na | mātaraḥ ||6.45.25||

IAST: dūṇāśaṁ sakhyaṁ tava gaur asi vīra gavyate
Griffith: Hard is thy love to win: thou art a Steer to him who longs for steers:
Devanāgarī: दूणाशं सख्यं तव गौरसि वीर गव्यते
pada pāṭha: duḥ-naśam | sakhyam | tava | gauḥ | asi | vīra | gavyate || aśvaḥ | aśva-yate | bhava ||6.45.26||

IAST: aśvo aśvāyate bhava
Griffith: Be to one craving steeds a Steed.
Devanāgarī: अश्वो अश्वायते भव
pada pāṭha: duḥ-naśam | sakhyam | tava | gauḥ | asi | vīra | gavyate || aśvaḥ | aśva-yate | bhava ||6.45.26||

IAST: sa mandasvā hy andhaso rādhase tanvā mahe
Griffith: Delight thee with the juice we pour for thine own great munificence:
Devanāgarī: स मन्दस्वा ह्यन्धसो राधसे तन्वा महे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | andhasaḥ | rādhase | tanvā | mahe || na | stotāram | nide | karaḥ ||6.45.27||

IAST: na stotāraṁ nide karaḥ
Griffith: Yield not thy singer to reproach.
Devanāgarī: न स्तोतारं निदे करः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mandasva | hi | andhasaḥ | rādhase | tanvā | mahe || na | stotāram | nide | karaḥ ||6.45.27||

IAST: imā u tvā sute-sute nakṣante girvaṇo giraḥ
Griffith: These songs with every draught we pour come, Lover of the Song, to thee,
Devanāgarī: इमा उ त्वा सुतेसुते नक्षन्ते गिर्वणो गिरः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | sute-sute | nakṣante | girvaṇaḥ | giraḥ || vatsam | gāvaḥ | na | dhenavaḥ ||6.45.28||

IAST: vatsaṁ gāvo na dhenavaḥ
Griffith: As milch-kine hasten to their young
Devanāgarī: वत्सं गावो न धेनवः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | tvā | sute-sute | nakṣante | girvaṇaḥ | giraḥ || vatsam | gāvaḥ | na | dhenavaḥ ||6.45.28||

IAST: purūtamam purūṇāṁ stotṝṇāṁ vivāci
Griffith: To thee most oft invoked, amid the many singers' rivalry
Devanāgarī: पुरूतमं पुरूणां स्तोतॄणां विवाचि
pada pāṭha: puru-tamam | purūṇām | stotr̥̄ṇām | vi-vāci || vājebhiḥ | vāja-yatām ||6.45.29||

IAST: vājebhir vājayatām
Griffith: Who beg with all their might for wealth.
Devanāgarī: वाजेभिर्वाजयताम्
pada pāṭha: puru-tamam | purūṇām | stotr̥̄ṇām | vi-vāci || vājebhiḥ | vāja-yatām ||6.45.29||

IAST: asmākam indra bhūtu te stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ
Griffith: Nearest and most attractive may our laud,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमिन्द्र भूतु ते स्तोमो वाहिष्ठो अन्तमः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | bhūtu | te | stomaḥ | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | antamaḥ || asmān | rāye | mahe | hinu ||6.45.30||

IAST: asmān rāye mahe hinu
Griffith: Urge thou us on to ample wealth.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्राये महे हिनु
pada pāṭha: asmākam | indra | bhūtu | te | stomaḥ | vāhiṣṭhaḥ | antamaḥ || asmān | rāye | mahe | hinu ||6.45.30||

IAST: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnāṁ varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhann asthāt
Griffith: Brbu hath set himself above the Panis, o'er their highest head,
Devanāgarī: अधि बृबुः पणीनां वर्षिष्ठे मूर्धन्नस्थात्
pada pāṭha: adhi | br̥buḥ | paṇīnām | varṣiṣṭhe | mūrdhan | asthāt || uruḥ | kakṣaḥ | na | gāṅgyaḥ ||6.45.31||

IAST: uruḥ kakṣo na gāṅgyaḥ
Griffith: Like the wide bush on Ganga's bank.
Devanāgarī: उरुः कक्षो न गाङ्ग्यः
pada pāṭha: adhi | br̥buḥ | paṇīnām | varṣiṣṭhe | mūrdhan | asthāt || uruḥ | kakṣaḥ | na | gāṅgyaḥ ||6.45.31||

IAST: yasya vāyor iva dravad bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī
Griffith: He whose good bounty, thousandfold, swift as the rushing of the wind,
Devanāgarī: यस्य वायोरिव द्रवद्भद्रा रातिः सहस्रिणी
pada pāṭha: yasya | vāyoḥ-iva | dravat | bhadrā | rātiḥ | sahasriṇī || sadyaḥ | dānāya | maṁhate ||6.45.32||

IAST: sadyo dānāya maṁhate
Griffith: Suddenly offers as a gift.
Devanāgarī: सद्यो दानाय मंहते
pada pāṭha: yasya | vāyoḥ-iva | dravat | bhadrā | rātiḥ | sahasriṇī || sadyaḥ | dānāya | maṁhate ||6.45.32||

IAST: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
Griffith: So all our singers ever praise the pious Brbu's noble deed,
Devanāgarī: तत्सु नो विश्वे अर्य आ सदा गृणन्ति कारवः
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | viśve | aryaḥ | ā | sadā | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ || br̥bum | sahasra-dātamam | sūrim | sahasra-sātamam ||6.45.33||

IAST: bṛbuṁ sahasradātamaṁ sūriṁ sahasrasātamam
Griffith: Chief, best to give his thousands, best to give a thousand liberal gifts.
Devanāgarī: बृबुं सहस्रदातमं सूरिं सहस्रसातमम्
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | viśve | aryaḥ | ā | sadā | gr̥ṇanti | kāravaḥ || br̥bum | sahasra-dātamam | sūrim | sahasra-sātamam ||6.45.33||

IAST: tvām id dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ
Griffith: THAT we may win us wealth and power we poets, verily, call on thee:
Devanāgarī: त्वामिद्धि हवामहे साता वाजस्य कारवः
pada pāṭha: tvām | it | hi | havāmahe | sātā | vājasya | kāravaḥ || tvām | vr̥treṣu | indra | sat-patim | naraḥ | tvām | kāṣṭhāsu | arvataḥ ||6.46.1||

IAST: tvāṁ vṛtreṣv indra satpatiṁ naras tvāṁ kāṣṭhāsv arvataḥ
Griffith: In war men call on thee, Indra, the hero's Lord, in the steed's race-course call on thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वां वृत्रेष्विन्द्र सत्पतिं नरस्त्वां काष्ठास्वर्वतः
pada pāṭha: tvām | it | hi | havāmahe | sātā | vājasya | kāravaḥ || tvām | vr̥treṣu | indra | sat-patim | naraḥ | tvām | kāṣṭhāsu | arvataḥ ||6.46.1||

IAST: sa tvaṁ naś citra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā mahaḥ stavāno adrivaḥ
Griffith: As such, O Wonderful, whose hand holds thunder, praised as mighty, Caster of the Stone!
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नश्चित्र वज्रहस्त धृष्णुया महः स्तवानो अद्रिवः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | citra | vajra-hasta | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | mahaḥ | stavānaḥ | adri-vaḥ || gām | aśvam | rathyam | indra | sam | kira | satrā | vājam | na | jigyuṣe ||6.46.2||

IAST: gām aśvaṁ rathyam indra saṁ kira satrā vājaṁ na jigyuṣe
Griffith: Pour on us boldly, Indra, kine and chariotsteeds, ever to be the conqueror's strength.
Devanāgarī: गामश्वं रथ्यमिन्द्र सं किर सत्रा वाजं न जिग्युषे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | citra | vajra-hasta | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | mahaḥ | stavānaḥ | adri-vaḥ || gām | aśvam | rathyam | indra | sam | kira | satrā | vājam | na | jigyuṣe ||6.46.2||

IAST: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇir indraṁ taṁ hūmahe vayam
Griffith: We call upon that Indra, who, most active, ever slays the foe:
Devanāgarī: यः सत्राहा विचर्षणिरिन्द्रं तं हूमहे वयम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | satrā-hā | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | indram | tam | hūmahe | vayam || sahasra-muṣka | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | sat-pate | bhava | samat-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||6.46.3||

IAST: sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe
Griffith: Lord of the brave, Most Manly, with a thousand powers, help thou and prosper us in fight.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रमुष्क तुविनृम्ण सत्पते भवा समत्सु नो वृधे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | satrā-hā | vi-carṣaṇiḥ | indram | tam | hūmahe | vayam || sahasra-muṣka | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | sat-pate | bhava | samat-su | naḥ | vr̥dhe ||6.46.3||

IAST: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḻha ṛcīṣama
Griffith: Rcisama, thou forcest men as with a bull, with anger, in the furious fray.
Devanāgarī: बाधसे जनान्वृषभेव मन्युना घृषौ मीळ्ह ऋचीषम
pada pāṭha: bādhase | janān | vr̥ṣabhā-iva | manyunā | ghr̥ṣau | mīḷhe | r̥cīṣama || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | mahā-dhane | tanūṣu | ap-su | sūrye ||6.46.4||

IAST: asmākam bodhy avitā mahādhane tanūṣv apsu sūrye
Griffith: Be thou our Helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight, water, and for life.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं बोध्यविता महाधने तनूष्वप्सु सूर्ये
pada pāṭha: bādhase | janān | vr̥ṣabhā-iva | manyunā | ghr̥ṣau | mīḷhe | r̥cīṣama || asmākam | bodhi | avitā | mahā-dhane | tanūṣu | ap-su | sūrye ||6.46.4||

IAST: indra jyeṣṭhaṁ na ā bharam̐ ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, bring us name and fame, enriching, mightiest, excellent,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र ज्येष्ठं न आ भरँ ओजिष्ठं पपुरि श्रवः
pada pāṭha: indra | jyeṣṭham | naḥ | ā | bhara | ojiṣṭham | papuri | śravaḥ || yena | ime iti | citra | vajra-hasta | rodasī iti | ā | ubhe iti | su-śipra | prāḥ ||6.46.5||

IAST: yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ
Griffith: Wherewith, O Wondrous God, fair-visored, thunder-armed, thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: येनेमे चित्र वज्रहस्त रोदसी ओभे सुशिप्र प्राः
pada pāṭha: indra | jyeṣṭham | naḥ | ā | bhara | ojiṣṭham | papuri | śravaḥ || yena | ime iti | citra | vajra-hasta | rodasī iti | ā | ubhe iti | su-śipra | prāḥ ||6.46.5||

IAST: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇīsahaṁ rājan deveṣu hūmahe
Griffith: We call on thee, O King, Mighty amid the Gods, Ruler of men, to succour us.
Devanāgarī: त्वामुग्रमवसे चर्षणीसहं राजन्देवेषु हूमहे
pada pāṭha: tvām | ugram | avase | carṣaṇi-saham | rājan | deveṣu | hūmahe || viśvā | su | naḥ | vithurā | pibdanā | vaso iti | amitrān | su-sahān | kr̥dhi ||6.46.6||

IAST: viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso 'mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
Griffith: All that is weak in us, Excellent God, make firm: make our foes easy to subdue.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा सु नो विथुरा पिब्दना वसोऽमित्रान्सुषहान्कृधि
pada pāṭha: tvām | ugram | avase | carṣaṇi-saham | rājan | deveṣu | hūmahe || viśvā | su | naḥ | vithurā | pibdanā | vaso iti | amitrān | su-sahān | kr̥dhi ||6.46.6||

IAST: yad indra nāhuṣīṣv ām̐ ojo nṛmṇaṁ ca kṛṣṭiṣu
Griffith: All strength and valour that is found, Indra, in tribes of Nahusas, and all the splendid fame that the Fiv
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र नाहुषीष्वाँ ओजो नृम्णं च कृष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | nāhuṣīṣu | ā | ojaḥ | nr̥mṇam | ca | kr̥ṣṭiṣu || yat | vā | pañca | kṣitīnām | dyumnam | ā | bhara | satrā | viśvāni | pauṁsyā ||6.46.7||

IAST: yad vā pañca kṣitīnāṁ dyumnam ā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṁsyā
Griffith: Bring, yea, all manly powers at once.
Devanāgarī: यद्वा पञ्च क्षितीनां द्युम्नमा भर सत्रा विश्वानि पौंस्या
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | nāhuṣīṣu | ā | ojaḥ | nr̥mṇam | ca | kr̥ṣṭiṣu || yat | vā | pañca | kṣitīnām | dyumnam | ā | bhara | satrā | viśvāni | pauṁsyā ||6.46.7||

IAST: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāv ā jane yat pūrau kac ca vṛṣṇyam
Griffith: Or, Maghavan, what vigorous strength in Trksi lay, in Druhyus or in Paru's folk,
Devanāgarī: यद्वा तृक्षौ मघवन्द्रुह्यावा जने यत्पूरौ कच्च वृष्ण्यम्
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | tr̥kṣau | magha-van | druhyau | ā | jane | yat | pūrau | kat | ca | vr̥ṣṇyam || asmabhyam | tat | rirīhi | sam | nr̥-sahye | amitrān | pr̥t-su | turvaṇe ||6.46.8||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tad rirīhi saṁ nṛṣāhye 'mitrān pṛtsu turvaṇe
Griffith: Fully bestow on us, that, in the conquering fray, we may subdue our foes in fight.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं तद्रिरीहि सं नृषाह्येऽमित्रान्पृत्सु तुर्वणे
pada pāṭha: yat | vā | tr̥kṣau | magha-van | druhyau | ā | jane | yat | pūrau | kat | ca | vr̥ṣṇyam || asmabhyam | tat | rirīhi | sam | nr̥-sahye | amitrān | pr̥t-su | turvaṇe ||6.46.8||

IAST: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṁ trivarūthaṁ svastimat
Griffith: O Indra, grant a happy home, a triple refuge triply strong.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र त्रिधातु शरणं त्रिवरूथं स्वस्तिमत्
pada pāṭha: indra | tri-dhātu | śaraṇam | tri-varūtham | svasti-mat || chardiḥ | yaccha | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | mahyam | ca | yavaya | didyum | ebhyaḥ ||6.46.9||

IAST: chardir yaccha maghavadbhyaś ca mahyaṁ ca yāvayā didyum ebhyaḥ
Griffith: Bestow a dwelling-place on the rich lords and me, and keep thy dart afar from these.
Devanāgarī: छर्दिर्यच्छ मघवद्भ्यश्च मह्यं च यावया दिद्युमेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: indra | tri-dhātu | śaraṇam | tri-varūtham | svasti-mat || chardiḥ | yaccha | maghavat-bhyaḥ | ca | mahyam | ca | yavaya | didyum | ebhyaḥ ||6.46.9||

IAST: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhur abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā
Griffith: They who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe, boldly attack and smite him down,-
Devanāgarī: ये गव्यता मनसा शत्रुमादभुरभिप्रघ्नन्ति धृष्णुया
pada pāṭha: ye | gavyatā | manasā | śatrum | ā-dabhuḥ | abhi-praghnanti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || adha | sma | naḥ | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | tanū-pāḥ | antamaḥ | bhava ||6.46.10||

IAST: adha smā no maghavann indra girvaṇas tanūpā antamo bhava
Griffith: From these, O Indra Maghavan who lovest song, be closest guardian of our lives.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा नो मघवन्निन्द्र गिर्वणस्तनूपा अन्तमो भव
pada pāṭha: ye | gavyatā | manasā | śatrum | ā-dabhuḥ | abhi-praghnanti | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā || adha | sma | naḥ | magha-van | indra | girvaṇaḥ | tanū-pāḥ | antamaḥ | bhava ||6.46.10||

IAST: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyam avā yudhi
Griffith: And now, O Indra, strengthen us: come near and aid us in the fight,
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा नो वृधे भवेन्द्र नायमवा युधि
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | naḥ | vr̥dhe | bhava | indra | nāyam | ava | yudhi || yat | antarikṣe | patayanti | parṇinaḥ | didyavaḥ | tigma-mūrdhānaḥ ||6.46.11||

IAST: yad antarikṣe patayanti parṇino didyavas tigmamūrdhānaḥ
Griffith: What time the feathered shafts are flying in the air, the arrows with their sharpened points.
Devanāgarī: यदन्तरिक्षे पतयन्ति पर्णिनो दिद्यवस्तिग्ममूर्धानः
pada pāṭha: adha | sma | naḥ | vr̥dhe | bhava | indra | nāyam | ava | yudhi || yat | antarikṣe | patayanti | parṇinaḥ | didyavaḥ | tigma-mūrdhānaḥ ||6.46.11||

IAST: yatra śūrāsas tanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām
Griffith: Give us, where heroes strain their bodies in the fight, the shelter that our fathers loved.
Devanāgarī: यत्र शूरासस्तन्वो वितन्वते प्रिया शर्म पितॄणाम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | śūrāsaḥ | tanvaḥ | vi-tanvate | priyā | śarma | pitr̥̄ṇām || adha | sma | yaccha | tanve | tane | ca | chardhiḥ | acittam | yavaya | dveṣaḥ ||6.46.12||

IAST: adha smā yaccha tanve tane ca chardir acittaṁ yāvaya dveṣaḥ
Griffith: To us and to our sons give refuge: keep afar all unobserved hostility.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मा यच्छ तन्वे तने च छर्दिरचित्तं यावय द्वेषः
pada pāṭha: yatra | śūrāsaḥ | tanvaḥ | vi-tanvate | priyā | śarma | pitr̥̄ṇām || adha | sma | yaccha | tanve | tane | ca | chardhiḥ | acittam | yavaya | dveṣaḥ ||6.46.12||

IAST: yad indra sarge arvataś codayāse mahādhane
Griffith: When, Indra, in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed,
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्र सर्गे अर्वतश्चोदयासे महाधने
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | sarge | arvataḥ | codayāse | mahā-dhane || asamane | adhvani | vr̥jine | pathi | śyenān-iva | śravasyataḥ ||6.46.13||

IAST: asamane adhvani vṛjine pathi śyenām̐ iva śravasyataḥ
Griffith: On the uneven road and on a toilsome path, like falcons, eager for renown,
Devanāgarī: असमने अध्वनि वृजिने पथि श्येनाँ इव श्रवस्यतः
pada pāṭha: yat | indra | sarge | arvataḥ | codayāse | mahā-dhane || asamane | adhvani | vr̥jine | pathi | śyenān-iva | śravasyataḥ ||6.46.13||

IAST: sindhūm̐r iva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośam anu ṣvaṇi
Griffith: Speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent, responsive to the urging call,
Devanāgarī: सिन्धूँरिव प्रवण आशुया यतो यदि क्लोशमनु ष्वणि
pada pāṭha: sindhūn-iva | pravaṇe | āśu-yā | yataḥ | yadi | klośam | anu | svani || ā | ye | vayaḥ | na | varvr̥tati | āmiṣi | gr̥bhītāḥ | bāhvoḥ | gavi ||6.46.14||

IAST: ā ye vayo na varvṛtaty āmiṣi gṛbhītā bāhvor gavi
Griffith: That come like birds attracted to the bait, held in by reins in both the driver's hands.
Devanāgarī: आ ये वयो न वर्वृतत्यामिषि गृभीता बाह्वोर्गवि
pada pāṭha: sindhūn-iva | pravaṇe | āśu-yā | yataḥ | yadi | klośam | anu | svani || ā | ye | vayaḥ | na | varvr̥tati | āmiṣi | gr̥bhītāḥ | bāhvoḥ | gavi ||6.46.14||

IAST: svāduṣ kilāyam madhumām̐ utāyaṁ tīvraḥ kilāyaṁ rasavām̐ utāyam
Griffith: YEA, this is good to taste and full of sweetness, verily it is strong and rich in flavour.
Devanāgarī: स्वादुष्किलायं मधुमाँ उतायं तीव्रः किलायं रसवाँ उतायम्
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | kila | ayam | madhu-mān | uta | ayam | tīvraḥ | kila | ayam | rasa-vān | uta | ayam || uto iti | nu | asya | papi-vāṁsam | indram | na | kaḥ | cana | sahate | ā-haveṣu ||6.47.1||

IAST: uto nv asya papivāṁsam indraṁ na kaś cana sahata āhaveṣu
Griffith: No one may conquer Indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.
Devanāgarī: उतो न्वस्य पपिवांसमिन्द्रं न कश्चन सहत आहवेषु
pada pāṭha: svāduḥ | kila | ayam | madhu-mān | uta | ayam | tīvraḥ | kila | ayam | rasa-vān | uta | ayam || uto iti | nu | asya | papi-vāṁsam | indram | na | kaḥ | cana | sahate | ā-haveṣu ||6.47.1||

IAST: ayaṁ svādur iha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda
Griffith: This sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden: it boldened Indra when he siaughtered Vrtra,
Devanāgarī: अयं स्वादुरिह मदिष्ठ आस यस्येन्द्रो वृत्रहत्ये ममाद
pada pāṭha: ayam | svāduḥ | iha | madiṣṭhaḥ | āsa | yasya | indraḥ | vr̥tra-hatye | mamāda || purūṇi | yaḥ | cyautnā | śambarasya | vi | navatim | nava | ca | dehyaḥ | han ||6.47.2||

IAST: purūṇi yaś cyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṁ nava ca dehyo han
Griffith: When he defeated Sambara's many onslaughts, and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.
Devanāgarī: पुरूणि यश्च्यौत्ना शम्बरस्य वि नवतिं नव च देह्यो हन्
pada pāṭha: ayam | svāduḥ | iha | madiṣṭhaḥ | āsa | yasya | indraḥ | vr̥tra-hatye | mamāda || purūṇi | yaḥ | cyautnā | śambarasya | vi | navatim | nava | ca | dehyaḥ | han ||6.47.2||

IAST: ayam me pīta ud iyarti vācam ayam manīṣām uśatīm ajīgaḥ
Griffith: This stirreth up my voice when I have drunk it: this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit.
Devanāgarī: अयं मे पीत उदियर्ति वाचमयं मनीषामुशतीमजीगः
pada pāṭha: ayam | me | pītaḥ | ut | iyarti | vācam | ayam | manīṣām | uśatīm | ajīgariti || ayam | ṣaṭ | urvīḥ | amimīta | dhīraḥ | na | yābhyaḥ | bhuvanam | kat | cana | āre ||6.47.3||

IAST: ayaṁ ṣaḻ urvīr amimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṁ kac canāre
Griffith: This Sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.
Devanāgarī: अयं षळुर्वीरमिमीत धीरो न याभ्यो भुवनं कच्चनारे
pada pāṭha: ayam | me | pītaḥ | ut | iyarti | vācam | ayam | manīṣām | uśatīm | ajīgariti || ayam | ṣaṭ | urvīḥ | amimīta | dhīraḥ | na | yābhyaḥ | bhuvanam | kat | cana | āre ||6.47.3||

IAST: ayaṁ sa yo varimāṇam pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṁ divo akṛṇod ayaṁ saḥ
Griffith: This, even this, is he who hath created the breadth of earth, the lofty height of heaven.
Devanāgarī: अयं स यो वरिमाणं पृथिव्या वर्ष्माणं दिवो अकृणोदयं सः
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | yaḥ | varimāṇam | pr̥thivyāḥ | varṣmāṇam | divaḥ | akr̥ṇot | ayam | saḥ || ayam | pīyūṣam | tisr̥ṣu | pravat-su | somaḥ | dādhāra | uru | antarikṣam ||6.47.4||

IAST: ayam pīyūṣaṁ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorv antarikṣam
Griffith: He formed the nectar in three headlong rivers. Soma supports the wide mid-air above us.
Devanāgarī: अयं पीयूषं तिसृषु प्रवत्सु सोमो दाधारोर्वन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | saḥ | yaḥ | varimāṇam | pr̥thivyāḥ | varṣmāṇam | divaḥ | akr̥ṇot | ayam | saḥ || ayam | pīyūṣam | tisr̥ṣu | pravat-su | somaḥ | dādhāra | uru | antarikṣam ||6.47.4||

IAST: ayaṁ vidac citradṛśīkam arṇaḥ śukrasadmanām uṣasām anīke
Griffith: He found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the Dawns who dwell in brightness.
Devanāgarī: अयं विदच्चित्रदृशीकमर्णः शुक्रसद्मनामुषसामनीके
pada pāṭha: ayam | vidat | citra-dr̥śīkam | arṇaḥ | śukra-sadmanām | uṣasām | anīke || ayam | mahān | mahatā | skambhanena | ut | dyām | astabhnāt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān ||6.47.5||

IAST: ayam mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyām astabhnād vṛṣabho marutvān
Griffith: This Mighty One, the Steer begirt by Maruts, hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.
Devanāgarī: अयं महान्महता स्कम्भनेनोद्द्यामस्तभ्नाद्वृषभो मरुत्वान्
pada pāṭha: ayam | vidat | citra-dr̥śīkam | arṇaḥ | śukra-sadmanām | uṣasām | anīke || ayam | mahān | mahatā | skambhanena | ut | dyām | astabhnāt | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | marutvān ||6.47.5||

IAST: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām
Griffith: Drink Soma boldly from the beaker, Indra, in war for treasures, Hero, Vrtra-slayer!
Devanāgarī: धृषत्पिब कलशे सोममिन्द्र वृत्रहा शूर समरे वसूनाम्
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ṣat | piba | kalaśe | somam | indra | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | sam-are | vasūnām || mādhyaṁdine | savane | ā | vr̥ṣasva | rayi-sthānaḥ | rayim | asmāsu | dhehi ||6.47.6||

IAST: mādhyaṁdine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayim asmāsu dhehi
Griffith: Fill thyself full at the mid-day libation, and give us wealth, thou Treasury of riches.
Devanāgarī: माध्यंदिने सवन आ वृषस्व रयिस्थानो रयिमस्मासु धेहि
pada pāṭha: dhr̥ṣat | piba | kalaśe | somam | indra | vr̥tra-hā | śūra | sam-are | vasūnām || mādhyaṁdine | savane | ā | vr̥ṣasva | rayi-sthānaḥ | rayim | asmāsu | dhehi ||6.47.6||

IAST: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṁ vasyo accha
Griffith: Look out for us, O Indra, as our Leader, and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र प्र णः पुरएतेव पश्य प्र नो नय प्रतरं वस्यो अच्छ
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | naḥ | puraetā-iva | paśya | pra | naḥ | naya | pra-taram | vasyaḥ | accha || bhava | su-pāraḥ | ati-pārayaḥ | naḥ | bhava | su-nītiḥ | uta | vāma-nītiḥ ||6.47.7||

IAST: bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītir uta vāmanītiḥ
Griffith: Excellent Guardian, bear us well through peril, and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.
Devanāgarī: भवा सुपारो अतिपारयो नो भवा सुनीतिरुत वामनीतिः
pada pāṭha: indra | pra | naḥ | puraetā-iva | paśya | pra | naḥ | naya | pra-taram | vasyaḥ | accha || bhava | su-pāraḥ | ati-pārayaḥ | naḥ | bhava | su-nītiḥ | uta | vāma-nītiḥ ||6.47.7||

IAST: uruṁ no lokam anu neṣi vidvān svarvaj jyotir abhayaṁ svasti
Griffith: Lead us to ample room, O thou who knowest, to happiness, security, and sunlight.
Devanāgarī: उरुं नो लोकमनु नेषि विद्वान्स्वर्वज्ज्योतिरभयं स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: urum | naḥ | lokam | anu | neṣi | vidvān | svaḥ-vat | jyotiḥ | abhayam | svasti || r̥ṣvā | te | indra | sthavirasya | bāhū iti | upa | stheyāma | śaraṇā | br̥hantā ||6.47.8||

IAST: ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā
Griffith: High, Indra, are the arms of thee the Mighty: may we betake. us to their lofty shelter.
Devanāgarī: ऋष्वा त इन्द्र स्थविरस्य बाहू उप स्थेयाम शरणा बृहन्ता
pada pāṭha: urum | naḥ | lokam | anu | neṣi | vidvān | svaḥ-vat | jyotiḥ | abhayam | svasti || r̥ṣvā | te | indra | sthavirasya | bāhū iti | upa | stheyāma | śaraṇā | br̥hantā ||6.47.8||

IAST: variṣṭhe na indra vandhure dhā vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvann aśvayor ā
Griffith: Set us on widest chariot-seat, O Indra, with two steeds best to draw, O Lord of Hundreds!
Devanāgarī: वरिष्ठे न इन्द्र वन्धुरे धा वहिष्ठयोः शतावन्नश्वयोरा
pada pāṭha: variṣṭhe | naḥ | indra | vandhure | dhāḥ | vahiṣṭhayoḥ | śata-van | aśvayoḥ | ā || iṣam | ā | vakṣi | iṣām | varṣiṣṭhām | mā | naḥ | tārīt | magha-van | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ ||6.47.9||

IAST: iṣam ā vakṣīṣāṁ varṣiṣṭhām mā nas tārīn maghavan rāyo aryaḥ
Griffith: Bring us the best among all sorts of viands: let not the foe's wealth, Maghavan, subdue us.
Devanāgarī: इषमा वक्षीषां वर्षिष्ठां मा नस्तारीन्मघवन्रायो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: variṣṭhe | naḥ | indra | vandhure | dhāḥ | vahiṣṭhayoḥ | śata-van | aśvayoḥ | ā || iṣam | ā | vakṣi | iṣām | varṣiṣṭhām | mā | naḥ | tārīt | magha-van | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ ||6.47.9||

IAST: indra mṛḻa mahyaṁ jīvātum iccha codaya dhiyam ayaso na dhārām
Griffith: Be gracious, Indra, let my days be lengthened: sharpen my thought as 'twere a blade of iron
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र मृळ मह्यं जीवातुमिच्छ चोदय धियमयसो न धाराम्
pada pāṭha: indra | mr̥ḷa | mahyam | jīvātum | iccha | codaya | dhiyam | ayasaḥ | na | dhārām || yat | kim | ca | aham | tvā-yuḥ | idam | vadāmi | tat | juṣasva | kr̥dhi | mā | deva-vantam ||6.47.10||

IAST: yat kiṁ cāhaṁ tvāyur idaṁ vadāmi taj juṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam
Griffith: Approve whatever words I speak, dependent on thee, and grant me thy divine protection.
Devanāgarī: यत्किं चाहं त्वायुरिदं वदामि तज्जुषस्व कृधि मा देववन्तम्
pada pāṭha: indra | mr̥ḷa | mahyam | jīvātum | iccha | codaya | dhiyam | ayasaḥ | na | dhārām || yat | kim | ca | aham | tvā-yuḥ | idam | vadāmi | tat | juṣasva | kr̥dhi | mā | deva-vantam ||6.47.10||

IAST: trātāram indram avitāram indraṁ have-have suhavaṁ śūram indram
Griffith: Indra the Rescuer, Indra the Helper, Hero who listens at each invocation,
Devanāgarī: त्रातारमिन्द्रमवितारमिन्द्रं हवेहवे सुहवं शूरमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: trātāram | indram | avitāram | indram | have-have | su-havam | śūram | indram || hvayāmi | śakram | puru-hūtam | indram | svasti | naḥ | magha-vā | dhātu | indraḥ ||6.47.11||

IAST: hvayāmi śakram puruhūtam indraṁ svasti no maghavā dhātv indraḥ
Griffith: Sakra I call, Indra invoked of many. May Indra Maghavan prosper and bless us.
Devanāgarī: ह्वयामि शक्रं पुरुहूतमिन्द्रं स्वस्ति नो मघवा धात्विन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: trātāram | indram | avitāram | indram | have-have | su-havam | śūram | indram || hvayāmi | śakram | puru-hūtam | indram | svasti | naḥ | magha-vā | dhātu | indraḥ ||6.47.11||

IAST: indraḥ sutrāmā svavām̐ avobhiḥ sumṛḻīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ
Griffith: May helpful Indra as our good Protector, Lord of all treasures, favour us with succour,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः सुत्रामा स्ववाँ अवोभिः सुमृळीको भवतु विश्ववेदाः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su-trāmā | sva-vān | avaḥ-bhiḥ | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | bhavatu | viśva-vedāḥ || bādhatām | dveṣaḥ | abhayam | kr̥ṇotu | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||6.47.12||

IAST: bādhatāṁ dveṣo abhayaṁ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: Baffle our foes, and give us rest and safety, and may we be the lords of hero vigour.
Devanāgarī: बाधतां द्वेषो अभयं कृणोतु सुवीर्यस्य पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | su-trāmā | sva-vān | avaḥ-bhiḥ | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | bhavatu | viśva-vedāḥ || bādhatām | dveṣaḥ | abhayam | kr̥ṇotu | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||6.47.12||

IAST: tasya vayaṁ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma
Griffith: May we enjoy the grace of him the Holy, yea, may we dwell in his auspicious favour.
Devanāgarī: तस्य वयं सुमतौ यज्ञियस्यापि भद्रे सौमनसे स्याम
pada pāṭha: tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma || saḥ | su-trāmā | sva-vān | indraḥ | asme iti | ārāt | cit | dveṣaḥ | sanutaḥ | yuyotu ||6.47.13||

IAST: sa sutrāmā svavām̐ indro asme ārāc cid dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu
Griffith: May helpful Indra as our good Preserver drive from us, even from afar, our foemen.
Devanāgarī: स सुत्रामा स्ववाँ इन्द्रो अस्मे आराच्चिद्द्वेषः सनुतर्युयोतु
pada pāṭha: tasya | vayam | su-matau | yajñiyasya | api | bhadre | saumanase | syāma || saḥ | su-trāmā | sva-vān | indraḥ | asme iti | ārāt | cit | dveṣaḥ | sanutaḥ | yuyotu ||6.47.13||

IAST: ava tve indra pravato normir giro brahmāṇi niyuto dhavante
Griffith: Like rivers rushing down a slope, O Indra, to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses.
Devanāgarī: अव त्वे इन्द्र प्रवतो नोर्मिर्गिरो ब्रह्माणि नियुतो धवन्ते
pada pāṭha: ava | tve iti | indra | pra-vataḥ | na | ūrmiḥ | giraḥ | brahmāṇi | ni-yutaḥ | dhavante || uru | na | rādhaḥ | savanā | purūṇi | apaḥ | gāḥ | vajrin | yuvase | sam | indūn ||6.47.14||

IAST: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇy apo gā vajrin yuvase sam indūn
Griffith: Thou gatherest, Thunderer! like widespread bounty, kine, water, drops, and manifold libations.
Devanāgarī: उरू न राधः सवना पुरूण्यपो गा वज्रिन्युवसे समिन्दून्
pada pāṭha: ava | tve iti | indra | pra-vataḥ | na | ūrmiḥ | giraḥ | brahmāṇi | ni-yutaḥ | dhavante || uru | na | rādhaḥ | savanā | purūṇi | apaḥ | gāḥ | vajrin | yuvase | sam | indūn ||6.47.14||

IAST: ka īṁ stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt ko yajāte yad ugram in maghavā viśvahāvet
Griffith: Who lauds him, satisfies him, pays him worship? E'en the rich noble still hath found him mighty.
Devanāgarī: क ईं स्तवत्कः पृणात्को यजाते यदुग्रमिन्मघवा विश्वहावेत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | īm | stavat | kaḥ | pr̥ṇāt | kaḥ | yajāte | yat | ugram | it | magha-vā | viśvahā | avet || pādau-iva | pra-haran | anyam-anyam | kr̥ṇoti | pūrvam | aparam | śacībhiḥ ||6.47.15||

IAST: pādāv iva praharann anyam-anyaṁ kṛṇoti pūrvam aparaṁ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: With power, as when one moves his feet alternate, he makes the last precede, the foremost follow.
Devanāgarī: पादाविव प्रहरन्नन्यमन्यं कृणोति पूर्वमपरं शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | īm | stavat | kaḥ | pr̥ṇāt | kaḥ | yajāte | yat | ugram | it | magha-vā | viśvahā | avet || pādau-iva | pra-haran | anyam-anyam | kr̥ṇoti | pūrvam | aparam | śacībhiḥ ||6.47.15||

IAST: śṛṇve vīra ugram-ugraṁ damāyann anyam-anyam atinenīyamānaḥ
Griffith: Famed is the Hero as each strong man's tamer, ever advancing one and then another.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वे वीर उग्रमुग्रं दमायन्नन्यमन्यमतिनेनीयमानः
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇve | vīraḥ | ugram-ugram | dama-yan | anyam-anyam | ati-nenīyamānaḥ || edhamāna-dviṭ | ubhayasya | rājā | coṣkūyate | viśaḥ | indraḥ | manuṣyān ||6.47.16||

IAST: edhamānadviḻ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśa indro manuṣyān
Griffith: King of both worlds, hating the high and haughty, Indra protects the men who are his people.
Devanāgarī: एधमानद्विळुभयस्य राजा चोष्कूयते विश इन्द्रो मनुष्यान्
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇve | vīraḥ | ugram-ugram | dama-yan | anyam-anyam | ati-nenīyamānaḥ || edhamāna-dviṭ | ubhayasya | rājā | coṣkūyate | viśaḥ | indraḥ | manuṣyān ||6.47.16||

IAST: parā pūrveṣāṁ sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇo aparebhir eti
Griffith: He loves no more the men he loved aforetime: he turns and moves away allied with others.
Devanāgarī: परा पूर्वेषां सख्या वृणक्ति वितर्तुराणो अपरेभिरेति
pada pāṭha: parā | pūrveṣām | sakhyā | vr̥ṇakti | vi-tarturāṇaḥ | aparebhiḥ | eti || ananu-bhūtīḥ | ava-dhūnvānaḥ | pūrvīḥ | indraḥ | śaradaḥ | tartarīti ||6.47.17||

IAST: anānubhūtīr avadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīr indraḥ śaradas tartarīti
Griffith: Rejecting those who disregard his worship, Indra victorious lives through many autumns.
Devanāgarī: अनानुभूतीरवधून्वानः पूर्वीरिन्द्रः शरदस्तर्तरीति
pada pāṭha: parā | pūrveṣām | sakhyā | vr̥ṇakti | vi-tarturāṇaḥ | aparebhiḥ | eti || ananu-bhūtīḥ | ava-dhūnvānaḥ | pūrvīḥ | indraḥ | śaradaḥ | tartarīti ||6.47.17||

IAST: rūpaṁ-rūpam pratirūpo babhūva tad asya rūpam praticakṣaṇāya
Griffith: In every figure he hath been the mode: this is his only form for us to look on.
Devanāgarī: रूपंरूपं प्रतिरूपो बभूव तदस्य रूपं प्रतिचक्षणाय
pada pāṭha: rūpam-rūpam | prati-rūpaḥ | babhūva | tat | asya | rūpam | prati-cakṣaṇāya || indraḥ | māyābhiḥ | puru-rūpaḥ | īyate | yuktāḥ | hi | asya | harayaḥ | śatā | daśa ||6.47.18||

IAST: indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate yuktā hy asya harayaḥ śatā daśa
Griffith: Indra moves multiform by his illusions; for his Bay Steeds are yoked, ten times a hundred.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो मायाभिः पुरुरूप ईयते युक्ता ह्यस्य हरयः शता दश
pada pāṭha: rūpam-rūpam | prati-rūpaḥ | babhūva | tat | asya | rūpam | prati-cakṣaṇāya || indraḥ | māyābhiḥ | puru-rūpaḥ | īyate | yuktāḥ | hi | asya | harayaḥ | śatā | daśa ||6.47.18||

IAST: yujāno haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭeha rājati
Griffith: Here Tvastar, yoking to the car the Bay Steeds, hath extended sway.
Devanāgarī: युजानो हरिता रथे भूरि त्वष्टेह राजति
pada pāṭha: yujānaḥ | haritā | rathe | bhūri | tvaṣṭā | iha | rājati || kaḥ | viśvāhā | dviṣataḥ | pakṣaḥ | āsate | uta | āsīneṣu | sūriṣu ||6.47.19||

IAST: ko viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣa āsata utāsīneṣu sūriṣu
Griffith: Who will for ever stand upon the foeman's side, even when our princes sit at ease?
Devanāgarī: को विश्वाहा द्विषतः पक्ष आसत उतासीनेषु सूरिषु
pada pāṭha: yujānaḥ | haritā | rathe | bhūri | tvaṣṭā | iha | rājati || kaḥ | viśvāhā | dviṣataḥ | pakṣaḥ | āsate | uta | āsīneṣu | sūriṣu ||6.47.19||

IAST: agavyūti kṣetram āganma devā urvī satī bhūmir aṁhūraṇābhūt
Griffith: Gods, we have reached a country void of pasture the land, though spacious, was too small to hold us.
Devanāgarī: अगव्यूति क्षेत्रमागन्म देवा उर्वी सती भूमिरंहूरणाभूत्
pada pāṭha: agavyūti | kṣetram | ā | aganma | devāḥ | urvī | satī | bhūmiḥ | aṁhūraṇā | abhūt || br̥haspate | pra | cikitsa | go-iṣṭau | itthā | sate | jaritre | indra | panthām ||6.47.20||

IAST: bṛhaspate pra cikitsā gaviṣṭāv itthā sate jaritra indra panthām
Griffith: Brhaspati, provide in war for cattle; find a path, Indra, for this faithful singer.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते प्र चिकित्सा गविष्टावित्था सते जरित्र इन्द्र पन्थाम्
pada pāṭha: agavyūti | kṣetram | ā | aganma | devāḥ | urvī | satī | bhūmiḥ | aṁhūraṇā | abhūt || br̥haspate | pra | cikitsa | go-iṣṭau | itthā | sate | jaritre | indra | panthām ||6.47.20||

IAST: dive-dive sadṛśīr anyam ardhaṁ kṛṣṇā asedhad apa sadmano jāḥ
Griffith: Day after day far from their seat he drove them, alike, from place to place, those darksome creatures.
Devanāgarī: दिवेदिवे सदृशीरन्यमर्धं कृष्णा असेधदप सद्मनो जाः
pada pāṭha: dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | anyam | ardham | kr̥ṣṇāḥ | asedhat | apa | sadmanaḥ | jāḥ || ahan | dāsā | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vasna-yantā | uda-vraje | varcinam | śambaram | ca ||6.47.21||

IAST: ahan dāsā vṛṣabho vasnayantodavraje varcinaṁ śambaraṁ ca
Griffith: The Hero slew the meanly-huckstering Dasas, Varcin and Sambara, where the waters gather.
Devanāgarī: अहन्दासा वृषभो वस्नयन्तोदव्रजे वर्चिनं शम्बरं च
pada pāṭha: dive-dive | sa-dr̥śīḥ | anyam | ardham | kr̥ṣṇāḥ | asedhat | apa | sadmanaḥ | jāḥ || ahan | dāsā | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | vasna-yantā | uda-vraje | varcinam | śambaram | ca ||6.47.21||

IAST: prastoka in nu rādhasas ta indra daśa kośayīr daśa vājino 'dāt
Griffith: Out of thy bounty, Indra, hath Prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses.
Devanāgarī: प्रस्तोक इन्नु राधसस्त इन्द्र दश कोशयीर्दश वाजिनोऽदात्
pada pāṭha: pra-stokaḥ | it | nu | rādhasaḥ | te | indra | daśa | kośayīḥ | daśa | vājinaḥ | adāt || divaḥ-dāsāt | atithi-gvasya | rādhaḥ | śāmbaram | vasu | prati | agrabhīṣma ||6.47.22||

IAST: divodāsād atithigvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaraṁ vasu praty agrabhīṣma
Griffith: We have received in turn from Divodasa Sambara's wealth, the gift of Atithigva.
Devanāgarī: दिवोदासादतिथिग्वस्य राधः शाम्बरं वसु प्रत्यग्रभीष्म
pada pāṭha: pra-stokaḥ | it | nu | rādhasaḥ | te | indra | daśa | kośayīḥ | daśa | vājinaḥ | adāt || divaḥ-dāsāt | atithi-gvasya | rādhaḥ | śāmbaram | vasu | prati | agrabhīṣma ||6.47.22||

IAST: daśāśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrādhibhojanā
Griffith: Ten horses and ten treasure-chests, ten garments as an added gift,
Devanāgarī: दशाश्वान्दश कोशान्दश वस्त्राधिभोजना
pada pāṭha: daśa | aśvān | daśa | kośān | daśa | vastrā | adhi-bhojanā || daśo iti | hiraṇya-piṇḍān | divaḥ-dāsāt | asāniṣam ||6.47.23||

IAST: daśo hiraṇyapiṇḍān divodāsād asāniṣam
Griffith: These and ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodasa's hand.
Devanāgarī: दशो हिरण्यपिण्डान्दिवोदासादसानिषम्
pada pāṭha: daśa | aśvān | daśa | kośān | daśa | vastrā | adhi-bhojanā || daśo iti | hiraṇya-piṇḍān | divaḥ-dāsāt | asāniṣam ||6.47.23||

IAST: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śataṁ gā atharvabhyaḥ
Griffith: Ten cars with extra steed to each, for the Atharvans hundred cows,
Devanāgarī: दश रथान्प्रष्टिमतः शतं गा अथर्वभ्यः
pada pāṭha: daśa | rathān | praṣṭi-mataḥ | śatam | gāḥ | atharva-bhyaḥ || aśvathaḥ | pāyave | adāt ||6.47.24||

IAST: aśvathaḥ pāyave 'dāt
Griffith: Hath Asvatha to Payu given.
Devanāgarī: अश्वथः पायवेऽदात्
pada pāṭha: daśa | rathān | praṣṭi-mataḥ | śatam | gāḥ | atharva-bhyaḥ || aśvathaḥ | pāyave | adāt ||6.47.24||

IAST: mahi rādho viśvajanyaṁ dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayo abhy ayaṣṭa
Griffith: Thus Srnjaya's son honoured the Bharadvajas, recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.
Devanāgarī: महि राधो विश्वजन्यं दधानान्भरद्वाजान्सार्ञ्जयो अभ्ययष्ट
pada pāṭha: mahi | rādhaḥ | viśva-janyam | dadhānān | bharat-vājān | sarñjayaḥ | abhi | ayaṣṭa ||6.47.25||

IAST: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgo hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ
Griffith: Lord of the wood, be firm and strong in body: be, bearing us, a brave victorious hero
Devanāgarī: गोभिः संनद्धो असि वीळयस्वास्थाता ते जयतु जेत्वानि
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | vīḷu-aṅgaḥ | hi | bhūyāḥ | asmat-sakhā | pra-taraṇaḥ | su-vīraḥ || gobhiḥ | sam-naddhaḥ | asi | vīḷayasva | ā-sthātā | te | jayatu | jetvāni ||6.47.26||

IAST: gobhiḥ saṁnaddho asi vīḻayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni
Griffith: Show forth thy strength, compact with straps of leather, and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.
Devanāgarī: वनस्पते वीड्वङ्गो हि भूया अस्मत्सखा प्रतरणः सुवीरः
pada pāṭha: vanaspate | vīḷu-aṅgaḥ | hi | bhūyāḥ | asmat-sakhā | pra-taraṇaḥ | su-vīraḥ || gobhiḥ | sam-naddhaḥ | asi | vīḷayasva | ā-sthātā | te | jayatu | jetvāni ||6.47.26||

IAST: divas pṛthivyāḥ pary oja udbhṛtaṁ vanaspatibhyaḥ pary ābhṛtaṁ sahaḥ
Griffith: Its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth: its conquering force was brought from sovrans
Devanāgarī: अपामोज्मानं परि गोभिरावृतमिन्द्रस्य वज्रं हविषा रथं यज
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | pari | ojaḥ | ut-bhr̥tam | vanaspati-bhyaḥ | pari | ā-bhr̥tam | sahaḥ || apām | ojmānam | pari | gobhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | indrasya | vajram | haviṣā | ratham | yaja ||6.47.27||

IAST: apām ojmānam pari gobhir āvṛtam indrasya vajraṁ haviṣā rathaṁ yaja
Griffith: Honour with holy gifts the Car like Indra's bolt, the Car bound round with straps, the vigour of the flo
Devanāgarī: दिवस्पृथिव्याः पर्योज उद्भृतं वनस्पतिभ्यः पर्याभृतं सहः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | pari | ojaḥ | ut-bhr̥tam | vanaspati-bhyaḥ | pari | ā-bhr̥tam | sahaḥ || apām | ojmānam | pari | gobhiḥ | ā-vr̥tam | indrasya | vajram | haviṣā | ratham | yaja ||6.47.27||

IAST: indrasya vajro marutām anīkam mitrasya garbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ
Griffith: Thou Bolt of Indra, Vanguard of the Maruts, close knit to Varuna and Child of Mitra,-
Devanāgarī: सेमां नो हव्यदातिं जुषाणो देव रथ प्रति हव्या गृभाय
pada pāṭha: indrasya | vajraḥ | marutām | anīkam | mitrasya | garbhaḥ | varuṇasya | nābhiḥ || saḥ | imām | naḥ | havya-dātim | juṣāṇaḥ | deva | ratha | prati | havyā | gr̥bhāya ||6.47.28||

IAST: semāṁ no havyadātiṁ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya
Griffith: As such, accepting gifts which here we offer, receive, O Godlike Chariot, these oblations.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य वज्रो मरुतामनीकं मित्रस्य गर्भो वरुणस्य नाभिः
pada pāṭha: indrasya | vajraḥ | marutām | anīkam | mitrasya | garbhaḥ | varuṇasya | nābhiḥ || saḥ | imām | naḥ | havya-dātim | juṣāṇaḥ | deva | ratha | prati | havyā | gr̥bhāya ||6.47.28||

IAST: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyām purutrā te manutāṁ viṣṭhitaṁ jagat
Griffith: Send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven, and let the world in all its breadth regard thee;
Devanāgarī: स दुन्दुभे सजूरिन्द्रेण देवैर्दूराद्दवीयो अप सेध शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: upa | śvāsaya | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | puru-trā | te | manutām | vi-sthitam | jagat || saḥ | dundubhe | sa-jūḥ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | dūrāt | davīyaḥ | apa | sedha | śatrūn ||6.47.29||

IAST: sa dundubhe sajūr indreṇa devair dūrād davīyo apa sedha śatrūn
Griffith: O Drum, accordant with the Gods and Indra, drive thou afar, yea, very far, our foemen.
Devanāgarī: उप श्वासय पृथिवीमुत द्यां पुरुत्रा ते मनुतां विष्ठितं जगत्
pada pāṭha: upa | śvāsaya | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām | puru-trā | te | manutām | vi-sthitam | jagat || saḥ | dundubhe | sa-jūḥ | indreṇa | devaiḥ | dūrāt | davīyaḥ | apa | sedha | śatrūn ||6.47.29||

IAST: ā krandaya balam ojo na ā dhā niḥ ṣṭanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ
Griffith: Thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour: yea, thunder forth and drive away all dangers.
Devanāgarī: अप प्रोथ दुन्दुभे दुच्छुना इत इन्द्रस्य मुष्टिरसि वीळयस्व
pada pāṭha: ā | krandaya | balam | ojaḥ | naḥ | ā | dhāḥ | niḥ | stanihi | duḥ-itā | bādhamānaḥ || apa | protha | dundubhe | ducchunāḥ | itaḥ | indrasya | muṣṭiḥ | asi | vīḷayasva ||6.47.30||

IAST: apa protha dundubhe ducchunā ita indrasya muṣṭir asi vīḻayasva
Griffith: Drive hence, O War-drum, drive away misfortune: thou art the Fist of Indra: show thy firmness.
Devanāgarī: आ क्रन्दय बलमोजो न आ धा निः ष्टनिहि दुरिता बाधमानः
pada pāṭha: ā | krandaya | balam | ojaḥ | naḥ | ā | dhāḥ | niḥ | stanihi | duḥ-itā | bādhamānaḥ || apa | protha | dundubhe | ducchunāḥ | itaḥ | indrasya | muṣṭiḥ | asi | vīḷayasva ||6.47.30||

IAST: āmūr aja pratyāvartayemāḥ ketumad dundubhir vāvadīti
Griffith: Drive hither those, and these again bring hither: the War-drum speaks aloud as battle's signal.
Devanāgarī: समश्वपर्णाश्चरन्ति नो नरोऽस्माकमिन्द्र रथिनो जयन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | amūḥ | aja | prati-āvartaya | imāḥ | ketu-mat | dundubhiḥ | vāvadīti || sam | aśva-parṇāḥ | caranti | naḥ | naraḥ | asmākam | indra | rathinaḥ | jayantu ||6.47.31||

IAST: sam aśvaparṇāś caranti no naro 'smākam indra rathino jayantu
Griffith: Our heroes, winged with horses, come together. Let our car-warriors, Indra, be triumphant.
Devanāgarī: आमूरज प्रत्यावर्तयेमाः केतुमद्दुन्दुभिर्वावदीति
pada pāṭha: ā | amūḥ | aja | prati-āvartaya | imāḥ | ketu-mat | dundubhiḥ | vāvadīti || sam | aśva-parṇāḥ | caranti | naḥ | naraḥ | asmākam | indra | rathinaḥ | jayantu ||6.47.31||

IAST: yajñā-yajñā vo agnaye girā-girā ca dakṣase
Griffith: SING to your Agni with each song, at every sacrifice, for strength.
Devanāgarī: प्रप्र वयममृतं जातवेदसं प्रियं मित्रं न शंसिषम्
pada pāṭha: yajñā-yajñā | vaḥ | agnaye | girā-girā | ca | dakṣase || pra-pra | vayam | amr̥tam | jāta-vedasam | priyam | mitram | na | śaṁsiṣam ||6.48.1||

IAST: pra-pra vayam amṛtaṁ jātavedasam priyam mitraṁ na śaṁsiṣam
Griffith: Come, let us praise the Wise and Everlasting God, even as a well-beloved Friend,
Devanāgarī: यज्ञायज्ञा वो अग्नये गिरागिरा च दक्षसे
pada pāṭha: yajñā-yajñā | vaḥ | agnaye | girā-girā | ca | dakṣase || pra-pra | vayam | amr̥tam | jāta-vedasam | priyam | mitram | na | śaṁsiṣam ||6.48.1||

IAST: ūrjo napātaṁ sa hināyam asmayur dāśema havyadātaye
Griffith: The Son of Strength; for is he not our gracious Lord? Let us serve him who bears our gifts.
Devanāgarī: भुवद्वाजेष्वविता भुवद्वृध उत त्राता तनूनाम्
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | saḥ | hina | ayam | asma-yuḥ | dāśema | havya-dātaye || bhuvat | vājeṣu | avitā | bhuvat | vr̥dhaḥ | uta | trātā | tanūnām ||6.48.2||

IAST: bhuvad vājeṣv avitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām
Griffith: In battle may he be our help and strengthener, yea, be the saviour of our lives.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जो नपातं स हिनायमस्मयुर्दाशेम हव्यदातये
pada pāṭha: ūrjaḥ | napātam | saḥ | hina | ayam | asma-yuḥ | dāśema | havya-dātaye || bhuvat | vājeṣu | avitā | bhuvat | vr̥dhaḥ | uta | trātā | tanūnām ||6.48.2||

IAST: vṛṣā hy agne ajaro mahān vibhāsy arciṣā
Griffith: Agni, thou beamest forth with light, great Hero, never changed by time.
Devanāgarī: अजस्रेण शोचिषा शोशुचच्छुचे सुदीतिभिः सु दीदिहि
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | hi | agne | ajaraḥ | mahān | vi-bhāsi | arciṣā || ajasreṇa | śociṣā | śośucat | śuce | sudīti-bhiḥ | su | dīdihi ||6.48.3||

IAST: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucac chuce sudītibhiḥ su dīdihi
Griffith: Shining, pure Agni! with a light that never fades, beam with thy fair beams brilliantly.
Devanāgarī: वृषा ह्यग्ने अजरो महान्विभास्यर्चिषा
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | hi | agne | ajaraḥ | mahān | vi-bhāsi | arciṣā || ajasreṇa | śociṣā | śośucat | śuce | sudīti-bhiḥ | su | dīdihi ||6.48.3||

IAST: maho devān yajasi yakṣy ānuṣak tava kratvota daṁsanā
Griffith: Thou worshippest great Gods: bring them without delay by wisdom and thy wondrous power.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचः सीं कृणुह्यग्नेऽवसे रास्व वाजोत वंस्व
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | devān | yajasi | yakṣi | ānuṣak | tava | kratvā | uta | daṁsanā || arvācaḥ | sīm | kr̥ṇuhi | agne | avase | rāsva | vājā | uta | vaṁsva ||6.48.4||

IAST: arvācaḥ sīṁ kṛṇuhy agne 'vase rāsva vājota vaṁsva
Griffith: O Agni, make them turn hither to succour us. Give strength, and win it for thyself.
Devanāgarī: महो देवान्यजसि यक्ष्यानुषक्तव क्रत्वोत दंसना
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | devān | yajasi | yakṣi | ānuṣak | tava | kratvā | uta | daṁsanā || arvācaḥ | sīm | kr̥ṇuhi | agne | avase | rāsva | vājā | uta | vaṁsva ||6.48.4||

IAST: yam āpo adrayo vanā garbham ṛtasya piprati
Griffith: He whom floods, stones, and trees support, the offspring of eternal Law;
Devanāgarī: सहसा यो मथितो जायते नृभिः पृथिव्या अधि सानवि
pada pāṭha: yam | āpaḥ | adrayaḥ | vanā | garbham | r̥tasya | piprati || sahasā | yaḥ | mathitaḥ | jāyate | nr̥-bhiḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi | sānavi ||6.48.5||

IAST: sahasā yo mathito jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyā adhi sānavi
Griffith: He who when rubbed with force is brought to life by men upon the lofty height of earth;
Devanāgarī: यमापो अद्रयो वना गर्भमृतस्य पिप्रति
pada pāṭha: yam | āpaḥ | adrayaḥ | vanā | garbham | r̥tasya | piprati || sahasā | yaḥ | mathitaḥ | jāyate | nr̥-bhiḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | adhi | sānavi ||6.48.5||

IAST: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi
Griffith: He who hath filled both worlds fult with his brilliant shine, who hastens with his smoke to heaven;
Devanāgarī: तिरस्तमो ददृश ऊर्म्यास्वा श्यावास्वरुषो वृषा श्यावा अरुषो वृषा
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | paprau | bhānunā | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | dhūmena | dhāvate | divi || tiraḥ | tamaḥ | dadr̥śe | ūrmyāsu | ā | śyāvāsu | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā | ā | śyāvāḥ | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā ||6.48.6||

IAST: tiras tamo dadṛśa ūrmyāsv ā śyāvāsv aruṣo vṛṣā śyāvā aruṣo vṛṣā
Griffith: He made himself apparent through the gloom by night, the Red Bull in the darksome nights, the Red Bull i
Devanāgarī: आ यः पप्रौ भानुना रोदसी उभे धूमेन धावते दिवि
pada pāṭha: ā | yaḥ | paprau | bhānunā | rodasī iti | ubhe iti | dhūmena | dhāvate | divi || tiraḥ | tamaḥ | dadr̥śe | ūrmyāsu | ā | śyāvāsu | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā | ā | śyāvāḥ | aruṣaḥ | vr̥ṣā ||6.48.6||

IAST: bṛhadbhir agne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā
Griffith: O Agni, with thy lofty beams, with thy pure brilliancy, O God,
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजे समिधानो यविष्ठ्य रेवन्नः शुक्र दीदिहि द्युमत्पावक दीदिहि
pada pāṭha: br̥hat-bhiḥ | agne | arci-bhiḥ | śukreṇa | deva | śociṣā || bharat-vāje | sam-idhānaḥ | yaviṣṭhya | revat | naḥ | śukra | dīdihi | dyu-mat | pāvaka | dīdihi ||6.48.7||

IAST: bharadvāje samidhāno yaviṣṭhya revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
Griffith: Kindled, Most Youthful One! by Bharadvaja's hand, shine on us, O pure God, with wealth, shine, Purifier
Devanāgarī: बृहद्भिरग्ने अर्चिभिः शुक्रेण देव शोचिषा
pada pāṭha: br̥hat-bhiḥ | agne | arci-bhiḥ | śukreṇa | deva | śociṣā || bharat-vāje | sam-idhānaḥ | yaviṣṭhya | revat | naḥ | śukra | dīdihi | dyu-mat | pāvaka | dīdihi ||6.48.7||

IAST: viśvāsāṁ gṛhapatir viśām asi tvam agne mānuṣīṇām
Griffith: Thou art the Lord of house and home of all the tribes, O Agni, of all tribes of men.
Devanāgarī: शतं पूर्भिर्यविष्ठ पाह्यंहसः समेद्धारं शतं हिमाः स्तोतृभ्यो ये च ददति
pada pāṭha: viśvāsām | gr̥ha-patiḥ | viśām | asi | tvam | agne | mānuṣīṇām || śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭha | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | sam-eddhāram | śatam | himāḥ | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ye | ca | dadati ||6.48.8||

IAST: śatam pūrbhir yaviṣṭha pāhy aṁhasaḥ sameddhāraṁ śataṁ himāḥ stotṛbhyo ye ca dadati
Griffith: Guard with a hundred forts thy kindler from distress, through hundred winters, Youngest God! and those w
Devanāgarī: विश्वासां गृहपतिर्विशामसि त्वमग्ने मानुषीणाम्
pada pāṭha: viśvāsām | gr̥ha-patiḥ | viśām | asi | tvam | agne | mānuṣīṇām || śatam | pūḥ-bhiḥ | yaviṣṭha | pāhi | aṁhasaḥ | sam-eddhāram | śatam | himāḥ | stotr̥-bhyaḥ | ye | ca | dadati ||6.48.8||

IAST: tvaṁ naś citra ūtyā vaso rādhāṁsi codaya
Griffith: Wonderful, with thy favouring help, send us thy bounties, gracious Lord.
Devanāgarī: अस्य रायस्त्वमग्ने रथीरसि विदा गाधं तुचे तु नः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | citraḥ | ūtyā | vaso iti | rādhāṁsi | codaya || asya | rāyaḥ | tvam | agne | rathīḥ | asi | vidāḥ | gādham | tuce | tu | naḥ ||6.48.9||

IAST: asya rāyas tvam agne rathīr asi vidā gādhaṁ tuce tu naḥ
Griffith: Thou art the Charioteer, Agni, of earthly wealth: find rest and safety for our seed.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नश्चित्र ऊत्या वसो राधांसि चोदय
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | citraḥ | ūtyā | vaso iti | rādhāṁsi | codaya || asya | rāyaḥ | tvam | agne | rathīḥ | asi | vidāḥ | gādham | tuce | tu | naḥ ||6.48.9||

IAST: parṣi tokaṁ tanayam partṛbhiṣ ṭvam adabdhair aprayutvabhiḥ
Griffith: With guards unfailing never negligent speed thou our children and our progeny.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने हेळांसि दैव्या युयोधि नोऽदेवानि ह्वरांसि च
pada pāṭha: parṣi | tokam | tanayam | partr̥-bhiḥ | tvam | adabdhaiḥ | aprayutva-bhiḥ || agne | heḷāṁsi | daivyā | yuyodhi | naḥ | adevāni | hvarāṁsi | ca ||6.48.10||

IAST: agne heḻāṁsi daivyā yuyodhi no 'devāni hvarāṁsi ca
Griffith: Keep far from us, O Agni, all celestial wrath and wickedness of godless men.
Devanāgarī: पर्षि तोकं तनयं पर्तृभिष्ट्वमदब्धैरप्रयुत्वभिः
pada pāṭha: parṣi | tokam | tanayam | partr̥-bhiḥ | tvam | adabdhaiḥ | aprayutva-bhiḥ || agne | heḷāṁsi | daivyā | yuyodhi | naḥ | adevāni | hvarāṁsi | ca ||6.48.10||

IAST: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughāṁ dhenum ajadhvam upa navyasā vacaḥ
Griffith: Hither, O friends, with newest song drive her who freely pours her milk;
Devanāgarī: सृजध्वमनपस्फुराम्
pada pāṭha: ā | sakhāyaḥ | sabaḥ-dughām | dhenum | ajadhvam | upa | navyasā | vacaḥ || sr̥jadhvam | anapa-sphurām ||6.48.11||

IAST: sṛjadhvam anapasphurām
Griffith: Loose her who never turns away;
Devanāgarī: आ सखायः सबर्दुघां धेनुमजध्वमुप नव्यसा वचः
pada pāṭha: ā | sakhāyaḥ | sabaḥ-dughām | dhenum | ajadhvam | upa | navyasā | vacaḥ || sr̥jadhvam | anapa-sphurām ||6.48.11||

IAST: yā śardhāya mārutāya svabhānave śravo 'mṛtyu dhukṣata
Griffith: Who, for the host of Maruts bright with native sheen, hath shed immortal fame like milk;
Devanāgarī: या मृळीके मरुतां तुराणां या सुम्नैरेवयावरी
pada pāṭha: yā | śardhāya | mārutāya | sva-bhānave | śravaḥ | amr̥tyu | dhukṣata || yā | mr̥ḷīke | marutām | turāṇām | yā | sumnaiḥ | eva-yāvarī ||6.48.12||

IAST: yā mṛḻīke marutāṁ turāṇāṁ yā sumnair evayāvarī
Griffith: Whom the impetuous Maruts look upon with love, who moves in splendour on their ways.
Devanāgarī: या शर्धाय मारुताय स्वभानवे श्रवोऽमृत्यु धुक्षत
pada pāṭha: yā | śardhāya | mārutāya | sva-bhānave | śravaḥ | amr̥tyu | dhukṣata || yā | mr̥ḷīke | marutām | turāṇām | yā | sumnaiḥ | eva-yāvarī ||6.48.12||

IAST: bharadvājāyāva dhukṣata dvitā
Griffith: For Bharadvaja she poured down in days of old
Devanāgarī: धेनुं च विश्वदोहसमिषं च विश्वभोजसम्
pada pāṭha: bharat-vājāya | ava | dhukṣata | dvitā || dhenum | ca | viśva-dohasam | iṣam | ca | viśva-bhojasam ||6.48.13||

IAST: dhenuṁ ca viśvadohasam iṣaṁ ca viśvabhojasam
Griffith: The milch-cow yielding milk for all, and food that gives all nourishment.
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजायाव धुक्षत द्विता
pada pāṭha: bharat-vājāya | ava | dhukṣata | dvitā || dhenum | ca | viśva-dohasam | iṣam | ca | viśva-bhojasam ||6.48.13||

IAST: taṁ va indraṁ na sukratuṁ varuṇam iva māyinam
Griffith: Your friend like Indra passing wise, with magic power like Varuna.
Devanāgarī: अर्यमणं न मन्द्रं सृप्रभोजसं विष्णुं न स्तुष आदिशे
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | indram | na | su-kratum | varuṇam-iva | māyinam || aryamaṇam | na | mandram | sr̥pra-bhojasam | viṣṇum | na | stuṣe | ā-diśe ||6.48.14||

IAST: aryamaṇaṁ na mandraṁ sṛprabhojasaṁ viṣṇuṁ na stuṣa ādiśe
Griffith: Like Aryaman joy-giving, bringing plenteous food like ViSnxu for my wish, I praise,
Devanāgarī: तं व इन्द्रं न सुक्रतुं वरुणमिव मायिनम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vaḥ | indram | na | su-kratum | varuṇam-iva | māyinam || aryamaṇam | na | mandram | sr̥pra-bhojasam | viṣṇum | na | stuṣe | ā-diśe ||6.48.14||

IAST: tveṣaṁ śardho na mārutaṁ tuviṣvaṇy anarvāṇam pūṣaṇaṁ saṁ yathā śatā
Griffith: Bright as the host of Maruts mighty in their roar. May they bring Pusan free from foes;
Devanāgarī: सं सहस्रा कारिषच्चर्षणिभ्य आँ आविर्गूळ्हा वसू करत्सुवेदा नो वसू करत्
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | śardhaḥ | na | mārutam | tuvi-svaṇi | anarvāṇam | pūṣaṇam | sam | yathā | śatā || sam | sahasrā | kāriṣat | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | ā | āviḥ | gūḷhā | vasu | karat | su-vedā | naḥ | vasu | karat ||6.48.15||

IAST: saṁ sahasrā kāriṣac carṣaṇibhya ām̐ āvir gūḻhā vasū karat suvedā no vasū karat
Griffith: May they bring hither hundreds, thousands for our men: may they bring hidden stores to light, and make w
Devanāgarī: त्वेषं शर्धो न मारुतं तुविष्वण्यनर्वाणं पूषणं सं यथा शता
pada pāṭha: tveṣam | śardhaḥ | na | mārutam | tuvi-svaṇi | anarvāṇam | pūṣaṇam | sam | yathā | śatā || sam | sahasrā | kāriṣat | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | ā | āviḥ | gūḷhā | vasu | karat | su-vedā | naḥ | vasu | karat ||6.48.15||

IAST: ā mā pūṣann upa drava śaṁsiṣaṁ nu te apikarṇa āghṛṇe
Griffith: Haste to me, Pusan, in thine car, bright Deity: I fain would speak:
Devanāgarī: अघा अर्यो अरातयः
pada pāṭha: ā | mā | pūṣan | upa | drava | śaṁsiṣam | nu | te | api-karṇe | āghr̥ṇe || aghāḥ | aryaḥ | arātayaḥ ||6.48.16||

IAST: aghā aryo arātayaḥ
Griffith: Most sinful is our foeman's hate.
Devanāgarī: आ मा पूषन्नुप द्रव शंसिषं नु ते अपिकर्ण आघृणे
pada pāṭha: ā | mā | pūṣan | upa | drava | śaṁsiṣam | nu | te | api-karṇe | āghr̥ṇe || aghāḥ | aryaḥ | arātayaḥ ||6.48.16||

IAST: mā kākambīram ud vṛho vanaspatim aśastīr vi hi nīnaśaḥ
Griffith: Tear not up by the roots the Kakambira tree: destroy thou all malignity.
Devanāgarī: मोत सूरो अह एवा चन ग्रीवा आदधते वेः
pada pāṭha: mā | kākambīram | ut | vr̥haḥ | vanaspatim | aśastīḥ | vi | hi | nīnaśaḥ || mā | uta | sūraḥ | ahariti | eva | cana | grīvāḥ | ā-dadhate | veriti veḥ ||6.48.17||

IAST: mota sūro aha evā cana grīvā ādadhate veḥ
Griffith: Let them not snare by day the neck of that Celestial Bird the Sun.
Devanāgarī: मा काकम्बीरमुद्वृहो वनस्पतिमशस्तीर्वि हि नीनशः
pada pāṭha: mā | kākambīram | ut | vr̥haḥ | vanaspatim | aśastīḥ | vi | hi | nīnaśaḥ || mā | uta | sūraḥ | ahariti | eva | cana | grīvāḥ | ā-dadhate | veriti veḥ ||6.48.17||

IAST: dṛter iva te 'vṛkam astu sakhyam
Griffith: Uninjured let thy friendship be, like the smooth surface of a skin,
Devanāgarī: अच्छिद्रस्य दधन्वतः सुपूर्णस्य दधन्वतः
pada pāṭha: dr̥teḥ-iva | te | avr̥kam | astu | sakhyam || acchidrasya | dadhan-vataḥ | su-pūrṇasya | dadhan-vataḥ ||6.48.18||

IAST: acchidrasya dadhanvataḥ supūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ
Griffith: A flawless skin, containing curds, full to the mouth, containing curds.
Devanāgarī: दृतेरिव तेऽवृकमस्तु सख्यम्
pada pāṭha: dr̥teḥ-iva | te | avr̥kam | astu | sakhyam || acchidrasya | dadhan-vataḥ | su-pūrṇasya | dadhan-vataḥ ||6.48.18||

IAST: paro hi martyair asi samo devair uta śriyā
Griffith: For thou art high above mankind, in glory equal to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: अभि ख्यः पूषन्पृतनासु नस्त्वमवा नूनं यथा पुरा
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | hi | martyaiḥ | asi | samaḥ | devaiḥ | uta | śriyā || abhi | khyaḥ | pūṣan | pr̥tanāsu | naḥ | tvam | ava | nūnam | yathā | purā ||6.48.19||

IAST: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu nas tvam avā nūnaṁ yathā purā
Griffith: Therefore, O Pusan, look upon us in the fight: now help us as in days of old.
Devanāgarī: परो हि मर्त्यैरसि समो देवैरुत श्रिया
pada pāṭha: paraḥ | hi | martyaiḥ | asi | samaḥ | devaiḥ | uta | śriyā || abhi | khyaḥ | pūṣan | pr̥tanāsu | naḥ | tvam | ava | nūnam | yathā | purā ||6.48.19||

IAST: vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītir astu sūnṛtā
Griffith: May the kind excellence of him the Kind, loud Roarers! be our guide,
Devanāgarī: देवस्य वा मरुतो मर्त्यस्य वेजानस्य प्रयज्यवः
pada pāṭha: vāmī | vāmasya | dhūtayaḥ | pra-nītiḥ | astu | sūnr̥tā || devasya | vā | marutaḥ | martyasya | vā | ījānasya | pra-yajyavaḥ ||6.48.20||

IAST: devasya vā maruto martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ
Griffith: Be it the God's, O Maruts, or a mortal man's who worships, ye impetuous Ones!
Devanāgarī: वामी वामस्य धूतयः प्रणीतिरस्तु सूनृता
pada pāṭha: vāmī | vāmasya | dhūtayaḥ | pra-nītiḥ | astu | sūnr̥tā || devasya | vā | marutaḥ | martyasya | vā | ījānasya | pra-yajyavaḥ ||6.48.20||

IAST: sadyaś cid yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyāṁ devo naiti sūryaḥ
Griffith: They whose high glory in a moment like the God, the Sun, goes round the space of heaven,
Devanāgarī: त्वेषं शवो दधिरे नाम यज्ञियं मरुतो वृत्रहं शवो ज्येष्ठं वृत्रहं शवः
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | cit | yasya | carkr̥tiḥ | pari | dyām | devaḥ | na | eti | sūryaḥ || tveṣam | śavaḥ | dadhire | nāma | yajñiyam | marutaḥ | vr̥tra-ham | śavaḥ | jyeṣṭham | vr̥tra-ham | śavaḥ ||6.48.21||

IAST: tveṣaṁ śavo dadhire nāma yajñiyam maruto vṛtrahaṁ śavo jyeṣṭhaṁ vṛtrahaṁ śavaḥ
Griffith: The Maruts have obtained bright strength, a sacred name, strength that destroys the Vrtras, strength Vr
Devanāgarī: सद्यश्चिद्यस्य चर्कृतिः परि द्यां देवो नैति सूर्यः
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | cit | yasya | carkr̥tiḥ | pari | dyām | devaḥ | na | eti | sūryaḥ || tveṣam | śavaḥ | dadhire | nāma | yajñiyam | marutaḥ | vr̥tra-ham | śavaḥ | jyeṣṭham | vr̥tra-ham | śavaḥ ||6.48.21||

IAST: sakṛd dha dyaur ajāyata sakṛd bhūmir ajāyata
Griffith: Once, only once, the heaven was made, once only once, the earth was formed-
Devanāgarī: पृश्न्या दुग्धं सकृत्पयस्तदन्यो नानु जायते
pada pāṭha: sakr̥t | ha | dyauḥ | ajāyata | sakr̥t | bhūmiḥ | ajāyata || pr̥śnyāḥ | dugdham | sakr̥t | payaḥ | tat | anyaḥ | na | anu | jāyate ||6.48.22||

IAST: pṛśnyā dugdhaṁ sakṛt payas tad anyo nānu jāyate
Griffith: Once, only Prsni's milk was shed: no second, after this, is born.
Devanāgarī: सकृद्ध द्यौरजायत सकृद्भूमिरजायत
pada pāṭha: sakr̥t | ha | dyauḥ | ajāyata | sakr̥t | bhūmiḥ | ajāyata || pr̥śnyāḥ | dugdham | sakr̥t | payaḥ | tat | anyaḥ | na | anu | jāyate ||6.48.22||

IAST: stuṣe janaṁ suvrataṁ navyasībhir gīrbhir mitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā
Griffith: I LAUD with newest songs the Righteous People, Mitra and Varuna who make us happy.
Devanāgarī: त आ गमन्तु त इह श्रुवन्तु सुक्षत्रासो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | janam | su-vratam | navyasībhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | sumna-yantā || te | ā | gamantu | te | iha | śruvantu | su-kṣatrāsaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ ||6.49.1||

IAST: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro agniḥ
Griffith: Let them approach, here let them listen,Agni, Varuna, Mitra, Lords of fair dominion.
Devanāgarī: स्तुषे जनं सुव्रतं नव्यसीभिर्गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणा सुम्नयन्ता
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | janam | su-vratam | navyasībhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | sumna-yantā || te | ā | gamantu | te | iha | śruvantu | su-kṣatrāsaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ ||6.49.1||

IAST: viśo-viśa īḍyam adhvareṣv adṛptakratum aratiṁ yuvatyoḥ
Griffith: Him, to be praised at each tribe's sacrifices, the Two young Matrons' sober-minded Herald,
Devanāgarī: दिवः शिशुं सहसः सूनुमग्निं यज्ञस्य केतुमरुषं यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: viśaḥ-viśaḥ | īḍyam | adhvareṣu | adr̥pta-kratum | aratim | yuvatyoḥ || divaḥ | śiśum | sahasaḥ | sūnum | agnim | yajñasya | ketum | aruṣam | yajadhyai ||6.49.2||

IAST: divaḥ śiśuṁ sahasaḥ sūnum agniṁ yajñasya ketum aruṣaṁ yajadhyai
Griffith: The Son of Strength, the Child of Heaven, the signal of sacrifice, red Agni will I worship.
Devanāgarī: विशोविश ईड्यमध्वरेष्वदृप्तक्रतुमरतिं युवत्योः
pada pāṭha: viśaḥ-viśaḥ | īḍyam | adhvareṣu | adr̥pta-kratum | aratim | yuvatyoḥ || divaḥ | śiśum | sahasaḥ | sūnum | agnim | yajñasya | ketum | aruṣam | yajadhyai ||6.49.2||

IAST: aruṣasya duhitarā virūpe stṛbhir anyā pipiśe sūro anyā
Griffith: Unlike in form are the Red God's two Daughters: one is the Sun's, and stars bedeck the other.
Devanāgarī: मिथस्तुरा विचरन्ती पावके मन्म श्रुतं नक्षत ऋच्यमाने
pada pāṭha: aruṣasya | duhitarā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe | str̥-bhiḥ | anyā | pipiśe | sūraḥ | anyā || mithaḥ-turā | vicarantī iti vi-carantī | pāvake iti | manma | śrutam | nakṣataḥ | r̥cyamāne iti ||6.49.3||

IAST: mithasturā vicarantī pāvake manma śrutaṁ nakṣata ṛcyamāne
Griffith: Apart, the Sanctifiers, in succession, come to the famed hymn, praised in holy verses.
Devanāgarī: अरुषस्य दुहितरा विरूपे स्तृभिरन्या पिपिशे सूरो अन्या
pada pāṭha: aruṣasya | duhitarā | virūpe iti vi-rūpe | str̥-bhiḥ | anyā | pipiśe | sūraḥ | anyā || mithaḥ-turā | vicarantī iti vi-carantī | pāvake iti | manma | śrutam | nakṣataḥ | r̥cyamāne iti ||6.49.3||

IAST: pra vāyum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā bṛhadrayiṁ viśvavāraṁ rathaprām
Griffith: I with a lofty song call hither Vayu, all-bounteous, filler of his car, most wealthy.
Devanāgarī: द्युतद्यामा नियुतः पत्यमानः कविः कविमियक्षसि प्रयज्यो
pada pāṭha: pra | vāyum | accha | br̥hatī | manīṣā | br̥hat-rayim | viśva-vāram | ratha-prām || dyutat-yāmā | ni-yutaḥ | patyamānaḥ | kaviḥ | kavim | iyakṣasi | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo ||6.49.4||

IAST: dyutadyāmā niyutaḥ patyamānaḥ kaviḥ kavim iyakṣasi prayajyo
Griffith: Thou, Sage, with bright path, Lord of harnessed horses, impetuous, promptly honourest the prudent.
Devanāgarī: प्र वायुमच्छा बृहती मनीषा बृहद्रयिं विश्ववारं रथप्राम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vāyum | accha | br̥hatī | manīṣā | br̥hat-rayim | viśva-vāram | ratha-prām || dyutat-yāmā | ni-yutaḥ | patyamānaḥ | kaviḥ | kavim | iyakṣasi | prayajyo iti pra-yajyo ||6.49.4||

IAST: sa me vapuś chadayad aśvinor yo ratho virukmān manasā yujānaḥ
Griffith: That chariot of the Asvins, fair to look on, pleaseth me well, yoked with a thought, refulgent,
Devanāgarī: येन नरा नासत्येषयध्यै वर्तिर्याथस्तनयाय त्मने च
pada pāṭha: saḥ | me | vapuḥ | chadayat | aśvinoḥ | yaḥ | rathaḥ | virukmān | manasā | yujānaḥ || yena | narā | nāsatyā | iṣayadhyai | vartiḥ | yāthaḥ | tanayāya | tmane | ca ||6.49.5||

IAST: yena narā nāsatyeṣayadhyai vartir yāthas tanayāya tmane ca
Griffith: Wherewith, Nasatyas, Chiefs, ye seek our dwelling, to give new strength to us and to our children.
Devanāgarī: स मे वपुश्छदयदश्विनोर्यो रथो विरुक्मान्मनसा युजानः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | me | vapuḥ | chadayat | aśvinoḥ | yaḥ | rathaḥ | virukmān | manasā | yujānaḥ || yena | narā | nāsatyā | iṣayadhyai | vartiḥ | yāthaḥ | tanayāya | tmane | ca ||6.49.5||

IAST: parjanyavātā vṛṣabhā pṛthivyāḥ purīṣāṇi jinvatam apyāni
Griffith: Bulls of the Earth, O Vata and Parjanya, stir up for us the regions of the water.
Devanāgarī: सत्यश्रुतः कवयो यस्य गीर्भिर्जगतः स्थातर्जगदा कृणुध्वम्
pada pāṭha: parjanyavātā | vr̥ṣabhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | purīṣāṇi | jinvatam | apyāni || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yasya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | jagataḥ | sthātaḥ | jagat | ā | kr̥ṇudhvam ||6.49.6||

IAST: satyaśrutaḥ kavayo yasya gīrbhir jagataḥ sthātar jagad ā kṛṇudhvam
Griffith: Hearers of truth, ye, Sages, World-Supporters, increase his living wealth whose songs delight you.
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्यवाता वृषभा पृथिव्याः पुरीषाणि जिन्वतमप्यानि
pada pāṭha: parjanyavātā | vr̥ṣabhā | pr̥thivyāḥ | purīṣāṇi | jinvatam | apyāni || satya-śrutaḥ | kavayaḥ | yasya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | jagataḥ | sthātaḥ | jagat | ā | kr̥ṇudhvam ||6.49.6||

IAST: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṁ dhāt
Griffith: So may Sarasvati, the Hero's Consort, brisk with rare life, the lightning's Child, inspire us,
Devanāgarī: ग्नाभिरच्छिद्रं शरणं सजोषा दुराधर्षं गृणते शर्म यंसत्
pada pāṭha: pāvīravī | kanyā | citra-āyuḥ | sarasvatī | vīra-patnī | dhiyam | dhāt || gnābhiḥ | acchidram | śaraṇam | sa-joṣāḥ | duḥ-ādharṣam | gr̥ṇate | śarma | yaṁsat ||6.49.7||

IAST: gnābhir acchidraṁ śaraṇaṁ sajoṣā durādharṣaṁ gṛṇate śarma yaṁsat
Griffith: And, with the Dames accordant, give the singer a refuge unassailable and flawless.
Devanāgarī: पावीरवी कन्या चित्रायुः सरस्वती वीरपत्नी धियं धात्
pada pāṭha: pāvīravī | kanyā | citra-āyuḥ | sarasvatī | vīra-patnī | dhiyam | dhāt || gnābhiḥ | acchidram | śaraṇam | sa-joṣāḥ | duḥ-ādharṣam | gr̥ṇate | śarma | yaṁsat ||6.49.7||

IAST: pathas-pathaḥ paripatiṁ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhy ānaḻ arkam
Griffith: I praise with eloquence him who guards all pathways. He, when his love impelled him, went to Arka.
Devanāgarī: स नो रासच्छुरुधश्चन्द्राग्रा धियंधियं सीषधाति प्र पूषा
pada pāṭha: pathaḥ-pathaḥ | pari-patim | vacasyā | kāmena | kr̥taḥ | abhi | ānaṭ | arkam || saḥ | naḥ | rāsat | śurudhaḥ | candra-agrāḥ | dhiyam-dhiyam | sīsadhāti | pra | pūṣā ||6.49.8||

IAST: sa no rāsac churudhaś candrāgrā dhiyaṁ-dhiyaṁ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā
Griffith: May he vouchsafe us gear with gold to grace it: may Pusan make each prayer of ours efective.
Devanāgarī: पथस्पथः परिपतिं वचस्या कामेन कृतो अभ्यानळर्कम्
pada pāṭha: pathaḥ-pathaḥ | pari-patim | vacasyā | kāmena | kr̥taḥ | abhi | ānaṭ | arkam || saḥ | naḥ | rāsat | śurudhaḥ | candra-agrāḥ | dhiyam-dhiyam | sīsadhāti | pra | pūṣā ||6.49.8||

IAST: prathamabhājaṁ yaśasaṁ vayodhāṁ supāṇiṁ devaṁ sugabhastim ṛbhvam
Griffith: May Herald Agni, fulgent, bring for worship Tvastar adored, in homes and swift to listen,
Devanāgarī: होता यक्षद्यजतं पस्त्यानामग्निस्त्वष्टारं सुहवं विभावा
pada pāṭha: prathama-bhājam | yaśasam | vayaḥ-dhām | su-pāṇim | devam | su-gabhastim | r̥bhvam || hotā | yakṣat | yajatam | pastyānām | agniḥ | tvaṣṭāram | su-havam | vibhā-vā ||6.49.9||

IAST: hotā yakṣad yajatam pastyānām agnis tvaṣṭāraṁ suhavaṁ vibhāvā
Griffith: Glorious, first to share, the life-bestower, the ever active God, fair-armed, fair-handed.
Devanāgarī: प्रथमभाजं यशसं वयोधां सुपाणिं देवं सुगभस्तिमृभ्वम्
pada pāṭha: prathama-bhājam | yaśasam | vayaḥ-dhām | su-pāṇim | devam | su-gabhastim | r̥bhvam || hotā | yakṣat | yajatam | pastyānām | agniḥ | tvaṣṭāram | su-havam | vibhā-vā ||6.49.9||

IAST: bhuvanasya pitaraṁ gīrbhir ābhī rudraṁ divā vardhayā rudram aktau
Griffith: Rudra by day, Rudra at night we honour with these our songs, the Universe's Father.
Devanāgarī: बृहन्तमृष्वमजरं सुषुम्नमृधग्घुवेम कविनेषितासः
pada pāṭha: bhuvanasya | pitaram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ābhiḥ | rudram | divā | vardhaya | rudram | aktau || br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | su-sumnam | r̥dhak | huvema | kavinā | iṣitāsaḥ ||6.49.10||

IAST: bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṁ suṣumnam ṛdhag ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ
Griffith: Him great and lofty, blissful, undecaying let us call specially as the Sage impels us.
Devanāgarī: भुवनस्य पितरं गीर्भिराभी रुद्रं दिवा वर्धया रुद्रमक्तौ
pada pāṭha: bhuvanasya | pitaram | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ābhiḥ | rudram | divā | vardhaya | rudram | aktau || br̥hantam | r̥ṣvam | ajaram | su-sumnam | r̥dhak | huvema | kavinā | iṣitāsaḥ ||6.49.10||

IAST: ā yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso maruto ganta gṛṇato varasyām
Griffith: Ye who are youthful, wise, and meet for worship, come, Martits, to the longing of the singer.
Devanāgarī: अचित्रं चिद्धि जिन्वथा वृधन्त इत्था नक्षन्तो नरो अङ्गिरस्वत्
pada pāṭha: ā | yuvānaḥ | kavayaḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ | marutaḥ | ganta | gr̥ṇataḥ | varasyām || acitram | cit | hi | jinvatha | vr̥dhantaḥ | itthā | nakṣantaḥ | naraḥ | aṅgirasvat ||6.49.11||

IAST: acitraṁ cid dhi jinvathā vṛdhanta itthā nakṣanto naro aṅgirasvat
Griffith: Coming, as erst to Angiras, O Heroes, ye animate and quicken e'en the desert.
Devanāgarī: आ युवानः कवयो यज्ञियासो मरुतो गन्त गृणतो वरस्याम्
pada pāṭha: ā | yuvānaḥ | kavayaḥ | yajñiyāsaḥ | marutaḥ | ganta | gr̥ṇataḥ | varasyām || acitram | cit | hi | jinvatha | vr̥dhantaḥ | itthā | nakṣantaḥ | naraḥ | aṅgirasvat ||6.49.11||

IAST: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāyājā yūtheva paśurakṣir astam
Griffith: Even as the herdsman driveth home his cattle, I urge my songs to him the strong swift Hero
Devanāgarī: स पिस्पृशति तन्वि श्रुतस्य स्तृभिर्न नाकं वचनस्य विपः
pada pāṭha: pra | vīrāya | pra | tavase | turāya | aja | yūthā-iva | paśu-rakṣiḥ | astam || saḥ | pispr̥śati | tanvi | śrutasya | str̥-bhiḥ | na | nākam | vacanasya | vipaḥ ||6.49.12||

IAST: sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhir na nākaṁ vacanasya vipaḥ
Griffith: May he, the glorious, lay upon his body the singer's hymns, as stars bedeck the heaven.
Devanāgarī: प्र वीराय प्र तवसे तुरायाजा यूथेव पशुरक्षिरस्तम्
pada pāṭha: pra | vīrāya | pra | tavase | turāya | aja | yūthā-iva | paśu-rakṣiḥ | astam || saḥ | pispr̥śati | tanvi | śrutasya | str̥-bhiḥ | na | nākam | vacanasya | vipaḥ ||6.49.12||

IAST: yo rajāṁsi vimame pārthivāni triś cid viṣṇur manave bādhitāya
Griffith: He who for man's behoof in his afiliction thrice measured out the earthly regions, Visnu-
Devanāgarī: तस्य ते शर्मन्नुपदद्यमाने राया मदेम तन्वा तना च
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rajāṁsi | vi-mame | pārthivāni | triḥ | cit | viṣṇuḥ | manave | bādhitāya || tasya | te | śarman | upa-dadyamāne | rāyā | madema | tanvā | tanā | ca ||6.49.13||

IAST: tasya te śarmann upadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca
Griffith: When one so great as thou affordeth shelter, may we with wealth and with ourselves be happy.
Devanāgarī: यो रजांसि विममे पार्थिवानि त्रिश्चिद्विष्णुर्मनवे बाधिताय
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | rajāṁsi | vi-mame | pārthivāni | triḥ | cit | viṣṇuḥ | manave | bādhitāya || tasya | te | śarman | upa-dadyamāne | rāyā | madema | tanvā | tanā | ca ||6.49.13||

IAST: tan no 'hir budhnyo adbhir arkais tat parvatas tat savitā cano dhāt
Griffith: Sweet be this song of mine to Ahibudhnya, Parvata, Savitar, with Floods and Lightnings;
Devanāgarī: तदोषधीभिरभि रातिषाचो भगः पुरंधिर्जिन्वतु प्र राये
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | at-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ | tat | parvataḥ | tat | savitā | canaḥ | dhāt || tat | oṣadhībhiḥ | abhi | rāti-sācaḥ | bhagaḥ | puram-dhiḥ | jinvatu | pra | rāye ||6.49.14||

IAST: tad oṣadhībhir abhi rātiṣāco bhagaḥ puraṁdhir jinvatu pra rāye
Griffith: Sweet, with the Plants, to Gods who seek oblations. May liberal Bhaga speed us on to riches.
Devanāgarī: तन्नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यो अद्भिरर्कैस्तत्पर्वतस्तत्सविता चनो धात्
pada pāṭha: tat | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | at-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ | tat | parvataḥ | tat | savitā | canaḥ | dhāt || tat | oṣadhībhiḥ | abhi | rāti-sācaḥ | bhagaḥ | puram-dhiḥ | jinvatu | pra | rāye ||6.49.14||

IAST: nu no rayiṁ rathyaṁ carṣaṇiprām puruvīram maha ṛtasya gopām
Griffith: Give riches borne on cars, with many heroes, contenting men, the guard of mighty Order.
Devanāgarī: क्षयं दाताजरं येन जनान्स्पृधो अदेवीरभि च क्रमाम विश आदेवीरभ्यश्नवाम
