pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | rathyam | carṣaṇi-prām | puru-vīram | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopām || kṣayam | dāta | ajaram | yena | janān | spr̥dhaḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | ca | kramāma | viśaḥ | ā-devīḥ | abhi | aśnavāma ||6.49.15||

IAST: kṣayaṁ dātājaraṁ yena janān spṛdho adevīr abhi ca kramāma viśa ādevīr abhy aśnavāma
Griffith: Give us a lasting home that we may battle with godless bands of men who fight against us, and meet with
Devanāgarī: नु नो रयिं रथ्यं चर्षणिप्रां पुरुवीरं मह ऋतस्य गोपाम्
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | rathyam | carṣaṇi-prām | puru-vīram | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopām || kṣayam | dāta | ajaram | yena | janān | spr̥dhaḥ | adevīḥ | abhi | ca | kramāma | viśaḥ | ā-devīḥ | abhi | aśnavāma ||6.49.15||

IAST: huve vo devīm aditiṁ namobhir mṛḻīkāya varuṇam mitram agnim
Griffith: I CALL with prayers on Aditi your Goddess, on Agni, Mitra, Varuna for favour,
Devanāgarī: अभिक्षदामर्यमणं सुशेवं त्रातॄन्देवान्सवितारं भगं च
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | devīm | aditim | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mr̥ḷīkāya | varuṇam | mitram | agnim || abhi-kṣadām | aryamaṇam | su-śevam | trātr̥̄n | devān | savitāram | bhagam | ca ||6.50.1||

IAST: abhikṣadām aryamaṇaṁ suśevaṁ trātṝn devān savitāram bhagaṁ ca
Griffith: On Aryaman who gives unasked, the gracious, on Gods who save, on Savitar and Bhaga.
Devanāgarī: हुवे वो देवीमदितिं नमोभिर्मृळीकाय वरुणं मित्रमग्निम्
pada pāṭha: huve | vaḥ | devīm | aditim | namaḥ-bhiḥ | mr̥ḷīkāya | varuṇam | mitram | agnim || abhi-kṣadām | aryamaṇam | su-śevam | trātr̥̄n | devān | savitāram | bhagam | ca ||6.50.1||

IAST: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝn anāgāstve sumaho vīhi devān
Griffith: Visit, to prove us free from sin, O Surya Lord of great might, the bright Gods sprung from Daksa,
Devanāgarī: द्विजन्मानो य ऋतसापः सत्याः स्वर्वन्तो यजता अग्निजिह्वाः
pada pāṭha: su-jyotiṣaḥ | sūrya | dakṣa-pitr̥̄n | anāgāḥ-tve | su-mahaḥ | vīhi | devān || dvi-janmānaḥ | ye | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | satyāḥ | svaḥ-vantaḥ | yajatāḥ | agni-jihvāḥ ||6.50.2||

IAST: dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvanto yajatā agnijihvāḥ
Griffith: Twice-born and true, observing sacred duties, Holy and full of light, whose tongue is Agni.
Devanāgarī: सुज्योतिषः सूर्य दक्षपितॄननागास्त्वे सुमहो वीहि देवान्
pada pāṭha: su-jyotiṣaḥ | sūrya | dakṣa-pitr̥̄n | anāgāḥ-tve | su-mahaḥ | vīhi | devān || dvi-janmānaḥ | ye | r̥ta-sāpaḥ | satyāḥ | svaḥ-vantaḥ | yajatāḥ | agni-jihvāḥ ||6.50.2||

IAST: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatram uru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṁ suṣumne
Griffith: And, O ye Heaven and Earth, a wide dominion, O ye most blissful Worlds, our lofty shelter,
Devanāgarī: महस्करथो वरिवो यथा नोऽस्मे क्षयाय धिषणे अनेहः
pada pāṭha: uta | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | kṣatram | uru | br̥hat | rodasī iti | śaraṇam | susumne iti su-sumne || mahaḥ | karathaḥ | varivaḥ | yathā | naḥ | asme iti | kṣayāya | dhiṣaṇe iti | anehaḥ ||6.50.3||

IAST: mahas karatho varivo yathā no 'sme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ
Griffith: Give ample room and freedom for our dwelling, a home, ye Hemispheres, which none may rival.
Devanāgarī: उत द्यावापृथिवी क्षत्रमुरु बृहद्रोदसी शरणं सुषुम्ने
pada pāṭha: uta | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | kṣatram | uru | br̥hat | rodasī iti | śaraṇam | susumne iti su-sumne || mahaḥ | karathaḥ | varivaḥ | yathā | naḥ | asme iti | kṣayāya | dhiṣaṇe iti | anehaḥ ||6.50.3||

IAST: ā no rudrasya sūnavo namantām adyā hūtāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭāḥ
Griffith: This day invited may the Sons of Rudra, resistless, excellent, stoop down to meet us;
Devanāgarī: यदीमर्भे महति वा हितासो बाधे मरुतो अह्वाम देवान्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | rudrasya | sūnavaḥ | namantām | adya | hūtāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ || yat | īm | arbhe | mahati | vā | hitāsaḥ | bādhe | marutaḥ | ahvāma | devān ||6.50.4||

IAST: yad īm arbhe mahati vā hitāso bādhe maruto ahvāma devān
Griffith: For, when beset with slight or sore affliction, we ever call upon the Gods, the Maruts;
Devanāgarī: आ नो रुद्रस्य सूनवो नमन्तामद्या हूतासो वसवोऽधृष्टाः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | rudrasya | sūnavaḥ | namantām | adya | hūtāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ || yat | īm | arbhe | mahati | vā | hitāsaḥ | bādhe | marutaḥ | ahvāma | devān ||6.50.4||

IAST: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardhayajvā
Griffith: To whom the Goddess Rodasi clings closely, whom Pusan follows bringing ample bounty.
Devanāgarī: श्रुत्वा हवं मरुतो यद्ध याथ भूमा रेजन्ते अध्वनि प्रविक्ते
pada pāṭha: mimyakṣa | yeṣu | rodasī | nu | devī | sisakti | pūṣā | abhyardha-yajvā || śrutvā | havam | marutaḥ | yat | ha | yātha | bhūma | rejante | adhvani | pra-vikte ||6.50.5||

IAST: śrutvā havam maruto yad dha yātha bhūmā rejante adhvani pravikte
Griffith: What time ye hear our call and come, O Maruts, upon your separate path all creatures tremble.
Devanāgarī: मिम्यक्ष येषु रोदसी नु देवी सिषक्ति पूषा अभ्यर्धयज्वा
pada pāṭha: mimyakṣa | yeṣu | rodasī | nu | devī | sisakti | pūṣā | abhyardha-yajvā || śrutvā | havam | marutaḥ | yat | ha | yātha | bhūma | rejante | adhvani | pra-vikte ||6.50.5||

IAST: abhi tyaṁ vīraṁ girvaṇasam arcendram brahmaṇā jaritar navena
Griffith: With a new hymn extol, O thou who singest, the Lover of the Song, the Hero Indra.
Devanāgarī: श्रवदिद्धवमुप च स्तवानो रासद्वाजाँ उप महो गृणानः
pada pāṭha: abhi | tyam | vīram | girvaṇasam | arca | indram | brahmaṇā | jaritaḥ | navena || śravat | it | havam | upa | ca | stavānaḥ | rāsat | vājān | upa | mahaḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||6.50.6||

IAST: śravad id dhavam upa ca stavāno rāsad vājām̐ upa maho gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: May he, exalted, hear our invocation, and grant us mighty wealth and strength when lauded.
Devanāgarī: अभि त्यं वीरं गिर्वणसमर्चेन्द्रं ब्रह्मणा जरितर्नवेन
pada pāṭha: abhi | tyam | vīram | girvaṇasam | arca | indram | brahmaṇā | jaritaḥ | navena || śravat | it | havam | upa | ca | stavānaḥ | rāsat | vājān | upa | mahaḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||6.50.6||

IAST: omānam āpo mānuṣīr amṛktaṁ dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṁ yoḥ
Griffith: Give full protection, Friends of man, ye Waters, in peace and trouble, to our sons and grandsons.
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि ष्ठा भिषजो मातृतमा विश्वस्य स्थातुर्जगतो जनित्रीः
pada pāṭha: omānam | āpaḥ | mānuṣīḥ | amr̥ktam | dhāta | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ || yūyam | hi | stha | bhiṣajaḥ | mātr̥-tamāḥ | viśvasya | sthātuḥ | jagataḥ | janitrīḥ ||6.50.7||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajo mātṛtamā viśvasya sthātur jagato janitrīḥ
Griffith: For ye are our most motherly physicians, parents of all that standeth, all that moveth.
Devanāgarī: ओमानमापो मानुषीरमृक्तं धात तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
pada pāṭha: omānam | āpaḥ | mānuṣīḥ | amr̥ktam | dhāta | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ || yūyam | hi | stha | bhiṣajaḥ | mātr̥-tamāḥ | viśvasya | sthātuḥ | jagataḥ | janitrīḥ ||6.50.7||

IAST: ā no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇo hiraṇyapāṇir yajato jagamyāt
Griffith: May Savitar come hither and approach us, the God who rescues, Holy, goldenhanded,
Devanāgarī: यो दत्रवाँ उषसो न प्रतीकं व्यूर्णुते दाशुषे वार्याणि
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | trāyamāṇaḥ | hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | yajataḥ | jagamyāt || yaḥ | datra-vān | uṣasaḥ | na | pratīkam | vi-ūrṇute | dāśuṣe | vāryāṇi ||6.50.8||

IAST: yo datravām̐ uṣaso na pratīkaṁ vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
Griffith: The God who, bounteous as the face of Morning, discloses precious gifts for him who worships.
Devanāgarī: आ नो देवः सविता त्रायमाणो हिरण्यपाणिर्यजतो जगम्यात्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | trāyamāṇaḥ | hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | yajataḥ | jagamyāt || yaḥ | datra-vān | uṣasaḥ | na | pratīkam | vi-ūrṇute | dāśuṣe | vāryāṇi ||6.50.8||

IAST: uta tvaṁ sūno sahaso no adyā devām̐ asminn adhvare vavṛtyāḥ
Griffith: And thou, O Son of Strength, do thou turn hither the Gods to-day to this our holy service.
Devanāgarī: स्यामहं ते सदमिद्रातौ तव स्यामग्नेऽवसा सुवीरः
pada pāṭha: uta | tvam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | adya | ā | devān | asmin | adhvare | vavr̥tyāḥ || syām | aham | te | sadam | it | rātau | tava | syām | agne | avasā | su-vīraḥ ||6.50.9||

IAST: syām ahaṁ te sadam id rātau tava syām agne 'vasā suvīraḥ
Griffith: May I for evermore enjoy thy bounty and, Agni, by thy grace be rich in heroes.
Devanāgarī: उत त्वं सूनो सहसो नो अद्या देवाँ अस्मिन्नध्वरे ववृत्याः
pada pāṭha: uta | tvam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | adya | ā | devān | asmin | adhvare | vavr̥tyāḥ || syām | aham | te | sadam | it | rātau | tava | syām | agne | avasā | su-vīraḥ ||6.50.9||

IAST: uta tyā me havam ā jagmyātaṁ nāsatyā dhībhir yuvam aṅga viprā
Griffith: Come also to my call, O ye Nasatyas, yea, verily, through my prayers, ye Holy Sages.
Devanāgarī: अत्रिं न महस्तमसोऽमुमुक्तं तूर्वतं नरा दुरितादभीके
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | me | havam | ā | jagmyātam | nāsatyā | dhībhiḥ | yuvam | aṅga | viprā || atrim | na | mahaḥ | tamasaḥ | amumuktam | tūrvatam | narā | duḥ-itāt | abhīke ||6.50.10||

IAST: atriṁ na mahas tamaso 'mumuktaṁ tūrvataṁ narā duritād abhīke
Griffith: As from great darkness ye delivered Atri, protect us, Chiefs, from danger in the conflict.
Devanāgarī: उत त्या मे हवमा जग्म्यातं नासत्या धीभिर्युवमङ्ग विप्रा
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | me | havam | ā | jagmyātam | nāsatyā | dhībhiḥ | yuvam | aṅga | viprā || atrim | na | mahaḥ | tamasaḥ | amumuktam | tūrvatam | narā | duḥ-itāt | abhīke ||6.50.10||

IAST: te no rāyo dyumato vājavato dātāro bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
Griffith: O Gods, bestow upon us riches, splendid with strength and heroes, bringing food in plenty.
Devanāgarī: दशस्यन्तो दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता अप्या मृळता च देवाः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | rāyaḥ | dyu-mataḥ | vāja-vataḥ | dātāraḥ | bhūta | nr̥-vataḥ | puru-kṣoḥ || daśasyantaḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | go-jātāḥ | apyāḥ | mr̥ḷata | ca | devāḥ ||6.50.11||

IAST: daśasyanto divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā apyā mṛḻatā ca devāḥ
Griffith: Be gracious, helpful Gods of earth, of heaven, born of the Cow, and dwellers in the waters.
Devanāgarī: ते नो रायो द्युमतो वाजवतो दातारो भूत नृवतः पुरुक्षोः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | rāyaḥ | dyu-mataḥ | vāja-vataḥ | dātāraḥ | bhūta | nr̥-vataḥ | puru-kṣoḥ || daśasyantaḥ | divyāḥ | pārthivāsaḥ | go-jātāḥ | apyāḥ | mr̥ḷata | ca | devāḥ ||6.50.11||

IAST: te no rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣā mīḻhuṣmanto viṣṇur mṛḻantu vāyuḥ
Griffith: May Rudra and Sarasvati, accordant, Visnu and Vayu, pour down gifts and bless us;
Devanāgarī: ऋभुक्षा वाजो दैव्यो विधाता पर्जन्यावाता पिप्यतामिषं नः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | rudraḥ | sarasvatī | sa-joṣāḥ | mīḷhuṣmantaḥ | viṣṇuḥ | mr̥ḷantu | vāyuḥ || r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | daivyaḥ | vi-dhātā | parjanyāvātā | pipyatām | iṣam | naḥ ||6.50.12||

IAST: ṛbhukṣā vājo daivyo vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatām iṣaṁ naḥ
Griffith: Rbhuksan, Vaja, and divine Vidhatar, Parjanya, Vata make our food abundant.
Devanāgarī: ते नो रुद्रः सरस्वती सजोषा मीळ्हुष्मन्तो विष्णुर्मृळन्तु वायुः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | rudraḥ | sarasvatī | sa-joṣāḥ | mīḷhuṣmantaḥ | viṣṇuḥ | mr̥ḷantu | vāyuḥ || r̥bhukṣāḥ | vājaḥ | daivyaḥ | vi-dhātā | parjanyāvātā | pipyatām | iṣam | naḥ ||6.50.12||

IAST: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhago no 'pāṁ napād avatu dānu papriḥ
Griffith: May this God Savitar, the Lord, the Offspring of Waters, pouring down his dew be gracious,
Devanāgarī: त्वष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिः सजोषा द्यौर्देवेभिः पृथिवी समुद्रैः
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | naḥ | apām | napāt | avatu | dānu | papriḥ || tvaṣṭā | devebhiḥ | jani-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | dyauḥ | devebhiḥ | pr̥thivī | samudraiḥ ||6.50.13||

IAST: tvaṣṭā devebhir janibhiḥ sajoṣā dyaur devebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ
Griffith: And, with the Gods and Dames accordant, Tvastar; Dyaus with the Gods and Prthivi with oceans.
Devanāgarī: उत स्य देवः सविता भगो नोऽपां नपादवतु दानु पप्रिः
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | naḥ | apām | napāt | avatu | dānu | papriḥ || tvaṣṭā | devebhiḥ | jani-bhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | dyauḥ | devebhiḥ | pr̥thivī | samudraiḥ ||6.50.13||

IAST: uta no 'hir budhnyaḥ śṛṇotv aja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ
Griffith: May Aja-Ekapad and Ahibudhnya, and Earth and Ocean hear our invocation;
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा ऋतावृधो हुवानाः स्तुता मन्त्राः कविशस्ता अवन्तु
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | śr̥ṇotu | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | pr̥thivī | samudraḥ || viśve | devāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | huvānāḥ | stutāḥ | mantrāḥ | kavi-śastāḥ | avantu ||6.50.14||

IAST: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānāḥ stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu
Griffith: All Gods who strengthen Law, invoked and lauded, and holy texts uttered by sages, help us.
Devanāgarī: उत नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यः शृणोत्वज एकपात्पृथिवी समुद्रः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | ahiḥ | budhnyaḥ | śr̥ṇotu | ajaḥ | eka-pāt | pr̥thivī | samudraḥ || viśve | devāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | huvānāḥ | stutāḥ | mantrāḥ | kavi-śastāḥ | avantu ||6.50.14||

IAST: evā napāto mama tasya dhībhir bharadvājā abhy arcanty arkaiḥ
Griffith: So with my thoughts and hymns of praise the children of Bharadvaja sing aloud to please you.
Devanāgarī: ग्ना हुतासो वसवोऽधृष्टा विश्वे स्तुतासो भूता यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: eva | napātaḥ | mama | tasya | dhībhiḥ | bharat-vājāḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || gnāḥ | hutāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ | viśve | stutāsaḥ | bhūta | yajatrāḥ ||6.50.15||

IAST: gnā hutāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭā viśve stutāso bhūtā yajatrāḥ
Griffith: The Dames invoked, and the resistless Vasus, and all ye Holy Ones have been exalted.
Devanāgarī: एवा नपातो मम तस्य धीभिर्भरद्वाजा अभ्यर्चन्त्यर्कैः
pada pāṭha: eva | napātaḥ | mama | tasya | dhībhiḥ | bharat-vājāḥ | abhi | arcanti | arkaiḥ || gnāḥ | hutāsaḥ | vasavaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ | viśve | stutāsaḥ | bhūta | yajatrāḥ ||6.50.15||

IAST: ud u tyac cakṣur mahi mitrayor ām̐ eti priyaṁ varuṇayor adabdham
Griffith: THAT mighty eye of Varuna and Mitra, infallible and dear, is moving upward.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य शुचि दर्शतमनीकं रुक्मो न दिव उदिता व्यद्यौत्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tyat | cakṣuḥ | mahi | mitrayoḥ | ā | eti | priyam | varuṇayoḥ | adabdham || r̥tasya | śuci | darśatam | anīkam | rukmaḥ | na | divaḥ | ut-itā | vi | adyaut ||6.51.1||

IAST: ṛtasya śuci darśatam anīkaṁ rukmo na diva uditā vy adyaut
Griffith: The pure and lovely face of holy Order hath shone like gold of heaven in its arising.
Devanāgarī: उदु त्यच्चक्षुर्महि मित्रयोराँ एति प्रियं वरुणयोरदब्धम्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | tyat | cakṣuḥ | mahi | mitrayoḥ | ā | eti | priyam | varuṇayoḥ | adabdham || r̥tasya | śuci | darśatam | anīkam | rukmaḥ | na | divaḥ | ut-itā | vi | adyaut ||6.51.1||

IAST: veda yas trīṇi vidathāny eṣāṁ devānāṁ janma sanutar ā ca vipraḥ
Griffith: The Sage who knows these Gods' three ranks and orders, and all their generations near and distant,
Devanāgarī: ऋजु मर्तेषु वृजिना च पश्यन्नभि चष्टे सूरो अर्य एवान्
pada pāṭha: veda | yaḥ | trīṇi | vidathāni | eṣām | devānām | janma | sanutaḥ | ā | ca | vipraḥ || r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan | abhi | caṣṭe | sūraḥ | aryaḥ | evān ||6.51.2||

IAST: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyann abhi caṣṭe sūro arya evān
Griffith: Beholding good and evil acts of mortals, Sura marks well the doing of the pious.
Devanāgarī: वेद यस्त्रीणि विदथान्येषां देवानां जन्म सनुतरा च विप्रः
pada pāṭha: veda | yaḥ | trīṇi | vidathāni | eṣām | devānām | janma | sanutaḥ | ā | ca | vipraḥ || r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan | abhi | caṣṭe | sūraḥ | aryaḥ | evān ||6.51.2||

IAST: stuṣa u vo maha ṛtasya gopān aditim mitraṁ varuṇaṁ sujātān
Griffith: I praise you Guards of mighty Law eternal, Aditi, Mitra, Varuna, the noble,
Devanāgarī: अर्यमणं भगमदब्धधीतीनच्छा वोचे सधन्यः पावकान्
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopān | aditim | mitram | varuṇam | su-jātān || aryamaṇam | bhagam | adabdha-dhītīn | accha | voce | sa-dhanyaḥ | pāvakān ||6.51.3||

IAST: aryamaṇam bhagam adabdhadhītīn acchā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān
Griffith: Aryaman, Bhaga, all whose thoughts are faithful: hither I call the Bright who share in common.
Devanāgarī: स्तुष उ वो मह ऋतस्य गोपानदितिं मित्रं वरुणं सुजातान्
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | mahaḥ | r̥tasya | gopān | aditim | mitram | varuṇam | su-jātān || aryamaṇam | bhagam | adabdha-dhītīn | accha | voce | sa-dhanyaḥ | pāvakān ||6.51.3||

IAST: riśādasaḥ satpatīm̐r adabdhān maho rājñaḥ suvasanasya dātṝn
Griffith: Lords of the brave, infallible, foe-destroyers, great Kings, bestowers of fair homes to dwell in,
Devanāgarī: यूनः सुक्षत्रान्क्षयतो दिवो नॄनादित्यान्याम्यदितिं दुवोयु
pada pāṭha: riśādasaḥ | sat-patīn | adabdhān | mahaḥ | rājñaḥ | su-vasanasya | dātr̥̄n || yūnaḥ | su-kṣatrān | kṣayataḥ | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | ādityān | yāmi | aditim | duvaḥ-yu ||6.51.4||

IAST: yūnaḥ sukṣatrān kṣayato divo nṝn ādityān yāmy aditiṁ duvoyu
Griffith: Young, Heroes, ruling heaven with strong dominion, Adityas, Aditi I seek with worship.
Devanāgarī: रिशादसः सत्पतीँरदब्धान्महो राज्ञः सुवसनस्य दातॄन्
pada pāṭha: riśādasaḥ | sat-patīn | adabdhān | mahaḥ | rājñaḥ | su-vasanasya | dātr̥̄n || yūnaḥ | su-kṣatrān | kṣayataḥ | divaḥ | nr̥̄n | ādityān | yāmi | aditim | duvaḥ-yu ||6.51.4||

IAST: dyauṣ pitaḥ pṛthivi mātar adhrug agne bhrātar vasavo mṛḻatā naḥ
Griffith: O Heaven our Father, Earth our guileless Mother, O Brother Agni, and ye Vasus, bless us.
Devanāgarī: विश्व आदित्या अदिते सजोषा अस्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यन्त
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | pitariti | pr̥thivi | mātaḥ | adhruk | agne | bhrātaḥ | vasavaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ || viśve | ādityāḥ | adite | sa-joṣāḥ | asmabhyam | śarma | bahulam | vi | yanta ||6.51.5||

IAST: viśva ādityā adite sajoṣā asmabhyaṁ śarma bahulaṁ vi yanta
Griffith: Grant us, O Aditi and ye Adityas, all of one mind, your manifold protection.
Devanāgarī: द्यौष्पितः पृथिवि मातरध्रुगग्ने भ्रातर्वसवो मृळता नः
pada pāṭha: dyauḥ | pitariti | pr̥thivi | mātaḥ | adhruk | agne | bhrātaḥ | vasavaḥ | mr̥ḷata | naḥ || viśve | ādityāḥ | adite | sa-joṣāḥ | asmabhyam | śarma | bahulam | vi | yanta ||6.51.5||

IAST: mā no vṛkāya vṛkye samasmā aghāyate rīradhatā yajatrāḥ
Griffith: Give us not up to any evil creature, as spoil to wolf or she-wolf, O ye Holy.
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि ष्ठा रथ्यो नस्तनूनां यूयं दक्षस्य वचसो बभूव
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vr̥kāya | vr̥kye | samasmai | agha-yate | rīradhata | yajatrāḥ || yūyam | hi | stha | rathyaḥ | naḥ | tanūnām | yūyam | dakṣasya | vacasaḥ | babhūva ||6.51.6||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi ṣṭhā rathyo nas tanūnāṁ yūyaṁ dakṣasya vacaso babhūva
Griffith: For ye are they who guide aright our bodies, ye are the rulers of our speech and vigour.
Devanāgarī: मा नो वृकाय वृक्ये समस्मा अघायते रीरधता यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | vr̥kāya | vr̥kye | samasmai | agha-yate | rīradhata | yajatrāḥ || yūyam | hi | stha | rathyaḥ | naḥ | tanūnām | yūyam | dakṣasya | vacasaḥ | babhūva ||6.51.6||

IAST: mā va eno anyakṛtam bhujema mā tat karma vasavo yac cayadhve
Griffith: Let us not suffer for the sin of others, nor do the deed which ye, O Vasus, punish.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्य हि क्षयथ विश्वदेवाः स्वयं रिपुस्तन्वं रीरिषीष्ट
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | enaḥ | anya-kr̥tam | bhujema | mā | tat | karma | vasavaḥ | yat | cayadhve || viśvasya | hi | kṣayatha | viśva-devāḥ | svayam | ripuḥ | tanvam | ririṣīṣṭa ||6.51.7||

IAST: viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśvadevāḥ svayaṁ ripus tanvaṁ rīriṣīṣṭa
Griffith: Ye, Universal Gods! are all-controllers: may he do harm unto himself who hates Me.
Devanāgarī: मा व एनो अन्यकृतं भुजेम मा तत्कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे
pada pāṭha: mā | vaḥ | enaḥ | anya-kr̥tam | bhujema | mā | tat | karma | vasavaḥ | yat | cayadhve || viśvasya | hi | kṣayatha | viśva-devāḥ | svayam | ripuḥ | tanvam | ririṣīṣṭa ||6.51.7||

IAST: nama id ugraṁ nama ā vivāse namo dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām
Griffith: Mighty is homage: I adopt and use it. Homage hath held in place the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: नमो देवेभ्यो नम ईश एषां कृतं चिदेनो नमसा विवासे
pada pāṭha: namaḥ | it | ugram | namaḥ | ā | vivāse | namaḥ | dādhāra | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || namaḥ | devebhyaḥ | namaḥ | īśe | eṣām | kr̥tam | cit | enaḥ | namasā | ā | vivāse ||6.51.8||

IAST: namo devebhyo nama īśa eṣāṁ kṛtaṁ cid eno namasā vivāse
Griffith: Homage to Gods! Homage commands and rules them. I banish even committed sin by homage
Devanāgarī: नम इदुग्रं नम आ विवासे नमो दाधार पृथिवीमुत द्याम्
pada pāṭha: namaḥ | it | ugram | namaḥ | ā | vivāse | namaḥ | dādhāra | pr̥thivīm | uta | dyām || namaḥ | devebhyaḥ | namaḥ | īśe | eṣām | kr̥tam | cit | enaḥ | namasā | ā | vivāse ||6.51.8||

IAST: ṛtasya vo rathyaḥ pūtadakṣān ṛtasya pastyasado adabdhān
Griffith: You Furtherers of Law, pure in your spirit, infallible, dwellers in the home of Order,
Devanāgarī: ताँ आ नमोभिरुरुचक्षसो नॄन्विश्वान्व आ नमे महो यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | vaḥ | rathyaḥ | pūta-dakṣān | r̥tasya | pastya-sadaḥ | adabdhān || tān | ā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | uru-cakṣasaḥ | nr̥̄n | viśvān | vaḥ | ā | name | mahaḥ | yajatrāḥ ||6.51.9||

IAST: tām̐ ā namobhir urucakṣaso nṝn viśvān va ā name maho yajatrāḥ
Griffith: To you all Heroes mighty and far-seeing I bow me down, O Holy Ones, with homage.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य वो रथ्यः पूतदक्षानृतस्य पस्त्यसदो अदब्धान्
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | vaḥ | rathyaḥ | pūta-dakṣān | r̥tasya | pastya-sadaḥ | adabdhān || tān | ā | namaḥ-bhiḥ | uru-cakṣasaḥ | nr̥̄n | viśvān | vaḥ | ā | name | mahaḥ | yajatrāḥ ||6.51.9||

IAST: te hi śreṣṭhavarcasas ta u nas tiro viśvāni duritā nayanti
Griffith: For these are they who shine with noblest splendour; through all our troubles these conduct us safely-
Devanāgarī: सुक्षत्रासो वरुणो मित्रो अग्निरृतधीतयो वक्मराजसत्याः
pada pāṭha: te | hi | śreṣṭha-varcasaḥ | te | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | tiraḥ | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | nayanti || su-kṣatrāsaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | vakmarāja-satyāḥ ||6.51.10||

IAST: sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro agnir ṛtadhītayo vakmarājasatyāḥ
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, Agni, mighty Rulers, trueminded, faithful to the hymn's controllers.
Devanāgarī: ते हि श्रेष्ठवर्चसस्त उ नस्तिरो विश्वानि दुरिता नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: te | hi | śreṣṭha-varcasaḥ | te | ūm̐ iti | naḥ | tiraḥ | viśvāni | duḥ-itā | nayanti || su-kṣatrāsaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | agniḥ | r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | vakmarāja-satyāḥ ||6.51.10||

IAST: te na indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhago aditiḥ pañca janāḥ
Griffith: May they, Earth, Aditi, Indra, Bhaga, Pusan increase our laud, increase the Fivefold people.
Devanāgarī: सुशर्माणः स्ववसः सुनीथा भवन्तु नः सुत्रात्रासः सुगोपाः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivī | kṣāma | vardhan | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | aditiḥ | pañca | janāḥ || su-śarmāṇaḥ | su-avasaḥ | su-nīthāḥ | bhavantu | naḥ | su-trātrāsaḥ | su-gopāḥ ||6.51.11||

IAST: suśarmāṇaḥ svavasaḥ sunīthā bhavantu naḥ sutrātrāsaḥ sugopāḥ
Griffith: Giving good help, good refuge, goodly guidance, be they our good deliverers, good protectors.
Devanāgarī: ते न इन्द्रः पृथिवी क्षाम वर्धन्पूषा भगो अदितिः पञ्च जनाः
pada pāṭha: te | naḥ | indraḥ | pr̥thivī | kṣāma | vardhan | pūṣā | bhagaḥ | aditiḥ | pañca | janāḥ || su-śarmāṇaḥ | su-avasaḥ | su-nīthāḥ | bhavantu | naḥ | su-trātrāsaḥ | su-gopāḥ ||6.51.11||

IAST: nū sadmānaṁ divyaṁ naṁśi devā bhāradvājaḥ sumatiṁ yāti hotā
Griffith: Come now, O Gods, to your celestial station: the Bharadvajas' priest entreats your favour.
Devanāgarī: आसानेभिर्यजमानो मियेधैर्देवानां जन्म वसूयुर्ववन्द
pada pāṭha: nu | sadmānam | divyam | naṁśi | devāḥ | bhārat-vājaḥ | su-matim | yāti | hotā || āsānebhiḥ | yajamānaḥ | miyedhaiḥ | devānām | janma | vasu-yuḥ | vavanda ||6.51.12||

IAST: āsānebhir yajamāno miyedhair devānāṁ janma vasūyur vavanda
Griffith: He, sacrificing, fain for wealth, hath honoured the Gods vath those who sit and share oblations.
Devanāgarī: नू सद्मानं दिव्यं नंशि देवा भारद्वाजः सुमतिं याति होता
pada pāṭha: nu | sadmānam | divyam | naṁśi | devāḥ | bhārat-vājaḥ | su-matim | yāti | hotā || āsānebhiḥ | yajamānaḥ | miyedhaiḥ | devānām | janma | vasu-yuḥ | vavanda ||6.51.12||

IAST: apa tyaṁ vṛjinaṁ ripuṁ stenam agne durādhyam
Griffith: Agni, drive thou the wicked foe, the evil-hearted thief away,
Devanāgarī: दविष्ठमस्य सत्पते कृधी सुगम्
pada pāṭha: apa | tyam | vr̥jinam | ripum | stenam | agne | duḥ-ādhyam || daviṣṭham | asya | sat-pate | kr̥dhi | su-gam ||6.51.13||

IAST: daviṣṭham asya satpate kṛdhī sugam
Griffith: Far, far, Lord of the brave I and give us easy paths.
Devanāgarī: अप त्यं वृजिनं रिपुं स्तेनमग्ने दुराध्यम्
pada pāṭha: apa | tyam | vr̥jinam | ripum | stenam | agne | duḥ-ādhyam || daviṣṭham | asya | sat-pate | kr̥dhi | su-gam ||6.51.13||

IAST: grāvāṇaḥ soma no hi kaṁ sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ
Griffith: Soma, these pressing-stones have called aloud to win thee for our Friend.
Devanāgarī: जही न्यत्रिणं पणिं वृको हि षः
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | soma | naḥ | hi | kam | sakhi-tvanāya | vāvaśuḥ || jahi | ni | atriṇam | paṇim | vr̥kaḥ | hi | saḥ ||6.51.14||

IAST: jahī ny atriṇam paṇiṁ vṛko hi ṣaḥ
Griffith: Destroy the greedy Pani, for a wolf is he.
Devanāgarī: ग्रावाणः सोम नो हि कं सखित्वनाय वावशुः
pada pāṭha: grāvāṇaḥ | soma | naḥ | hi | kam | sakhi-tvanāya | vāvaśuḥ || jahi | ni | atriṇam | paṇim | vr̥kaḥ | hi | saḥ ||6.51.14||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ
Griffith: Ye, O most bountiful, are they who, led by Indra, seek the sky.
Devanāgarī: कर्ता नो अध्वन्ना सुगं गोपा अमा
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | stha | su-dānavaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ || karta | naḥ | adhvan | ā | su-gam | gopāḥ | amā ||6.51.15||

IAST: kartā no adhvann ā sugaṁ gopā amā
Griffith: Give us good paths for travel: guard us ivell at home.
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि ष्ठा सुदानव इन्द्रज्येष्ठा अभिद्यवः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | stha | su-dānavaḥ | indra-jyeṣṭhāḥ | abhi-dyavaḥ || karta | naḥ | adhvan | ā | su-gam | gopāḥ | amā ||6.51.15||

IAST: api panthām aganmahi svastigām anehasam
Griffith: Now have we entered on the road that leads to bliss, without a foe,
Devanāgarī: येन विश्वाः परि द्विषो वृणक्ति विन्दते वसु
pada pāṭha: api | panthām | aganmahi | svasti-gām | anehasam || yena | viśvāḥ | pari | dviṣaḥ | vr̥ṇakti | vindate | vasu ||6.51.16||

IAST: yena viśvāḥ pari dviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu
Griffith: The road whereon a man escapes all enemies and gathers wealth.
Devanāgarī: अपि पन्थामगन्महि स्वस्तिगामनेहसम्
pada pāṭha: api | panthām | aganmahi | svasti-gām | anehasam || yena | viśvāḥ | pari | dviṣaḥ | vr̥ṇakti | vindate | vasu ||6.51.16||

IAST: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhir ābhiḥ
Griffith: THIS I allow not in the earth or heaven, at sacrifice or in these holy duties.
Devanāgarī: उब्जन्तु तं सुभ्वः पर्वतासो नि हीयतामतियाजस्य यष्टा
pada pāṭha: na | tat | divā | na | pr̥thivyā | anu | manye | na | yajñena | na | uta | śamībhiḥ | ābhiḥ || ubjantu | tam | su-bhvaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ni | hīyatām | ati-yājasya | yaṣṭā ||6.52.1||

IAST: ubjantu taṁ subhvaḥ parvatāso ni hīyatām atiyājasya yaṣṭā
Griffith: May the huge mountains crush him down: degraded be Atiyaja's sacrificing patron.
Devanāgarī: न तद्दिवा न पृथिव्यानु मन्ये न यज्ञेन नोत शमीभिराभिः
pada pāṭha: na | tat | divā | na | pr̥thivyā | anu | manye | na | yajñena | na | uta | śamībhiḥ | ābhiḥ || ubjantu | tam | su-bhvaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ni | hīyatām | ati-yājasya | yaṣṭā ||6.52.1||

IAST: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṁ ninitsāt
Griffith: Or he who holds us in contempt, O Maruts, or seeks to blame the prayer that we are making,
Devanāgarī: तपूंषि तस्मै वृजिनानि सन्तु ब्रह्मद्विषमभि तं शोचतु द्यौः
pada pāṭha: ati | vā | yaḥ | marutaḥ | manyate | naḥ | brahma | vā | yaḥ | kriyamāṇam | ninitsāt || tapūṁṣi | tasmai | vr̥jināni | santu | brahma-dviṣam | abhi | tam | śocatu | dyauḥ ||6.52.2||

IAST: tapūṁṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣam abhi taṁ śocatu dyauḥ
Griffith: May agonies of burning be his portion. May the sky scorch the man who hates devotion.
Devanāgarī: अति वा यो मरुतो मन्यते नो ब्रह्म वा यः क्रियमाणं निनित्सात्
pada pāṭha: ati | vā | yaḥ | marutaḥ | manyate | naḥ | brahma | vā | yaḥ | kriyamāṇam | ninitsāt || tapūṁṣi | tasmai | vr̥jināni | santu | brahma-dviṣam | abhi | tam | śocatu | dyauḥ ||6.52.2||

IAST: kim aṅga tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma gopāṁ kim aṅga tvāhur abhiśastipāṁ naḥ
Griffith: Why then, O Soma, do they call thee keeper of prayer? Why then our guardian from reproaches?
Devanāgarī: किमङ्ग नः पश्यसि निद्यमानान्ब्रह्मद्विषे तपुषिं हेतिमस्य
pada pāṭha: kim | aṅga | tvā | brahmaṇaḥ | soma | gopām | kim | aṅga | tvā | āhuḥ | abhiśasti-pām | naḥ || kim | aṅga | naḥ | paśyasi | nidyamānān | brahma-dviṣe | tapuṣim | hetim | asya ||6.52.3||

IAST: kim aṅga naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṁ hetim asya
Griffith: Why then beholdest thou how men revile us? Cast thy hot dart at him who hates devotion.
Devanāgarī: किमङ्ग त्वा ब्रह्मणः सोम गोपां किमङ्ग त्वाहुरभिशस्तिपां नः
pada pāṭha: kim | aṅga | tvā | brahmaṇaḥ | soma | gopām | kim | aṅga | tvā | āhuḥ | abhiśasti-pām | naḥ || kim | aṅga | naḥ | paśyasi | nidyamānān | brahma-dviṣe | tapuṣim | hetim | asya ||6.52.3||

IAST: avantu mām uṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ
Griffith: May Mornings as they spring to life, protect me, and may the Rivers as they swell preserve me.
Devanāgarī: अवन्तु मा पर्वतासो ध्रुवासोऽवन्तु मा पितरो देवहूतौ
pada pāṭha: avantu | mām | uṣasaḥ | jāyamānāḥ | avantu | mā | sindhavaḥ | pinvamānāḥ || avantu | mā | parvatāsaḥ | dhruvāsaḥ | avantu | mā | pitaraḥ | deva-hūtau ||6.52.4||

IAST: avantu mā parvatāso dhruvāso 'vantu mā pitaro devahūtau
Griffith: My guardians be the firmly-seated mountains: the Fathers, when I call on Gods, defend me!
Devanāgarī: अवन्तु मामुषसो जायमाना अवन्तु मा सिन्धवः पिन्वमानाः
pada pāṭha: avantu | mām | uṣasaḥ | jāyamānāḥ | avantu | mā | sindhavaḥ | pinvamānāḥ || avantu | mā | parvatāsaḥ | dhruvāsaḥ | avantu | mā | pitaraḥ | deva-hūtau ||6.52.4||

IAST: viśvadānīṁ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam
Griffith: Through all our days may we be healthy. minded, and look upon the Sun when he arises.
Devanāgarī: तथा करद्वसुपतिर्वसूनां देवाँ ओहानोऽवसागमिष्ठः
pada pāṭha: viśva-dānīm | su-manasaḥ | syāma | paśyema | nu | sūryam | ut-carantam || tathā | karat | vasu-patiḥ | vasūnām | devān | ohānaḥ | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ ||6.52.5||

IAST: tathā karad vasupatir vasūnāṁ devām̐ ohāno 'vasāgamiṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Grant this the Treasure-Lord of treasures, coming, observant, oftenest of Gods, with succour!
Devanāgarī: विश्वदानीं सुमनसः स्याम पश्येम नु सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम्
pada pāṭha: viśva-dānīm | su-manasaḥ | syāma | paśyema | nu | sūryam | ut-carantam || tathā | karat | vasu-patiḥ | vasūnām | devān | ohānaḥ | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ ||6.52.5||

IAST: indro nediṣṭham avasāgamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā
Griffith: Most near, most oft comes Indra with protection, and she Sarasvati, who swells with rivers -
Devanāgarī: पर्जन्यो न ओषधीभिर्मयोभुरग्निः सुशंसः सुहवः पितेव
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | nediṣṭham | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ | sarasvatī | sindhu-bhiḥ | pinvamānā || parjanyaḥ | naḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ | agniḥ | su-śaṁsaḥ | su-havaḥ | pitā-iva ||6.52.6||

IAST: parjanyo na oṣadhībhir mayobhur agniḥ suśaṁsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva
Griffith: Parjanya, bringing health with herbs, and Agni, well lauded swift to listen, like a father.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो नेदिष्ठमवसागमिष्ठः सरस्वती सिन्धुभिः पिन्वमाना
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | nediṣṭham | avasā | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ | sarasvatī | sindhu-bhiḥ | pinvamānā || parjanyaḥ | naḥ | oṣadhībhiḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ | agniḥ | su-śaṁsaḥ | su-havaḥ | pitā-iva ||6.52.6||

IAST: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imaṁ havam
Griffith: Hear this mine invocation; come hither, O Universal Gods,
Devanāgarī: एदं बर्हिर्नि षीदत
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāsaḥ | ā | gata | śr̥ṇuta | me | imam | havam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | ni | sīdata ||6.52.7||

IAST: edam barhir ni ṣīdata
Griffith: Be seated on this holy grass.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवास आ गत शृणुता म इमं हवम्
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāsaḥ | ā | gata | śr̥ṇuta | me | imam | havam || ā | idam | barhiḥ | ni | sīdata ||6.52.7||

IAST: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati
Griffith: To him who comes to meet you, Gods, with offerings bathed in holy oil-
Devanāgarī: तं विश्व उप गच्छथ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vaḥ | devāḥ | ghr̥ta-snunā | havyena | prati-bhūṣati || tam | viśve | upa | gacchatha ||6.52.8||

IAST: taṁ viśva upa gacchatha
Griffith: Approach ye, one and all, to him.
Devanāgarī: यो वो देवा घृतस्नुना हव्येन प्रतिभूषति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vaḥ | devāḥ | ghr̥ta-snunā | havyena | prati-bhūṣati || tam | viśve | upa | gacchatha ||6.52.8||

IAST: upa naḥ sūnavo giraḥ śṛṇvantv amṛtasya ye
Griffith: All Sons of Immortality shall listen to the songs we sing,
Devanāgarī: सुमृळीका भवन्तु नः
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sūnavaḥ | giraḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | amr̥tasya | ye || su-mr̥ḷīkāḥ | bhavantu | naḥ ||6.52.9||

IAST: sumṛḻīkā bhavantu naḥ
Griffith: And be exceeding good to us.
Devanāgarī: उप नः सूनवो गिरः शृण्वन्त्वमृतस्य ये
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | sūnavaḥ | giraḥ | śr̥ṇvantu | amr̥tasya | ye || su-mr̥ḷīkāḥ | bhavantu | naḥ ||6.52.9||

IAST: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhir havanaśrutaḥ
Griffith: May all the Gods who strengthen Law, with Rtus, listening to our call,
Devanāgarī: जुषन्तां युज्यं पयः
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | r̥tu-bhiḥ | havana-śrutaḥ || juṣantām | yujyam | payaḥ ||6.52.10||

IAST: juṣantāṁ yujyam payaḥ
Griffith: Be pleased with theit appropriate draught.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा ऋतावृध ऋतुभिर्हवनश्रुतः
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | r̥tu-bhiḥ | havana-śrutaḥ || juṣantām | yujyam | payaḥ ||6.52.10||

IAST: stotram indro marudgaṇas tvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā
Griffith: May ndra, with the Marut host, with Tvastar, Mitra, Aryaman,
Devanāgarī: इमा हव्या जुषन्त नः
pada pāṭha: stotram | indraḥ | marut-gaṇaḥ | tvaṣṭr̥-mān | mitraḥ | aryamā || imā | havyā | juṣanta | naḥ ||6.52.11||

IAST: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ
Griffith: Accept the laud and these our gifts.
Devanāgarī: स्तोत्रमिन्द्रो मरुद्गणस्त्वष्टृमान्मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: stotram | indraḥ | marut-gaṇaḥ | tvaṣṭr̥-mān | mitraḥ | aryamā || imā | havyā | juṣanta | naḥ ||6.52.11||

IAST: imaṁ no agne adhvaraṁ hotar vayunaśo yaja
Griffith: O Agni, Priest, as rules ordain, offer this sacrifice of ours,
Devanāgarī: चिकित्वान्दैव्यं जनम्
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | agne | adhvaram | hotaḥ | vayuna-śaḥ | yaja || cikitvān | daivyam | janam ||6.52.12||

IAST: cikitvān daivyaṁ janam
Griffith: Remembering the Heavenly Folk.
Devanāgarī: इमं नो अग्ने अध्वरं होतर्वयुनशो यज
pada pāṭha: imam | naḥ | agne | adhvaram | hotaḥ | vayuna-śaḥ | yaja || cikitvān | daivyam | janam ||6.52.12||

IAST: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṁ havam me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha
Griffith: Listen, All-Gods, to this mine invocation, Ye who inhabit heaven, and air's midregions,
Devanāgarī: ये अग्निजिह्वा उत वा यजत्रा आसद्यास्मिन्बर्हिषि मादयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | śr̥ṇuta | imam | havam | me | ye | antarikṣe | ye | upa | dyavi | stha || ye | agni-jihvāḥ | uta | vā | yajatrāḥ | ā-sadya | asmin | barhiṣi | mādayadhvam ||6.52.13||

IAST: ye agnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
Griffith: All ye, O Holy Ones, whose tongue is Agni, seated upon this sacred grass, be joyful.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवाः शृणुतेमं हवं मे ये अन्तरिक्षे य उप द्यवि ष्ठ
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | śr̥ṇuta | imam | havam | me | ye | antarikṣe | ye | upa | dyavi | stha || ye | agni-jihvāḥ | uta | vā | yajatrāḥ | ā-sadya | asmin | barhiṣi | mādayadhvam ||6.52.13||

IAST: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṁ napāc ca manma
Griffith: May the All-Gods who claim our worship hear my thought; may the two World-halves hear it, and the Waters
Devanāgarī: मा वो वचांसि परिचक्ष्याणि वोचं सुम्नेष्विद्वो अन्तमा मदेम
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | mama | śr̥ṇvantu | yajñiyāḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | apām | napāt | ca | manma || mā | vaḥ | vacāṁsi | pari-cakṣyāṇi | vocam | sumneṣu | it | vaḥ | antamāḥ | madema ||6.52.14||

IAST: mā vo vacāṁsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṁ sumneṣv id vo antamā madema
Griffith: Let me not utter words that ye may disregard. Closely allied with you may we rejoice in bliss.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे देवा मम शृण्वन्तु यज्ञिया उभे रोदसी अपां नपाच्च मन्म
pada pāṭha: viśve | devāḥ | mama | śr̥ṇvantu | yajñiyāḥ | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | apām | napāt | ca | manma || mā | vaḥ | vacāṁsi | pari-cakṣyāṇi | vocam | sumneṣu | it | vaḥ | antamāḥ | madema ||6.52.14||

IAST: ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṁ sadhasthe
Griffith: And those who, Mighty, with the wiles of serpents, were born on earth, in heaven, where waters gather-
Devanāgarī: ते अस्मभ्यमिषये विश्वमायुः क्षप उस्रा वरिवस्यन्तु देवाः
pada pāṭha: ye | ke | ca | jmā | mahinaḥ | ahi-māyāḥ | divaḥ | jajñire | apām | sadha-sthe || te | asmabhyam | iṣaye | viśvam | āyuḥ | kṣapaḥ | usrāḥ | varivasyantu | devāḥ ||6.52.15||

IAST: te asmabhyam iṣaye viśvam āyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantu devāḥ
Griffith: May they vouchsafe us life of full duration. May the Gods kindly give us nights and mornings.
Devanāgarī: ये के च ज्मा महिनो अहिमाया दिवो जज्ञिरे अपां सधस्थे
pada pāṭha: ye | ke | ca | jmā | mahinaḥ | ahi-māyāḥ | divaḥ | jajñire | apām | sadha-sthe || te | asmabhyam | iṣaye | viśvam | āyuḥ | kṣapaḥ | usrāḥ | varivasyantu | devāḥ ||6.52.15||

IAST: agnīparjanyāv avataṁ dhiyam me 'smin have suhavā suṣṭutiṁ naḥ
Griffith: At this my call, O Agni and Parjanya, help, swift to hear, my thought and our laudation.
Devanāgarī: इळामन्यो जनयद्गर्भमन्यः प्रजावतीरिष आ धत्तमस्मे
pada pāṭha: agnīparjanyau | avatam | dhiyam | me | asmin | have | su-havā | su-stutim | naḥ || iḷām | anyaḥ | janayat | garbham | anyaḥ | prajā-vatīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | dhattam | asme iti ||6.52.16||

IAST: iḻām anyo janayad garbham anyaḥ prajāvatīr iṣa ā dhattam asme
Griffith: One generates holy food, the other offspring, so grant us food enough with store of children.
Devanāgarī: अग्नीपर्जन्याववतं धियं मेऽस्मिन्हवे सुहवा सुष्टुतिं नः
pada pāṭha: agnīparjanyau | avatam | dhiyam | me | asmin | have | su-havā | su-stutim | naḥ || iḷām | anyaḥ | janayat | garbham | anyaḥ | prajā-vatīḥ | iṣaḥ | ā | dhattam | asme iti ||6.52.16||

IAST: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse
Griffith: When holy grass is strewn and fire enkindled, with hymn and lowly homage I invite you.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्नो अद्य विदथे यजत्रा विश्वे देवा हविषि मादयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: stīrṇe | barhiṣi | sam-idhāne | agnau | su-uktena | mahā | namasā | ā | vivāse || asmin | naḥ | adya | vidathe | yajatrāḥ | viśve | devāḥ | haviṣi | mādayadhvam ||6.52.17||

IAST: asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam
Griffith: All-Gods, to day in this our great assembly rejoice, ye Holy, in the gifts we offer.
Devanāgarī: स्तीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्नौ सूक्तेन महा नमसा विवासे
pada pāṭha: stīrṇe | barhiṣi | sam-idhāne | agnau | su-uktena | mahā | namasā | ā | vivāse || asmin | naḥ | adya | vidathe | yajatrāḥ | viśve | devāḥ | haviṣi | mādayadhvam ||6.52.17||

IAST: vayam u tvā pathas pate rathaṁ na vājasātaye
Griffith: Lord of the path, O Pusan, we have yoked and bound thee to our hymn,
Devanāgarī: धिये पूषन्नयुज्महि
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | pathaḥ | pate | ratham | na | vāja-sātaye || dhiye | pūṣan | ayujmahi ||6.53.1||

IAST: dhiye pūṣann ayujmahi
Griffith: Even as a car, to win the prize.
Devanāgarī: वयमु त्वा पथस्पते रथं न वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: vayam | ūm̐ iti | tvā | pathaḥ | pate | ratham | na | vāja-sātaye || dhiye | pūṣan | ayujmahi ||6.53.1||

IAST: abhi no naryaṁ vasu vīram prayatadakṣiṇam
Griffith: Bring us the wealth that men require, a manly master of a house,
Devanāgarī: वामं गृहपतिं नय
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | naryam | vasu | vīram | prayata-dakṣiṇam || vāmam | gr̥ha-patim | naya ||6.53.2||

IAST: vāmaṁ gṛhapatiṁ naya
Griffith: Free-handed with the liberal meed.
Devanāgarī: अभि नो नर्यं वसु वीरं प्रयतदक्षिणम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | naryam | vasu | vīram | prayata-dakṣiṇam || vāmam | gr̥ha-patim | naya ||6.53.2||

IAST: aditsantaṁ cid āghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya
Griffith: Even him who would not give, do thou,
Devanāgarī: पणेश्चिद्वि म्रदा मनः
pada pāṭha: aditsantam | cit | āghr̥ṇe | pūṣan | dānāya | codaya || paṇeḥ | cit | vi | mrada | manaḥ ||6.53.3||

IAST: paṇeś cid vi mradā manaḥ
Griffith: O glowing Pusan, urge to give, and make the niggard's soul grow soft.
Devanāgarī: अदित्सन्तं चिदाघृणे पूषन्दानाय चोदय
pada pāṭha: aditsantam | cit | āghr̥ṇe | pūṣan | dānāya | codaya || paṇeḥ | cit | vi | mrada | manaḥ ||6.53.3||

IAST: vi patho vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdho jahi
Griffith: Clear paths that we may win the prize; scatter our enemies afar.
Devanāgarī: साधन्तामुग्र नो धियः
pada pāṭha: vi | pathaḥ | vāja-sātaye | cinuhi | vi | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi || sādhantām | ugra | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||6.53.4||

IAST: sādhantām ugra no dhiyaḥ
Griffith: Strong God, be al our thoughts fulfilled.
Devanāgarī: वि पथो वाजसातये चिनुहि वि मृधो जहि
pada pāṭha: vi | pathaḥ | vāja-sātaye | cinuhi | vi | mr̥dhaḥ | jahi || sādhantām | ugra | naḥ | dhiyaḥ ||6.53.4||

IAST: pari tṛndhi paṇīnām ārayā hṛdayā kave
Griffith: Penetrate with an awl, O Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls,
Devanāgarī: अथेमस्मभ्यं रन्धय
pada pāṭha: pari | tr̥ndhi | paṇīnām | ārayā | hr̥dayā | kave || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.5||

IAST: athem asmabhyaṁ randhaya
Griffith: And make them subject to our will.
Devanāgarī: परि तृन्धि पणीनामारया हृदया कवे
pada pāṭha: pari | tr̥ndhi | paṇīnām | ārayā | hr̥dayā | kave || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.5||

IAST: vi pūṣann ārayā tuda paṇer iccha hṛdi priyam
Griffith: Thrust with thine awl, O Pusan: seek that which the niggard's heart holds dear,
Devanāgarī: अथेमस्मभ्यं रन्धय
pada pāṭha: vi | pūṣan | ārayā | tuda | paṇeḥ | iccha | hr̥di | priyam || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.6||

IAST: athem asmabhyaṁ randhaya
Griffith: And make him subject to our will.
Devanāgarī: वि पूषन्नारया तुद पणेरिच्छ हृदि प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: vi | pūṣan | ārayā | tuda | paṇeḥ | iccha | hr̥di | priyam || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.6||

IAST: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnāṁ hṛdayā kave
Griffith: Tear up and read in pieces, Sage, the hearts of avaricious churls,
Devanāgarī: अथेमस्मभ्यं रन्धय
pada pāṭha: ā | rikha | kikirā | kr̥ṇu | paṇīnām | hr̥dayā | kave || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.7||

IAST: athem asmabhyaṁ randhaya
Griffith: And make them subject to our will.
Devanāgarī: आ रिख किकिरा कृणु पणीनां हृदया कवे
pada pāṭha: ā | rikha | kikirā | kr̥ṇu | paṇīnām | hr̥dayā | kave || atha | īm | asmabhyam | randhaya ||6.53.7||

IAST: yām pūṣan brahmacodanīm ārām bibharṣy āghṛṇe
Griffith: Thou, glowing Pusan, carriest an awl that urges men to prayer;
Devanāgarī: तया समस्य हृदयमा रिख किकिरा कृणु
pada pāṭha: yām | pūṣan | brahma-codanīm | ārām | bibharṣi | āghr̥ṇe || tayā | samasya | hr̥dayam | ā | rikha | kikirā | kr̥ṇu ||6.53.8||

IAST: tayā samasya hṛdayam ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu
Griffith: Therewith do thou tear up and rend to shreds the heart of every one.
Devanāgarī: यां पूषन्ब्रह्मचोदनीमारां बिभर्ष्याघृणे
pada pāṭha: yām | pūṣan | brahma-codanīm | ārām | bibharṣi | āghr̥ṇe || tayā | samasya | hr̥dayam | ā | rikha | kikirā | kr̥ṇu ||6.53.8||

IAST: yā te aṣṭrā goopaśāghṛṇe paśusādhanī
Griffith: Thou bearest, glowing Lord! A goad with horny point that guides the cows,
Devanāgarī: तस्यास्ते सुम्नमीमहे
pada pāṭha: yā | te | aṣṭrā | go-opaśā | āghr̥ṇe | paśu-sādhanī || tasyāḥ | te | sumnam | īmahe ||6.53.9||

IAST: tasyās te sumnam īmahe
Griffith: Thence do we seek thy gift of bliss.
Devanāgarī: या ते अष्ट्रा गोपशाघृणे पशुसाधनी
pada pāṭha: yā | te | aṣṭrā | go-opaśā | āghr̥ṇe | paśu-sādhanī || tasyāḥ | te | sumnam | īmahe ||6.53.9||

IAST: uta no goṣaṇiṁ dhiyam aśvasāṁ vājasām uta
Griffith: And make this hymn of ours produce kine, horses, and a store of wealth,
Devanāgarī: नृवत्कृणुहि वीतये
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-sanim | dhiyam | aśvasām | vāja-sām | uta || nr̥-vat | kr̥ṇuhi | vītaye ||6.53.10||

IAST: nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye
Griffith: For our delight and use as men.
Devanāgarī: उत नो गोषणिं धियमश्वसां वाजसामुत
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | go-sanim | dhiyam | aśvasām | vāja-sām | uta || nr̥-vat | kr̥ṇuhi | vītaye ||6.53.10||

IAST: sam pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati
Griffith: O PUSAN, bring us to the man who knows, who shall direct us straight,
Devanāgarī: य एवेदमिति ब्रवत्
pada pāṭha: sam | pūṣan | viduṣā | naya | yaḥ | añjasā | anu-śāsati || yaḥ | eva | idam | iti | bravat ||6.54.1||

IAST: ya evedam iti bravat
Griffith: And say unto us, It is here.
Devanāgarī: सं पूषन्विदुषा नय यो अञ्जसानुशासति
pada pāṭha: sam | pūṣan | viduṣā | naya | yaḥ | añjasā | anu-śāsati || yaḥ | eva | idam | iti | bravat ||6.54.1||

IAST: sam u pūṣṇā gamemahi yo gṛhām̐ abhiśāsati
Griffith: May we go forth with Pusan who shall point the houses out to us,
Devanāgarī: इम एवेति च ब्रवत्
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | pūṣṇā | gamemahi | yaḥ | gr̥hān | abhi-śāsati || ime | eva | iti | ca | bravat ||6.54.2||

IAST: ima eveti ca bravat
Griffith: And say to us, These same are they.
Devanāgarī: समु पूष्णा गमेमहि यो गृहाँ अभिशासति
pada pāṭha: sam | ūm̐ iti | pūṣṇā | gamemahi | yaḥ | gr̥hān | abhi-śāsati || ime | eva | iti | ca | bravat ||6.54.2||

IAST: pūṣṇaś cakraṁ na riṣyati na kośo 'va padyate
Griffith: Unharmed is Pusan's chariot wheel; the box ne'er falleth to the ground,
Devanāgarī: नो अस्य व्यथते पविः
pada pāṭha: pūṣṇaḥ | cakram | na | riṣyati | na | kośaḥ | ava | padyate || no iti | asya | vyathate | paviḥ ||6.54.3||

IAST: no asya vyathate paviḥ
Griffith: Nor doth the loosened felIy shake.
Devanāgarī: पूष्णश्चक्रं न रिष्यति न कोशोऽव पद्यते
pada pāṭha: pūṣṇaḥ | cakram | na | riṣyati | na | kośaḥ | ava | padyate || no iti | asya | vyathate | paviḥ ||6.54.3||

IAST: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na tam pūṣāpi mṛṣyate
Griffith: Pusan forgetteth not the man who serveth him with offered gift:
Devanāgarī: प्रथमो विन्दते वसु
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | haviṣā | avidhat | na | tam | pūṣā | api | mr̥ṣyate || prathamaḥ | vindate | vasu ||6.54.4||

IAST: prathamo vindate vasu
Griffith: That man is first to gather wealth.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्मै हविषाविधन्न तं पूषापि मृष्यते
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | asmai | haviṣā | avidhat | na | tam | pūṣā | api | mr̥ṣyate || prathamaḥ | vindate | vasu ||6.54.4||

IAST: pūṣā gā anv etu naḥ pūṣā rakṣatv arvataḥ
Griffith: May Pusan follow near our kine; may Pusan keep our horses safe:
Devanāgarī: पूषा वाजं सनोतु नः
pada pāṭha: pūṣā | gāḥ | anu | etu | naḥ | pūṣā | rakṣatu | arvataḥ || pūṣā | vājam | sanotu | naḥ ||6.54.5||

IAST: pūṣā vājaṁ sanotu naḥ
Griffith: May Pusan gather gear for us.
Devanāgarī: पूषा गा अन्वेतु नः पूषा रक्षत्वर्वतः
pada pāṭha: pūṣā | gāḥ | anu | etu | naḥ | pūṣā | rakṣatu | arvataḥ || pūṣā | vājam | sanotu | naḥ ||6.54.5||

IAST: pūṣann anu pra gā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ
Griffith: Follow the kine of him who pours libations out and worships thee;
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं स्तुवतामुत
pada pāṭha: pūṣan | anu | pra | gāḥ | ihi | yajamānasya | sunvataḥ || asmākam | stuvatām | uta ||6.54.6||

IAST: asmākaṁ stuvatām uta
Griffith: And ours who sing thee songs of praise.
Devanāgarī: पूषन्ननु प्र गा इहि यजमानस्य सुन्वतः
pada pāṭha: pūṣan | anu | pra | gāḥ | ihi | yajamānasya | sunvataḥ || asmākam | stuvatām | uta ||6.54.6||

IAST: mākir neśan mākīṁ riṣan mākīṁ saṁ śāri kevaṭe
Griffith: Let none be lost, none injured, none sink in a pit and break a limb.
Devanāgarī: अथारिष्टाभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: mākiḥ | neśat | mākīm | riṣat | mākīm | sam | śāri | kevaṭe || atha | ariṣṭābhiḥ | ā | gāhi ||6.54.7||

IAST: athāriṣṭābhir ā gahi
Griffith: Return with these all safe and sound.
Devanāgarī: माकिर्नेशन्माकीं रिषन्माकीं सं शारि केवटे
pada pāṭha: mākiḥ | neśat | mākīm | riṣat | mākīm | sam | śāri | kevaṭe || atha | ariṣṭābhiḥ | ā | gāhi ||6.54.7||

IAST: śṛṇvantam pūṣaṇaṁ vayam iryam anaṣṭavedasam
Griffith: Pusan who listens to our prayers, the Strong whose wealth is never lost,
Devanāgarī: ईशानं राय ईमहे
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇvantam | pūṣaṇam | vayam | iryam | anaṣṭa-vedasam || īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||6.54.8||

IAST: īśānaṁ rāya īmahe
Griffith: The Lord of riches, we implore.
Devanāgarī: शृण्वन्तं पूषणं वयमिर्यमनष्टवेदसम्
pada pāṭha: śr̥ṇvantam | pūṣaṇam | vayam | iryam | anaṣṭa-vedasam || īśānam | rāyaḥ | īmahe ||6.54.8||

IAST: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṁ na riṣyema kadā cana
Griffith: Secure in thy protecting care, O Pusan, never may we fail.
Devanāgarī: स्तोतारस्त इह स्मसि
pada pāṭha: pūṣan | tava | vrate | vayam | na | riṣyema | kadā | cana || stotāraḥ | te | iha | smasi ||6.54.9||

IAST: stotāras ta iha smasi
Griffith: We here are they who sing thy praise.
Devanāgarī: पूषन्तव व्रते वयं न रिष्येम कदा चन
pada pāṭha: pūṣan | tava | vrate | vayam | na | riṣyema | kadā | cana || stotāraḥ | te | iha | smasi ||6.54.9||

IAST: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṁ dadhātu dakṣiṇam
Griffith: From out the distance, far and wide, may Pusan stretch his right hand forth,
Devanāgarī: पुनर्नो नष्टमाजतु
pada pāṭha: pari | pūṣā | parastāt | hastam | dadhātu | dakṣiṇam || punaḥ | naḥ | naṣṭam | ā | ajatu ||6.54.10||

IAST: punar no naṣṭam ājatu
Griffith: And drive our lost again to us.
Devanāgarī: परि पूषा परस्ताद्धस्तं दधातु दक्षिणम्
pada pāṭha: pari | pūṣā | parastāt | hastam | dadhātu | dakṣiṇam || punaḥ | naḥ | naṣṭam | ā | ajatu ||6.54.10||

IAST: ehi vāṁ vimuco napād āghṛṇe saṁ sacāvahai
Griffith: SON of Deliverance, come, bright God!
Devanāgarī: रथीरृतस्य नो भव
pada pāṭha: ā | ihi | vām | vi-mucaḥ | napāt | āghr̥ṇe | sam | sacāvahai || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | naḥ | bhava ||6.55.1||

IAST: rathīr ṛtasya no bhava
Griffith: Let us twain go together: be our charioteer of sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: एहि वां विमुचो नपादाघृणे सं सचावहै
pada pāṭha: ā | ihi | vām | vi-mucaḥ | napāt | āghr̥ṇe | sam | sacāvahai || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | naḥ | bhava ||6.55.1||

IAST: rathītamaṁ kapardinam īśānaṁ rādhaso mahaḥ
Griffith: We pray for wealth to thee most skilled of charioteers, with braided hair,
Devanāgarī: रायः सखायमीमहे
pada pāṭha: rathi-tamam | kapardinam | īśānam | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || rāyaḥ | sakhāyam | īmahe ||6.55.2||

IAST: rāyaḥ sakhāyam īmahe
Griffith: Lord of great riches, and our Friend.
Devanāgarī: रथीतमं कपर्दिनमीशानं राधसो महः
pada pāṭha: rathi-tamam | kapardinam | īśānam | rādhasaḥ | mahaḥ || rāyaḥ | sakhāyam | īmahe ||6.55.2||

IAST: rāyo dhārāsy āghṛṇe vaso rāśir ajāśva
Griffith: Bright God whose steeds are goats, thou art a stream of wealth, a treasure-heap,
Devanāgarī: धीवतोधीवतः सखा
pada pāṭha: rāyaḥ | dhārā | asi | āghr̥ṇe | vasoḥ | rāśiḥ | aja-aśva || dhīvataḥ-dhīvataḥ | sakhā ||6.55.3||

IAST: dhīvato-dhīvataḥ sakhā
Griffith: The Friend of every pious man.
Devanāgarī: रायो धारास्याघृणे वसो राशिरजाश्व
pada pāṭha: rāyaḥ | dhārā | asi | āghr̥ṇe | vasoḥ | rāśiḥ | aja-aśva || dhīvataḥ-dhīvataḥ | sakhā ||6.55.3||

IAST: pūṣaṇaṁ nv ajāśvam upa stoṣāma vājinam
Griffith: Pusan, who driveth goats for steeds, the strong and Mighty, who is called
Devanāgarī: स्वसुर्यो जार उच्यते
pada pāṭha: pūṣaṇam | nu | aja-aśvam | upa | stoṣāma | vājinam || svasuḥ | yaḥ | jāraḥ | ucyate ||6.55.4||

IAST: svasur yo jāra ucyate
Griffith: His Sister's lover, will we laud.
Devanāgarī: पूषणं न्वजाश्वमुप स्तोषाम वाजिनम्
pada pāṭha: pūṣaṇam | nu | aja-aśvam | upa | stoṣāma | vājinam || svasuḥ | yaḥ | jāraḥ | ucyate ||6.55.4||

IAST: mātur didhiṣum abravaṁ svasur jāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ
Griffith: His Mother's suitor I address. May he who loves his Sister hear,
Devanāgarī: भ्रातेन्द्रस्य सखा मम
pada pāṭha: mātuḥ | didhiṣum | abravam | svasuḥ | jāraḥ | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ || bhrātā | indrasya | sakhā | mama ||6.55.5||

IAST: bhrātendrasya sakhā mama
Griffith: Brother of Indra, and my Friend.
Devanāgarī: मातुर्दिधिषुमब्रवं स्वसुर्जारः शृणोतु नः
pada pāṭha: mātuḥ | didhiṣum | abravam | svasuḥ | jāraḥ | śr̥ṇotu | naḥ || bhrātā | indrasya | sakhā | mama ||6.55.5||

IAST: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇaṁ rathe niśṛmbhās te janaśriyam
Griffith: May the sure-footed goats come nigh, conveying Pusan on his car,
Devanāgarī: देवं वहन्तु बिभ्रतः
pada pāṭha: ā | ajāsaḥ | pūṣaṇam | rathe | ni-śr̥mbhāḥ | te | jana-śriyam || devam | vahantu | bibhrataḥ ||6.55.6||

IAST: devaṁ vahantu bibhrataḥ
Griffith: The God who visiteth mankind.
Devanāgarī: आजासः पूषणं रथे निशृम्भास्ते जनश्रियम्
pada pāṭha: ā | ajāsaḥ | pūṣaṇam | rathe | ni-śr̥mbhāḥ | te | jana-śriyam || devam | vahantu | bibhrataḥ ||6.55.6||

IAST: ya enam ādideśati karambhād iti pūṣaṇam
Griffith: WHOSO remembers Pusan as cater of mingled curd and meal
Devanāgarī: न तेन देव आदिशे
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | enam | ā-dideśati | karambha-at | iti | pūṣaṇam || na | tena | devaḥ | ā-diśe ||6.56.1||

IAST: na tena deva ādiśe
Griffith: Need think no more upon the God.
Devanāgarī: य एनमादिदेशति करम्भादिति पूषणम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | enam | ā-dideśati | karambha-at | iti | pūṣaṇam || na | tena | devaḥ | ā-diśe ||6.56.1||

IAST: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatir yujā
Griffith: And he is best of charioteers. Indra, the hero's Lord, allied
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो वृत्राणि जिघ्नते
pada pāṭha: uta | gha | saḥ | rathi-tamaḥ | sakhyā | sat-patiḥ | yujā || indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||6.56.2||

IAST: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate
Griffith: With him as Friend, destroys the foes.
Devanāgarī: उत घा स रथीतमः सख्या सत्पतिर्युजा
pada pāṭha: uta | gha | saḥ | rathi-tamaḥ | sakhyā | sat-patiḥ | yujā || indraḥ | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||6.56.2||

IAST: utādaḥ paruṣe gavi sūraś cakraṁ hiraṇyayam
Griffith: And there the best of charioteers hath guided through the speckled cloud
Devanāgarī: न्यैरयद्रथीतमः
pada pāṭha: uta | adaḥ | paruṣe | gavi | sūraḥ | cakram | hiraṇyayam || ni | airayat | rathi-tamaḥ ||6.56.3||

IAST: ny airayad rathītamaḥ
Griffith: The golden wheel of Sura's car.
Devanāgarī: उतादः परुषे गवि सूरश्चक्रं हिरण्ययम्
pada pāṭha: uta | adaḥ | paruṣe | gavi | sūraḥ | cakram | hiraṇyayam || ni | airayat | rathi-tamaḥ ||6.56.3||

IAST: yad adya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ
Griffith: Whate'er we speak this day to thee, Wise, Wondrous God whom many praise,
Devanāgarī: तत्सु नो मन्म साधय
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | tvā | puru-stuta | bravāma | dasra | mantu-maḥ || tat | su | naḥ | manma | sādhaya ||6.56.4||

IAST: tat su no manma sādhaya
Griffith: Give thou fulfilment of our thought.
Devanāgarī: यदद्य त्वा पुरुष्टुत ब्रवाम दस्र मन्तुमः
pada pāṭha: yat | adya | tvā | puru-stuta | bravāma | dasra | mantu-maḥ || tat | su | naḥ | manma | sādhaya ||6.56.4||

IAST: imaṁ ca no gaveṣaṇaṁ sātaye sīṣadho gaṇam
Griffith: Lead on this company of ours, that longs for kine, to win the spoil:
Devanāgarī: आरात्पूषन्नसि श्रुतः
pada pāṭha: imam | ca | naḥ | go-eṣaṇam | sātaye | sīsadhaḥ | gaṇam || ārāt | pūṣan | asi | śrutaḥ ||6.56.5||

IAST: ārāt pūṣann asi śrutaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Pusan, art renowned afar.
Devanāgarī: इमं च नो गवेषणं सातये सीषधो गणम्
pada pāṭha: imam | ca | naḥ | go-eṣaṇam | sātaye | sīsadhaḥ | gaṇam || ārāt | pūṣan | asi | śrutaḥ ||6.56.5||

IAST: ā te svastim īmaha āreaghām upāvasum
Griffith: Prosperity we crave from thee, afar from sin and near to wealth,
Devanāgarī: अद्या च सर्वतातये श्वश्च सर्वतातये
pada pāṭha: ā | te | svastim | īmahe | āre-aghām | upa-vasum || adya | ca | sarva-tātaye | śvaḥ | ca | sarva-tātaye ||6.56.6||

IAST: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvaś ca sarvatātaye
Griffith: Tending to perfect happiness both for to. morrow and to-day.
Devanāgarī: आ ते स्वस्तिमीमह आरेअघामुपावसुम्
pada pāṭha: ā | te | svastim | īmahe | āre-aghām | upa-vasum || adya | ca | sarva-tātaye | śvaḥ | ca | sarva-tātaye ||6.56.6||

IAST: indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṁ sakhyāya svastaye
Griffith: INDRA and Pusan will we call for friend ship and prosperity
Devanāgarī: हुवेम वाजसातये
pada pāṭha: indrā | nu | pūṣaṇā | vayam | sakhyāya | svastaye || huvema | vāja-sātaye ||6.57.1||

IAST: huvema vājasātaye
Griffith: And for the winning of the spoil.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा नु पूषणा वयं सख्याय स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: indrā | nu | pūṣaṇā | vayam | sakhyāya | svastaye || huvema | vāja-sātaye ||6.57.1||

IAST: somam anya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam
Griffith: One by the Soma sits to drink juice which the mortar hath expressed:
Devanāgarī: करम्भमन्य इच्छति
pada pāṭha: somam | anyaḥ | upa | asadat | pātave | camvoḥ | sutam || karambham | anyaḥ | icchati ||6.57.2||

IAST: karambham anya icchati
Griffith: The other longs for curd and meal.
Devanāgarī: सोममन्य उपासदत्पातवे चम्वोः सुतम्
pada pāṭha: somam | anyaḥ | upa | asadat | pātave | camvoḥ | sutam || karambham | anyaḥ | icchati ||6.57.2||

IAST: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā
Griffith: Goats are the team that draws the one: the other hath Bay Steeds at hand;
Devanāgarī: ताभ्यां वृत्राणि जिघ्नते
pada pāṭha: ajāḥ | anyasya | vahnayaḥ | harī iti | anyasya | sam-bhr̥tā || tābhyām | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||6.57.3||

IAST: tābhyāṁ vṛtrāṇi jighnate
Griffith: With both of these he slays the fiends.
Devanāgarī: अजा अन्यस्य वह्नयो हरी अन्यस्य सम्भृता
pada pāṭha: ajāḥ | anyasya | vahnayaḥ | harī iti | anyasya | sam-bhr̥tā || tābhyām | vr̥trāṇi | jighnate ||6.57.3||

IAST: yad indro anayad rito mahīr apo vṛṣantamaḥ
Griffith: When Indra, wondrous strong, brought down the streams, the mighty waterfloods,
Devanāgarī: तत्र पूषाभवत्सचा
pada pāṭha: yat | indraḥ | anayat | ritaḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | vr̥ṣan-tamaḥ || tatra | pūṣā | abhavat | sacā ||6.57.4||

IAST: tatra pūṣābhavat sacā
Griffith: Pusan was standing by his side.
Devanāgarī: यदिन्द्रो अनयद्रितो महीरपो वृषन्तमः
pada pāṭha: yat | indraḥ | anayat | ritaḥ | mahīḥ | apaḥ | vr̥ṣan-tamaḥ || tatra | pūṣā | abhavat | sacā ||6.57.4||

IAST: tām pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṁ vayaṁ vṛkṣasya pra vayām iva
Griffith: To this, to Pusan's favouring love, and Indra's, may we closely cling,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य चा रभामहे
pada pāṭha: tām | pūṣṇaḥ | su-matim | vayam | vr̥kṣasya | pra | vayām-iva || indrasya | ca | ā | rabhāmahe ||6.57.5||

IAST: indrasya cā rabhāmahe
Griffith: As to a tree's extended bough.
Devanāgarī: तां पूष्णः सुमतिं वयं वृक्षस्य प्र वयामिव
pada pāṭha: tām | pūṣṇaḥ | su-matim | vayam | vr̥kṣasya | pra | vayām-iva || indrasya | ca | ā | rabhāmahe ||6.57.5||

IAST: ut pūṣaṇaṁ yuvāmahe 'bhīśūm̐r iva sārathiḥ
Griffith: As one who drives a car draws in his reins, may we draw Pusan near,
Devanāgarī: मह्या इन्द्रं स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: ut | pūṣaṇam | yuvāmahe | abhīśūn-iva | sārathiḥ || mahyai | indram | svastaye ||6.57.6||

IAST: mahyā indraṁ svastaye
Griffith: And Indra, for our great success.
Devanāgarī: उत्पूषणं युवामहेऽभीशूँरिव सारथिः
pada pāṭha: ut | pūṣaṇam | yuvāmahe | abhīśūn-iva | sārathiḥ || mahyai | indram | svastaye ||6.57.6||

IAST: śukraṁ te anyad yajataṁ te anyad viṣurūpe ahanī dyaur ivāsi
Griffith: LIKE heaven art thou: one form is bright, one holy, like Day and Night dissimilar in colour.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा हि माया अवसि स्वधावो भद्रा ते पूषन्निह रातिरस्तु
pada pāṭha: śukram | te | anyat | yajatam | te | anyat | viṣurūpe iti viṣu-rūpe | ahanī iti | dyauḥ-iva | asi || viśvāḥ | hi | māyāḥ | avasi | svadhā-vaḥ | bhadrā | te | pūṣan | iha | rātiḥ | astu ||6.58.1||

IAST: viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣann iha rātir astu
Griffith: All magic powers thou aidest, self-depen. dent! Auspicious be thy bounty here, O Pusan.
Devanāgarī: शुक्रं ते अन्यद्यजतं ते अन्यद्विषुरूपे अहनी द्यौरिवासि
pada pāṭha: śukram | te | anyat | yajatam | te | anyat | viṣurūpe iti viṣu-rūpe | ahanī iti | dyauḥ-iva | asi || viśvāḥ | hi | māyāḥ | avasi | svadhā-vaḥ | bhadrā | te | pūṣan | iha | rātiḥ | astu ||6.58.1||

IAST: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyaṁjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ
Griffith: Goat-borne, the guard of cattle, he whose home is strength, inspirer of the hymn, set over all the world;
Devanāgarī: अष्ट्रां पूषा शिथिरामुद्वरीवृजत्संचक्षाणो भुवना देव ईयते
pada pāṭha: aja-aśvaḥ | paśu-pāḥ | vāja-pastyaḥ | dhiyam-jinvaḥ | bhuvane | viśve | arpitaḥ || aṣṭrām | pūṣā | śithirām | ut-varīvr̥jat | sam-cakṣāṇaḥ | bhuvanā | devaḥ | īyate ||6.58.2||

IAST: aṣṭrām pūṣā śithirām udvarīvṛjat saṁcakṣāṇo bhuvanā deva īyate
Griffith: Brandishing here and there his lightly. moving goad, beholding every creature, Pusan, God, goes forth.
Devanāgarī: अजाश्वः पशुपा वाजपस्त्यो धियंजिन्वो भुवने विश्वे अर्पितः
pada pāṭha: aja-aśvaḥ | paśu-pāḥ | vāja-pastyaḥ | dhiyam-jinvaḥ | bhuvane | viśve | arpitaḥ || aṣṭrām | pūṣā | śithirām | ut-varīvr̥jat | sam-cakṣāṇaḥ | bhuvanā | devaḥ | īyate ||6.58.2||

IAST: yās te pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīr antarikṣe caranti
Griffith: O Pusan, with thy golden ships that travel across the ocean, in the air's mid-region,
Devanāgarī: ताभिर्यासि दूत्यां सूर्यस्य कामेन कृत श्रव इच्छमानः
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | te | pūṣan | nāvaḥ | antariti | samudre | hiraṇyayīḥ | antarikṣe | caranti || tābhiḥ | yāsi | dūtyām | sūryasya | kāmena | kr̥ta | śravaḥ | icchamānaḥ ||6.58.3||

IAST: tābhir yāsi dūtyāṁ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava icchamānaḥ
Griffith: Thou goest on an embassy to Surya, subdued by love, desirous of the glory.
Devanāgarī: यास्ते पूषन्नावो अन्तः समुद्रे हिरण्ययीरन्तरिक्षे चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | te | pūṣan | nāvaḥ | antariti | samudre | hiraṇyayīḥ | antarikṣe | caranti || tābhiḥ | yāsi | dūtyām | sūryasya | kāmena | kr̥ta | śravaḥ | icchamānaḥ ||6.58.3||

IAST: pūṣā subandhur diva ā pṛthivyā iḻas patir maghavā dasmavarcāḥ
Griffith: Near kinsman of the heaven and earth is Pusan, liberal, Lord of food, of wondrous iustre,
Devanāgarī: यं देवासो अददुः सूर्यायै कामेन कृतं तवसं स्वञ्चम्
pada pāṭha: pūṣā | su-bandhuḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | iḷaḥ | patiḥ | magha-vā | dasma-varcāḥ || yam | devāsaḥ | adaduḥ | sūryāyai | kāmena | kr̥tam | tavasam | su-añcam ||6.58.4||

IAST: yaṁ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṁ tavasaṁ svañcam
Griffith: Whom strong and vigorous and swiftlymoving, subdued by love, the Deities gave to Surya.
Devanāgarī: पूषा सुबन्धुर्दिव आ पृथिव्या इळस्पतिर्मघवा दस्मवर्चाः
pada pāṭha: pūṣā | su-bandhuḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | iḷaḥ | patiḥ | magha-vā | dasma-varcāḥ || yam | devāsaḥ | adaduḥ | sūryāyai | kāmena | kr̥tam | tavasam | su-añcam ||6.58.4||

IAST: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṁ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ
Griffith: I WILL declare, while juices flow, the manly deeds that ye have done:
Devanāgarī: हतासो वां पितरो देवशत्रव इन्द्राग्नी जीवथो युवम्
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | voca | suteṣu | vām | vīryā | yāni | cakrathuḥ || hatāsaḥ | vām | pitaraḥ | deva-śatravaḥ | indrāgnī iti | jīvathaḥ | yuvam ||6.59.1||

IAST: hatāso vām pitaro devaśatrava indrāgnī jīvatho yuvam
Griffith: Your Fathers, enemies of Gods, were smitten down, and, Indra-Agni, ye survive.
Devanāgarī: प्र नु वोचा सुतेषु वां वीर्या यानि चक्रथुः
pada pāṭha: pra | nu | voca | suteṣu | vām | vīryā | yāni | cakrathuḥ || hatāsaḥ | vām | pitaraḥ | deva-śatravaḥ | indrāgnī iti | jīvathaḥ | yuvam ||6.59.1||

IAST: baḻ itthā mahimā vām indrāgnī paniṣṭha ā
Griffith: Thus, Indra-Agnip verily your greatness merits loftiest praise,
Devanāgarī: समानो वां जनिता भ्रातरा युवं यमाविहेहमातरा
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | mahimā | vām | indrāgnī iti | paniṣṭhaḥ | ā || samānaḥ | vām | janitā | bhrātarā | yuvam | yamau | iheha-mātarā ||6.59.2||

IAST: samāno vāṁ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṁ yamāv ihehamātarā
Griffith: Sprung from one common Father, brothers, twins are ye; your Mother is in every place.
Devanāgarī: बळित्था महिमा वामिन्द्राग्नी पनिष्ठ आ
pada pāṭha: baṭ | itthā | mahimā | vām | indrāgnī iti | paniṣṭhaḥ | ā || samānaḥ | vām | janitā | bhrātarā | yuvam | yamau | iheha-mātarā ||6.59.2||

IAST: okivāṁsā sute sacām̐ aśvā saptī ivādane
Griffith: These who delight in flowing juice, like fellow horses at their food,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा न्वग्नी अवसेह वज्रिणा वयं देवा हवामहे
pada pāṭha: oki-vāṁsā | sute | sacā | aśvā | saptī iveti saptī-iva | ādane || indrā | nu | agnī iti | avasā | iha | vajriṇā | vayam | devā | havāmahe ||6.59.3||

IAST: indrā nv agnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṁ devā havāmahe
Griffith: Indra and Agni, Gods armed with the thunderbolt, we call this day to come with help.
Devanāgarī: ओकिवांसा सुते सचाँ अश्वा सप्ती इवादने
pada pāṭha: oki-vāṁsā | sute | sacā | aśvā | saptī iveti saptī-iva | ādane || indrā | nu | agnī iti | avasā | iha | vajriṇā | vayam | devā | havāmahe ||6.59.3||

IAST: ya indrāgnī suteṣu vāṁ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: Indra and Agni, Friends of Law, served with rich gifts, your speech is kind
Devanāgarī: जोषवाकं वदतः पज्रहोषिणा न देवा भसथश्चन
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indrāgnī iti | suteṣu | vām | stavat | teṣu | r̥ta-vr̥dhā || joṣa-vākam | vadataḥ | pajra-hoṣiṇā | na | devā | bhasathaḥ | cana ||6.59.4||

IAST: joṣavākaṁ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaś cana
Griffith: To him who praises you while these libations flow: that man, O Gods, ye ne'er consume.
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्राग्नी सुतेषु वां स्तवत्तेष्वृतावृधा
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indrāgnī iti | suteṣu | vām | stavat | teṣu | r̥ta-vr̥dhā || joṣa-vākam | vadataḥ | pajra-hoṣiṇā | na | devā | bhasathaḥ | cana ||6.59.4||

IAST: indrāgnī ko asya vāṁ devau martaś ciketati
Griffith: What mortal understands, O Gods, Indra and Agni, this your way?
Devanāgarī: विषूचो अश्वान्युयुजान ईयत एकः समान आ रथे
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | kaḥ | asya | vām | devau | martaḥ | ciketati || viṣūcaḥ | aśvān | yuyujānaḥ | īyate | ekaḥ | samāne | ā | rathe ||6.59.5||

IAST: viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe
Griffith: One of you, yoking Steeds that move to every side, advances in your common car.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी को अस्य वां देवौ मर्तश्चिकेतति
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | kaḥ | asya | vām | devau | martaḥ | ciketati || viṣūcaḥ | aśvān | yuyujānaḥ | īyate | ekaḥ | samāne | ā | rathe ||6.59.5||

IAST: indrāgnī apād iyam pūrvāgāt padvatībhyaḥ
Griffith: First, Indra-Agni, hath this Maid come footless unto those with feet.
Devanāgarī: हित्वी शिरो जिह्वया वावदच्चरत्त्रिंशत्पदा न्यक्रमीत्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | apāt | iyam | pūrvā | ā | agāt | pat-vatībhyaḥ || hitvī | śiraḥ | jihvayā | vāvadat | carat | triṁśat | padā | ni | akramīt ||6.59.6||

IAST: hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadac carat triṁśat padā ny akramīt
Griffith: Stretching her head and speaking loudly with her tongue, she hath gone downward thirty steps.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी अपादियं पूर्वागात्पद्वतीभ्यः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | apāt | iyam | pūrvā | ā | agāt | pat-vatībhyaḥ || hitvī | śiraḥ | jihvayā | vāvadat | carat | triṁśat | padā | ni | akramīt ||6.59.6||

IAST: indrāgnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ
Griffith: E'en now, O Indra-Agni, men hold in their arms and stretch their bows.
Devanāgarī: मा नो अस्मिन्महाधने परा वर्क्तं गविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | ā | hi | tanvate | naraḥ | dhanvāni | bāhvoḥ || mā | naḥ | asmin | mahā-dhane | parā | varktam | go-iṣṭiṣu ||6.59.7||

IAST: mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṁ gaviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Desert us not in this great fray, in battles for the sake of kine.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी आ हि तन्वते नरो धन्वानि बाह्वोः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | ā | hi | tanvate | naraḥ | dhanvāni | bāhvoḥ || mā | naḥ | asmin | mahā-dhane | parā | varktam | go-iṣṭiṣu ||6.59.7||

IAST: indrāgnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ
Griffith: The foeman's sinful enmities, Indra and Agni, vex me sore.
Devanāgarī: अप द्वेषांस्या कृतं युयुतं सूर्यादधि
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | tapanti | mā | aghāḥ | aryaḥ | arātayaḥ || apa | dveṣāṁsi | ā | kr̥tam | yuyutam | sūryāt | adhi ||6.59.8||

IAST: apa dveṣāṁsy ā kṛtaṁ yuyutaṁ sūryād adhi
Griffith: Drive those who hate me far away, and keep them distant from the Sun.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी तपन्ति माघा अर्यो अरातयः
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | tapanti | mā | aghāḥ | aryaḥ | arātayaḥ || apa | dveṣāṁsi | ā | kr̥tam | yuyutam | sūryāt | adhi ||6.59.8||

IAST: indrāgnī yuvor api vasu divyāni pārthivā
Griffith: Indra and Agni, yours are all the treasures of the heavens and earth.
Devanāgarī: आ न इह प्र यच्छतं रयिं विश्वायुपोषसम्
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yuvoḥ | api | vasu | divyāni | pārthivā || ā | naḥ | iha | pra | yacchatam | rayim | viśvāyu-poṣasam ||6.59.9||

IAST: ā na iha pra yacchataṁ rayiṁ viśvāyupoṣasam
Griffith: Here give ye us the opulence that prospers every living man.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी युवोरपि वसु दिव्यानि पार्थिवा
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yuvoḥ | api | vasu | divyāni | pārthivā || ā | naḥ | iha | pra | yacchatam | rayim | viśvāyu-poṣasam ||6.59.9||

IAST: indrāgnī ukthavāhasā stomebhir havanaśrutā
Griffith: O Indra-Agni, who accept the laud, and hear us for our praise,
Devanāgarī: विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरा गतमस्य सोमस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | uktha-vāhasā | stomebhiḥ | havana-śrutā || viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ā | gatam | asya | somasya | pītaye ||6.59.10||

IAST: viśvābhir gīrbhir ā gatam asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: Come near us, drawn by all our songs, to drink of this our Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी उक्थवाहसा स्तोमेभिर्हवनश्रुता
pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | uktha-vāhasā | stomebhiḥ | havana-śrutā || viśvābhiḥ | gīḥ-bhiḥ | ā | gatam | asya | somasya | pītaye ||6.59.10||

IAST: śnathad vṛtram uta sanoti vājam indrā yo agnī sahurī saparyāt
Griffith: HE slays the foe and wins the spoil who worships Indra and Agni, strong and mighty Heroes,
Devanāgarī: इरज्यन्ता वसव्यस्य भूरेः सहस्तमा सहसा वाजयन्ता
pada pāṭha: śnathat | vr̥tram | uta | sanoti | vājam | indrā | yaḥ | agnī iti | sahurī iti | saparyāt || irajyantā | vasavyasya | bhūreḥ | sahaḥ-tamā | sahasā | vāja-yantā ||6.60.1||

IAST: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā
Griffith: Who rule as Sovrans over ample riches, victorious, showing forth their power in conquest.
Devanāgarī: श्नथद्वृत्रमुत सनोति वाजमिन्द्रा यो अग्नी सहुरी सपर्यात्
pada pāṭha: śnathat | vr̥tram | uta | sanoti | vājam | indrā | yaḥ | agnī iti | sahurī iti | saparyāt || irajyantā | vasavyasya | bhūreḥ | sahaḥ-tamā | sahasā | vāja-yantā ||6.60.1||

IAST: tā yodhiṣṭam abhi gā indra nūnam apaḥ svar uṣaso agna ūḻhāḥ
Griffith: So battle now, O Indra and thou, Agni, for cows and waters, sunlight, stolen Mornings.
Devanāgarī: दिशः स्वरुषस इन्द्र चित्रा अपो गा अग्ने युवसे नियुत्वान्
pada pāṭha: tā | yodhiṣṭam | abhi | gāḥ | indra | nūnam | apaḥ | svaḥ | uṣasaḥ | agne | ūḷhāḥ || diśaḥ | svaḥ | uṣasaḥ | indra | citrāḥ | apaḥ | gāḥ | agne | yuvase | niyutvān ||6.60.2||

IAST: diśaḥ svar uṣasa indra citrā apo gā agne yuvase niyutvān
Griffith: Team-borne, thou makest kine thine own, O Agni: thou, Indra, light, Dawns, regions, wondrous waters.
Devanāgarī: ता योधिष्टमभि गा इन्द्र नूनमपः स्वरुषसो अग्न ऊळ्हाः
pada pāṭha: tā | yodhiṣṭam | abhi | gāḥ | indra | nūnam | apaḥ | svaḥ | uṣasaḥ | agne | ūḷhāḥ || diśaḥ | svaḥ | uṣasaḥ | indra | citrāḥ | apaḥ | gāḥ | agne | yuvase | niyutvān ||6.60.2||

IAST: ā vṛtrahaṇā vṛtrahabhiḥ śuṣmair indra yātaṁ namobhir agne arvāk
Griffith: With Vrtra-slaying might, Indra and Agni, come, drawn by homage, O ye Vrtra-slayers.
Devanāgarī: युवं राधोभिरकवेभिरिन्द्राग्ने अस्मे भवतमुत्तमेभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | vr̥tra-hanā | vr̥traha-bhiḥ | śuṣmaiḥ | indra | yātam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | agne | arvāk || yuvam | rādhaḥ-bhiḥ | akavebhiḥ | indra | agne | asme iti | bhavatam | ut-tamebhiḥ ||6.60.3||

IAST: yuvaṁ rādhobhir akavebhir indrāgne asme bhavatam uttamebhiḥ
Griffith: Indra and Agni, show yourselves among us with your supreme and unrestricted bounties.
Devanāgarī: आ वृत्रहणा वृत्रहभिः शुष्मैरिन्द्र यातं नमोभिरग्ने अर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ā | vr̥tra-hanā | vr̥traha-bhiḥ | śuṣmaiḥ | indra | yātam | namaḥ-bhiḥ | agne | arvāk || yuvam | rādhaḥ-bhiḥ | akavebhiḥ | indra | agne | asme iti | bhavatam | ut-tamebhiḥ ||6.60.3||

IAST: tā huve yayor idam papne viśvam purā kṛtam
Griffith: I call the Twain whose deeds of old have all been famed in ancient days
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राग्नी न मर्धतः
pada pāṭha: tā | huve | yayoḥ | idam | papne | viśvam | purā | kr̥tam || indrāgnī iti | na | mardhataḥ ||6.60.4||

IAST: indrāgnī na mardhataḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Agni, harm us not.
Devanāgarī: ता हुवे ययोरिदं पप्ने विश्वं पुरा कृतम्
pada pāṭha: tā | huve | yayoḥ | idam | papne | viśvam | purā | kr̥tam || indrāgnī iti | na | mardhataḥ ||6.60.4||

IAST: ugrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāgnī havāmahe
Griffith: The Strong, the scatterers of the foe, Indra and Agni, we invoke;
Devanāgarī: ता नो मृळात ईदृशे
pada pāṭha: ugrā | vi-ghaninā | mr̥dhaḥ | indrāgnī iti | havāmahe || tā | naḥ | mr̥ḷātaḥ | īdr̥śe ||6.60.5||

IAST: tā no mṛḻāta īdṛśe
Griffith: May they be kind to one like me.
Devanāgarī: उग्रा विघनिना मृध इन्द्राग्नी हवामहे
pada pāṭha: ugrā | vi-ghaninā | mr̥dhaḥ | indrāgnī iti | havāmahe || tā | naḥ | mr̥ḷātaḥ | īdr̥śe ||6.60.5||

IAST: hato vṛtrāṇy āryā hato dāsāni satpatī
Griffith: They slay our Arya foes, these Lords of heroes, slay our Dasyu foes
Devanāgarī: हतो विश्वा अप द्विषः
pada pāṭha: hataḥ | vr̥trāṇi | āryā | hataḥ | dāsāni | satpatī iti sat-patī || hataḥ | viśvāḥ | apa | dviṣaḥ ||6.60.6||

IAST: hato viśvā apa dviṣaḥ
Griffith: And drive our enemies away.
Devanāgarī: हतो वृत्राण्यार्या हतो दासानि सत्पती
pada pāṭha: hataḥ | vr̥trāṇi | āryā | hataḥ | dāsāni | satpatī iti sat-patī || hataḥ | viśvāḥ | apa | dviṣaḥ ||6.60.6||

IAST: indrāgnī yuvām ime 'bhi stomā anūṣata
Griffith: Indra and Agni, these our songs of praise have sounded forth to you:

pada pāṭha: indrāgnī iti | yuvām | ime | abhi | stomāḥ | anūṣata || pibatam | śam-bhuvā | sutam ||6.60.7||

pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vām | santi | puru-spr̥haḥ | ni-yutaḥ | dāśuṣe | narā || indrāgnī iti | tābhiḥ | ā | gatam ||6.60.8||

pada pāṭha: tam | īḷiṣva | yaḥ | arciṣā | vanā | viśvā | pari-svajat || kr̥ṣṇā | kr̥ṇoti | jihvayā ||6.60.10||

IAST: ya iddha āvivāsati sumnam indrasya martyaḥ

Griffith: Over the floods to happiness.
Devanāgarī: य इद्ध आविवासति सुम्नमिन्द्रस्य मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | iddhe | ā-vivāsati | sumnam | indrasya | martyaḥ || dyumnāya | su-tarāḥ | apaḥ ||6.60.11||

pada pāṭha: ubhā | vām | indrāgnī iti | ā-huvadhyai | ubhā | rādhasaḥ | saha | mādayadhyai || ubhā | dātārau | iṣām | rayīṇām | ubhā | vājasya | sātaye | huve | vām ||6.60.13||

Griffith: Sarasvati hath earned our praise.

pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | priyā | priyāsu | sapta-svasā | su-juṣṭā || sarasvatī | stomyā | bhūt ||6.61.10||

Griffith: Guard us from hate Sarasvati, she who hath filled the realms of earth,

Devanāgarī: सरस्वत्यभि नो नेषि वस्यो माप स्फरीः पयसा मा न आ धक्
pada pāṭha: sarasvati | abhi | naḥ | neṣi | vasyaḥ | mā | apa | spharīḥ | payasā | mā | naḥ | ā | dhak || juṣasva | naḥ | sakhyā | veśyā | ca | mā | tvat | kṣetrāṇi | araṇāni | ganma ||6.61.14||

IAST: stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ
Griffith: I LAUD the Heroes Twain, this heaven's Controllers: singing with songs of praise I call the Asvins,
Devanāgarī: या सद्य उस्रा व्युषि ज्मो अन्तान्युयूषतः पर्युरू वरांसि
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | narā | divaḥ | asya | pra-santā | aśvinā | huve | jaramāṇaḥ | arkaiḥ || yā | sadyaḥ | usrā | vi-uṣi | jmaḥ | antān | yuyūṣataḥ | pari | uru | varāṁsi ||6.62.1||

IAST: yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ pary urū varāṁsi
Griffith: Fain in a moment, when the morns are breaking, to part the earth's ends and the spacious regions.
Devanāgarī: स्तुषे नरा दिवो अस्य प्रसन्ताश्विना हुवे जरमाणो अर्कैः
pada pāṭha: stuṣe | narā | divaḥ | asya | pra-santā | aśvinā | huve | jaramāṇaḥ | arkaiḥ || yā | sadyaḥ | usrā | vi-uṣi | jmaḥ | antān | yuyūṣataḥ | pari | uru | varāṁsi ||6.62.1||

IAST: tā yajñam ā śucibhiś cakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṁ rurucū rajobhiḥ
Griffith: Moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them.
Devanāgarī: पुरू वरांस्यमिता मिमानापो धन्वान्यति याथो अज्रान्
pada pāṭha: tā | yajñam | ā | śuci-bhiḥ | cakramāṇā | rathasya | bhānum | rurucuḥ | rajaḥ-bhiḥ || puru | varāṁsi | amitā | mimānā | apaḥ | dhanvāni | ati | yāthaḥ | ajrān ||6.62.2||

IAST: purū varāṁsy amitā mimānāpo dhanvāny ati yātho ajrān
Griffith: Traversing many wide unmeasured spaces, over the wastes ye pass, and fields, and waters.
Devanāgarī: ता यज्ञमा शुचिभिश्चक्रमाणा रथस्य भानुं रुरुचू रजोभिः
pada pāṭha: tā | yajñam | ā | śuci-bhiḥ | cakramāṇā | rathasya | bhānum | rurucuḥ | rajaḥ-bhiḥ || puru | varāṁsi | amitā | mimānā | apaḥ | dhanvāni | ati | yāthaḥ | ajrān ||6.62.2||

IAST: tā ha tyad vartir yad aradhram ugretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvad aśvaiḥ
Griffith: Ye to that bounteous path of yours, ye mighty, have ever borne away our thoughts with horses,
Devanāgarī: मनोजवेभिरिषिरैः शयध्यै परि व्यथिर्दाशुषो मर्त्यस्य
pada pāṭha: tā | ha | tyat | vartiḥ | yat | aradhram | ugrā | itthā | dhiyaḥ | ūhathuḥ | śaśvat | aśvaiḥ || manaḥ-javebhiḥ | iṣiraiḥ | śayadhyai | pari | vyathiḥ | dāśuṣaḥ | martyasya ||6.62.3||

IAST: manojavebhir iṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathir dāśuṣo martyasya
Griffith: Mind-swift and full of vigour, that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.
Devanāgarī: ता ह त्यद्वर्तिर्यदरध्रमुग्रेत्था धिय ऊहथुः शश्वदश्वैः
pada pāṭha: tā | ha | tyat | vartiḥ | yat | aradhram | ugrā | itthā | dhiyaḥ | ūhathuḥ | śaśvat | aśvaiḥ || manaḥ-javebhiḥ | iṣiraiḥ | śayadhyai | pari | vyathiḥ | dāśuṣaḥ | martyasya ||6.62.3||

IAST: tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī
Griffith: So ye, when ye have yoked your chariothorses, come to the hymn of the most recent singer.
Devanāgarī: शुभं पृक्षमिषमूर्जं वहन्ता होता यक्षत्प्रत्नो अध्रुग्युवाना
pada pāṭha: tā | navyasaḥ | jaramāṇasya | manma | upa | bhūṣataḥ | yuyujānasaptī iti yuyujāna-saptī || śubham | pr̥kṣam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantā | hotā | yakṣat | pratnaḥ | adhruk | yuvānā ||6.62.4||

IAST: śubham pṛkṣam iṣam ūrjaṁ vahantā hotā yakṣat pratno adhrug yuvānā
Griffith: Our true and ancient Herald Priest shall bring you, the Youthful, bearing splendour, food, and vigour.
Devanāgarī: ता नव्यसो जरमाणस्य मन्मोप भूषतो युयुजानसप्ती
pada pāṭha: tā | navyasaḥ | jaramāṇasya | manma | upa | bhūṣataḥ | yuyujānasaptī iti yuyujāna-saptī || śubham | pr̥kṣam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantā | hotā | yakṣat | pratnaḥ | adhruk | yuvānā ||6.62.4||

IAST: tā valgū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse
Griffith: With newest hymn I call those Wonder-Workers, ancient and brilliant, and exceeding mighty,
Devanāgarī: या शंसते स्तुवते शम्भविष्ठा बभूवतुर्गृणते चित्रराती
pada pāṭha: tā | valgū iti | dasrā | puruśāka-tamā | pratnā | navyasā | vacasā | ā | vivāse || yā | śaṁsate | stuvate | śam-bhaviṣṭhā | babhūvatuḥ | gr̥ṇate | citrarātī iti citra-rātī ||6.62.5||

IAST: yā śaṁsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvatur gṛṇate citrarātī
Griffith: Bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises, bestowing varied bounties on the singer.
Devanāgarī: ता वल्गू दस्रा पुरुशाकतमा प्रत्ना नव्यसा वचसा विवासे
pada pāṭha: tā | valgū iti | dasrā | puruśāka-tamā | pratnā | navyasā | vacasā | ā | vivāse || yā | śaṁsate | stuvate | śam-bhaviṣṭhā | babhūvatuḥ | gr̥ṇate | citrarātī iti citra-rātī ||6.62.5||

IAST: tā bhujyuṁ vibhir adbhyaḥ samudrāt tugrasya sūnum ūhathū rajobhiḥ
Griffith: So ye, with birds, out of the sea and waters bore Bhujyu, son of Tugra, through the regions.
Devanāgarī: अरेणुभिर्योजनेभिर्भुजन्ता पतत्रिभिरर्णसो निरुपस्थात्
pada pāṭha: tā | bhujyum | vi-bhiḥ | at-bhyaḥ | samudrāt | tugrasya | sūnum | ūhathuḥ | rajaḥ-bhiḥ || areṇu-bhiḥ | yojanebhiḥ | bhujantā | patatri-bhiḥ | arṇasaḥ | niḥ | upa-sthāt ||6.62.6||

IAST: areṇubhir yojanebhir bhujantā patatribhir arṇaso nir upasthāt
Griffith: Speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces, out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.
Devanāgarī: ता भुज्युं विभिरद्भ्यः समुद्रात्तुग्रस्य सूनुमूहथू रजोभिः
pada pāṭha: tā | bhujyum | vi-bhiḥ | at-bhyaḥ | samudrāt | tugrasya | sūnum | ūhathuḥ | rajaḥ-bhiḥ || areṇu-bhiḥ | yojanebhiḥ | bhujantā | patatri-bhiḥ | arṇasaḥ | niḥ | upa-sthāt ||6.62.6||

IAST: vi jayuṣā rathyā yātam adriṁ śrutaṁ havaṁ vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ
Griffith: Victors, car-borne, ye rent the rock asunder: Bulls, heard the calling of the eunuch's consort.
Devanāgarī: दशस्यन्ता शयवे पिप्यथुर्गामिति च्यवाना सुमतिं भुरण्यू
pada pāṭha: vi | jayuṣā | rathyā | yātam | adrim | śrutam | havam | vr̥ṣaṇā | vadhri-matyāḥ || daśasyantā | śayave | pipyathuḥ | gām | iti | cyavānā | su-matim | bhuraṇyū iti ||6.62.7||

IAST: daśasyantā śayave pipyathur gām iti cyavānā sumatim bhuraṇyū
Griffith: Bounteous, ye filled the cow with milk for Sayu: thus, swift and zealous Ones, ye showed your favour.
Devanāgarī: वि जयुषा रथ्या यातमद्रिं श्रुतं हवं वृषणा वध्रिमत्याः
pada pāṭha: vi | jayuṣā | rathyā | yātam | adrim | śrutam | havam | vr̥ṣaṇā | vadhri-matyāḥ || daśasyantā | śayave | pipyathuḥ | gām | iti | cyavānā | su-matim | bhuraṇyū iti ||6.62.7||

IAST: yad rodasī pradivo asti bhūmā heḻo devānām uta martyatrā
Griffith: Whate'er from olden time, Heaven, Earth! existeth great object of the wrath of Gods and mortals,
Devanāgarī: तदादित्या वसवो रुद्रियासो रक्षोयुजे तपुरघं दधात
pada pāṭha: yat | rodasī iti | pra-divaḥ | asti | bhūma | heḷaḥ | devānām | uta | martya-trā || tat | ādityāḥ | vasavaḥ | rudriyāsaḥ | rakṣaḥ-yuje | tapuḥ | agham | dadhāta ||6.62.8||

IAST: tad ādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyuje tapur aghaṁ dadhāta
Griffith: Make that, Adityas, Vasus, sons of Rudra, an evil brand to one allied with demons.
Devanāgarī: यद्रोदसी प्रदिवो अस्ति भूमा हेळो देवानामुत मर्त्यत्रा
pada pāṭha: yat | rodasī iti | pra-divaḥ | asti | bhūma | heḷaḥ | devānām | uta | martya-trā || tat | ādityāḥ | vasavaḥ | rudriyāsaḥ | rakṣaḥ-yuje | tapuḥ | agham | dadhāta ||6.62.8||

IAST: ya īṁ rājānāv ṛtuthā vidadhad rajaso mitro varuṇaś ciketat
Griffith: May he who knows, as Varuna and Mitra, air's realm, appointing both the Kings in season,
