Devanāgarī: गम्भीराय रक्षसे हेतिमस्य द्रोघाय चिद्वचस आनवाय
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | īm | rājānau | r̥tu-thā | vi-dadhat | rajasaḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | ciketat || gambhīrāya | rakṣase | hetim | asya | droghāya | cit | vacase | ānavāya ||6.62.9||

IAST: gambhīrāya rakṣase hetim asya droghāya cid vacasa ānavāya
Griffith: Against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon, against the lying words that strangers utter.
Devanāgarī: य ईं राजानावृतुथा विदधद्रजसो मित्रो वरुणश्चिकेतत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | īm | rājānau | r̥tu-thā | vi-dadhat | rajasaḥ | mitraḥ | varuṇaḥ | ciketat || gambhīrāya | rakṣase | hetim | asya | droghāya | cit | vacase | ānavāya ||6.62.9||

IAST: antaraiś cakrais tanayāya vartir dyumatā yātaṁ nṛvatā rathena
Griffith: Come to our home with friendly wheels, for offipring; come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes.
Devanāgarī: सनुत्येन त्यजसा मर्त्यस्य वनुष्यतामपि शीर्षा ववृक्तम्
pada pāṭha: antaraiḥ | cakraiḥ | tanayāya | vartiḥ | dyu-matā | ā | yātam | nr̥-vatā | rathena || sanutyena | tyajasā | martyasya | vanuṣyatām | api | śīrṣā | vavr̥ktam ||6.62.10||

IAST: sanutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatām api śīrṣā vavṛktam
Griffith: Strike off, ye Twain, the heads of our assailants who with man's treacherous attack approach us.
Devanāgarī: अन्तरैश्चक्रैस्तनयाय वर्तिर्द्युमता यातं नृवता रथेन
pada pāṭha: antaraiḥ | cakraiḥ | tanayāya | vartiḥ | dyu-matā | ā | yātam | nr̥-vatā | rathena || sanutyena | tyajasā | martyasya | vanuṣyatām | api | śīrṣā | vavr̥ktam ||6.62.10||

IAST: ā paramābhir uta madhyamābhir niyudbhir yātam avamābhir arvāk
Griffith: Come hitherward to us with teams of horses, the highest and the midmost and the lowest.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हस्य चिद्गोमतो वि व्रजस्य दुरो वर्तं गृणते चित्रराती
pada pāṭha: ā | paramābhiḥ | uta | madhyamābhiḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | yātam | avamābhiḥ | arvāk || dr̥ḷhasya | cit | go-mataḥ | vi | vrajasya | duraḥ | vartam | gr̥ṇate | citrarātī iti citra-rātī ||6.62.11||

IAST: dṛḻhasya cid gomato vi vrajasya duro vartaṁ gṛṇate citrarātī
Griffith: Bountiful Lords, throw open to the singer doors e'en of the firm-closed stall of cattle.
Devanāgarī: आ परमाभिरुत मध्यमाभिर्नियुद्भिर्यातमवमाभिरर्वाक्
pada pāṭha: ā | paramābhiḥ | uta | madhyamābhiḥ | niyut-bhiḥ | yātam | avamābhiḥ | arvāk || dr̥ḷhasya | cit | go-mataḥ | vi | vrajasya | duraḥ | vartam | gr̥ṇate | citrarātī iti citra-rātī ||6.62.11||

IAST: kva tyā valgū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo 'vidan namasvān
Griffith: WHERE hath the hymn with reverence, like an envoy, found both fair Gods to-day, invoked of many-
Devanāgarī: आ यो अर्वाङ्नासत्या ववर्त प्रेष्ठा ह्यसथो अस्य मन्मन्
pada pāṭha: kva | tyā | valgū iti | puru-hūtā | adya | dūtaḥ | na | stomaḥ | avidat | namasvān || ā | yaḥ | arvāk | nāsatyā | vavarta | preṣṭhā | hi | asathaḥ | asya | manman ||6.63.1||

IAST: ā yo arvāṅ nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hy asatho asya manman
Griffith: Hymn that hath brought the two Nasatyas hither? To this man's thought be ye, both Gods, most friendly.
Devanāgarī: क्व त्या वल्गू पुरुहूताद्य दूतो न स्तोमोऽविदन्नमस्वान्
pada pāṭha: kva | tyā | valgū iti | puru-hūtā | adya | dūtaḥ | na | stomaḥ | avidat | namasvān || ā | yaḥ | arvāk | nāsatyā | vavarta | preṣṭhā | hi | asathaḥ | asya | manman ||6.63.1||

IAST: aram me gantaṁ havanāyāsmai gṛṇānā yathā pibātho andhaḥ
Griffith: Come readily to this mine invocation, lauded with songs, that ye may drink the juices.
Devanāgarī: परि ह त्यद्वर्तिर्याथो रिषो न यत्परो नान्तरस्तुतुर्यात्
pada pāṭha: aram | me | gantam | havanāya | asmai | gr̥ṇānā | yathā | pibāthaḥ | andhaḥ || pari | ha | tyat | vartiḥ | yāthaḥ | riṣaḥ | na | yat | paraḥ | na | antaraḥ | tuturyāt ||6.63.2||

IAST: pari ha tyad vartir yātho riṣo na yat paro nāntaras tuturyāt
Griffith: Compass this house to keep it from the foeman, that none may force it, either near or distant.
Devanāgarī: अरं मे गन्तं हवनायास्मै गृणाना यथा पिबाथो अन्धः
pada pāṭha: aram | me | gantam | havanāya | asmai | gr̥ṇānā | yathā | pibāthaḥ | andhaḥ || pari | ha | tyat | vartiḥ | yāthaḥ | riṣaḥ | na | yat | paraḥ | na | antaraḥ | tuturyāt ||6.63.2||

IAST: akāri vām andhaso varīmann astāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam
Griffith: Juice in wide room hath been prepared to feast you: for you the grass is strewn, most soft to tread on.
Devanāgarī: उत्तानहस्तो युवयुर्ववन्दा वां नक्षन्तो अद्रय आञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: akāri | vām | andhasaḥ | varīman | astāri | barhiḥ | supra-ayanatamam || uttāna-hastaḥ | yuvayuḥ | vavanda | ā | vām | nakṣantaḥ | adrayaḥ | āñjan ||6.63.3||

IAST: uttānahasto yuvayur vavandā vāṁ nakṣanto adraya āñjan
Griffith: With lifted hands your servant hath adored you. Yearningfor you the press-stones shed the liquid.
Devanāgarī: अकारि वामन्धसो वरीमन्नस्तारि बर्हिः सुप्रायणतमम्
pada pāṭha: akāri | vām | andhasaḥ | varīman | astāri | barhiḥ | supra-ayanatamam || uttāna-hastaḥ | yuvayuḥ | vavanda | ā | vām | nakṣantaḥ | adrayaḥ | āñjan ||6.63.3||

IAST: ūrdhvo vām agnir adhvareṣv asthāt pra rātir eti jūrṇinī ghṛtācī
Griffith: Agni uplifts him at your sacrifices: forth goes the oblation dropping oil and glowing.
Devanāgarī: प्र होता गूर्तमना उराणोऽयुक्त यो नासत्या हवीमन्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | vām | agniḥ | adhvareṣu | asthāt | pra | rātiḥ | eti | jūrṇinī | ghr̥tācī || pra | hotā | gūrta-manāḥ | urāṇaḥ | ayukta | yaḥ | nāsatyā | havīman ||6.63.4||

IAST: pra hotā gūrtamanā urāṇo 'yukta yo nāsatyā havīman
Griffith: Up stands the grateful-minded priest, elected, appointed to invoke the two Nasatyas.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो वामग्निरध्वरेष्वस्थात्प्र रातिरेति जूर्णिनी घृताची
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | vām | agniḥ | adhvareṣu | asthāt | pra | rātiḥ | eti | jūrṇinī | ghr̥tācī || pra | hotā | gūrta-manāḥ | urāṇaḥ | ayukta | yaḥ | nāsatyā | havīman ||6.63.4||

IAST: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya rathaṁ tasthau purubhujā śatotim
Griffith: Lords of great wealth! for glory, Surya's Daughter mounted your car that brings a hundred succours.
Devanāgarī: प्र मायाभिर्मायिना भूतमत्र नरा नृतू जनिमन्यज्ञियानाम्
pada pāṭha: adhi | śriye | duhitā | sūryasya | ratham | tasthau | puru-bhujā | śata-ūtim || pra | māyābhiḥ | māyinā | bhūtam | atra | narā | nr̥tū iti | janiman | yajñiyānām ||6.63.5||

IAST: pra māyābhir māyinā bhūtam atra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām
Griffith: Famed for your magic arts were ye, magicians! amid the race of Gods, ye dancing Heroes!
Devanāgarī: अधि श्रिये दुहिता सूर्यस्य रथं तस्थौ पुरुभुजा शतोतिम्
pada pāṭha: adhi | śriye | duhitā | sūryasya | ratham | tasthau | puru-bhujā | śata-ūtim || pra | māyābhiḥ | māyinā | bhūtam | atra | narā | nr̥tū iti | janiman | yajñiyānām ||6.63.5||

IAST: yuvaṁ śrībhir darśatābhir ābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭim ūhathuḥ sūryāyāḥ
Griffith: Ye Twain, with these your glories fair to look on, brought, to win victory, rich gifts for Surya.
Devanāgarī: प्र वां वयो वपुषेऽनु पप्तन्नक्षद्वाणी सुष्टुता धिष्ण्या वाम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | śrībhiḥ | darśatābhiḥ | ābhiḥ | śubhe | puṣṭim | ūhathuḥ | sūryāyāḥ || pra | vām | vayaḥ | vapuṣe | anu | paptan | nakṣat | vāṇī | su-stutā | dhiṣṇyā | vām ||6.63.6||

IAST: pra vāṁ vayo vapuṣe 'nu paptan nakṣad vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām
Griffith: After you flew your birds, marvels of beauty: dear to our hearts! the song, well lauded, reached you.
Devanāgarī: युवं श्रीभिर्दर्शताभिराभिः शुभे पुष्टिमूहथुः सूर्यायाः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | śrībhiḥ | darśatābhiḥ | ābhiḥ | śubhe | puṣṭim | ūhathuḥ | sūryāyāḥ || pra | vām | vayaḥ | vapuṣe | anu | paptan | nakṣat | vāṇī | su-stutā | dhiṣṇyā | vām ||6.63.6||

IAST: ā vāṁ vayo 'śvāso vahiṣṭhā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahantu
Griffith: May your winged coursers, best to draw. Nasatyas! convey you to the object of your wishes.
Devanāgarī: प्र वां रथो मनोजवा असर्जीषः पृक्ष इषिधो अनु पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vayaḥ | aśvāsaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ | abhi | prayaḥ | nāsatyā | vahantu || pra | vām | rathaḥ | manaḥ-javāḥ | asarji | iṣaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | iṣidhaḥ | anu | pūrvīḥ ||6.63.7||

IAST: pra vāṁ ratho manojavā asarjīṣaḥ pṛkṣa iṣidho anu pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Swift as the thought, your car hath been sent onward to food of many a sort and dainty viands.
Devanāgarī: आ वां वयोऽश्वासो वहिष्ठा अभि प्रयो नासत्या वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vayaḥ | aśvāsaḥ | vahiṣṭhāḥ | abhi | prayaḥ | nāsatyā | vahantu || pra | vām | rathaḥ | manaḥ-javāḥ | asarji | iṣaḥ | pr̥kṣaḥ | iṣidhaḥ | anu | pūrvīḥ ||6.63.7||

IAST: puru hi vām purubhujā deṣṇaṁ dhenuṁ na iṣam pinvatam asakrām
Griffith: Lords of great wealth, manifold is your bounty: ye filled our cow with food that never faileth.
Devanāgarī: स्तुतश्च वां माध्वी सुष्टुतिश्च रसाश्च ये वामनु रातिमग्मन्
pada pāṭha: puru | hi | vām | puru-bhujā | deṣṇam | dhenum | naḥ | iṣam | pinvatam | asakrām || stutaḥ | ca | vām | mādhvī iti | su-stutiḥ | ca | rasāḥ | ca | ye | vām | anu | rātim | agman ||6.63.8||

IAST: stutaś ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutiś ca rasāś ca ye vām anu rātim agman
Griffith: Lovers of sweetness! yours are praise and singers, and poured libations which have sought your favour.
Devanāgarī: पुरु हि वां पुरुभुजा देष्णं धेनुं न इषं पिन्वतमसक्राम्
pada pāṭha: puru | hi | vām | puru-bhujā | deṣṇam | dhenum | naḥ | iṣam | pinvatam | asakrām || stutaḥ | ca | vām | mādhvī iti | su-stutiḥ | ca | rasāḥ | ca | ye | vām | anu | rātim | agman ||6.63.8||

IAST: uta ma ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḻhe śatam peruke ca pakvā
Griffith: Mine were two mares of Puraya, brown, swift-footed; a hundred with Sumidha, food with Peruk
Devanāgarī: शाण्डो दाद्धिरणिनः स्मद्दिष्टीन्दश वशासो अभिषाच ऋष्वान्
pada pāṭha: uta | me | r̥jre iti | purayasya | raghvī iti | su-mīḷhe | śatam | peruke | ca | pakvā || śāṇḍaḥ | dāt | hiraṇinaḥ | smat-diṣṭīn | daśa | vaśāsaḥ | abhi-sācaḥ | r̥ṣvān ||6.63.9||

IAST: śāṇḍo dād dhiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāso abhiṣāca ṛṣvān
Griffith: Sanda gave ten gold-decked and well-trained horses, tame and obedient and of lofty stature.
Devanāgarī: उत म ऋज्रे पुरयस्य रघ्वी सुमीळ्हे शतं पेरुके च पक्वा
pada pāṭha: uta | me | r̥jre iti | purayasya | raghvī iti | su-mīḷhe | śatam | peruke | ca | pakvā || śāṇḍaḥ | dāt | hiraṇinaḥ | smat-diṣṭīn | daśa | vaśāsaḥ | abhi-sācaḥ | r̥ṣvān ||6.63.9||

IAST: saṁ vāṁ śatā nāsatyā sahasrāśvānām purupanthā gire dāt
Griffith: Nasatyas! Purupanthas offered hundreds, thousands of steeds to him who sang your praises,
Devanāgarī: भरद्वाजाय वीर नू गिरे दाद्धता रक्षांसि पुरुदंससा स्युः
pada pāṭha: sam | vām | śatā | nāsatyā | sahasrā | aśvānām | puru-panthāḥ | gire | dāt || bharat-vājāya | vīra | nu | gire | dāt | hatā | rakṣāṁsi | puru-daṁsasā | syuriti syuḥ ||6.63.10||

IAST: bharadvājāya vīra nū gire dād dhatā rakṣāṁsi purudaṁsasā syuḥ
Griffith: Gave, Heroes! to the singer Bharadvaja. Ye-Wonder-Workers, let the fiends be slaughtered.
Devanāgarī: सं वां शता नासत्या सहस्राश्वानां पुरुपन्था गिरे दात्
pada pāṭha: sam | vām | śatā | nāsatyā | sahasrā | aśvānām | puru-panthāḥ | gire | dāt || bharat-vājāya | vīra | nu | gire | dāt | hatā | rakṣāṁsi | puru-daṁsasā | syuriti syuḥ ||6.63.10||

IAST: ā vāṁ sumne variman sūribhiḥ ṣyām
Griffith: May I with princes share your bliss in freedom.
Devanāgarī: आ वां सुम्ने वरिमन्सूरिभिः ष्याम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | sumne | variman | sūri-bhiḥ | syām ||6.63.11||

IAST: ud u śriya uṣaso rocamānā asthur apāṁ normayo ruśantaḥ
Griffith: THE radiant Dawns have risen up for glory, in their white splendour like the waves of waters.
Devanāgarī: उदु श्रिय उषसो रोचमाना अस्थुरपां नोर्मयो रुशन्तः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | śriye | uṣasaḥ | rocamānāḥ | asthuḥ | apām | na | ūrmayaḥ | ruśantaḥ || kr̥ṇoti | viśvā | su-pathā | su-gāni | abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vasvī | dakṣiṇā | maghonī ||6.64.1||

IAST: kṛṇoti viśvā supathā sugāny abhūd u vasvī dakṣiṇā maghonī
Griffith: She maketh paths all easy, fair to travel, and, rich, hath shown herself benign and friendly.
Devanāgarī: कृणोति विश्वा सुपथा सुगान्यभूदु वस्वी दक्षिणा मघोनी
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | śriye | uṣasaḥ | rocamānāḥ | asthuḥ | apām | na | ūrmayaḥ | ruśantaḥ || kr̥ṇoti | viśvā | su-pathā | su-gāni | abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vasvī | dakṣiṇā | maghonī ||6.64.1||

IAST: bhadrā dadṛkṣa urviyā vi bhāsy ut te śocir bhānavo dyām apaptan
Griffith: We see that thou art good: far shines thy lustre; thy beams, thy splendours have flown up to heaven.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा ददृक्ष उर्विया वि भास्युत्ते शोचिर्भानवो द्यामपप्तन्
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | dadr̥kṣe | urviyā | vi | bhāsi | ut | te | śociḥ | bhānavaḥ | dyām | apaptan || āviḥ | vakṣaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣe | śumbhamānā | uṣaḥ | devi | rocamānā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ ||6.64.2||

IAST: āvir vakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānoṣo devi rocamānā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: Decking thyself, thou makest bare thy bosom, shining in majesty, thou Goddess Morning.
Devanāgarī: आविर्वक्षः कृणुषे शुम्भमानोषो देवि रोचमाना महोभिः
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | dadr̥kṣe | urviyā | vi | bhāsi | ut | te | śociḥ | bhānavaḥ | dyām | apaptan || āviḥ | vakṣaḥ | kr̥ṇuṣe | śumbhamānā | uṣaḥ | devi | rocamānā | mahaḥ-bhiḥ ||6.64.2||

IAST: vahanti sīm aruṇāso ruśanto gāvaḥ subhagām urviyā prathānām
Griffith: Red are the kine and luminous that bear her the Blessed One who spreadeth through the distance.
Devanāgarī: वहन्ति सीमरुणासो रुशन्तो गावः सुभगामुर्विया प्रथानाम्
pada pāṭha: vahanti | sīm | aruṇāsaḥ | ruśantaḥ | gāvaḥ | su-bhagām | urviyā | prathānām || apa | ījate | śūraḥ | astā-iva | śatrūn | bādhate | tamaḥ | ajiraḥ | na | voḷhā ||6.64.3||

IAST: apejate śūro asteva śatrūn bādhate tamo ajiro na voḻhā
Griffith: The foes she chaseth like a valiant archer, like a swift warrior she repelleth darkness.
Devanāgarī: अपेजते शूरो अस्तेव शत्रून्बाधते तमो अजिरो न वोळ्हा
pada pāṭha: vahanti | sīm | aruṇāsaḥ | ruśantaḥ | gāvaḥ | su-bhagām | urviyā | prathānām || apa | ījate | śūraḥ | astā-iva | śatrūn | bādhate | tamaḥ | ajiraḥ | na | voḷhā ||6.64.3||

IAST: sugota te supathā parvateṣv avāte apas tarasi svabhāno
Griffith: Thy ways are easy on the hills: thou passest Invincible! Sef-luminous! through waters.
Devanāgarī: सुगोत ते सुपथा पर्वतेष्ववाते अपस्तरसि स्वभानो
pada pāṭha: su-gā | uta | te | su-pathā | parvateṣu | avāte | apaḥ | tarasi | svabhāno iti sva-bhāno || sā | naḥ | ā | vaha | pr̥thu-yāman | r̥ṣve | rayim | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | iṣayadhyai ||6.64.4||

IAST: sā na ā vaha pṛthuyāmann ṛṣve rayiṁ divo duhitar iṣayadhyai
Griffith: So lofty Goddess with thine ample pathway, Daughter of Heaven, bring wealth to give us comfort.
Devanāgarī: सा न आ वह पृथुयामन्नृष्वे रयिं दिवो दुहितरिषयध्यै
pada pāṭha: su-gā | uta | te | su-pathā | parvateṣu | avāte | apaḥ | tarasi | svabhāno iti sva-bhāno || sā | naḥ | ā | vaha | pr̥thu-yāman | r̥ṣve | rayim | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | iṣayadhyai ||6.64.4||

IAST: sā vaha yokṣabhir avātoṣo varaṁ vahasi joṣam anu
Griffith: Dawn, bring me wealth: untroubled, with thine oxen thou bearest riches at thy will and pleasure;
Devanāgarī: सा वह योक्षभिरवातोषो वरं वहसि जोषमनु
pada pāṭha: sā | ā | vaha | yā | ukṣa-bhiḥ | avātā | uṣaḥ | varam | vahasi | joṣam | anu || tvam | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | yā | ha | devī | pūrva-hūtau | maṁhanā | darśatā | bhūḥ ||6.64.5||

IAST: tvaṁ divo duhitar yā ha devī pūrvahūtau maṁhanā darśatā bhūḥ
Griffith: Thou who, a Goddess, Child of Heaven, hast shown thee lovely through bounty when we called thee early.
Devanāgarī: त्वं दिवो दुहितर्या ह देवी पूर्वहूतौ मंहना दर्शता भूः
pada pāṭha: sā | ā | vaha | yā | ukṣa-bhiḥ | avātā | uṣaḥ | varam | vahasi | joṣam | anu || tvam | divaḥ | duhitaḥ | yā | ha | devī | pūrva-hūtau | maṁhanā | darśatā | bhūḥ ||6.64.5||

IAST: ut te vayaś cid vasater apaptan naraś ca ye pitubhājo vyuṣṭau
Griffith: As the birds fly forth from their restingplaces, so men with store of food rise at thy dawning.
Devanāgarī: उत्ते वयश्चिद्वसतेरपप्तन्नरश्च ये पितुभाजो व्युष्टौ
pada pāṭha: ut | te | vayaḥ | cit | vasateḥ | apaptan | naraḥ | ca | ye | pitu-bhājaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || amā | sate | vahasi | bhūri | vāmam | uṣaḥ | devi | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||6.64.6||

IAST: amā sate vahasi bhūri vāmam uṣo devi dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: Yea, to the liberal mortal who rernaineth at home, O Goddess Dawn, much good thou bringest.
Devanāgarī: अमा सते वहसि भूरि वाममुषो देवि दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: ut | te | vayaḥ | cit | vasateḥ | apaptan | naraḥ | ca | ye | pitu-bhājaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || amā | sate | vahasi | bhūri | vāmam | uṣaḥ | devi | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||6.64.6||

IAST: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīr ucchantī mānuṣīr ajīgaḥ
Griffith: SHEDDING her light on human habitations this Child of Heaven hath called us from our slumber;
Devanāgarī: एषा स्या नो दुहिता दिवोजाः क्षितीरुच्छन्ती मानुषीरजीगः
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | naḥ | duhitā | divaḥ-jāḥ | kṣitīḥ | ucchantī | mānuṣīḥ | ajīgariti || yā | bhānunā | ruśatā | rāmyāsu | ajñāyi | tiraḥ | tamasaḥ | cit | aktūn ||6.65.1||

IAST: yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsv ajñāyi tiras tamasaś cid aktūn
Griffith: She who at night-time with her argent lustre hath shown herself e'en through the shades of darkness.
Devanāgarī: या भानुना रुशता राम्यास्वज्ञायि तिरस्तमसश्चिदक्तून्
pada pāṭha: eṣā | syā | naḥ | duhitā | divaḥ-jāḥ | kṣitīḥ | ucchantī | mānuṣīḥ | ajīgariti || yā | bhānunā | ruśatā | rāmyāsu | ajñāyi | tiraḥ | tamasaḥ | cit | aktūn ||6.65.1||

IAST: vi tad yayur aruṇayugbhir aśvaiś citram bhānty uṣasaś candrarathāḥ
Griffith: All this with red-rayed steeds have they divided: the Dawns on bright cars shine in wondrous fashion.
Devanāgarī: वि तद्ययुररुणयुग्भिरश्वैश्चित्रं भान्त्युषसश्चन्द्ररथाः
pada pāṭha: vi | tat | yayuḥ | aruṇayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | citram | bhānti | uṣasaḥ | candra-rathāḥ || agram | yajñasya | br̥hataḥ | nayantīḥ | vi | tāḥ | bādhante | tamaḥ | ūrmyāyāḥ ||6.65.2||

IAST: agraṁ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīr vi tā bādhante tama ūrmyāyāḥ
Griffith: They, bringing near the stately rite's commencement, drive far away the night's surrounding shadows.
Devanāgarī: अग्रं यज्ञस्य बृहतो नयन्तीर्वि ता बाधन्ते तम ऊर्म्यायाः
pada pāṭha: vi | tat | yayuḥ | aruṇayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | citram | bhānti | uṣasaḥ | candra-rathāḥ || agram | yajñasya | br̥hataḥ | nayantīḥ | vi | tāḥ | bādhante | tamaḥ | ūrmyāyāḥ ||6.65.2||

IAST: śravo vājam iṣam ūrjaṁ vahantīr ni dāśuṣa uṣaso martyāya
Griffith: Dawns, bringing hither, to the man who worships, glory and power and might and food and vigour,
Devanāgarī: श्रवो वाजमिषमूर्जं वहन्तीर्नि दाशुष उषसो मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: śravaḥ | vājam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantīḥ | ni | dāśuṣe | uṣasaḥ | martyāya || maghonīḥ | vīra-vat | patyamānāḥ | avaḥ | dhāta | vidhate | ratnam | adya ||6.65.3||

IAST: maghonīr vīravat patyamānā avo dhāta vidhate ratnam adya
Griffith: Opulent, with imperial sway like heroes, favour your servant and this day enrich him.
Devanāgarī: मघोनीर्वीरवत्पत्यमाना अवो धात विधते रत्नमद्य
pada pāṭha: śravaḥ | vājam | iṣam | ūrjam | vahantīḥ | ni | dāśuṣe | uṣasaḥ | martyāya || maghonīḥ | vīra-vat | patyamānāḥ | avaḥ | dhāta | vidhate | ratnam | adya ||6.65.3||

IAST: idā hi vo vidhate ratnam astīdā vīrāya dāśuṣa uṣāsaḥ
Griffith: Now is there treasure for the man who serves you, now for the hero, Dawns! who brings oblation;
Devanāgarī: इदा हि वो विधते रत्नमस्तीदा वीराय दाशुष उषासः
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | vaḥ | vidhate | ratnam | asti | idā | vīrāya | dāśuṣe | uṣasaḥ || idā | viprāya | jarate | yat | ukthā | ni | sma | mā-vate | vahatha | purā | cit ||6.65.4||

IAST: idā viprāya jarate yad ukthā ni ṣma māvate vahathā purā cit
Griffith: Now for the singer when he sings the praise-song. Even to one like me ye brought aforetime.
Devanāgarī: इदा विप्राय जरते यदुक्था नि ष्म मावते वहथा पुरा चित्
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | vaḥ | vidhate | ratnam | asti | idā | vīrāya | dāśuṣe | uṣasaḥ || idā | viprāya | jarate | yat | ukthā | ni | sma | mā-vate | vahatha | purā | cit ||6.65.4||

IAST: idā hi ta uṣo adrisāno gotrā gavām aṅgiraso gṛṇanti
Griffith: O Dawn who standest on the mountain ridges, Angirases now praise thy stalls of cattle.
Devanāgarī: इदा हि त उषो अद्रिसानो गोत्रा गवामङ्गिरसो गृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | te | uṣaḥ | adrisāno ityadri-sāno | gotrā | gavām | aṅgirasaḥ | gr̥ṇanti || vi | arkeṇa | bibhiduḥ | brahmaṇā | ca | satyā | nr̥ṇām | abhavat | deva-hūtiḥ ||6.65.5||

IAST: vy arkeṇa bibhidur brahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇām abhavad devahūtiḥ
Griffith: With prayer and holy hymn they burst them open: the heroes' calling on the Gods was fruitful.
Devanāgarī: व्यर्केण बिभिदुर्ब्रह्मणा च सत्या नृणामभवद्देवहूतिः
pada pāṭha: idā | hi | te | uṣaḥ | adrisāno ityadri-sāno | gotrā | gavām | aṅgirasaḥ | gr̥ṇanti || vi | arkeṇa | bibhiduḥ | brahmaṇā | ca | satyā | nr̥ṇām | abhavat | deva-hūtiḥ ||6.65.5||

IAST: ucchā divo duhitaḥ pratnavan no bharadvājavad vidhate maghoni
Griffith: Shine on us as of old, thou Child of Heaven,on him, rich Maid! who serves like Bharadvaja.
Devanāgarī: उच्छा दिवो दुहितः प्रत्नवन्नो भरद्वाजवद्विधते मघोनि
pada pāṭha: uccha | divaḥ | duhitariti | pratna-vat | naḥ | bharadvāja-vat | vidhate | maghoni || su-vīram | rayim | gr̥ṇate | rirīhi | uru-gāyam | adhi | dhehi | śravaḥ | naḥ ||6.65.6||

IAST: suvīraṁ rayiṁ gṛṇate rirīhy urugāyam adhi dhehi śravo naḥ
Griffith: Give to the singer wealth with noble heroes, and upon us bestow wide-spreading glory.
Devanāgarī: सुवीरं रयिं गृणते रिरीह्युरुगायमधि धेहि श्रवो नः
pada pāṭha: uccha | divaḥ | duhitariti | pratna-vat | naḥ | bharadvāja-vat | vidhate | maghoni || su-vīram | rayim | gr̥ṇate | rirīhi | uru-gāyam | adhi | dhehi | śravaḥ | naḥ ||6.65.6||

IAST: vapur nu tac cikituṣe cid astu samānaṁ nāma dhenu patyamānam
Griffith: E'EN to the wise let that be still a wonder to which the general name of Cow is given.
Devanāgarī: वपुर्नु तच्चिकितुषे चिदस्तु समानं नाम धेनु पत्यमानम्
pada pāṭha: vapuḥ | nu | tat | cikituṣe | cit | astu | samānam | nāma | dhenu | patyamānam || marteṣu | anyat | dohase | pīpāya | sakr̥t | śukram | duduhe | pr̥śniḥ | ūdhaḥ ||6.66.1||

IAST: marteṣv anyad dohase pīpāya sakṛc chukraṁ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ
Griffith: The one hath swelled among mankind for milking: Prsni hath drained but once her fair bright udder.
Devanāgarī: मर्तेष्वन्यद्दोहसे पीपाय सकृच्छुक्रं दुदुहे पृश्निरूधः
pada pāṭha: vapuḥ | nu | tat | cikituṣe | cit | astu | samānam | nāma | dhenu | patyamānam || marteṣu | anyat | dohase | pīpāya | sakr̥t | śukram | duduhe | pr̥śniḥ | ūdhaḥ ||6.66.1||

IAST: ye agnayo na śośucann idhānā dvir yat trir maruto vāvṛdhanta
Griffith: They who like kindled flames of fire are glowing,. the Maruts, twice and thrice have waxen mighty.
Devanāgarī: ये अग्नयो न शोशुचन्निधाना द्विर्यत्त्रिर्मरुतो वावृधन्त
pada pāṭha: ye | agnayaḥ | na | śośucan | idhānāḥ | dviḥ | yat | triḥ | marutaḥ | vavr̥dhanta || areṇavaḥ | hiraṇyayāsaḥ | eṣām | sākam | nr̥mṇaiḥ | pauṁsyebhiḥ | ca | bhūvan ||6.66.2||

IAST: areṇavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṁ sākaṁ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṁsyebhiś ca bhūvan
Griffith: Golden and dustless were their cars, invested with their great strength and their heroic vigour.
Devanāgarī: अरेणवो हिरण्ययास एषां साकं नृम्णैः पौंस्येभिश्च भूवन्
pada pāṭha: ye | agnayaḥ | na | śośucan | idhānāḥ | dviḥ | yat | triḥ | marutaḥ | vavr̥dhanta || areṇavaḥ | hiraṇyayāsaḥ | eṣām | sākam | nr̥mṇaiḥ | pauṁsyebhiḥ | ca | bhūvan ||6.66.2||

IAST: rudrasya ye mīḻhuṣaḥ santi putrā yām̐ś co nu dādhṛvir bharadhyai
Griffith: They who are Sons of the rain-pouring Rudra, whom the long-lasting One had power to foster:
Devanāgarī: रुद्रस्य ये मीळ्हुषः सन्ति पुत्रा याँश्चो नु दाधृविर्भरध्यै
pada pāṭha: rudrasya | ye | mīḷhuṣaḥ | santi | putrāḥ | yān | co iti | nu | dādhr̥viḥ | bharadhyai || vide | hi | mātā | mahaḥ | mahī | sā | sā | it | pr̥śniḥ | su-bhve | garbham | ā | adhāt ||6.66.3||

IAST: vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve garbham ādhāt
Griffith: The Mighty Ones whose germ great Mother Prsni is known to have received for man's advantage.
Devanāgarī: विदे हि माता महो मही षा सेत्पृश्निः सुभ्वे गर्भमाधात्
pada pāṭha: rudrasya | ye | mīḷhuṣaḥ | santi | putrāḥ | yān | co iti | nu | dādhr̥viḥ | bharadhyai || vide | hi | mātā | mahaḥ | mahī | sā | sā | it | pr̥śniḥ | su-bhve | garbham | ā | adhāt ||6.66.3||

IAST: na ya īṣante januṣo 'yā nv antaḥ santo 'vadyāni punānāḥ
Griffith: They shrink not from the birth; in this same manner still resting there they purge away reproaches.
Devanāgarī: न य ईषन्ते जनुषोऽया न्वन्तः सन्तोऽवद्यानि पुनानाः
pada pāṭha: na | ye | īṣante | januṣaḥ | ayā | nu | antariti | santaḥ | avadyāni | punānāḥ || niḥ | yat | duhre | śucayaḥ | anu | joṣam | anu | śriyā | tanvam | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||6.66.4||

IAST: nir yad duhre śucayo 'nu joṣam anu śriyā tanvam ukṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: When they have streamed forth, brilliant, at their pleasure, with their own splendour they bedew their
Devanāgarī: निर्यद्दुह्रे शुचयोऽनु जोषमनु श्रिया तन्वमुक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: na | ye | īṣante | januṣaḥ | ayā | nu | antariti | santaḥ | avadyāni | punānāḥ || niḥ | yat | duhre | śucayaḥ | anu | joṣam | anu | śriyā | tanvam | ukṣamāṇāḥ ||6.66.4||

IAST: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cid ayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutaṁ dadhānāḥ
Griffith: Even those who bear the brave bold name of Maruts, whom not the active quickly wins for milking.
Devanāgarī: मक्षू न येषु दोहसे चिदया आ नाम धृष्णु मारुतं दधानाः
pada pāṭha: makṣu | na | yeṣu | dohase | cit | ayāḥ | ā | nāma | dhr̥ṣṇu | mārutam | dadhānāḥ || na | ye | staunāḥ | ayāsaḥ | mahnā | nu | cit | su-dānuḥ | ava | yāsat | ugrān ||6.66.5||

IAST: na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānur ava yāsad ugrān
Griffith: Even the liberal wards not off those fierce ones, those who are light and agile in their greatness.
Devanāgarī: न ये स्तौना अयासो मह्ना नू चित्सुदानुरव यासदुग्रान्
pada pāṭha: makṣu | na | yeṣu | dohase | cit | ayāḥ | ā | nāma | dhr̥ṣṇu | mārutam | dadhānāḥ || na | ye | staunāḥ | ayāsaḥ | mahnā | nu | cit | su-dānuḥ | ava | yāsat | ugrān ||6.66.5||

IAST: ta id ugrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke
Griffith: When, strong in strength and armed with potent weapons, they had united wellformed earth and heaven,
Devanāgarī: त इदुग्राः शवसा धृष्णुषेणा उभे युजन्त रोदसी सुमेके
pada pāṭha: te | it | ugrāḥ | śavasā | dhr̥ṣṇu-senāḥ | ubhe iti | yujanta | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || adha | sma | eṣu | rodasī | sva-śociḥ | ā | amavat-su | tasthau | na | rokaḥ ||6.66.6||

IAST: adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocir āmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ
Griffith: Rodasl stood among these furious Heroes like splendour shining with her native brightness.
Devanāgarī: अध स्मैषु रोदसी स्वशोचिरामवत्सु तस्थौ न रोकः
pada pāṭha: te | it | ugrāḥ | śavasā | dhr̥ṣṇu-senāḥ | ubhe iti | yujanta | rodasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || adha | sma | eṣu | rodasī | sva-śociḥ | ā | amavat-su | tasthau | na | rokaḥ ||6.66.6||

IAST: aneno vo maruto yāmo astv anaśvaś cid yam ajaty arathīḥ
Griffith: No team of goats shall draw your car, O Maruts, no horse no charioteer be he who drives it.
Devanāgarī: अनेनो वो मरुतो यामो अस्त्वनश्वश्चिद्यमजत्यरथीः
pada pāṭha: anenaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yāmaḥ | astu | anaśvaḥ | cit | yam | ajati | arathīḥ || anavasaḥ | anabhīśuḥ | rajaḥ-tūḥ | vi | rodasī iti | pathyāḥ | yāti | sādhan ||6.66.7||

IAST: anavaso anabhīśū rajastūr vi rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan
Griffith: Halting not, reinless, through the air it travels, speeding alone its paths through earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: अनवसो अनभीशू रजस्तूर्वि रोदसी पथ्या याति साधन्
pada pāṭha: anenaḥ | vaḥ | marutaḥ | yāmaḥ | astu | anaśvaḥ | cit | yam | ajati | arathīḥ || anavasaḥ | anabhīśuḥ | rajaḥ-tūḥ | vi | rodasī iti | pathyāḥ | yāti | sādhan ||6.66.7||

IAST: nāsya vartā na tarutā nv asti maruto yam avatha vājasātau
Griffith: None may obstruct, none overtake, O Maruts, him whom ye succour in the strife of battle
Devanāgarī: नास्य वर्ता न तरुता न्वस्ति मरुतो यमवथ वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: na | asya | vartā | na | tarutā | nu | asti | marutaḥ | yam | avatha | vāja-sātau || toke | vā | goṣu | tanaye | yam | ap-su | saḥ | vrajam | dartā | pārye | adha | dyoḥ ||6.66.8||

IAST: toke vā goṣu tanaye yam apsu sa vrajaṁ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ
Griffith: For sons and progeny, for kine and waters: he bursts the cow-stall on the day of trial.
Devanāgarī: तोके वा गोषु तनये यमप्सु स व्रजं दर्ता पार्ये अध द्योः
pada pāṭha: na | asya | vartā | na | tarutā | nu | asti | marutaḥ | yam | avatha | vāja-sātau || toke | vā | goṣu | tanaye | yam | ap-su | saḥ | vrajam | dartā | pārye | adha | dyoḥ ||6.66.8||

IAST: pra citram arkaṁ gṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam
Griffith: Bring a bright hymn to praise the band of Maruts, the Singers, rapid, strong in native vigour,
Devanāgarī: प्र चित्रमर्कं गृणते तुराय मारुताय स्वतवसे भरध्वम्
pada pāṭha: pra | citram | arkam | gr̥ṇate | turāya | mārutāya | sva-tavase | bharadhvam || ye | sahāṁsi | sahasā | sahante | rejate | agne | pr̥thivī | makhebhyaḥ ||6.66.9||

IAST: ye sahāṁsi sahasā sahante rejate agne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ
Griffith: Who conquer mighty strength with strength more mighty: earth shakes in terror at their wars, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: ये सहांसि सहसा सहन्ते रेजते अग्ने पृथिवी मखेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: pra | citram | arkam | gr̥ṇate | turāya | mārutāya | sva-tavase | bharadhvam || ye | sahāṁsi | sahasā | sahante | rejate | agne | pr̥thivī | makhebhyaḥ ||6.66.9||

IAST: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāgneḥ
Griffith: Bright like the flashing flames of sacrifices, like tongues of fire impetuous in their onset,
Devanāgarī: त्विषीमन्तो अध्वरस्येव दिद्युत्तृषुच्यवसो जुह्वो नाग्नेः
pada pāṭha: tviṣi-mantaḥ | adhvarasya-iva | didyut | tr̥ṣu-cyavasaḥ | juhvaḥ | na | agneḥ || arcatrayaḥ | dhunayaḥ | na | vīrāḥ | bhrājat-janmānaḥ | marutaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ ||6.66.10||

IAST: arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ
Griffith: Chanting their psalm, singing aloud, like heroes, splendid from birth, invincible, the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: अर्चत्रयो धुनयो न वीरा भ्राजज्जन्मानो मरुतो अधृष्टाः
pada pāṭha: tviṣi-mantaḥ | adhvarasya-iva | didyut | tr̥ṣu-cyavasaḥ | juhvaḥ | na | agneḥ || arcatrayaḥ | dhunayaḥ | na | vīrāḥ | bhrājat-janmānaḥ | marutaḥ | adhr̥ṣṭāḥ ||6.66.10||

IAST: taṁ vṛdhantam mārutam bhrājadṛṣṭiṁ rudrasya sūnuṁ havasā vivāse
Griffith: That swelling band I call with invocation, the brood of Rudra, armed with glittering lances.
Devanāgarī: तं वृधन्तं मारुतं भ्राजदृष्टिं रुद्रस्य सूनुं हवसा विवासे
pada pāṭha: tam | vr̥dhantam | mārutam | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭim | rudrasya | sūnum | havasā | ā | vivāse || divaḥ | śardhāya | śucayaḥ | manīṣāḥ | girayaḥ | na | āpaḥ | ugrāḥ | aspr̥dhran ||6.66.11||

IAST: divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā girayo nāpa ugrā aspṛdhran
Griffith: Pure hymns are meet for that celestial army: like floods and mountains have the Strong Ones battled.
Devanāgarī: दिवः शर्धाय शुचयो मनीषा गिरयो नाप उग्रा अस्पृध्रन्
pada pāṭha: tam | vr̥dhantam | mārutam | bhrājat-r̥ṣṭim | rudrasya | sūnum | havasā | ā | vivāse || divaḥ | śardhāya | śucayaḥ | manīṣāḥ | girayaḥ | na | āpaḥ | ugrāḥ | aspr̥dhran ||6.66.11||

IAST: viśveṣāṁ vaḥ satāṁ jyeṣṭhatamā gīrbhir mitrāvaruṇā vāvṛdhadhyai
Griffith: NOW Mitra-Varuna shall be exalted high by your songs, noblest of all existing;
Devanāgarī: विश्वेषां वः सतां ज्येष्ठतमा गीर्भिर्मित्रावरुणा वावृधध्यै
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | vaḥ | satām | jyeṣṭha-tamā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vavr̥dhadhyai || sam | yā | raśmā-iva | yamatuḥ | yamiṣṭhā | dvā | janān | asamā | bāhu-bhiḥ | svaiḥ ||6.67.1||

IAST: saṁ yā raśmeva yamatur yamiṣṭhā dvā janām̐ asamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ
Griffith: They who, as 'twere with reins are best Controllers, unequalled with their arms to check the people.
Devanāgarī: सं या रश्मेव यमतुर्यमिष्ठा द्वा जनाँ असमा बाहुभिः स्वैः
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | vaḥ | satām | jyeṣṭha-tamā | gīḥ-bhiḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | vavr̥dhadhyai || sam | yā | raśmā-iva | yamatuḥ | yamiṣṭhā | dvā | janān | asamā | bāhu-bhiḥ | svaiḥ ||6.67.1||

IAST: iyam mad vām pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhir accha
Griffith: To you Two Gods is this my thought extended, turned to the sacred grass with loving homage.
Devanāgarī: इयं मद्वां प्र स्तृणीते मनीषोप प्रिया नमसा बर्हिरच्छ
pada pāṭha: iyam | mat | vām | pra | str̥ṇīte | manīṣā | upa | priyā | namasā | barhiḥ | accha || yantam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | adhr̥ṣṭam | chardiḥ | yat | vām | varūthyam | sudānū iti su-dānū ||6.67.2||

IAST: yantaṁ no mitrāvaruṇāv adhṛṣṭaṁ chardir yad vāṁ varūthyaṁ sudānū
Griffith: Give us, O Mitra-Varuna, a dwelling safe from attack, which ye shall guard, Boon-Givers!
Devanāgarī: यन्तं नो मित्रावरुणावधृष्टं छर्दिर्यद्वां वरूथ्यं सुदानू
pada pāṭha: iyam | mat | vām | pra | str̥ṇīte | manīṣā | upa | priyā | namasā | barhiḥ | accha || yantam | naḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | adhr̥ṣṭam | chardiḥ | yat | vām | varūthyam | sudānū iti su-dānū ||6.67.2||

IAST: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā suśasty upa priyā namasā hūyamānā
Griffith: Come hither, Mitra-Varuna, invited with eulogies and loving adoration,
Devanāgarī: आ यातं मित्रावरुणा सुशस्त्युप प्रिया नमसा हूयमाना
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | mitrāvaruṇā | su-śasti | upa | priyā | namasā | hūyamānā || sam | yau | apnaḥ-sthaḥ | apasā-iva | janān | śrudhi-yataḥ | cit | yatathaḥ | mahi-tvā ||6.67.3||

IAST: saṁ yāv apnaḥstho apaseva janāñ chrudhīyataś cid yatatho mahitvā
Griffith: Ye who with your might, as Work-Controllers, urge even men who quickly hear to labour.
Devanāgarī: सं यावप्नःस्थो अपसेव जनाञ्छ्रुधीयतश्चिद्यतथो महित्वा
pada pāṭha: ā | yātam | mitrāvaruṇā | su-śasti | upa | priyā | namasā | hūyamānā || sam | yau | apnaḥ-sthaḥ | apasā-iva | janān | śrudhi-yataḥ | cit | yatathaḥ | mahi-tvā ||6.67.3||

IAST: aśvā na yā vājinā pūtabandhū ṛtā yad garbham aditir bharadhyai
Griffith: Whom, of pure origin, like two strong horses, Aditi bore as babes in proper season,
Devanāgarī: अश्वा न या वाजिना पूतबन्धू ऋता यद्गर्भमदितिर्भरध्यै
pada pāṭha: aśvā | na | yā | vājinā | pūtabandhū iti pūta-bandhū | r̥tā | yat | garbham | aditiḥ | bharadhyai || pra | yā | mahi | mahāntā | jāyamānā | ghorā | martāya | ripave | ni | dīdhariti dīdhaḥ ||6.67.4||

IAST: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāya ripave ni dīdhaḥ
Griffith: Whom, Mighty at your birth, the Mighty Goddess brought forth as terrors to the mortal foeman.
Devanāgarī: प्र या महि महान्ता जायमाना घोरा मर्ताय रिपवे नि दीधः
pada pāṭha: aśvā | na | yā | vājinā | pūtabandhū iti pūta-bandhū | r̥tā | yat | garbham | aditiḥ | bharadhyai || pra | yā | mahi | mahāntā | jāyamānā | ghorā | martāya | ripave | ni | dīdhariti dīdhaḥ ||6.67.4||

IAST: viśve yad vām maṁhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatraṁ devāso adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: As all the Gods in their great joy and gladness gave you with one accord your high dominion,
Devanāgarī: विश्वे यद्वां मंहना मन्दमानाः क्षत्रं देवासो अदधुः सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: viśve | yat | vām | maṁhanā | mandamānāḥ | kṣatram | devāsaḥ | adadhuḥ | sa-joṣāḥ || pari | yat | bhūthaḥ | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | santi | spaśaḥ | adabdhāsaḥ | amūrāḥ ||6.67.5||

IAST: pari yad bhūtho rodasī cid urvī santi spaśo adabdhāso amūrāḥ
Griffith: As ye surround both worlds, though wide and spacious your spies are ever true and never bewildered.
Devanāgarī: परि यद्भूथो रोदसी चिदुर्वी सन्ति स्पशो अदब्धासो अमूराः
pada pāṭha: viśve | yat | vām | maṁhanā | mandamānāḥ | kṣatram | devāsaḥ | adadhuḥ | sa-joṣāḥ || pari | yat | bhūthaḥ | rodasī iti | cit | urvī iti | santi | spaśaḥ | adabdhāsaḥ | amūrāḥ ||6.67.5||

IAST: tā hi kṣatraṁ dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṁhethe sānum upamād iva dyoḥ
Griffith: So, through the days maintaining princely power. ye prop the height as 'twere from loftiest heaven.
Devanāgarī: ता हि क्षत्रं धारयेथे अनु द्यून्दृंहेथे सानुमुपमादिव द्योः
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | kṣatram | dhārayethe iti | anu | dyūn | dr̥ṁhethe iti | sānum | upamāt-iva | dyoḥ || dr̥ḷhaḥ | nakṣatraḥ | uta | viśva-devaḥ | bhūmim | ā | atān | dyām | dhāsinā | āyoḥ ||6.67.6||

IAST: dṛḻho nakṣatra uta viśvadevo bhūmim ātān dyāṁ dhāsināyoḥ
Griffith: The Star of all the Gods, established, filleth the heaven and earth with food of man who liveth.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हो नक्षत्र उत विश्वदेवो भूमिमातान्द्यां धासिनायोः
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | kṣatram | dhārayethe iti | anu | dyūn | dr̥ṁhethe iti | sānum | upamāt-iva | dyoḥ || dr̥ḷhaḥ | nakṣatraḥ | uta | viśva-devaḥ | bhūmim | ā | atān | dyām | dhāsinā | āyoḥ ||6.67.6||

IAST: tā vigraṁ dhaithe jaṭharam pṛṇadhyā ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti
Griffith: Take the strong drink, to quaff till ye are sated, when he and his attendants fill the chamber.
Devanāgarī: ता विग्रं धैथे जठरं पृणध्या आ यत्सद्म सभृतयः पृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: tā | vigram | dhaithe iti | jaṭharam | pr̥ṇadhyai | ā | yat | sadma | sa-bhr̥tayaḥ | pr̥ṇanti || na | mr̥ṣyante | yuvatayaḥ | avātāḥ | vi | yat | payaḥ | viśva-jinvā | bharante ||6.67.7||

IAST: na mṛṣyante yuvatayo 'vātā vi yat payo viśvajinvā bharante
Griffith: The young Maids brook not that none seeks to win them, when, Quickeners of all! they scatter moisture.
Devanāgarī: न मृष्यन्ते युवतयोऽवाता वि यत्पयो विश्वजिन्वा भरन्ते
pada pāṭha: tā | vigram | dhaithe iti | jaṭharam | pr̥ṇadhyai | ā | yat | sadma | sa-bhr̥tayaḥ | pr̥ṇanti || na | mr̥ṣyante | yuvatayaḥ | avātāḥ | vi | yat | payaḥ | viśva-jinvā | bharante ||6.67.7||

IAST: tā jihvayā sadam edaṁ sumedhā ā yad vāṁ satyo aratir ṛte bhūt
Griffith: So with your tongue come ever, when your envoy, faithful and very wise, attends our worship.
Devanāgarī: ता जिह्वया सदमेदं सुमेधा आ यद्वां सत्यो अरतिरृते भूत्
pada pāṭha: tā | jihvayā | sadam | ā | idam | su-medhāḥ | ā | yat | vām | satyaḥ | aratiḥ | r̥te | bhūt || tat | vām | mahi-tvam | ghr̥ta-annau | astu | yuvam | dāśuṣe | vi | cayiṣṭam | aṁhaḥ ||6.67.8||

IAST: tad vām mahitvaṁ ghṛtānnāv astu yuvaṁ dāśuṣe vi cayiṣṭam aṁhaḥ
Griffith: Nourished by holy oil! he this yGur glory: annihilate the sacrificer's trouble.
Devanāgarī: तद्वां महित्वं घृतान्नावस्तु युवं दाशुषे वि चयिष्टमंहः
pada pāṭha: tā | jihvayā | sadam | ā | idam | su-medhāḥ | ā | yat | vām | satyaḥ | aratiḥ | r̥te | bhūt || tat | vām | mahi-tvam | ghr̥ta-annau | astu | yuvam | dāśuṣe | vi | cayiṣṭam | aṁhaḥ ||6.67.8||

IAST: pra yad vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti
Griffith: When, Mitra-Varuna, they strive against you and break the friendly laws ye have established,
Devanāgarī: प्र यद्वां मित्रावरुणा स्पूर्धन्प्रिया धाम युवधिता मिनन्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | yat | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | spūrdhan | priyā | dhāma | yuva-dhitā | minanti || na | ye | devāsaḥ | ohasā | na | martāḥ | ayajña-sācaḥ | apyaḥ | na | putrāḥ ||6.67.9||

IAST: na ye devāsa ohasā na martā ayajñasāco apyo na putrāḥ
Griffith: They, neither Gods nor men in estimation, like Api's sons have godless sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: न ये देवास ओहसा न मर्ता अयज्ञसाचो अप्यो न पुत्राः
pada pāṭha: pra | yat | vām | mitrāvaruṇā | spūrdhan | priyā | dhāma | yuva-dhitā | minanti || na | ye | devāsaḥ | ohasā | na | martāḥ | ayajña-sācaḥ | apyaḥ | na | putrāḥ ||6.67.9||

IAST: vi yad vācaṁ kīstāso bharante śaṁsanti ke cin nivido manānāḥ
Griffith: When singers in their song uplift their voices, some chant the Nivid texts with steady purpose.
Devanāgarī: वि यद्वाचं कीस्तासो भरन्ते शंसन्ति के चिन्निविदो मनानाः
pada pāṭha: vi | yat | vācam | kīstāsaḥ | bharante | śaṁsanti | ke | cit | ni-vidaḥ | manānāḥ || āt | vām | bravāma | satyāni | ukthā | nakiḥ | devebhiḥ | yatathaḥ | mahi-tvā ||6.67.10||

IAST: ād vām bravāma satyāny ukthā nakir devebhir yatatho mahitvā
Griffith: Then may we sing you lauds that shall be fruitful: dp ye not rival all the Gods in greatness?
Devanāgarī: आद्वां ब्रवाम सत्यान्युक्था नकिर्देवेभिर्यतथो महित्वा
pada pāṭha: vi | yat | vācam | kīstāsaḥ | bharante | śaṁsanti | ke | cit | ni-vidaḥ | manānāḥ || āt | vām | bravāma | satyāni | ukthā | nakiḥ | devebhiḥ | yatathaḥ | mahi-tvā ||6.67.10||

IAST: avor itthā vāṁ chardiṣo abhiṣṭau yuvor mitrāvaruṇāv askṛdhoyu
Griffith: O Mitra-Varuna, may your large bounty come to us hither, near to this our dwelling,
Devanāgarī: अवोरित्था वां छर्दिषो अभिष्टौ युवोर्मित्रावरुणावस्कृधोयु
pada pāṭha: avoḥ | itthā | vām | chardiṣaḥ | abhiṣṭau | yuvoḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | askr̥dhoyu || anu | yat | gāvaḥ | sphurān | r̥jipyam | dhr̥ṣṇum | yat | raṇe | vr̥ṣaṇam | yunajan ||6.67.11||

IAST: anu yad gāvaḥ sphurān ṛjipyaṁ dhṛṣṇuṁ yad raṇe vṛṣaṇaṁ yunajan
Griffith: When the kine haste to us, and when they harness the fleet-foot mettled stallion for the battle.
Devanāgarī: अनु यद्गावः स्फुरानृजिप्यं धृष्णुं यद्रणे वृषणं युनजन्
pada pāṭha: avoḥ | itthā | vām | chardiṣaḥ | abhiṣṭau | yuvoḥ | mitrāvaruṇau | askr̥dhoyu || anu | yat | gāvaḥ | sphurān | r̥jipyam | dhr̥ṣṇum | yat | raṇe | vr̥ṣaṇam | yunajan ||6.67.11||

IAST: śruṣṭī vāṁ yajña udyataḥ sajoṣā manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣo yajadhyai
Griffith: HIS honouring rite whose grass is trimmed is offered swiftly to you, in Manu's wise, accordant,
Devanāgarī: श्रुष्टी वां यज्ञ उद्यतः सजोषा मनुष्वद्वृक्तबर्हिषो यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: śruṣṭī | vām | yajñaḥ | ut-yataḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | manuṣvat | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | yajadhyai || ā | yaḥ | indrāvaruṇau | iṣe | adya | mahe | sumnāya | mahe | ā-vavartat ||6.68.1||

IAST: ā ya indrāvaruṇāv iṣe adya mahe sumnāya maha āvavartat
Griffith: The rite which Indra-Varuna shall carry this day to high success and glorious issue.
Devanāgarī: आ य इन्द्रावरुणाविषे अद्य महे सुम्नाय मह आववर्तत्
pada pāṭha: śruṣṭī | vām | yajñaḥ | ut-yataḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | manuṣvat | vr̥kta-barhiṣaḥ | yajadhyai || ā | yaḥ | indrāvaruṇau | iṣe | adya | mahe | sumnāya | mahe | ā-vavartat ||6.68.1||

IAST: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṁ śaviṣṭhā tā hi bhūtam
Griffith: For at Gods' worship they are best through vigour; they have become the strongest of the Heroes;
Devanāgarī: ता हि श्रेष्ठा देवताता तुजा शूराणां शविष्ठा ता हि भूतम्
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śreṣṭhā | deva-tātā | tujā | śūrāṇām | śaviṣṭhā | tā | hi | bhūtam || maghonām | maṁhiṣṭhā | tuvi-śuṣmā | r̥tena | vr̥tra-turā | sarva-senā ||6.68.2||

IAST: maghonām maṁhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarvasenā
Griffith: With mighty strength, most liberal of the Princes, Chiefs of the host, by Law made Vrtra's slayers.
Devanāgarī: मघोनां मंहिष्ठा तुविशुष्म ऋतेन वृत्रतुरा सर्वसेना
pada pāṭha: tā | hi | śreṣṭhā | deva-tātā | tujā | śūrāṇām | śaviṣṭhā | tā | hi | bhūtam || maghonām | maṁhiṣṭhā | tuvi-śuṣmā | r̥tena | vr̥tra-turā | sarva-senā ||6.68.2||

IAST: tā gṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhir indrāvaruṇā cakānā
Griffith: Praise those Twain Gods for powers that merit worship, Indra and Varuna, for bliss, the joyous.
Devanāgarī: ता गृणीहि नमस्येभिः शूषैः सुम्नेभिरिन्द्रावरुणा चकाना
pada pāṭha: tā | gr̥ṇīhi | namasyebhiḥ | śūṣaiḥ | sumnebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | cakānā || vajreṇa | anyaḥ | śavasā | hanti | vr̥tram | sisakti | anyaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | vipraḥ ||6.68.3||

IAST: vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṁ siṣakty anyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ
Griffith: One with his might and thunderbolt slays Vrtra; the other as a Sage stands near in troubles.
Devanāgarī: वज्रेणान्यः शवसा हन्ति वृत्रं सिषक्त्यन्यो वृजनेषु विप्रः
pada pāṭha: tā | gr̥ṇīhi | namasyebhiḥ | śūṣaiḥ | sumnebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | cakānā || vajreṇa | anyaḥ | śavasā | hanti | vr̥tram | sisakti | anyaḥ | vr̥janeṣu | vipraḥ ||6.68.3||

IAST: gnāś ca yan naraś ca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṁ svagūrtāḥ
Griffith: Though dames and men have waxen strong and mighty, and all the Gods selfpraised among the Heroes,
Devanāgarī: ग्नाश्च यन्नरश्च वावृधन्त विश्वे देवासो नरां स्वगूर्ताः
pada pāṭha: gnāḥ | ca | yat | naraḥ | ca | vavr̥dhanta | viśve | devāsaḥ | narām | sva-gūrtāḥ || pra | ebhyaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | mahi-tvā | dyauḥ | ca | pr̥thivi | bhūtam | urvī iti ||6.68.4||

IAST: praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauś ca pṛthivi bhūtam urvī
Griffith: Ye, Indra-Varuna, have in might surpassed them, and thus were ye spread wide, O Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: प्रैभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा महित्वा द्यौश्च पृथिवि भूतमुर्वी
pada pāṭha: gnāḥ | ca | yat | naraḥ | ca | vavr̥dhanta | viśve | devāsaḥ | narām | sva-gūrtāḥ || pra | ebhyaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | mahi-tvā | dyauḥ | ca | pr̥thivi | bhūtam | urvī iti ||6.68.4||

IAST: sa it sudānuḥ svavām̐ ṛtāvendrā yo vāṁ varuṇa dāśati tman
Griffith: Righteous is he, and liberal and helpful who, Indra-Varuna, brings you gifts with gladness.
Devanāgarī: स इत्सुदानुः स्ववाँ ऋतावेन्द्रा यो वां वरुण दाशति त्मन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | su-dānuḥ | sva-vān | r̥ta-vā | indrā | yaḥ | vām | varuṇā | dāśati | tman || iṣā | saḥ | dviṣaḥ | taret | dāsvān | vaṁsat | rayim | rayi-vataḥ | ca | janān ||6.68.5||

IAST: iṣā sa dviṣas tared dāsvān vaṁsad rayiṁ rayivataś ca janān
Griffith: That bounteous man through food shall conquer faemen, and win him opulence and wealthy people.
Devanāgarī: इषा स द्विषस्तरेद्दास्वान्वंसद्रयिं रयिवतश्च जनान्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | su-dānuḥ | sva-vān | r̥ta-vā | indrā | yaḥ | vām | varuṇā | dāśati | tman || iṣā | saḥ | dviṣaḥ | taret | dāsvān | vaṁsat | rayim | rayi-vataḥ | ca | janān ||6.68.5||

IAST: yaṁ yuvaṁ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṁ dhattho vasumantam purukṣum
Griffith: May wealth which ye bestow in food and treasure on him who brings you gifts and sacrifices,
Devanāgarī: यं युवं दाश्वध्वराय देवा रयिं धत्थो वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम्
pada pāṭha: yam | yuvam | dāśu-adhvarāya | devā | rayim | dhatthaḥ | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || asme iti | saḥ | indrāvaruṇau | api | syāt | pra | yaḥ | bhanakti | vanuṣām | aśastīḥ ||6.68.6||

IAST: asme sa indrāvaruṇāv api ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣām aśastīḥ
Griffith: Wealth, Gods! which breaks the curse of those who vex us, be, Indra-Varuna, e'en our own possession.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे स इन्द्रावरुणावपि ष्यात्प्र यो भनक्ति वनुषामशस्तीः
pada pāṭha: yam | yuvam | dāśu-adhvarāya | devā | rayim | dhatthaḥ | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || asme iti | saḥ | indrāvaruṇau | api | syāt | pra | yaḥ | bhanakti | vanuṣām | aśastīḥ ||6.68.6||

IAST: uta naḥ sutrātro devagopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt
Griffith: So also, Indra-Varuna, may our princes have riches swift to save, with Gods to guard them-
Devanāgarī: उत नः सुत्रात्रो देवगोपाः सूरिभ्य इन्द्रावरुणा रयिः ष्यात्
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | su-trātraḥ | deva-gopāḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | rayiḥ | syāt || yeṣām | śuṣmaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sahvān | pra | sadyaḥ | dyumnā | tirate | taturiḥ ||6.68.7||

IAST: yeṣāṁ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnā tirate taturiḥ
Griffith: They whose great might gives victory in battles, and their triumphant glory spreads with swiftness.
Devanāgarī: येषां शुष्मः पृतनासु साह्वान्प्र सद्यो द्युम्ना तिरते ततुरिः
pada pāṭha: uta | naḥ | su-trātraḥ | deva-gopāḥ | sūri-bhyaḥ | indrāvaruṇā | rayiḥ | syāt || yeṣām | śuṣmaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | sahvān | pra | sadyaḥ | dyumnā | tirate | taturiḥ ||6.68.7||

IAST: nū na indrāvaruṇā gṛṇānā pṛṅktaṁ rayiṁ sauśravasāya devā
Griffith: Indra. and Varuna, Gods whom we are lauding, mingle ye wealth with our heroic glory.
Devanāgarī: नू न इन्द्रावरुणा गृणाना पृङ्क्तं रयिं सौश्रवसाय देवा
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | gr̥ṇānā | pr̥ṅktam | rayim | sauśravasāya | devā || itthā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | mahinasya | śardhaḥ | apaḥ | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | tarema ||6.68.8||

IAST: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śardho 'po na nāvā duritā tarema
Griffith: May we, who praise the strength of what is mighty, pass dangers, as with boats we cross the waters.
Devanāgarī: इत्था गृणन्तो महिनस्य शर्धोऽपो न नावा दुरिता तरेम
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | indrāvaruṇā | gr̥ṇānā | pr̥ṅktam | rayim | sauśravasāya | devā || itthā | gr̥ṇantaḥ | mahinasya | śardhaḥ | apaḥ | na | nāvā | duḥ-itā | tarema ||6.68.8||

IAST: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyam arca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ
Griffith: Now will I sing a dear and far-extending hymn to Varuna the God, sublime, imperial Lord,
Devanāgarī: प्र सम्राजे बृहते मन्म नु प्रियमर्च देवाय वरुणाय सप्रथः
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rāje | br̥hate | manma | nu | priyam | arca | devāya | varuṇāya | sa-prathaḥ || ayam | yaḥ | urvī iti | mahinā | mahi-vrataḥ | kratvā | vi-bhāti | ajaraḥ | na | śociṣā ||6.68.9||

IAST: ayaṁ ya urvī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhāty ajaro na śociṣā
Griffith: Who, mighty Governor, Eternal, as with flame, illumines both wide worlds with majesty and power.
Devanāgarī: अयं य उर्वी महिना महिव्रतः क्रत्वा विभात्यजरो न शोचिषा
pada pāṭha: pra | sam-rāje | br̥hate | manma | nu | priyam | arca | devāya | varuṇāya | sa-prathaḥ || ayam | yaḥ | urvī iti | mahinā | mahi-vrataḥ | kratvā | vi-bhāti | ajaraḥ | na | śociṣā ||6.68.9||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā sutapāv imaṁ sutaṁ somam pibatam madyaṁ dhṛtavratā
Griffith: True to Law, Indra-Varuna, drinkers of the juice, drink this pressed Soma which shall give you rapturous
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा सुतपाविमं सुतं सोमं पिबतं मद्यं धृतव्रता
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | suta-pau | imam | sutam | somam | pibatam | madyam | dhr̥ta-vratā || yuvoḥ | rathaḥ | adhvaram | deva-vītaye | prati | svasaram | upa | yāti | pītaye ||6.68.10||

IAST: yuvo ratho adhvaraṁ devavītaye prati svasaram upa yāti pītaye
Griffith: Your chariot cometh to the banquet of the Gods, to sacrifice, as it were home, that ye may drink.
Devanāgarī: युवो रथो अध्वरं देववीतये प्रति स्वसरमुप याति पीतये
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | suta-pau | imam | sutam | somam | pibatam | madyam | dhr̥ta-vratā || yuvoḥ | rathaḥ | adhvaram | deva-vītaye | prati | svasaram | upa | yāti | pītaye ||6.68.10||

IAST: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
Griffith: Indra and Varuna, drink your fill, ye Heroes, of this invigorating sweetest Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रावरुणा मधुमत्तमस्य वृष्णः सोमस्य वृषणा वृषेथाम्
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | madhumat-tamasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | somasya | vr̥ṣaṇā | ā | vr̥ṣethām || idam | vām | andhaḥ | pari-siktam | asme iti | ā-sadya | asmin | barhiṣi | mādayethām ||6.68.11||

IAST: idaṁ vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam asme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām
Griffith: This juice is shed by us that ye may quaff it: on this trimmed grass be seated, and rejoice you
Devanāgarī: इदं वामन्धः परिषिक्तमस्मे आसद्यास्मिन्बर्हिषि मादयेथाम्
pada pāṭha: indrāvaruṇā | madhumat-tamasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | somasya | vr̥ṣaṇā | ā | vr̥ṣethām || idam | vām | andhaḥ | pari-siktam | asme iti | ā-sadya | asmin | barhiṣi | mādayethām ||6.68.11||

IAST: saṁ vāṁ karmaṇā sam iṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pāre asya
Griffith: INDRA and Visnu, at my task's completion I urge you on with food and sacred service.
Devanāgarī: सं वां कर्मणा समिषा हिनोमीन्द्राविष्णू अपसस्पारे अस्य
pada pāṭha: sam | vām | karmaṇā | sam | iṣā | hinomi | indrāviṣṇū iti | apasaḥ | pāre | asya || juṣethām | yajñam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam | ariṣṭaiḥ | naḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | pārayantā ||6.69.1||

IAST: juṣethāṁ yajñaṁ draviṇaṁ ca dhattam ariṣṭair naḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā
Griffith: Accept the sacrifice and grant us riches, leading us on by unobstructed pathways.
Devanāgarī: जुषेथां यज्ञं द्रविणं च धत्तमरिष्टैर्नः पथिभिः पारयन्ता
pada pāṭha: sam | vām | karmaṇā | sam | iṣā | hinomi | indrāviṣṇū iti | apasaḥ | pāre | asya || juṣethām | yajñam | draviṇam | ca | dhattam | ariṣṭaiḥ | naḥ | pathi-bhiḥ | pārayantā ||6.69.1||

IAST: yā viśvāsāṁ janitārā matīnām indrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā
Griffith: Ye who inspire all hymns, Indra and Visnu, ye vessels who contain the Soma juices,
Devanāgarī: या विश्वासां जनितारा मतीनामिन्द्राविष्णू कलशा सोमधाना
pada pāṭha: yā | viśvāsām | janitārā | matīnām | indrāviṣṇū iti | kalaśā | soma-dhānā || pra | vām | giraḥ | śasyamānāḥ | avantu | pra | stomāsaḥ | gīyamānāsaḥ | arkaiḥ ||6.69.2||

IAST: pra vāṁ giraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso gīyamānāso arkaiḥ
Griffith: May hymns of praise that now are sung address you, the lauds that are recited by the singers.
Devanāgarī: प्र वां गिरः शस्यमाना अवन्तु प्र स्तोमासो गीयमानासो अर्कैः
pada pāṭha: yā | viśvāsām | janitārā | matīnām | indrāviṣṇū iti | kalaśā | soma-dhānā || pra | vām | giraḥ | śasyamānāḥ | avantu | pra | stomāsaḥ | gīyamānāsaḥ | arkaiḥ ||6.69.2||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānām ā somaṁ yātaṁ draviṇo dadhānā
Griffith: Lords of joy-giving draughts, Indra and Visnu, come, giving gifts of treasure, to the Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू मदपती मदानामा सोमं यातं द्रविणो दधाना
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | madapatī iti mada-patī | madānām | ā | somam | yātam | draviṇo iti | dadhānā || sam | vām | añjantu | aktu-bhiḥ | matīnām | sam | stomāsaḥ | śasyamānāsaḥ | ukthaiḥ ||6.69.3||

IAST: saṁ vām añjantv aktubhir matīnāṁ saṁ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ
Griffith: With brilliant rays of hymns let chanted praises, repeated with the lauds, adorn and deck you.
Devanāgarī: सं वामञ्जन्त्वक्तुभिर्मतीनां सं स्तोमासः शस्यमानास उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | madapatī iti mada-patī | madānām | ā | somam | yātam | draviṇo iti | dadhānā || sam | vām | añjantu | aktu-bhiḥ | matīnām | sam | stomāsaḥ | śasyamānāsaḥ | ukthaiḥ ||6.69.3||

IAST: ā vām aśvāso abhimātiṣāha indrāviṣṇū sadhamādo vahantu
Griffith: May your foe-conquering horses bring you hither, Indra and Visnu, sharers of the banquet.
Devanāgarī: आ वामश्वासो अभिमातिषाह इन्द्राविष्णू सधमादो वहन्तु
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | aśvāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ | indrāviṣṇū iti | sadha-mādaḥ | vahantu || juṣethām | viśvā | havanā | matīnām | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇutam | giraḥ | me ||6.69.4||

IAST: juṣethāṁ viśvā havanā matīnām upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṁ giro me
Griffith: Of all our hymns accept the invocations list to my prayers and hear the songs I sing you.
Devanāgarī: जुषेथां विश्वा हवना मतीनामुप ब्रह्माणि शृणुतं गिरो मे
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | aśvāsaḥ | abhimāti-sahaḥ | indrāviṣṇū iti | sadha-mādaḥ | vahantu || juṣethām | viśvā | havanā | matīnām | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇutam | giraḥ | me ||6.69.4||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyaṁ vāṁ somasya mada uru cakramāthe
Griffith: This your deed, Indra-Visnu, must be lauded: widely ye strode in the wild joy of Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू तत्पनयाय्यं वां सोमस्य मद उरु चक्रमाथे
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | tat | panayāyyam | vām | somasya | made | uru | cakramāthe iti || akr̥ṇutam | antarikṣam | varīyaḥ | aprathatam | jīvase | naḥ | rajāṁsi ||6.69.5||

IAST: akṛṇutam antarikṣaṁ varīyo 'prathataṁ jīvase no rajāṁsi
Griffith: Ye made the firmament of larger compass, and made the regions broad for our existence.
Devanāgarī: अकृणुतमन्तरिक्षं वरीयोऽप्रथतं जीवसे नो रजांसि
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | tat | panayāyyam | vām | somasya | made | uru | cakramāthe iti || akr̥ṇutam | antarikṣam | varīyaḥ | aprathatam | jīvase | naḥ | rajāṁsi ||6.69.5||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānāgrādvānā namasā rātahavyā
Griffith: Strengthened with sacred offerings, IndraVisnu, first eaters, served with worship ana oblation,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू हविषा वावृधानाग्राद्वाना नमसा रातहव्या
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | haviṣā | vavr̥dhānā | agra-advānā | namasā | rāta-havyā || ghr̥tāsutī iti ghr̥ta-āsutī | draviṇam | dhattam | asme iti | samudraḥ | sthaḥ | kalaśaḥ | soma-dhānaḥ ||6.69.6||

IAST: ghṛtāsutī draviṇaṁ dhattam asme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ somadhānaḥ
Griffith: Fed with the holy oil, vouchsafe us riches ye are the lake, the vat that holds the Soma.
Devanāgarī: घृतासुती द्रविणं धत्तमस्मे समुद्रः स्थः कलशः सोमधानः
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | haviṣā | vavr̥dhānā | agra-advānā | namasā | rāta-havyā || ghr̥tāsutī iti ghr̥ta-āsutī | draviṇam | dhattam | asme iti | samudraḥ | sthaḥ | kalaśaḥ | soma-dhānaḥ ||6.69.6||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū pibatam madhvo asya somasya dasrā jaṭharam pṛṇethām
Griffith: Drink of this meath, O Indra, thou, and Visnu; drink ye your fill of Soma, Wonder-Workers.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू पिबतं मध्वो अस्य सोमस्य दस्रा जठरं पृणेथाम्
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | pibatam | madhvaḥ | asya | somasya | dasrā | jaṭharam | pr̥ṇethām || ā | vām | andhāṁsi | madirāṇi | agman | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇutam | havam | me ||6.69.7||

IAST: ā vām andhāṁsi madirāṇy agmann upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṁ havam me
Griffith: The sweet exhilarating juice hath reached you. Hear ye my prayers, give ear unto my calling.
Devanāgarī: आ वामन्धांसि मदिराण्यग्मन्नुप ब्रह्माणि शृणुतं हवं मे
pada pāṭha: indrāviṣṇū iti | pibatam | madhvaḥ | asya | somasya | dasrā | jaṭharam | pr̥ṇethām || ā | vām | andhāṁsi | madirāṇi | agman | upa | brahmāṇi | śr̥ṇutam | havam | me ||6.69.7||

IAST: ubhā jigyathur na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraś canainoḥ
Griffith: Ye Twain have conquered, ne'er have yc been conquered: never hath either of the Twain been vanquished.
Devanāgarī: उभा जिग्यथुर्न परा जयेथे न परा जिग्ये कतरश्चनैनोः
pada pāṭha: ubhā | jigyathuḥ | na | parā | jayethe iti | na | parā | jigye | kataraḥ | cana | enoḥ || indraḥ | ca | viṣṇo iti | yat | apaspr̥dhethām | tredhā | sahasram | vi | tat | airayethām ||6.69.8||

IAST: indraś ca viṣṇo yad apaspṛdhethāṁ tredhā sahasraṁ vi tad airayethām
Griffith: Ye, Indra-Visnu, when ye fought the battle, produced this infinite with three divisions.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च विष्णो यदपस्पृधेथां त्रेधा सहस्रं वि तदैरयेथाम्
pada pāṭha: ubhā | jigyathuḥ | na | parā | jayethe iti | na | parā | jigye | kataraḥ | cana | enoḥ || indraḥ | ca | viṣṇo iti | yat | apaspr̥dhethām | tredhā | sahasram | vi | tat | airayethām ||6.69.8||

IAST: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā
Griffith: FILLED full of fatness, compassing all things that be, wide, spacious, dropping meath, beautiful in their
Devanāgarī: घृतवती भुवनानामभिश्रियोर्वी पृथ्वी मधुदुघे सुपेशसा
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tavatī iti ghr̥ta-vatī | bhuvanānām | abhi-śriyā | urvī iti | pr̥thvī iti | madhudughe iti madhu-dughe | su-peśasā || dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | varuṇasya | dharmaṇā | viskabhite iti vi-skabhite | ajare iti | bhūri-retasā ||6.70.1||

IAST: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūriretasā
Griffith: The Heaven and the Earth by Varuna's decree, unwasting, rich in germs, stand parted each from each.
Devanāgarī: द्यावापृथिवी वरुणस्य धर्मणा विष्कभिते अजरे भूरिरेतसा
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tavatī iti ghr̥ta-vatī | bhuvanānām | abhi-śriyā | urvī iti | pr̥thvī iti | madhudughe iti madhu-dughe | su-peśasā || dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | varuṇasya | dharmaṇā | viskabhite iti vi-skabhite | ajare iti | bhūri-retasā ||6.70.1||

IAST: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṁ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate
Griffith: The Everlasting Pair, with full streams, rich in milk, in their pure rule pour fatness for the pious man.
Devanāgarī: असश्चन्ती भूरिधारे पयस्वती घृतं दुहाते सुकृते शुचिव्रते
pada pāṭha: asaścantī iti | bhūridhāre iti bhūri-dhāre | payasvatī iti | ghr̥tam | duhāte iti | su-kr̥te | śucivrate iti śuci-vrate || rājantī iti | asya | bhuvanasya | rodasī iti | asme iti | retaḥ | siñcatam | yat | manuḥ-hitam ||6.70.2||

IAST: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṁ yan manurhitam
Griffith: Ye who are Regents of this world, O Earth and Heaven, pour into us the genial flow that prospers meit.
Devanāgarī: राजन्ती अस्य भुवनस्य रोदसी अस्मे रेतः सिञ्चतं यन्मनुर्हितम्
pada pāṭha: asaścantī iti | bhūridhāre iti bhūri-dhāre | payasvatī iti | ghr̥tam | duhāte iti | su-kr̥te | śucivrate iti śuci-vrate || rājantī iti | asya | bhuvanasya | rodasī iti | asme iti | retaḥ | siñcatam | yat | manuḥ-hitam ||6.70.2||

IAST: yo vām ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati
Griffith: Whoso, for righteous life, pours offerings to you, O Heaven and Earth, ye Hemispheres, that man succeeds.
Devanāgarī: यो वामृजवे क्रमणाय रोदसी मर्तो ददाश धिषणे स साधति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | r̥jave | kramaṇāya | rodasī iti | martaḥ | dadāśa | dhiṣaṇe iti | saḥ | sādhati || pra | pra-jābhiḥ | jāyate | dharmaṇaḥ | pari | yuvoḥ | siktā | viṣu-rūpāṇi | sa-vratā ||6.70.3||

IAST: pra prajābhir jāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā
Griffith: He in his seed is born again and spreads by Law: from you flow things diverse in form, but ruled alike.
Devanāgarī: प्र प्रजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस्परि युवोः सिक्ता विषुरूपाणि सव्रता
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vām | r̥jave | kramaṇāya | rodasī iti | martaḥ | dadāśa | dhiṣaṇe iti | saḥ | sādhati || pra | pra-jābhiḥ | jāyate | dharmaṇaḥ | pari | yuvoḥ | siktā | viṣu-rūpāṇi | sa-vratā ||6.70.3||

IAST: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā
Griffith: Enclosed in fatness, Heaven and Earth are bright therewith: they mingle with the fatness which they still
Devanāgarī: घृतेन द्यावापृथिवी अभीवृते घृतश्रिया घृतपृचा घृतावृधा
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tena | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | abhivr̥te ityabhi-vr̥te | ghr̥ta-śriyā | ghr̥ta-pr̥cā | ghr̥ta-vr̥dhā || urvī iti | pr̥thvī iti | hotr̥-vūrye | purohite iti puraḥ-hite | te iti | it | viprāḥ | īḷate | sumnam | iṣṭaye ||6.70.4||

IAST: urvī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḻate sumnam iṣṭaye
Griffith: Wide, broad, set foremost at election of the priest, to them the singers pray for bliss to further them
Devanāgarī: उर्वी पृथ्वी होतृवूर्ये पुरोहिते ते इद्विप्रा ईळते सुम्नमिष्टये
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tena | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | abhivr̥te ityabhi-vr̥te | ghr̥ta-śriyā | ghr̥ta-pr̥cā | ghr̥ta-vr̥dhā || urvī iti | pr̥thvī iti | hotr̥-vūrye | purohite iti puraḥ-hite | te iti | it | viprāḥ | īḷate | sumnam | iṣṭaye ||6.70.4||

IAST: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatām madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate
Griffith: May Heaven and Earth pour down the balmy rain for us, balm-dropping, yielding balm, with balm upon your pa
Devanāgarī: मधु नो द्यावापृथिवी मिमिक्षतां मधुश्चुता मधुदुघे मधुव्रते
pada pāṭha: madhu | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | mimikṣatām | madhu-ścutā | madhudughe iti madhu-dughe | madhuvrate iti madhu-vrate || dadhāne iti | yajñam | draviṇam | ca | devatā | mahi | śravaḥ | vājam | asme iti | su-vīryam ||6.70.5||

IAST: dadhāne yajñaṁ draviṇaṁ ca devatā mahi śravo vājam asme suvīryam
Griffith: Bestowing by your Godhead sacrifice and wealth, great fame and strength for us and good heroic might.
Devanāgarī: दधाने यज्ञं द्रविणं च देवता महि श्रवो वाजमस्मे सुवीर्यम्
pada pāṭha: madhu | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | mimikṣatām | madhu-ścutā | madhudughe iti madhu-dughe | madhuvrate iti madhu-vrate || dadhāne iti | yajñam | draviṇam | ca | devatā | mahi | śravaḥ | vājam | asme iti | su-vīryam ||6.70.5||

IAST: ūrjaṁ no dyauś ca pṛthivī ca pinvatām pitā mātā viśvavidā sudaṁsasā
Griffith: May Heaven and Earth make food swell plenteously for us, all-knowing Father, jother, wondrous in their wo
Devanāgarī: ऊर्जं नो द्यौश्च पृथिवी च पिन्वतां पिता माता विश्वविदा सुदंससा
pada pāṭha: ūrjam | naḥ | dyauḥ | ca | pr̥thivī | ca | pinvatām | pitā | mātā | viśva-vidā | su-daṁsasā || saṁrarāṇe iti sam-rarāṇe | rodasī iti | viśva-śambhuvā | sanim | vājam | rayim | asme iti | sam | invatām ||6.70.6||

IAST: saṁrarāṇe rodasī viśvaśambhuvā saniṁ vājaṁ rayim asme sam invatām
Griffith: Pouring out bounties, may, in union, both the Worlds, all beneficial, send us gain, and power, and weal
Devanāgarī: संरराणे रोदसी विश्वशम्भुवा सनिं वाजं रयिमस्मे समिन्वताम्
pada pāṭha: ūrjam | naḥ | dyauḥ | ca | pr̥thivī | ca | pinvatām | pitā | mātā | viśva-vidā | su-daṁsasā || saṁrarāṇe iti sam-rarāṇe | rodasī iti | viśva-śambhuvā | sanim | vājam | rayim | asme iti | sam | invatām ||6.70.6||

IAST: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṁsta savanāya sukratuḥ
Griffith: FULL of effectual wisdom Savitar the God hath stretched out golden arms that he may bring forth life.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य देवः सविता हिरण्यया बाहू अयंस्त सवनाय सुक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | hiraṇyayā | bāhū iti | ayaṁsta | savanāya | su-kratuḥ || ghr̥tena | pāṇī iti | abhi | pruṣṇute | makhaḥ | yuvā | su-dakṣaḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi ||6.71.1||

IAST: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi
Griffith: Young and most skilful, while he holds the region up, the Warrior sprinkles fatness over both his hands
Devanāgarī: घृतेन पाणी अभि प्रुष्णुते मखो युवा सुदक्षो रजसो विधर्मणि
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | hiraṇyayā | bāhū iti | ayaṁsta | savanāya | su-kratuḥ || ghr̥tena | pāṇī iti | abhi | pruṣṇute | makhaḥ | yuvā | su-dakṣaḥ | rajasaḥ | vi-dharmaṇi ||6.71.1||

IAST: devasya vayaṁ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaś ca dāvane
Griffith: May we enjoy the noblest vivifying force of Savitar the God, that he may give us wealth:
Devanāgarī: देवस्य वयं सवितुः सवीमनि श्रेष्ठे स्याम वसुनश्च दावने
pada pāṭha: devasya | vayam | savituḥ | savīmani | śreṣṭhe | syāma | vasunaḥ | ca | dāvane || yaḥ | viśvasya | dvi-padaḥ | yaḥ | catuḥ-padaḥ | ni-veśane | pra-save | ca | asi | bhūmanaḥ ||6.71.2||

IAST: yo viśvasya dvipado yaś catuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ
Griffith: For thou art mighty to produce and lull to rest the world of life that moves on two feet and on four.
Devanāgarī: यो विश्वस्य द्विपदो यश्चतुष्पदो निवेशने प्रसवे चासि भूमनः
pada pāṭha: devasya | vayam | savituḥ | savīmani | śreṣṭhe | syāma | vasunaḥ | ca | dāvane || yaḥ | viśvasya | dvi-padaḥ | yaḥ | catuḥ-padaḥ | ni-veśane | pra-save | ca | asi | bhūmanaḥ ||6.71.2||

IAST: adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṁ śivebhir adya pari pāhi no gayam
Griffith: Protect our habitation, Savitar, this day, with guardian aids around, auspicious, firm and true.
Devanāgarī: अदब्धेभिः सवितः पायुभिष्ट्वं शिवेभिरद्य परि पाहि नो गयम्
pada pāṭha: adabdhebhiḥ | savitariti | pāyu-bhiḥ | tvam | śivebhiḥ | adya | pari | pāhi | naḥ | gayam || hiraṇya-jihvaḥ | suvitāya | navyase | rakṣa | mākiḥ | naḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||6.71.3||

IAST: hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākir no aghaśaṁsa īśata
Griffith: God of the golden tongue, keep us for newest bliss: let not the evil-wisher have us in his power.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्यजिह्वः सुविताय नव्यसे रक्षा माकिर्नो अघशंस ईशत
pada pāṭha: adabdhebhiḥ | savitariti | pāyu-bhiḥ | tvam | śivebhiḥ | adya | pari | pāhi | naḥ | gayam || hiraṇya-jihvaḥ | suvitāya | navyase | rakṣa | mākiḥ | naḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||6.71.3||

IAST: ud u ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣam asthāt
Griffith: This Savitar the God, the golden-handed, Friend of the home, hath risen to meet the twilight.
Devanāgarī: उदु ष्य देवः सविता दमूना हिरण्यपाणिः प्रतिदोषमस्थात्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | damūnāḥ | hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | prati-doṣam | asthāt || ayaḥ-hanuḥ | yajataḥ | mandra-jihvaḥ | ā | dāśuṣe | suvati | bhūri | vāmam ||6.71.4||

IAST: ayohanur yajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūri vāmam
Griffith: With cheeks of brass, with pleasant tongue, the Holy, he sends the worshipper rich gifts in plenty.
Devanāgarī: अयोहनुर्यजतो मन्द्रजिह्व आ दाशुषे सुवति भूरि वामम्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | syaḥ | devaḥ | savitā | damūnāḥ | hiraṇya-pāṇiḥ | prati-doṣam | asthāt || ayaḥ-hanuḥ | yajataḥ | mandra-jihvaḥ | ā | dāśuṣe | suvati | bhūri | vāmam ||6.71.4||

IAST: ud ū ayām̐ upavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā
Griffith: Like a Director, Savitar hath extended his golden arms, exceeding fair to look on.
Devanāgarī: उदू अयाँ उपवक्तेव बाहू हिरण्यया सविता सुप्रतीका
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | ayān | upavaktā-iva | bāhū iti | hiranyayā | savitā | su-pratīkā || divaḥ | rohāṁsi | aruhat | pr̥thivyāḥ | arīramat | patayat | kat | cit | abhvam ||6.71.5||

IAST: divo rohāṁsy aruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kac cid abhvam
Griffith: He hath gone up the heights of earth and heaven, and made each monster fall and cease from troubling.
Devanāgarī: दिवो रोहांस्यरुहत्पृथिव्या अरीरमत्पतयत्कच्चिदभ्वम्
pada pāṭha: ut | ūm̐ iti | ayān | upavaktā-iva | bāhū iti | hiranyayā | savitā | su-pratīkā || divaḥ | rohāṁsi | aruhat | pr̥thivyāḥ | arīramat | patayat | kat | cit | abhvam ||6.71.5||

IAST: vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvo dive-dive vāmam asmabhyaṁ sāvīḥ
Griffith: Fair wealth, O Savitar, to-day, to-morrow, fair wealth produce for us each day that passes.
Devanāgarī: वाममद्य सवितर्वाममु श्वो दिवेदिवे वाममस्मभ्यं सावीः
pada pāṭha: vāmam | adya | savitaḥ | vāmam | ūm̐ iti | śvaḥ | dive-dive | vāmam | asmabhyam | sāvīḥ || vāmasya | hi | kṣayasya | deva | bhūreḥ | ayā | dhiyā | vāma-bhājaḥ | syāma ||6.71.6||

IAST: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrer ayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma
Griffith: May we through this our song be happy gainers, God, of a fair and spacious habitation.
Devanāgarī: वामस्य हि क्षयस्य देव भूरेरया धिया वामभाजः स्याम
pada pāṭha: vāmam | adya | savitaḥ | vāmam | ūm̐ iti | śvaḥ | dive-dive | vāmam | asmabhyam | sāvīḥ || vāmasya | hi | kṣayasya | deva | bhūreḥ | ayā | dhiyā | vāma-bhājaḥ | syāma ||6.71.6||

IAST: indrāsomā mahi tad vām mahitvaṁ yuvam mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ
Griffith: GREAT is this might of yours, Indra and Soma: the first high exploits were your own achievements.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा महि तद्वां महित्वं युवं महानि प्रथमानि चक्रथुः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | mahi | tat | vām | mahi-tvam | yuvam | mahāni | prathamāni | cakrathuḥ || yuvam | sūryam | vividathuḥ | yuvam | svaḥ | viśvā | tamāṁsi | ahatam | nidaḥ | ca ||6.72.1||

IAST: yuvaṁ sūryaṁ vividathur yuvaṁ svar viśvā tamāṁsy ahataṁ nidaś ca
Griffith: Ye found the Sun ye found the light of heaven: ye killed all darkness and the Gods' blasphemers.
Devanāgarī: युवं सूर्यं विविदथुर्युवं स्वर्विश्वा तमांस्यहतं निदश्च
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | mahi | tat | vām | mahi-tvam | yuvam | mahāni | prathamāni | cakrathuḥ || yuvam | sūryam | vividathuḥ | yuvam | svaḥ | viśvā | tamāṁsi | ahatam | nidaḥ | ca ||6.72.1||

IAST: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsam ut sūryaṁ nayatho jyotiṣā saha
Griffith: Ye, Indra-Soma, gave her light to Morning, and led the Sun on high with all his splendour.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा वासयथ उषासमुत्सूर्यं नयथो ज्योतिषा सह
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vāsayathaḥ | uṣasam | ut | sūryam | nayathaḥ | jyotiṣā | saha || upa | dyām | skambhathuḥ | skambhanena | aprathatam | pr̥thivīm | mātaram | vi ||6.72.2||

IAST: upa dyāṁ skambhathuḥ skambhanenāprathatam pṛthivīm mātaraṁ vi
Griffith: Ye stayed the heaven with a supporting pillar, and spread abroad apart, the Earth, the Mother.
Devanāgarī: उप द्यां स्कम्भथुः स्कम्भनेनाप्रथतं पृथिवीं मातरं वि
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | vāsayathaḥ | uṣasam | ut | sūryam | nayathaḥ | jyotiṣā | saha || upa | dyām | skambhathuḥ | skambhanena | aprathatam | pr̥thivīm | mātaram | vi ||6.72.2||

IAST: indrāsomāv ahim apaḥ pariṣṭhāṁ hatho vṛtram anu vāṁ dyaur amanyata
Griffith: Ye slew the flood -obstructing serpent Vrtra, Indra and Soma: Heaven approved your exploit.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमावहिमपः परिष्ठां हथो वृत्रमनु वां द्यौरमन्यत
pada pāṭha: indrāsomau | ahim | apaḥ | pari-sthām | hathaḥ | vr̥tram | anu | vām | dyauḥ | amanyata || pra | arṇāṁsi | airayatam | nadīnām | ā | samudrāṇi | paprathuḥ | purūṇi ||6.72.3||

IAST: prārṇāṁsy airayataṁ nadīnām ā samudrāṇi paprathuḥ purūṇi
Griffith: Ye urged to speed the currents of the rivers, and many seas have ye filled full with waters.
Devanāgarī: प्रार्णांस्यैरयतं नदीनामा समुद्राणि पप्रथुः पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: indrāsomau | ahim | apaḥ | pari-sthām | hathaḥ | vr̥tram | anu | vām | dyauḥ | amanyata || pra | arṇāṁsi | airayatam | nadīnām | ā | samudrāṇi | paprathuḥ | purūṇi ||6.72.3||

IAST: indrāsomā pakvam āmāsv antar ni gavām id dadhathur vakṣaṇāsu
Griffith: Ye in the unripe udders of the milch-kine have set the ripe milk, Indra, thou, and Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा पक्वमामास्वन्तर्नि गवामिद्दधथुर्वक्षणासु
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | pakvam | āmāsu | antaḥ | ni | gavām | it | dadhathuḥ | vakṣaṇāsu || jagr̥bhathuḥ | anapi-naddham | āsu | ruśat | citrāsu | jagatīṣu | antariti ||6.72.4||

IAST: jagṛbhathur anapinaddham āsu ruśac citrāsu jagatīṣv antaḥ
Griffith: Ye have held fast the unimpeded whiteness within these many-coloured moving creatures.
Devanāgarī: जगृभथुरनपिनद्धमासु रुशच्चित्रासु जगतीष्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | pakvam | āmāsu | antaḥ | ni | gavām | it | dadhathuḥ | vakṣaṇāsu || jagr̥bhathuḥ | anapi-naddham | āsu | ruśat | citrāsu | jagatīṣu | antariti ||6.72.4||

IAST: indrāsomā yuvam aṅga tarutram apatyasācaṁ śrutyaṁ rarāthe
Griffith: Verily ye bestow, Indra and Soma, wealth, famed, victorious, passing to our children.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रासोमा युवमङ्ग तरुत्रमपत्यसाचं श्रुत्यं रराथे
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | yuvam | aṅga | tarutram | apatya-sācam | śrutyam | rarāthe iti || yuvam | śuṣmam | naryam | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | sam | vivyathuḥ | pr̥tanā-saham | ugrā ||6.72.5||

IAST: yuvaṁ śuṣmaṁ naryaṁ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṁ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāham ugrā
Griffith: Ye have invested men, ye Mighty Beings, with manly strength that conquers in the battle.
Devanāgarī: युवं शुष्मं नर्यं चर्षणिभ्यः सं विव्यथुः पृतनाषाहमुग्रा
pada pāṭha: indrāsomā | yuvam | aṅga | tarutram | apatya-sācam | śrutyam | rarāthe iti || yuvam | śuṣmam | naryam | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | sam | vivyathuḥ | pr̥tanā-saham | ugrā ||6.72.5||

IAST: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatir āṅgiraso haviṣmān
Griffith: SERVED with oblations, first-born, mountain-render, Angiras' son, Brhaspati, the Holy,
Devanāgarī: यो अद्रिभित्प्रथमजा ऋतावा बृहस्पतिराङ्गिरसो हविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | adri-bhit | prathama-jāḥ | r̥ta-vā | br̥haspatiḥ | āṅgirasaḥ | haviṣmān || dvibarha-jmā | prāgharma-sat | pitā | naḥ | ā | rodasī iti | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti ||6.73.1||

IAST: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti
Griffith: With twice-firm path, dwelling in light, our Father, roars loudly, as a bull, to Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: द्विबर्हज्मा प्राघर्मसत्पिता न आ रोदसी वृषभो रोरवीति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | adri-bhit | prathama-jāḥ | r̥ta-vā | br̥haspatiḥ | āṅgirasaḥ | haviṣmān || dvibarha-jmā | prāgharma-sat | pitā | naḥ | ā | rodasī iti | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti ||6.73.1||

IAST: janāya cid ya īvata u lokam bṛhaspatir devahūtau cakāra
Griffith: Brhaspati, who made for such a people wide room and verge when Gods were invocated,
Devanāgarī: जनाय चिद्य ईवत उ लोकं बृहस्पतिर्देवहूतौ चकार
pada pāṭha: janāya | cit | yaḥ | īvate | ūm̐ iti | lokam | br̥haspatiḥ | deva-hūtau | cakāra || ghnan | vr̥trāṇi | vi | puraḥ | dardarīti | jayan | śatrūn | amitrān | pr̥t-su | sahan ||6.73.2||

IAST: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañ chatrūm̐r amitrān pṛtsu sāhan
Griffith: Slaying his enemies, breaks down their castles, quelling his foes and conquering those who hate him.
Devanāgarī: घ्नन्वृत्राणि वि पुरो दर्दरीति जयञ्छत्रूँरमित्रान्पृत्सु साहन्
pada pāṭha: janāya | cit | yaḥ | īvate | ūm̐ iti | lokam | br̥haspatiḥ | deva-hūtau | cakāra || ghnan | vr̥trāṇi | vi | puraḥ | dardarīti | jayan | śatrūn | amitrān | pr̥t-su | sahan ||6.73.2||

IAST: bṛhaspatiḥ sam ajayad vasūni maho vrajān gomato deva eṣaḥ
Griffith: Brhaspati in war hath won rich treasures, hath won, this God, the great stalls filled with cattle.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिः समजयद्वसूनि महो व्रजान्गोमतो देव एषः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspatiḥ | sam | ajayat | vasūni | mahaḥ | vrajān | go-mataḥ | devaḥ | eṣaḥ || apaḥ | sisāsan | svaḥ | aprati-itaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | hanti | amitram | arkaiḥ ||6.73.3||

IAST: apaḥ siṣāsan svar apratīto bṛhaspatir hanty amitram arkaiḥ
Griffith: Striving to win waters and light, resistless, Brhaspati with lightning smites the foeman.
Devanāgarī: अपः सिषासन्स्वरप्रतीतो बृहस्पतिर्हन्त्यमित्रमर्कैः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspatiḥ | sam | ajayat | vasūni | mahaḥ | vrajān | go-mataḥ | devaḥ | eṣaḥ || apaḥ | sisāsan | svaḥ | aprati-itaḥ | br̥haspatiḥ | hanti | amitram | arkaiḥ ||6.73.3||

IAST: somārudrā dhārayethām asuryam pra vām iṣṭayo 'ram aśnuvantu
Griffith: HOLD fast your Godlike sway, O Soma-Rudra: let these our sacrifices quickly reach you.
Devanāgarī: सोमारुद्रा धारयेथामसुर्यं प्र वामिष्टयोऽरमश्नुवन्तु
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | dhārayethām | asuryam | pra | vām | iṣṭayaḥ | aram | aśnuvantu || dame-dame | sapta | ratnā | dadhānā | śam | naḥ | bhūtam | dvi-pade | śam | catuḥ-pade ||6.74.1||

IAST: dame-dame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṁ no bhūtaṁ dvipade śaṁ catuṣpade
Griffith: Placing in every house your seven great treasures, bring blessing to our quadrupeds and bipeds.
Devanāgarī: दमेदमे सप्त रत्ना दधाना शं नो भूतं द्विपदे शं चतुष्पदे
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | dhārayethām | asuryam | pra | vām | iṣṭayaḥ | aram | aśnuvantu || dame-dame | sapta | ratnā | dadhānā | śam | naḥ | bhūtam | dvi-pade | śam | catuḥ-pade ||6.74.1||

IAST: somārudrā vi vṛhataṁ viṣūcīm amīvā yā no gayam āviveśa
Griffith: Soma and Rudra, chase to every quarter the sickness that hath visited our dwelling.
Devanāgarī: सोमारुद्रा वि वृहतं विषूचीममीवा या नो गयमाविवेश
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | vi | vr̥hatam | viṣūcīm | amīvā | yā | naḥ | gayam | ā-viveśa || āre | bādhethām | niḥ-r̥tim | parācaiḥ | asme iti | bhadrā | sauśravasāni | santu ||6.74.2||

IAST: āre bādhethāṁ nirṛtim parācair asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu
Griffith: Drive Nirrti away into the distance, and give us excellent and happy glories.
Devanāgarī: आरे बाधेथां निरृतिं पराचैरस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि सन्तु
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | vi | vr̥hatam | viṣūcīm | amīvā | yā | naḥ | gayam | ā-viveśa || āre | bādhethām | niḥ-r̥tim | parācaiḥ | asme iti | bhadrā | sauśravasāni | santu ||6.74.2||

IAST: somārudrā yuvam etāny asme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam
Griffith: Provide, O Soma-Rudra, for our bodies all needful medicines to heal and cure us.
Devanāgarī: सोमारुद्रा युवमेतान्यस्मे विश्वा तनूषु भेषजानि धत्तम्
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | yuvam | etāni | asme iti | viśvā | tanūṣu | bheṣajāni | dhattam || ava | syatam | muñcatam | yat | naḥ | asti | tanūṣu | baddham | kr̥tam | enaḥ | asmat ||6.74.3||

IAST: ava syatam muñcataṁ yan no asti tanūṣu baddhaṁ kṛtam eno asmat
Griffith: Set free and draw away the sin committed which we have still inherent in our persons.
Devanāgarī: अव स्यतं मुञ्चतं यन्नो अस्ति तनूषु बद्धं कृतमेनो अस्मत्
pada pāṭha: somārudrā | yuvam | etāni | asme iti | viśvā | tanūṣu | bheṣajāni | dhattam || ava | syatam | muñcatam | yat | naḥ | asti | tanūṣu | baddham | kr̥tam | enaḥ | asmat ||6.74.3||

IAST: tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāv iha su mṛḻataṁ naḥ
Griffith: Armed with keen shafts and weapons, kind and loving, be gracious unto us, Soma and Rudra.
Devanāgarī: तिग्मायुधौ तिग्महेती सुशेवौ सोमारुद्राविह सु मृळतं नः
pada pāṭha: tigma-āyudhau | tigmahetī iti tigma-hetī | su-śevau | somārudrā | iha | su | mr̥ḷatam | naḥ || pra | naḥ | muñcatam | varuṇasya | pāśāt | gopāyatam | naḥ | su-manasyamānā ||6.74.4||

IAST: pra no muñcataṁ varuṇasya pāśād gopāyataṁ naḥ sumanasyamānā
Griffith: Release us from the noose of Varuna; keep us from sorrow, in your tender loving-kindness.
Devanāgarī: प्र नो मुञ्चतं वरुणस्य पाशाद्गोपायतं नः सुमनस्यमाना
pada pāṭha: tigma-āyudhau | tigmahetī iti tigma-hetī | su-śevau | somārudrā | iha | su | mr̥ḷatam | naḥ || pra | naḥ | muñcatam | varuṇasya | pāśāt | gopāyatam | naḥ | su-manasyamānā ||6.74.4||

IAST: jīmūtasyeva bhavati pratīkaṁ yad varmī yāti samadām upasthe
Griffith: THE warrior's look is like a thunderous rain-cloud's, when, armed with mail, he seeks the lap of battle.
Devanāgarī: जीमूतस्येव भवति प्रतीकं यद्वर्मी याति समदामुपस्थे
pada pāṭha: jīmūtasya-iva | bhavati | pratīkam | yat | varmī | yāti | sa-madām | upa-sthe || anāviddhayā | tanvā | jaya | tvam | saḥ | tvā | varmaṇaḥ | mahimā | pipartu ||6.75.1||

IAST: anāviddhayā tanvā jaya tvaṁ sa tvā varmaṇo mahimā pipartu
Griffith: Be thou victorious with unwounded body: so let the thickness of thy mail protect thee.
Devanāgarī: अनाविद्धया तन्वा जय त्वं स त्वा वर्मणो महिमा पिपर्तु
pada pāṭha: jīmūtasya-iva | bhavati | pratīkam | yat | varmī | yāti | sa-madām | upa-sthe || anāviddhayā | tanvā | jaya | tvam | saḥ | tvā | varmaṇaḥ | mahimā | pipartu ||6.75.1||

IAST: dhanvanā gā dhanvanājiṁ jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samado jayema
Griffith: With Bow let us win kine, with Bow the battle, with Bow be victors in our hot encounters.
Devanāgarī: धन्वना गा धन्वनाजिं जयेम धन्वना तीव्राः समदो जयेम
pada pāṭha: dhanvanā | gāḥ | dhanvanā | ājim | jayema | dhanvanā | tīvrāḥ | sa-madaḥ | jayema || dhanuḥ | śatroḥ | apa-kāmam | kr̥ṇoti | dhanvanā | sarvāḥ | pra-diśaḥ | jayema ||6.75.2||

IAST: dhanuḥ śatror apakāmaṁ kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśo jayema
Griffith: The Bow brings grief and sorrow to the foeman: armed with the Bow may we subdue all regions.
Devanāgarī: धनुः शत्रोरपकामं कृणोति धन्वना सर्वाः प्रदिशो जयेम
pada pāṭha: dhanvanā | gāḥ | dhanvanā | ājim | jayema | dhanvanā | tīvrāḥ | sa-madaḥ | jayema || dhanuḥ | śatroḥ | apa-kāmam | kr̥ṇoti | dhanvanā | sarvāḥ | pra-diśaḥ | jayema ||6.75.2||

IAST: vakṣyantīved ā ganīganti karṇam priyaṁ sakhāyam pariṣasvajānā
Griffith: Close to his car, as fain to speak, She presses, holding her well-loved Friend in her embraces.
Devanāgarī: वक्ष्यन्तीवेदा गनीगन्ति कर्णं प्रियं सखायं परिषस्वजाना
pada pāṭha: vakṣyantī-iva | it | ā | ganīganti | karṇam | priyam | sakhāyam | pari-sasvajānā || yoṣā-iva | śiṅkte | vi-tatā | adhi | dhanvan | jyā | iyam | samane | pārayantī ||6.75.3||

IAST: yoṣeva śiṅkte vitatādhi dhanvañ jyā iyaṁ samane pārayantī
Griffith: Strained on the Bow, She whispers like a woman-this Bowstring that preserves us in the combat.
Devanāgarī: योषेव शिङ्क्ते वितताधि धन्वञ्ज्या इयं समने पारयन्ती
pada pāṭha: vakṣyantī-iva | it | ā | ganīganti | karṇam | priyam | sakhāyam | pari-sasvajānā || yoṣā-iva | śiṅkte | vi-tatā | adhi | dhanvan | jyā | iyam | samane | pārayantī ||6.75.3||

IAST: te ācarantī samaneva yoṣā māteva putram bibhṛtām upasthe
Griffith: These, meeting like a woman and her lover, bear, mother-like, their child upon their bosom.
Devanāgarī: ते आचरन्ती समनेव योषा मातेव पुत्रं बिभृतामुपस्थे
