pada pāṭha: te iti | ācarantī ityā-carantī | samanā-iva | yoṣā | mātā-iva | putram | bibhr̥tām | upa-sthe || apa | śatrūn | vidhyatām | saṁvidāne iti sam-vidāne | ārtnī iti | ime iti | visphurantī iti vi-sphurantī | amitrān ||6.75.4||

IAST: apa śatrūn vidhyatāṁ saṁvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantī amitrān
Griffith: May the two Bow-ends, starting swift asunder, scatter, in unison, the foes who hate us.
Devanāgarī: अप शत्रून्विध्यतां संविदाने आर्त्नी इमे विष्फुरन्ती अमित्रान्
pada pāṭha: te iti | ācarantī ityā-carantī | samanā-iva | yoṣā | mātā-iva | putram | bibhr̥tām | upa-sthe || apa | śatrūn | vidhyatām | saṁvidāne iti sam-vidāne | ārtnī iti | ime iti | visphurantī iti vi-sphurantī | amitrān ||6.75.4||

IAST: bahvīnām pitā bahur asya putraś ciścā kṛṇoti samanāvagatya
Griffith: With many a son, father of many daughters, He clangs and clashes as he goes to battle.
Devanāgarī: बह्वीनां पिता बहुरस्य पुत्रश्चिश्चा कृणोति समनावगत्य
pada pāṭha: bahvīnām | pitā | bahuḥ | asya | putraḥ | ciścā | kr̥ṇoti | samanā | ava-gatya || iṣu-dhiḥ | saṅkāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | ca | sarvāḥ | pr̥ṣṭhe | ni-naddhaḥ | jayati | pra-sūtaḥ ||6.75.5||

IAST: iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāś ca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddho jayati prasūtaḥ
Griffith: Slung on the back, pouring his brood, the Quiver vanquishes all opposing bands and armies.
Devanāgarī: इषुधिः सङ्काः पृतनाश्च सर्वाः पृष्ठे निनद्धो जयति प्रसूतः
pada pāṭha: bahvīnām | pitā | bahuḥ | asya | putraḥ | ciścā | kr̥ṇoti | samanā | ava-gatya || iṣu-dhiḥ | saṅkāḥ | pr̥tanāḥ | ca | sarvāḥ | pr̥ṣṭhe | ni-naddhaḥ | jayati | pra-sūtaḥ ||6.75.5||

IAST: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puro yatra-yatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ
Griffith: Upstanding in the Car the skilful Charioteer guides his strong Horses on whithersoe'er he will.
Devanāgarī: रथे तिष्ठन्नयति वाजिनः पुरो यत्रयत्र कामयते सुषारथिः
pada pāṭha: rathe | tiṣṭhan | nayati | vājinaḥ | puraḥ | yatra-yatra | kāmayate | su-sārathiḥ || abhīśūnām | mahimānam | panāyata | manaḥ | paścāt | anu | yacchanti | raśmayaḥ ||6.75.6||

IAST: abhīśūnām mahimānam panāyata manaḥ paścād anu yacchanti raśmayaḥ
Griffith: See and admire the strength of those controlling Reins which from behind declare the will of him who dri
Devanāgarī: अभीशूनां महिमानं पनायत मनः पश्चादनु यच्छन्ति रश्मयः
pada pāṭha: rathe | tiṣṭhan | nayati | vājinaḥ | puraḥ | yatra-yatra | kāmayate | su-sārathiḥ || abhīśūnām | mahimānam | panāyata | manaḥ | paścāt | anu | yacchanti | raśmayaḥ ||6.75.6||

IAST: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣapāṇayo 'śvā rathebhiḥ saha vājayantaḥ
Griffith: Horses whose hoofs rain dust are neighing loudly, yoked to the Chariots, showing forth their vigour,
Devanāgarī: तीव्रान्घोषान्कृण्वते वृषपाणयोऽश्वा रथेभिः सह वाजयन्तः
pada pāṭha: tīvrān | ghoṣān | kr̥ṇvate | vr̥ṣa-pāṇayaḥ | aśvāḥ | rathebhiḥ | saha | vājayantaḥ || ava-krāmantaḥ | pra-padaiḥ | amitrān | kṣiṇanti | śatrūn | anapa-vyayantaḥ ||6.75.7||

IAST: avakrāmantaḥ prapadair amitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūm̐r anapavyayantaḥ
Griffith: With their forefeet descending on the foemen, they, never flinching, trample and destroy them.
Devanāgarī: अवक्रामन्तः प्रपदैरमित्रान्क्षिणन्ति शत्रूँरनपव्ययन्तः
pada pāṭha: tīvrān | ghoṣān | kr̥ṇvate | vr̥ṣa-pāṇayaḥ | aśvāḥ | rathebhiḥ | saha | vājayantaḥ || ava-krāmantaḥ | pra-padaiḥ | amitrān | kṣiṇanti | śatrūn | anapa-vyayantaḥ ||6.75.7||

IAST: rathavāhanaṁ havir asya nāma yatrāyudhaṁ nihitam asya varma
Griffith: Car-bearer is the name of his oblation, whercon are laid his Weapons and his Armour.
Devanāgarī: रथवाहनं हविरस्य नाम यत्रायुधं निहितमस्य वर्म
pada pāṭha: ratha-vāhanam | haviḥ | asya | nāma | yatra | āyudham | ni-hitam | asya | varma || tatra | ratham | upa | śagmam | sadema | viśvāhā | vayam | su-manasyamānāḥ ||6.75.8||

IAST: tatrā ratham upa śagmaṁ sadema viśvāhā vayaṁ sumanasyamānāḥ
Griffith: So let us here, each day that passes, honour the helpful Car with hearts exceeding joyful.
Devanāgarī: तत्रा रथमुप शग्मं सदेम विश्वाहा वयं सुमनस्यमानाः
pada pāṭha: ratha-vāhanam | haviḥ | asya | nāma | yatra | āyudham | ni-hitam | asya | varma || tatra | ratham | upa | śagmam | sadema | viśvāhā | vayam | su-manasyamānāḥ ||6.75.8||

IAST: svāduṣaṁsadaḥ pitaro vayodhāḥ kṛcchreśritaḥ śaktīvanto gabhīrāḥ
Griffith: In sweet association lived the fathers who gave us life, profound and strong in trouble,
Devanāgarī: स्वादुषंसदः पितरो वयोधाः कृच्छ्रेश्रितः शक्तीवन्तो गभीराः
pada pāṭha: svādu-saṁsadaḥ | pitaraḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | kr̥cchra-śritaḥ | śakti-vantaḥ | gabhīrāḥ || citra-senāḥ | iṣu-balāḥ | amr̥dhrāḥ | sataḥ-vīrāḥ | uravaḥ | vrāta-sahāḥ ||6.75.9||

IAST: citrasenā iṣubalā amṛdhrāḥ satovīrā uravo vrātasāhāḥ
Griffith: Unwearied, armed with shafts and wondrous weapons, free, real heroes, conquerors of armies.
Devanāgarī: चित्रसेना इषुबला अमृध्राः सतोवीरा उरवो व्रातसाहाः
pada pāṭha: svādu-saṁsadaḥ | pitaraḥ | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | kr̥cchra-śritaḥ | śakti-vantaḥ | gabhīrāḥ || citra-senāḥ | iṣu-balāḥ | amr̥dhrāḥ | sataḥ-vīrāḥ | uravaḥ | vrāta-sahāḥ ||6.75.9||

IAST: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive no dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā
Griffith: The Brahmans, and the Fathers meet for Soma-draughts, and, graciously inclined, unequalled Heaven and Ea
Devanāgarī: ब्राह्मणासः पितरः सोम्यासः शिवे नो द्यावापृथिवी अनेहसा
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | pitaraḥ | somyāsaḥ | śive iti | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | anehasā || pūṣā | naḥ | pātu | duḥ-itāt | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | rakṣa | mākiḥ | naḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||6.75.10||

IAST: pūṣā naḥ pātu duritād ṛtāvṛdho rakṣā mākir no aghaśaṁsa īśata
Griffith: Guard us trom evil, Pusan, guard us strengtheners of Law: let not the evil-wisher master us.
Devanāgarī: पूषा नः पातु दुरितादृतावृधो रक्षा माकिर्नो अघशंस ईशत
pada pāṭha: brāhmaṇāsaḥ | pitaraḥ | somyāsaḥ | śive iti | naḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | anehasā || pūṣā | naḥ | pātu | duḥ-itāt | r̥ta-vr̥dhaḥ | rakṣa | mākiḥ | naḥ | agha-śaṁsaḥ | īśata ||6.75.10||

IAST: suparṇaṁ vaste mṛgo asyā danto gobhiḥ saṁnaddhā patati prasūtā
Griffith: Her tooth a deer, dressed in an eagle's feathers, bound with cow-hide, launched forth, She flieth onward
Devanāgarī: सुपर्णं वस्ते मृगो अस्या दन्तो गोभिः संनद्धा पतति प्रसूता
pada pāṭha: su-parṇam | vaste | mr̥gaḥ | asyāḥ | dantaḥ | gobhiḥ | sam-naddhā | patati | pra-sūtā || yatra | naraḥ | sam | ca | vi | ca | dravanti | tatra | asmabhyam | iṣavaḥ | śarma | yaṁsan ||6.75.11||

IAST: yatrā naraḥ saṁ ca vi ca dravanti tatrāsmabhyam iṣavaḥ śarma yaṁsan
Griffith: There where the heroes speed hither and thither, there may the Arrows shelter and protect us.
Devanāgarī: यत्रा नरः सं च वि च द्रवन्ति तत्रास्मभ्यमिषवः शर्म यंसन्
pada pāṭha: su-parṇam | vaste | mr̥gaḥ | asyāḥ | dantaḥ | gobhiḥ | sam-naddhā | patati | pra-sūtā || yatra | naraḥ | sam | ca | vi | ca | dravanti | tatra | asmabhyam | iṣavaḥ | śarma | yaṁsan ||6.75.11||

IAST: ṛjīte pari vṛṅdhi no 'śmā bhavatu nas tanūḥ
Griffith: Avoid us thou whose flight is straight, and let our bodies be as stone.
Devanāgarī: ऋजीते परि वृङ्धि नोऽश्मा भवतु नस्तनूः
pada pāṭha: r̥jīte | pari | vr̥ṅdhi | naḥ | aśmā | bhavatu | naḥ | tanūḥ || somaḥ | adhi | bravītu | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu ||6.75.12||

IAST: somo adhi bravītu no 'ditiḥ śarma yacchatu
Griffith: May Soma kindly speak to us, and Aditi protect us well.
Devanāgarī: सोमो अधि ब्रवीतु नोऽदितिः शर्म यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: r̥jīte | pari | vr̥ṅdhi | naḥ | aśmā | bhavatu | naḥ | tanūḥ || somaḥ | adhi | bravītu | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu ||6.75.12||

IAST: ā jaṅghanti sānv eṣāṁ jaghanām̐ upa jighnate
Griffith: He lays his blows upon their backs, he deals his blows upon their thighs.
Devanāgarī: आ जङ्घन्ति सान्वेषां जघनाँ उप जिघ्नते
pada pāṭha: ā | jaṅghanti | sānu | eṣām | jaghanān | upa | jighnate || aśva-ajani | pra-cetasaḥ | aśvān | samat-su | codaya ||6.75.13||

IAST: aśvājani pracetaso 'śvān samatsu codaya
Griffith: Thou, Whip, who urgest horses, drive sagacious horses in the fray.
Devanāgarī: अश्वाजनि प्रचेतसोऽश्वान्समत्सु चोदय
pada pāṭha: ā | jaṅghanti | sānu | eṣām | jaghanān | upa | jighnate || aśva-ajani | pra-cetasaḥ | aśvān | samat-su | codaya ||6.75.13||

IAST: ahir iva bhogaiḥ pary eti bāhuṁ jyāyā hetim paribādhamānaḥ
Griffith: It compasses the arm with serpent windings, fending away the friction of the bowstring:
Devanāgarī: अहिरिव भोगैः पर्येति बाहुं ज्याया हेतिं परिबाधमानः
pada pāṭha: ahiḥ-iva | bhogaiḥ | pari | eti | bāhum | jyāyāḥ | hetim | pari-bādhamānaḥ || hasta-ghnaḥ | viśvā | vayunāni | vidvān | pumān | pumāṁsam | pari | pātu | viśvataḥ ||6.75.14||

IAST: hastaghno viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṁsam pari pātu viśvataḥ
Griffith: So may the Brace, well-skilled in all its duties, guard manfully the man from every quarter.
Devanāgarī: हस्तघ्नो विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान्पुमान्पुमांसं परि पातु विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: ahiḥ-iva | bhogaiḥ | pari | eti | bāhum | jyāyāḥ | hetim | pari-bādhamānaḥ || hasta-ghnaḥ | viśvā | vayunāni | vidvān | pumān | pumāṁsam | pari | pātu | viśvataḥ ||6.75.14||

IAST: ālāktā yā ruruśīrṣṇy atho yasyā ayo mukham
Griffith: Now to the Shaft with venom smeared, tipped with deer-horn, with iron mouth,
Devanāgarī: आलाक्ता या रुरुशीर्ष्ण्यथो यस्या अयो मुखम्
pada pāṭha: āla-aktā | yā | ruru-śīrṣṇī | atho iti | yasyāḥ | ayaḥ | mukham || idam | parjanya-retase | iṣvai | devyai | br̥hat | namaḥ ||6.75.15||

IAST: idam parjanyaretasa iṣvai devyai bṛhan namaḥ
Griffith: Celestial, of Parjanya's seed, be this great adoration paid.
Devanāgarī: इदं पर्जन्यरेतस इष्वै देव्यै बृहन्नमः
pada pāṭha: āla-aktā | yā | ruru-śīrṣṇī | atho iti | yasyāḥ | ayaḥ | mukham || idam | parjanya-retase | iṣvai | devyai | br̥hat | namaḥ ||6.75.15||

IAST: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasaṁśite
Griffith: Loosed from the Bowstring fly away, thou Arrow, sharpened by our prayer.
Devanāgarī: अवसृष्टा परा पत शरव्ये ब्रह्मसंशिते
pada pāṭha: ava-sr̥ṣṭā | parā | pata | śaravye | brahma-saṁśite || gaccha | amitrān | pra | padyasva | mā | amīṣām | kam | cana | ut | śiṣaḥ ||6.75.16||

IAST: gacchāmitrān pra padyasva māmīṣāṁ kaṁ canoc chiṣaḥ
Griffith: Go to the foemen, strike them home, and let not one be left alive.
Devanāgarī: गच्छामित्रान्प्र पद्यस्व मामीषां कं चनोच्छिषः
pada pāṭha: ava-sr̥ṣṭā | parā | pata | śaravye | brahma-saṁśite || gaccha | amitrān | pra | padyasva | mā | amīṣām | kam | cana | ut | śiṣaḥ ||6.75.16||

IAST: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva
Griffith: There where the flights of Arrows fall like boys whose locks are yet unshorn.
Devanāgarī: यत्र बाणाः सम्पतन्ति कुमारा विशिखा इव
pada pāṭha: yatra | bāṇāḥ | sam-patanti | kumārāḥ | viśikhāḥ-iva || tatra | naḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu | viśvāhā | śarma | yacchatu ||6.75.17||

IAST: tatrā no brahmaṇas patir aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu
Griffith: Even there may Brahmanaspati, and Aditi protect us well, protect us well through all our days.
Devanāgarī: तत्रा नो ब्रह्मणस्पतिरदितिः शर्म यच्छतु विश्वाहा शर्म यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: yatra | bāṇāḥ | sam-patanti | kumārāḥ | viśikhāḥ-iva || tatra | naḥ | brahmaṇaḥ | patiḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yacchatu | viśvāhā | śarma | yacchatu ||6.75.17||

IAST: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somas tvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām
Griffith: Thy vital parts I cover with thine Armour: with immortality King Soma clothe thee.
Devanāgarī: मर्माणि ते वर्मणा छादयामि सोमस्त्वा राजामृतेनानु वस्ताम्
pada pāṭha: marmāṇi | te | varmaṇā | chādayāmi | somaḥ | tvā | rājā | amr̥tena | anu | vastām || uroḥ | varīyaḥ | varuṇaḥ | te | kr̥ṇotu | jayantam | tvā | anu | devāḥ | madantu ||6.75.18||

IAST: uror varīyo varuṇas te kṛṇotu jayantaṁ tvānu devā madantu
Griffith: Varuna give tliee what is more than ample, and in thy triumph may the Gods be joyful.
Devanāgarī: उरोर्वरीयो वरुणस्ते कृणोतु जयन्तं त्वानु देवा मदन्तु
pada pāṭha: marmāṇi | te | varmaṇā | chādayāmi | somaḥ | tvā | rājā | amr̥tena | anu | vastām || uroḥ | varīyaḥ | varuṇaḥ | te | kr̥ṇotu | jayantam | tvā | anu | devāḥ | madantu ||6.75.18||

IAST: yo naḥ svo araṇo yaś ca niṣṭyo jighāṁsati
Griffith: Whoso would kill us, whether he be a strange foe or one of us,
Devanāgarī: यो नः स्वो अरणो यश्च निष्ट्यो जिघांसति
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | svaḥ | araṇaḥ | yaḥ | ca | niṣṭyaḥ | jighāṁsati || devāḥ | tam | sarve | dhūrvantu | brahma | varma | mama | antaram ||6.75.19||

IAST: devās taṁ sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaram
Griffith: May all the Gods discomfit him. My nearest, closest mail is prayer.
Devanāgarī: देवास्तं सर्वे धूर्वन्तु ब्रह्म वर्म ममान्तरम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | naḥ | svaḥ | araṇaḥ | yaḥ | ca | niṣṭyaḥ | jighāṁsati || devāḥ | tam | sarve | dhūrvantu | brahma | varma | mama | antaram ||6.75.19||
